Lots of little touches and attention to detail made this a particularly special stay.  Great location for visiting neighbouring wineries  - some within a 5 minute walk from Little Para -  and the town centre of Tanunda.  Would highly recommend.
Great character accommodation. Close to everything so could walk to the town and a number of wineries. Wendy, the host was lovely. Would definitely book again.
Wendy’s cottage is quiet and secluded but a short walk to a lovely restaurant. Would recommend
Thanks to Wendy for a lovely stay, we really enjoyed this airbnb for our wine-derful time in the Barossa Valley

Fantastic private little cottage 
Everything you need and really cosy 
Loved it
This was a great spot to stay very quiet and close to Main Street. Would have stayed longer if we could.

Little Para Cottage is a cosy, friendly place central to many wineries, including Langmeil, which is only a 7 minute walk and well worth visiting. A short drive from the town centre and lots of extra touches to make us feel welcome. Exactly how I pictured our Barossa experience to be!

Wendy was a warm and welcoming host and was happy to help out in any way.  The outside space was particularly impressive, with interesting, eclectic and creative objects, and lots of segmented seating areas for afternoon drinks, breakfast or anything in between.  It was also a very private space, and we felt very much at home here.  The bed was very comfortable and whilst it was a bit dark inside the house, this worked well for the hot days, as did the airconditioner.  If you want to visit the Barossa for a period of time, this is a perfect place to stay as it's a great location, right on the edge of town with a fabulous restauraunt at one end of the street, and numerous wineries at the other, all within walking distance.  Also right next to the bike path.  Thanks for making our stay memorable Wendy!

This charming cottage is perfect for a romantic get away in the beautiful Barossa. The old style furnishings and decorative touches create an "old world" and charming atmosphere.
It is very quiet and private, and has a gorgeous garden full of well tended succulents and other plants and lots of sweet seating nooks and options.
The cottage is clean and well equipped, and the bed is really comfortable - my husband said he had his first really good "sleep-in" for some time!
Wendy is a thoughtful host and clear and responsive communicator.
We would certainly go again.

I recently stayed at Wendy's cottage for a night, it was a beautiful space and Wendy was very hospitable. We informed her we would be arriving early due to doing a wine tour that started at 10am and asked if we could leave our rental car there, which she said was no problem. When we arrived, the previous guests had already left so Wendy was kind enough to let us leave our bags in the cottage garden and wait there until our tour car arrived. The space itself is gorgeous, had all the amenities we needed, a comfy bed and lovely garden area. It's very close to a few good wine/restaurant spots too. Thanks Wendy!

If you want to stay in a beautiful little cottage in the Barossa Valley I would 100% recommend Wendy's place! It is the perfect size and so close to many different wineries! Wendy is also an amazing host - she gave information on the Barossa Valley and was very responsive !!

Little Para Cottage is great!  We had a perfect time staying in Wendy's little cottage, the bed is super comfy, the garden is funky and lovely, Wendy was a really welcoming host.  Easy to stroll to Peter Lehmann, Langmeil, David Franz cellar doors.  About a 25 minute walk into Tanunda so easily doable for dinner too once you have sampled too much to drive anywhere.
For a weekend getaway for two in the Barossa you can't really ask for more.

Beautiful little cottage! Great location for exploring Tanunda and lovely hospitality shown by Wendy, the late lazy checkout was especially appreciated! We especially loved the private location and garden setting. We’ll be back!
Amazing little cottage. Perfect to go out to visit the wineries and what the Barossa has to offer. Wendy is very lovely and welcoming.
Lovely place!

Excellent cottage! Ideally located for exploring Tanunda and its surrounds. The cottage has so much character, and the private gardens and courtyard are great. Wendy is an incredibly thoughtful host, and helped ensure that we had a truly wonderful stay at Little Para Cottage.
A great, private place with lovely, thoughtful touches.

This cottage has the most divine garden. Make sure you take advantage of it by leaving time to have a cup of tea or glass of wine. Wendy was a generous and kind host and the house had everything you could need.

We had an amazing stay at Little Para Cottage, it was exactly what we needed. Beautiful garden area to relax with cheese and wine and a super comfy but stylish interior to wind down with one of the many dvd's Wendy has on offer. Would definitely recommend - location was great and Wendy provides great tips for the area and all amenities you could need. Thanks!
Beautiful cottage with lots of character and amazing personal touches! Didn’t want to leave
great cottage!
A charming cottage with lovely touches of hospitality. Very comfortable bed & clean facilities. Many things provided for entertainment. Close to all facilities. Very accommodating host.
Great place, great communication, really helpful tips and thoughtful touches. Well recommended
Clean, cozy, beautifully manicured garden.   Friendly and responsive host.  Highly recommend!
Well located with lovely private garden and  attentive hostess
A gorgeous, private and very comfortable cottage just a short walk from the main street. The host gave me a warm welcome.  Everything you need and more, highly recommended.
Awesome little getaway with a beautiful garden & quaint little cottage! It was lovely!

A very nice quiet spot. A little out of town, about 35 minute walk and a bit dark at night but there is always a taxi!. Very near a number of cellar doors for wine tasting so no worries over drinking and driving. A good spot for touring the Barossa Valley.

My boyfriend and I had an absolutely wonderful stay in Little Para Cottage. The Cottage is so delightful, and had good attention to detail! There's also a few good wineries within walking distance! Will definitely back again next time we're in the Barossa Valley.
Wendy's cottage is beautiful and we really enjoyed spending some time in the amazing courtyard.
Best location in the Barossa, private, East to find, great amenities and sensational value for money. Recommended!
Wonderful space and a great location. So stylish too!

The Little Para cottage has everything you need for a great stay in Barossa.  Wendy is a lovely host, and even had some fresh nectarines and grapes waiting for us, as well as some music playing.  Nice playlist!The bed is super comfortable, everything you need to cook a simple meal is there, even a bbq, and the bathroom amenities are great.  lots of space as well, and a wonderful private garden.  I highly recommend!
We are a fussy couple and loved every aspect of this short stay, it was well worth it!

Wow, you have to stay here! This cottage is perfect for a couple with lots of lovely touches to make your stay special. The cottage is close to plenty of cellar doors and restaurants, or there is ample cooking and fridge space if you want to stay in. The outdoor area is perfect for warmer afternoons or an outdoor breakfast. Wendy is a delightful host and I can not recommend this cottage enough!
Lovely private home, cottage garden with space to relax outside. Perfect location for us. Close enough to walk, and remains private.

Perfect little cottage hideaway.  Quiet and peaceful.  Gardens are beautiful and a perfect place to relax and enjoy the fruits of the Barossa. Wendy is a great host.  So many extra little  touches to make your stay special.
Little Para Cottage is a lovely space with a gorgeous garden and many little, thoughtful extras. Highly recommend it for comfort, cleanliness and hospitality.
A perfect getaway for couples. Lovely, cosy cottage and the outdoor area / garden was great for relaxation. Wendy was a lovely host who took care of all our needs.

Little Para Cottage was the perfect base to explore the wineries of Barossa Valley.  On the same street as the Para wine trial, we were able to explore Peter Lehmann's and Langmire by foot.  Which means you don't have to worry about a designated driver.

The cottage it self was a complete oasis with everything you need plus bonus extras (Port and Easter eggs!).  Super comfy bed, and a host that's fast responding yet still so very respectful of your privacy.

We loved every moment. Thank you Wendy and Lynn!

Wendy’s place is in a great location, a stones throw away from many of the wineries. The cottage is cosy and comfortable and a lot of thought has gone into making it a very enjoyable experience. Wendy was a great host. Would highly recommend!
A real charm of a cottage with lovely treats.  Wendy is a fantastic host and we would recommend anyone visiting the Barossa stay at Little Para Cottage.
Great stay at little para. Wendy was a very helpful and generous host offering local tips and nice extra touches. Would stay again.
Comfy cottage
Fantastic place - loved staying there.
Fantastic little cottage in a great location! Perfect for a cosy getaway.
A cosy and comfortable retreat which is quiet and well located in Tanunda.
Wendy’s place was welcoming, cosy and comfortable. It was well appointed with everything you need for an enjoyable holiday.
A private and quiet location. Close to wineries and several are well within walking distance. Great facilities and we would not hesitate in deciding to stay here again.

Fantastic place to stay - 2nd time in cottage and never disappoints 

Mal and Jill
It was great to explore the surrounding winery’s and return to a cosy home. Wendy was easy to communicate with but also respected my privacy. I definitely stay again.
All we wanted for a perfect stay.

Little Para Cottage is an ample sized holiday stay location but with a very cosy cottage feel, inside and out. Wendy was very welcoming and filled the cottage with lovely touches.
Tanunda is a great location from which to explore the Barossa. Everything is within easy access.

Little Para Cottage is such a cute cottage and a great location to explore the Barossa from. Wendy was a great host and made us feel very welcome with lots of little extra touches. The garden is so peaceful, a beautiful spot to relax.
The Little Para Cottage is the cutest little cosy getaway. Beautiful gardens surrounding for peace and quiet. Wendy was an amazing host, can’t fault a single thing.
Absolutely beautiful cottage in a perfect location, very cosy. Would not hesitate to stay again.

This is a beautiful place to experience. It is small,  cosy, warm, private and welcoming in all ways. From comfy bed and sofas,to selections of videos,kinds of coffee and teas etc. It is a base for excursions within the Barossa or a very pleasant place to rest, recuperate, read and meditate. We wished we had booked several days here.
Clean, tidy and very comfortable. It was a lovely place to stay!

Little Para Cottage provided a charming stay in Tununda. 
The space itself is small and simple but presented beautifully and with some special attention to detail making Wendy a wonderful host. Would definitely look at staying here in the future for further visits to the Barossa
Wonderful cottage. Lots of special little extra touches that made it more welcoming. Nice drop of port. Thanks

This is a lovely, character-packed place to stay and use as a base to explore the beautiful Barossa. Wendy was a lovely host and answered all queries very quickly. The music and heating was on when I arrived... such a warm (literally) welcome.
Lovely quiet location close enough to the action. Everything you need for a lovely stay is right here including a wonderful outdoor area.
fantastic again - thanks Wendy

This lovely cottage in the centre of the Barossa is a perfect escape. The cottage is fully equiped, has a nice bathroom, and a lovely garden where you can relax. Wendy ads some personal douches that make the difference!!

Clean and well located in Nuri. Keys were obtained from the cellar door and Tush was very helpful. They even gave us a few bottles of wine to enjoy during the stay. 
Would recommend this place to others.

The first time I have booked using airbnb and I am a convert thanks to the Elderton Wines Guest house. As a group of four girls from Melbourne and Perth we stayed here last weekend (the beginning of August). The house is in such a central location, it's specious and was a great space to stay in winter and we all could picture it being just as wonderful at any time of the year. We instantly felt at home.  The house could also comfortably sleep six people with three bedrooms and has all the facilities you might need. 

We were made to feel really welcome with a bottle of wine on our arrival and our host recommending restaurants and wineries to us before we arrived. When we come back to the Barossa we will most definitely stay here!

The stay at Elderton Lodge was great, we received a warm welcome from Tush, the lodge was comfortable and convenient to all amenities.

We enjoyed tasting the wines at the tasting room and sharing a bottle kindly provided by the lodge.

Would recommend this to others wishing to explore the Barossa.

Elderton Wines lodge was a clean and comfortable house. It is well located within walking distance of most locations in Nuriootpa. The support at the cellar door was excellent and we enjoyed tasting the range of wines. Would recommend as a base to explore the Barossa region.

We loved our staying in Elderton Guest house. House is perfectly located near to all the shops and restaurants.  Best part was the park near by which kids enjoyed every day. I would say it is perfect place for small family of two adult and 2 kids to group of 4 to 5 adults.

What an amazing Place. Elderton guest house is the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. The house was close to the centre of Nuriootpa and right next door to the Elderton vineyard.

On arrival, a bottle of red and a bottle of white were awating for us in the house. The place was very clean and tidy with everything and more than you need. 

Tush thank you so much for being such an amazing host, and indulging us with a wine tasting. I recommend this to anyone who stays there. Tush is also a wealth of knowledge on what to explore in the area and also made us feel extremely welcome.

We will definitely be back.

Lovely clean comfortable home, fully equipped with nice welcoming touches. 

The host was accommodating and communicated well. 

Maggie Beer's farm shop is a short drive away and is fantastic to visit.

We were four guys enjoying a golf and wines experience. Communication leading up to our stay was terrific. Once there, everything was at or above expectation. We collected the keys from Elderton Cellar Door and enjoyed an excellent tasting session hosted by Tush (rhymes with "rush", of which there was none - but "just don't call me Trish"). We learned from her and enjoyed her suggested wines.
All voted for a return next year.

Comfortable and cozy stay. Great location. Stayed here with 6 guests  (2 couples 2 friends ) and it was a good size, not too small. The hot water stayed hot for everyone and the heating kept the house warm. Nice complimentary touches that made our stay enjoyable.  Recommended to anybody.

Very close to all amenities and some amazing wineries. Check in was smooth and the guest house is actually on a seperate street (roughly 50m away) from the Cellar door, so you can enjoy some privacy.
There was 6 of us, and we had a fantastic stay at Elderton. Some nights spent enjoying the Barossa, and some cooking at home. Very enjoyable!
Thank you!
When we arrived staff were very friendly.  Please see all other comments for my feedback.
Great house in a fantastic location, would recommend to any one coming to Noori!

I stayed at Elderton house with my parents and partner for two nights as we visited the Barossa wine region. The house was in a great central but also nice and quiet location for visiting the nearby wineries and restaurants. The house is very nice with two full bedrooms, a kitchen and living room and very modern bathroom. The providing of continental breakfast supplies were great for feeding us in the mornings. 

The only hiccup during our stay was that the hot water heater was broken when we arrived. The hosts sent their maintenance people out the next morning to fix it which was excellent, unfortunately this meant we only had hot water for the last morning of our two night stay.

A group of 6 friends stayed here on our way to Clare for a wedding. The staff at Elderton were very welcoming. The house was exactly as we expected, very spacious and comfy beds. The provisions and wine on arrival was wonderful and greatly appreciated. Would definitely return and recommend to others.

Beautiful home close to the winery. Very central and so close to the grocery store. Bottle shop is also walking distance.
Very lovely place
Nice, clean and comfortable accommodation, and lovely quiet neighbourhood for relaxing.
A great place with a good location. The team at Elderton were very lovely to deal with and we will happily visit again. Thank you!!

Beautiful and comfortable cottage and the continental breakfast and wine provided were very much appreciated and very good. Local tips were useful and location was central to everything in the Barossa - thank you for a great stay!

Elderton guest house was exactly what we needed in the Barossa - close to all the great wineries and we even did a tasting at the Elderton cellar door which is beautiful. The house was clean and comfortable and perfect for couples travelling together.
Lovely house, well appointed, comfortable beds & great location
A lovely place that felt like home! Lovely and warm and had all that we needed!

We had a wonderful time at Elderton Guest House. It was spotlessly clean, very welcoming, and with a lovely outdoor space. We hired electric bikes from Barossa Bike Hire, and the guest house was perfectly located for family bike rides throughout the Barossa, with wine tasting along the way.
The host canceled this reservation 76 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great stay, comfy beds, easy communication

A very comfortable and spacious house, with all the thoughtful touches for a lovely weekend in the barossa. Well located and perfect for our family with 2 young kids, including high chair etc. and fenced yard.
Excellent location & gorgeous house
The host canceled this reservation 4 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Really great place to stay, close to everything and right in the middle of a vineyard!  Cynthia was really nice to deal with and left us lots of great food for breakfast.  Cottage is immaculately clean and well stocked with everything you could need.
Lovely accommodation - exceptionally clean very central to all highlights - will recommend to friends and would definitely  stay again

We had a wonderful stay at Veritas.  The cottage was in amongst the wine district with vines in front of the cottage, but walking distance from Tanunda.  Tununda has a lovely village feel with boutique shops and cafes central to all the main attractions.  Cynthia was very welcoming the cottage was supper stocked with a breakfast feast and everything needed.  The retro deco was very impressive with lots of treasures, also so fab cook books to browse.  A really lovely relaxing stay and everything as expected.

Our weekend was one of amazing time, with the host and cottage far exceeding our expectation
The retro style bought back many happy memories and the location was perfect 
the little things that the Host provided made it just perfect  
Our time visiting the winery was simply amazing 
We cant recommend this highly enough

Had a really lovely time, cottage was everything we expected and more, lovely setting among the vineyards a stones throw from some great cellar doors. 

Breakfast food was delicious and generous (cooking provisions as well as more mundane) along with a lovely bottle of wine.

Thorough information pack gave us heaps of info on the area and the best spots to eat whilst in the region. 

Very well organised; host was away but made regular contact prior to our arrival to ensure arrangements for key and housing were all in order.

Would highly recommend to anyone looking for a spot to stay.

We had a wonderful time staying at Veritas cottage. Cynthia left us provisions for breakfast which were much appreciated. The cottage had everything we needed and we particularly enjoyed the outdoor patio with views over the vineyards. Location was good- 20 min walk into town or a very short drive with plenty of vineyards close by. Thanks for having us!

Great location and a cute, quirky house.  The breakfast spread was amazing with eggs from the chook pen on the property. Cynthia was lovely and accommodating. She sent through a comprehensive email prior to check in that helped make the check in process smooth.  Communication was great and prompt.  She was quick to attend to any issues we had during our stay.  We really enjoyed our visit to the lovely region.

Great communication in the lead up to our arrival and Cynthia made us feel very welcome.   Lovely food and wine provided and the cottage is just wonderful - an ideal location for a stay in the Barossa.   We also recommend that you pop into the Visitors Information Centre in the main street of Tanunda - the staff there are terrific and very helpful with tips, restaurant recommendations etc.
We were made very welcome. Veritas Cottage is very comfortable and Cynthia left us lots of provisions icluding a bottle of their excellent red. Loved the retro feel of the cottage!

We had a wonderful time at Veritas Cottage. Despite traveling during a heatwave, the place was comfortable, airy, and super homey. 

The hosts did a wonderful job stocking it just right and thinking through what we would need. On our last day, we cooked eggs laid by the chickens my daughter visited earlier.

And there's nothing like having a vintner as your landlord while you're in the area tasting wine :)

Highly recommend!
Lovely retro cottage in a really good location.

We absolutely loved our stay at Veritas Cottage. Rolf was great and left us some lovely and fresh produce in the fridge and a nice bottle of wine on our arrival. 

The cottage was so cute and everything we were looking for, and location of the cottage is perfect and so central to everything.

Loved our stay.

Thanks heaps Rolf

My fiancé, parents and I enjoyed two nights at Veritas cottage.
It was a very clean, cosy cottage with a retro style feel. 
We enjoyed the peaceful setting of the cottage and the lovely breakfast provisions provided by the host. 
It is in a good location; within moderate walking distance to Tanunda and central to exploring the Barossa wine region via car. 
We thoroughly enjoyed meeting the owner Rolf and tasting wine at the Rolf Binder winery.
Great spot,close to town and vineyards.Art deco furnishings complimented by excellent provisions for breakfast.loved eating outside overlooking the vineyard.lovely house in a lovely place!

I have booked Veritas Cottage for my mother and her friend. They loved the proximity to Tanunda and the other wineries. The enjoyed to meet the owner Rolf and wine tasting at the Rolf Binder winery. The cottage offer plenty of space.

A lovely little cottage in Tanunda away from the hustle and bustle of the main street. We had very clear directions of how to find the cottage and received a phone call on the night of arrival to make sure everything was OK. The cottage was exactly as described and the breakfast provisions were good. Excellent warm fluffy blankets a huge bonus

Just a lovely lovely stay. The property is delightful, hosts Emalee from the Cellar Door and Rolf the owner very giving and generous (the tasting was superb and Rolf left fresh eggs, some wonderful smoked bacon, fresh juice - the works for breakfast). Plus a free bottle to enjoy!
Easy access to Tanunda and all the vineyards, and very comfy beds!

The cottage was cute, very clean and an ideal base for exploring the Barossa.  We enjoyed everything from the breakfast provisions, the music cd's to the comfy bed.  We had a great weekend and thanks so much for the bottle of wine too !!  Would definitely recommend the place to anyone looking for a quiet place with a funky feel !! We loved it.

Veritas cottage was a beautifully decorated, cosy and quiet spot for a mother-daughter catch up. We loved the decor. Cynthia made us feel so welcome and was a available by phone if needed. We enjoyed a bottle of the beautiful Rolf Binder Shiraz!
A lovely home away from home. It was the ideal place to base our stay in the Barossa Valley.

This place was wonderful! It is located very close to the heart of Tanunda and very continently to two very good wineries. It is also only a short drive to Maggie Beer's farm shop. My family and I loved this place, Cynthia had everything we needed and was kind enough to have he heaters going before our arrival. Would highly recommend this place.
Fantastic stay! Could not have been happier with Veritas Cottages or Cynthia's service. Will definitely recommend it to others & be back next time we're in the Barossa!
Charming cottage, charming hosts, charming location!
The location is quiet and very near Tanunda, ie central to the Barossa area. The cottage was well supplied. We were very happy with our accommodation.
This is a lovely cottage extremely well positioned  and very close to some lovely wineries. The host was excellent and attentive.

Don't be fooled by the 1980's build as this place has immense charm, abundant good taste and a great layout. Secluded and private but also in a perfect position for exploring the valley. Surrounded by grapevines, native cypress and its own kitchen garden. Cynthia encouraged foraging so we grazed on fresh herbs, spinach, spring onions and asparagus. An ideal experience; a microcosm of the broader growers valley itself. Rolf and Cynthia are generous hosts and the breakfast provisions, wine and facilities were terrific. We only had a few days, but a meal at FermentAsian was sublime and by the time we dined at Hentley Farm, reality was slipping as the euphoria was overtaking us. A perfect break and Veritas cottage was so central to it all in more ways than one. A brilliant place to stay. Thanks.

We loved our stay here - quiet location near the heart of Tanunda and just a few mins drive from reataurants and wineries. The place was well maintained and Cynthia made sure we had yummy breakfast provisions during our stay. Great place to stay, would definitely recommend it! :)

We loved our stay at Veritas, the cottage was gorgeous, and such a cool retro vibe!! Breakfast supplies were super generous and the veggie garden provided lots of lovely fresh ingredients for cooking dinners. Would definitely recommend!!

Excellent house great location clean spacious comfy bed lovely wine left for us and ample provisions so close to tanunda but quiet and private great for a getaway recommended highly great communication thanks

Veritas is a cute retro styled cottage tucked away close to Tanunda and ideally located for many of the top wineries in the Barossa. The check in & communication with our host Cynthia at all times was super-easy. There were a number of small touches that really made the cottage excellent, including ample food for breakfasts, local information, complimentary bottle of wine and an honesty bar with extra wine if you run out. The air conditioning was a must for us (we spent Christmas Day here at 40 degree heat, so that was essential). 

There is one other property nearby but the cottage feels extremely private. There is a nice little patio area with chairs & a table looking out onto the vines.
What an amazing unique cottage! Easy to find, close to town and to wineries. The local recommendations and fresh produce provided was a lovely extra - we just loved staying here.

We had a great stay at Veritas Cottage, it was comfortable, welcoming and had everything we could have needed. Cynthia's communication was fantastic - really quick responses and perfect instructions. Highly recommend for anyone visiting the Barossa!

Lovely place and left breakfast food for us which was a great touch and much appreciated.
Wifi was difficult (but I have found this a problem everywhere in Australia).

We had a lovely couple of nights staying at Veritas Cottage. It is well situated for visiting all the Barossa Valley has to offer. We enjoyed the superb bottle of wine from their winery and the huge choice of breakfast items. Cynthia is a great host!

What a wonderful special private place, an escape from reality! The house was lovely and was well set up for all our needs. It was easily within walking distance of town and to numerous wineries close by. Our hosts were very helpful, easy to communicate with, and on top of it have an amazing winery. Looking forward to heading back very soon to this gem!Cheers

Cynthia was the perfect host. Although we didn't meet in person, veritas cottage was so homely and full of personal touches. The bottle of wine and breakfast provisions were a lovely touch and most welcome. 

The house is full of quirky vintage character but we immediately felt at home.

The location is perfect - short drive to Tanunda and a load of popular vineyards and cellar doors. 

Would recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to base themselves to explore the Barossa.

Cynthia and the Rolf Binder gang were more than accommodating. A behind the scenes look of the winery topped it up! The cottage was lovely, secluded, but close to the town center and the wineries of Barossa.

Cynthia greeted us just after we arrived and made us feel very welcome in her cosy rental cottage. We cooked a meal in the well-equipped kitchen one night of our stay. We had dinner at a great restaurant in town on the other. The place was everything we needed for our short stay in the Barossa.

If you're wanting self catering and quiet accommodation on the outskirts of Tanunda, with a super-friendly host who goes the distance on customer service, then this is the place for you.

Loved our stay at veritas cottage. The cottage was perfect, a retro feel, in a beautiful garden setting. Cynthia and Rolf were extremely hospitable. Just look inside their fridge for eg. Eggs bacon sausages fruit yogurt bread OJ - you name it. Very cosy clean and in a perfect spot when touring around the barossa valley- tasting all the beautiful wines. Rolf being his own winemaker - giving us a tour - tasting wines out of the barrell was a very personal touch. Thankyou. They also left us a bottle of their wine to enjoy. And their yummy port. Very fun hosts- allowing us to join their night. Definitly a must stay at the cottage- a peaceful getaway- and a must to go tasting at their cellar door. Beautiful wines. Some of the nicest in the Barossa. Cynthias communication was perfect prior- sharing tips for us. Thankyou to both of you. A perfect stay.

What a delight. We based ourselves at Veritas cottage over my birthday weekend and it was perfect. Cosy, comfy, delicious brekky supplies and ideally located just on the outskirts of Tanunda - we will be back to stay next time we in the Barossa long lunching!

Cynthia is a lovely host, have the georceries ready in the fridge for her guests, provided orientation to us when we check-in. Lovely cottage, clean, and very homely. Also a complimentary bottle of wine, and some port from their winery! Good place to rest and relax. Cynthia is also very quick with any inquiries. Last but not least, do wine tasting at the cellar door, I love the wine! I would highly recommend this place. And I hope to come back for longer stay.

Rolf and Cynthia were fantastic hosts. We experienced a wonderful wine tasting and Cynthia was kind enough to give us a lift to the cottage afterwards. The cottage is lovely, decorated in 50s style and well located with great wineries nearby. The kitchen was packed with fresh produce, for a delicious breakfast. We recommend it to everyone and look forward to our next stay!

We loved our stay at the Veritas cottage, it's a beautiful, relaxing and quiet spot in the outskirt of Tanunda. Many restaurants and wineries are just a short drive away, two wineries are in walking distance.
Cynthia provided us with a generous supply of breakfast items, fruits, milk, cereals, jams, bacon and fresh eggs from her chickens. And a bottle of superb wine from the Rolf Binder winery - they make beautiful wines.
Absolutely outstanding is the hospitality of Cynthia and Rolf, they made us feel more than welcome and part of the family. We will be back!

A delightful place to spend a weekend away.  The herb and vege gardens were great and there is a lovely spot to sit out the front and enjoy the bird-life and peaceful surrounds. Very tranquil. The interior is clean and unfussy, with hardwood floors throughout (big tick for those with allergies). And yes, those gorgeous retro lounge chairs you see in the photos are super comfy to sit in. Cynthia is a very caring host and her communication was excellent. Thank you Cynthia!

Cynthia and Rolf are great hosts. From the start we booked with them, Cynthia was eager to assist us in booking activities and help us get the most of the visit.
Once there, they had arranged breakfast for us, ready in the kitchen, bottle of wine and we did some wine tasting at their winery and Rolf showed us part of their production site.
Very friendly and helpful. We highly recommend Cynthia and Rolf's place.
Great location to see everything in the Barossa. Exceptional hosts!

Excellent location on the outskirts of Tanunda and set back a bit from the road. We enjoyed the bottle of wine that was left for us on the patio in the evening after we arrived. Fridge was packed with stuff for making breakfast. Great stay.

Great house to stay at. Lots of great touches: organic hen layed eggs, tomatoes, mushrooms, bacon, bread and coffee. 
Town nearby. 
Best stemware ever, of all the Australian B&B I have stayed at. 
Great hosts.

Thanks for a great weekend! It’s a nice cosy place to stay with enough privacy & nice surroundings, but close to Tanunda & walking distance to some great wineries. We’ll definitely look forward to coming back soon!

This cottage is delightful: great retro look, beautiful new bathroom with underfloor heating, north facing kitchen, lounge and outdoor sitting area meant we soaked up the winter sun. Cynthia is a very thoughtful host - having the house warm and cosy when we arrived in the evening. The breakfast provisions are generous and delicious. We can highly recommend staying at this lovely little cottage.

Rolf and Cynthia’s accommodation was a wonderful base for exploring the Barossa. Cynthia gave us some great tips for things to do and see in the area. Definitely visit their winery for beautiful reds and Cynthia’s knowledge of the wine industry.
Fantastic location, close to town and all the sights. Fresh provisions such as bread, fresh eggs fruit and yogurt was a fantastic touch.
Super cute slightly retro accommodation but with an updated bathroom. Great hosts! very lovely breakfast provisions and wine. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Will absolutely be back again.

Cynthia and Rolf’s cosy cottage was everything you’d need for a stay in the Barossa. Brilliantly located just out of the throng of Tanunda and a short to medium stroll to some of the Barossa’s finest vineyards, this thoughtfully finished, welcoming home truly made our stay. Biggest of thanks to both of you guys for the delicious brekkie goods and a bottle of 2015 Shiraz that turned out to be our fave! All the best :)
Thank you so much. Cynthia was very responsive, thoughtful and made us feel like nothing was an effort. Great location. Breakfast provision a great touch.
Great location, just out of town, quiet and relaxing. Generous breakfast supplies. Comfortable bed and quality bathroom supplies. Sweetly fitted out in retro style.

A beautiful, well appointed cottage with vintage style and modern amenities. Comfy queen bed, generous breakfast provisions, and a lovely spot to sit outside in the sun and enjoy a coffee/ wine and meal. Close to loads of amazing food options, bike tracks and beautiful bush walks. Thank you so much for having us.
What a gorgeous place ... beautiful garden, delightful Cottage and such a great spot.

A lovely, cozy little cottage with all you could need.  Wonderful spaces to chill out, both indoors and out, and a choir of very talented magpies.  Some thoughtful vintage choices sprinkled around.  I felt like I was visiting with my lovely nan for the weekend.  The added bonus is some top notch wineries within walking distance.

A cosy little cottage, very good location. Very clean and has everything you need. 
Breakfast provisions provided were sourced locally and were delicious.
Thanks for a lovely long weekend.
Cute little cottage in a great location, great hosts with lots of good tips about the area. Highly recommend.

Alice and Tony, along with their charming children and dog, Rosie, made our short stay in Angaston a memorable one. This young and busy family make guests feel right at home. The self-contained accommodation is near the house and is well equipped and comfortable. Heating/cooling is more than adequate and the bed is very comfortable. The bathroom is clean and functional. The property is close to a number of quality restaurants and overlooks a vineyard, thus providing a degree of inspiration. Tony is a brilliant sculptor and his artworks in metal adorn the property. One of my favourites is what I call "Ned Kelly on acid."

Excellent place to stay in the heart of the Barossa region and really close by to Angaston. Alice was great and extremely flexible with us. Would highly recommend this place and would certainly come back. Thanks.
Beautiful and quiet spot.  We were made to feel very welcome!!!

Alice's little unit was lovely and private; exactly what we were looking for.  It was also perfectly situated in the heart of the Barossa and so close to a wonderful dining spot, Vintners (as suggested by Tony!)  whilst we didn't get much of a chance to speak to Alice as we arrived late and were out the next morning, she and her husband were very kind and welcoming.  We were also suggested some fantastic wineries to check out and were highly appreciative.  I would recommend Alice's place to anyone hoping for a quiet, clean and pleasant stay in the Barossa!

A lovely, quaint place to stay in the heart of the Barossa, The Sculptors Shed was perfect for our short stay in Angaston. Tony was very friendly and provided lots of suggested wineries to explore and even made us a cup of coffee in the morning to get us started! Unfortunately we didn't have much of a chance to speak to Alice as we arrived late on a Sunday night. The Sculptors Shed is a good value option for exploring the Barossa. Next time we will have to stay more than one night!
Easy, clean and comfortable.  Good value in the Barossa!

Alice has a great cottage that was even better than we expected. She was very flexible and accommodating. Her place was easy to find, very comfortable, and within easy walking distance of a fabulous restaurant. We look forward to staying again when the weather improves.

I got to the room late at 10:30pm and the host was waiting for me so there was no trouble getting in.  The room was small  but tidy and functional.   There is a TV and heater and the bathroom is modern.  I was only there for 1 night and moved on early but I would have no problem staying there again.

Our hosts were very welcoming and their compact, clean and comfortable accommodation was the ideal base to explore the Barossa Valley.
From the first contact nothing was lacking in communication and our hosts' willingness to provide for us.
A great base at a reasonable price!
We were greeted at the gate as we arrived and made right at home. The accommodation was really nice. Lovely location. Had a great time while we were there. We would definitely stay here again.

We arrived very late on a Saturday evening and was greeted immediately at the front by Alice.  We felt very welcome and very comfortable in the room. The place was extremely clean and tidy, the bed super comfortable and there was plenty of space for everything.  It is in a fabulous location and we can wait to return again! Their dog is absolutely gorgeous and the family very friendly but having your own separate space gives you all the privacy you need.
What a lovely place to stay. The host was very accommodating and very flexible with check-in and check-out times. Looking forward to staying there again next time we stay in the Barossa.
A very neat and comfy room that we all enjoyed our days in Barossa Valley.
Nice friendly welcome and accomodation was as expected. Thanks Alice and Tony for restaurant recommendation, it was worth the walk.
Good accommodation, Alice and Tony were very accommodating for anything extra we needed.

My husband and I had a lovely time staying at the Sculptor's Shed in Angaston! The location couldn't have been better, close to all of the wineries and a great restaurant. The room itself was very cozy and colorfully decorated. Tony was a great host, giving us plenty of recommendations about the area and showing us his sculptures. Would definitely recommend this place!

The Sculptor's Shed provided a very comfortable stay. We only stayed one night and it was close to the farmers market for a delicious breakfast the next day.  Highly recommended and would love to stay there again.
Fabulous stay in the Barossa! Thank you!
A great place with delightful hosts. The perfect base from which to explore the Barossa. To sum up :" 4 C's" : Comfort, cleanliness, coziness and convenience!

We loved our stay in the best part of the Barossa. The studio is beautifully and simply appointed. Hosts were friendly and offered helpful tips on where to go. We travel with bicycles and were delighted that our accom was just across the vineyard from the regional bike way.  Accom was clean and private from the main house. Nice to be able to cook for ourselves in the adjoining shed.

We had a lovely stay at Alice's place! We didn't have the pleasure of meeting Alice or her family, but everything was organised and perfect for our stay. Communication was very easy, and the location in the Barossa is superb. Highly recommend staying here!
Alice and Tony were amazing hosts. The room was more than we could have hoped for. We would be more than happy to stay with them again.

Our stay at the Sculptors Shed was delightful!  Àlice and Tony were great hosts - really flexible about check in and out times and straight forward communication in setting up our stay. They also recommended great places to see in the area and offered us a real coffee to start our day off (although I have to admit we slept so well on the comfy bed that it was mid morning before we got up so we bypassed the coffee so we could quickly get going for the day!) The accomodation was lovely - nice relaxing decor and new ensuite facilities. Being just out of Angaston means that everything in the Barossa is only a  quick car trip away. We enjoyed great food and wine, Maggie Beers Farmshop, The cheeseshop, Seppeltsville, the Jam Factory, Gully Gardens orchards, the Sculpture Park etc etc. On top of all that Tony is a talented sculptor and it is well worth checking out his work at Hentley Farm Winery. We would definitely stay again!

Arrival to the property was easily identifiable by the Robotic sculptor out the front! Especially since it was almost dark, it made it easier.
We were also welcomed by the owner's dog that signalled our arrival and Tony came out to greet us and show us to our room.

Location was great and room was exactly what we needed - clean, air-conditioned with all the requirements of an ensuite to freshen up and get on with our day of exploring!

Alice and her husband were extremely welcoming and the 'check-in' went super smooth. The Sculptures Shed was a charming little apartment we had all for ourselves, with a private bathroom (modern and clean) and a comfy bed. The best about our stay in the heart of the Barossa were the vineyards around Alice's place. We took many great shots and really enjoyed every second of our weekend getaway. We will be back for sure.

The Sculptures Shed was a fantastically presented little studio. More than adequate for a couple's getaway. We would definitely come back if we are in the Barossa. Alice and Tony we very pleasant and giving hosts.

The sculpture shed was a nice stay after a full day of wine tasting! Alice and Tony were flexible for checking in, which allowed us to explore the Barossa on our own schedule. Upon arrival they were friendly and showed us to our room. The room was super cute and was prefect for a one night stay. If you like to meet people during your travels this place will work for you. Tony and Alice did invite us to join in around their evening fire, but we we were too tired from the day. They also provided good food recommendations and a awesome lookout to see the entire valley.

The accommodation was clean and comfortable and well appointed.  It was peaceful and central to all we wanted to do and see in the Barossa Valley.  We were welcomed by Tony, who showed us the facilities and gave us some suggestions on where to eat and local attractions.
Beautiful room near lovely Angaston. Alice and Tony (and family) couldn't have been more welcoming.

Thank you Alice and Tony for your warm hospitality. A lovely little spot you have in The Barossa. We so enjoyed meeting you and your family plus your mascot Rosie! We wish you every success. Having the markets just up the road was a real treat.

It's our fault we only had a day in the Barossa.  Alice was super quick to respond to request, and they made it easy on us all the way.  Alice and Tony were there to meet us and set us up.  It's fun and homey staying with them, while having all the privacy you want.  Tony was helpful with recommendations, spot on for us.  Recommend them completely.

Thank you for a great stay Tony and Alice! Such a beautifully decorated room and comfy bed and location was great!

Thanks for being super helpful with where to eat/visit, was lovely to stay with you and check out some of your sculptures. We will be back again!
A clean and confy room, really closed to Angaston. Thank you Tony for the suggestion about the restaurant... It was amazing!

We stayed at Alice and Tony's place for one night and we were a bit unlucky with the weather, so we haven't been able to enoy the area as much as I am sure we would have if the weather was good.

The accommodation is nicely decorated, clean an private if you want to. The location is amazing, in the middle of the Barossa valley, so don't mind staying more than one night!!

The only thing that didn't work in the room was the WIFI, probably not a problem if you are just on your holidays, but not ideal if you have to do some work. I am sure you are welcome to use the internet while sitting closer to the house, but with the weather like it was when we were there, that wasn't an option.

Alice and Tony were great hosts, very welcoming. We will certainly be recommending their cozy and clean set up to our friend for weekends away. Tony your sculptures are fabulous and they look great around your property.  Thanks for creating such a relaxing and reguvinating environment.

We had a great few days at The Sculptors Shed, chosen for it's location - close to a fabulous restaurant, local market and cellar door within easy walking distance. Angaston is about 5 mins by car or approx 30 mins brisk walk for more cellar door opportunities, great breakfast cafe and other local amenities.  

Loved staying here - Tony and Alice were generous hosts, really warm, enthusiastic and welcoming.   We enjoyed a great bottle of wine and good craic with Tony on our first night. If you are into self-catering they have a funky kitchenette.

Alice and Tony were excellent hosts. Tony was there to meet us and give some recommendations for dinner. The room was lovely, perfect for us to enjoy a couple of days in the Barossa. We also had access to the kitchenette which was a bonus, would definitely stay here again next time we are in the Barossa.

Alice and Tony were wonderful hosts, ensuring that the apartment was equipped with everything we needed while allowing us as much privacy as we wanted. The location is fantastic, just a short walk to good restaurants (eg. Vintners) and wineries or a quick taxi into Angaston. The apartment itself was very clean and tidy and made a great base for exploring the Barossa Valley. I would recommend "The Sculptors Shed" to anyone travelling to the area.
A great little hideaway in the Barossa. Lovely garden with Tony's artwork on display. Wonderful to meet you both. Hope to be back!

Thank you Alice & Tony for a great stay. The room was ideal for what we needed & the use of the kitchenette next door was an added bonus. Nothing was too much trouble & we would definitely stay again & highly recommend to any of out friends & family coming to stay in the Barossa.

Alice and Tony were very lovely and helpful hosts. On an extremely hot weekend our shed was cool and clean- bed very comfortable and the bathroom lovely and new. We had the use of a kitchenette in the garage and discussed with Tony our only need- coffee making facilities which he assured us was on the way . In the mean time he took time to make us a beautiful cup in his own kitchen-Lovely.
The Shed is wonderfully central to all of the Barossa and especially to Angaston  which is cute and has great cafe's.
Highly recommended !
Lovely room, great location and welcoming hosts.

Our stay at the Sculptors Shed was absolutely perfect for our night away in the Barossa. Very central to everything with great wineries and restaurants only a short distance from the property. The accommodation itself was clean, modern and cosy-we loved it. Tony was friendly,helpful and made us feel right at home. His sculptures the adorn the yard are a true work of art. We highly recommend the Sculptors Shed for anyone travelling in this lovely part of South Australia
Excellent hosts and a wonderful place to stay in the heart of the Barossa.  Great location and the Sculptors Shed is the nicest shed we have ever seen!  Thanks

Alice und Tony haben mich sehr freundlich empfangen und waren sehr hilfsbereit. Ich habe mich mit Tony bei Bier und Wein prima unterhalten und wusste seine Fürsorge sehr zu schätzen. Das Zimmer befindet sich separat vom Wohnhaus und ist geschmackvoll eingerichtet mit neuem Bad. Infos zu der Umgebung lagen ebenfalls aus und die Beiden waren immer ansprechbar und sehr hilfsbereit wenn man Fragen hatte.
Ich habe meinen Aufenthalt bei ihnen genossen und wünsche den Beiden alles Gute für die Zukunft und Tony viel Erfolg für seine Selbstständigkeit.

The Sculptors Shed is in a great location in Angaston, the heart of the Barossa Valley region.  Alice & Tony made us feel very welcome and provided good local knowledge of the area.  Rosie (the dog) is very excitable and loves meeting new guests.  Highly recommended.

We fell in love with this property immediately! Alice and Tony were amazing hosts, we will definitely be back! Room was gorgeous and just what we needed. We loved their dog Rosie on arrival. Excellent hosts, beautiful family - highly recommend this property!

Thank you Alice and Tony for making our Barossa Valley trip memorable! We loved everything about 'the sculptors shed' and it is a perfect little space! Likewise thank you for all the suggestions and advice on the must visits in the area! 
We highly recommend anyone visiting the Barossa Valley to stay here for the comfort and the central location.
Thank you and hopefully to see you on the Mornington Peninsula in the future.

Best regards,
Dmitry and Emma

This gorgeous 'shed' was exactly as shown. Extremely clean, great air con (perfect for the 40 degree day I stayed), quiet and everything you need for a short stay. I didn't get to meet Alice and Tony unfortunately, but received a very clear welcome email with everything I needed. Very quick responses to queries too! Thank you

This was one of the highlights of our trip across Australia. Tony was a great host and the room was immaculate and clean. We felt like we were on a honeymoon. We look forward to staying there again when Tony has made all the changes, especially the pizza oven ;)

Great stay. Looks much better in person then in the pictures. Very clean. Also very close to Vinters which has excellent food and wine. Had a great day in the Barossa Valley and this location is the ideal spot to be when exploring. Also very cool to see Tony's sculpture, very inspiring. Wish them all the best.

The shed is a cutely decorated and comfortable place to stay in the Barossa. Alice and Tony are friendly hosts. Tony is also very thoughtful to make sure we had what we needed. We felt welcomed and relaxed during our stay. We particularly enjoyed sampling the local produce hauled from the Barossa Farmers Market across the road.

What a charming place to stay. Alice, Tony and their dog are delightful   and couldn't have been more welcoming.
LOVED the sculptures in the garden and being in the country.
Thank you both ;-))
Alice and Tony are two great host. They know the area very well and were really helpful. We had a nice time at their place. The shed is very comfortable.

Alice & Tony's place is perfect for a stay in the Barossa. It's central to everything, the room is clean, comfortable, has everything you need and the kitchen is handy for cheese and wine hauls after a day out and about. It was easy to check in and out and Alice and Tony are friendly and easy going (and Rosie the dog is gorgeous!). Thanks guys :)
The place is s described. Beautiful, clean and functional. Tony and Alice were friendly, hospitable and helpful. The location was close to all the different wineries.
Great place. Wonderful hosts! Good location. Comfy bed... Honestly nothing felt amiss. And their dog is adorable.
A lovely night at this place. Made welcome and had a good nights sleep   Thank you

What a lovely little home. Shed on the outside but like a hotel on the inside. It was so clean and such a convenient location we were able to go for a couple of nice walks on our 1 night stay. All the wineries we wanted to go to were an easy drive away. Got to meet Tony and Alice in the morning who were both very warm and friendly people. If I went to this area again I would definitely stay here again and I will also be recommending it to friends and family.
Tip: Close the window at night as the bugs get attracted to the lights inside and can sneak in. As soon as we realised we shut it and has no issues.

Alice and Tony made us feel very welcome at the Sculptors shed. They have turned this "Shed" into a wonderful comfortable space. when I first saw this listing I thought it was so querky that I just had to stay there, I was not disappointed. There is no better position in the Barossa valley than here, you are right in the middle of the four main towns that border the Barossa. This is a beautifully appointed room, we found it very well decorated and insulated from noise, weather and certainly no drafts, which you may expect in a shed. This is no ordinary shed, it is simply a wonderful room an beautiful area of Australia that must be experienced.

Super schoenes Zimmer um sich wohlzufuehlen. Das Zimmer war ein Anbau an die Garage und man ist separat zum Haus der Familie. Man kann in der Garage eine kleine Kochecke benutzen. Fuer ein Gespraech war die Familie sehr offen und total unkompliziert. Es hat an nichts gefehlt. Die Gastgeber waren sehr herzlich und nett. Wir wurden sogar noch mit frischen Nektarinen vom Garten verwoehnt. Wir wuerden dass Airbnb defintiv weiter empfehlen. Es liegt perfekt zentral zu diversen Weingueter.

What a cute and cosy place! The room was clean and bright and the location was amazing. Alice and Tony were lovely hosts and we loved patting their dog Rosie. Great place to base yourself in the Barossa.
Amazing. Would stay again!

We had a wedding in the Barossa and this was the perfect place to stay. Close to everything, quiet and separate from the main house! Wonderful hosts and just like the pictures, would stay again. Thanks Alice and Tony
Alice and Tony were great hosts, very friendly and the room was immaculate. Good central location for exploring the barossa wine region.

We had a wonderful time in the "shed" -- hard to call it that because it had all creature comforts. Alice supplied anything we were lacking on a moment's notice --even brought us unlimited freshly picked apples. It was wonderful being around a young, active family, in a sculpture garden, and a perfect location. We were walking distance to the fabulous Barossa Valley Saturday market as well as the best restaurant in the valley. Easy to get to anywhere from their place.
Excellent space - everything that I needed and all things just a short drive away. A wonderful place to stay for several days! I would definitely love to return!

We enjoyed our stay in the Sculptor's Shed and our hosts were both friendly and considerate of our privacy. They were very accommodating on all accounts and gave some great recommendations on food and restaurants. However, the bed might be a bit hard for some. WiFi only worked reliably when in their family space which can be a bit disconcerting when you are aware of the hosts family personal space. Unfortunately we stayed at the tail-end of the vintage so there were lots of noisy trucks during the night.

Had a wonderful time in the Barossa. Alice and Tony made us feel very welcome during our stay over the Easter long weekend. They even left us chocolate Easter eggs. Sculptors Shed was very clean and comfortable. Would definitely recommend.

My partner and I enjoyed our stay at the shed. Both Alice and Tony were very helpful both prior and during our stay. The room and bathroom was very clean and we had easy access to basic kitchen facilities and a fridge in the garage next door. We would definitely recommend this place for anyone looking for a easy, cosy place to stay while visiting the Barossa.

Such a great location to base yourself in the Barossa. Tony was really helpful when we arrived. Showed us the "shed" and kitchenette and gave us tips on where to eat and wineries to see. The Sculptors Shed looks nothing like a shed inside. It's well insulated and comfortable for two, although I will agree with another persons review that the bed was a little hard for my liking. We didn't use the wi-fi access which was in the house but we were welcome to. Tony was very welcoming.  Even though I prefer a softer mattress I would still recommend anyone to stay here and would stay here again myself.  
Tips for places to dine and wineries, Tscharke (great, tasty and CHEAP wines), Yalumba (impressive cellar door with nice wines) (both are Vegan BTW), Artisans for tastings and lunch ( Lucy was great for tastings) St Hallets, Rockford. Go to Vintners for dinner or lunch ( don't eat anything else for the day), Blonde cafe in Angaston town, fermenAsian in Tanunda.

The Sculptor's Shed is in a great location in the Barossa, especially to visit wineries and the Farmer's Market down the road! It's got everything you need in a private little space, and Alice and Tony were very friendly. Highly recommended!

Alice and Tony made us feel very welcome, meeting us on arrival, showing us around their lovely property and chatting about things to do in the area. The Sculptor's Shed is fabulous accommodation, quirky on the outside and modern and luxurious on the inside. It was also great to have access to kitchenette facilities nearby so we could organise our own breakfast. 
I would have no hesitation in recommending this accommodation and the hosts to others.

A great stay in the very cute shed. Interior was lovely! Tony and Alice were friendly and we enjoyed sitting out on their terrace with a bottle of wine and seeing one of Tony's fire pits being lit. Excellent location for Barossa, right near the farmers market and vintners!
What a delightful place to stay. We were welcomed so warmly and the 'shed' is so close to all the Barossa has to offer. Lovely hosts with a lovely family!

The Sculptors Shed is a cosy space with separate entrance to the host's house. it has an internal bathroom, TV (which we didn't use) and heated air con which was very much appreciated!! (It can get cold at night). Tony was welcoming and friendly and provided great tips to dining in the area. Thank you!

We really enjoyed our stay here. The room is small and very cosy. The bathroom was nice. It's a nice quiet spot if you want to explore Barossa. You can hear some traffic noise once in a while, but nothing to bother about. We were greeted very friendly. Were allowed to use the fridge and kitchen next door, which was really good. A nice place. Really liked it there!

The Sculptors Shed was in a fantastic location for a weekend away. Their veranda was perfect for enjoying a cheese plate and a bottle of wine too. We didn't see Alice and Tony the whole weekend but had everything we needed.

Had a nice stay at Alice and Tony's place and got blessed with perfect weather too! Communication was very easy with them and they are lovely people. Amazing area to stay and explore what the barossa valley has to offer. Thankyou very much for having us
Room as described, clean, nice hosts, room set in a lovely surrounding, and in the perfect location !
We felt incredibly welcome and didn't feel at all as if we were intruding on the family privacy

Our first foray using Airbnb and we were looking for somewhere to break our trip to the Flinders. We were not disappointed. What a find, great location, excellent lodgings and very welcoming hosts. Would most definitely stop here again and will be recommending this place to all our friends

This is an arty environment. The shed door opens out onto Tony's sculpture in the garden. The room was clean, had air con and a private bathroom. The kitchen next door was satisfactory. Tony has plans for improvement of this whole area. Tony and Alice were welcoming and  friendly.
Lovely little space, conveniently located, very friendly and accommodating host. Definitely recommend staying here.

Tony met us on arrival and was really welcoming to us after a long car trip. We loved sitting with a glass of wine admiring the sculpture yard and hearing about the area's history. The property is surrounded by vineyards and is very charming. Our room had everything we needed for our short stay. Thank you Tony and family.

Although only a very short trip, we really enjoyed staying at the Sculptors Shed. The accommodation was cute and cosy, and very warm in Winter! The property was beautiful and in a very good location, next to restaurants and the Farmers Market. Alice and Tony were very friendly and welcoming. Would recommend the place to anyone staying in the Barossa. We hope to come back one day!

Alice and Tony were away but made us feel welcome by sending an email beforehand to let us know with instructions on where everything was. The place was great - great location, very homely and cosey. Lots of character and perfect for what we needed! We were very happy with our few days there and enjoyed the Barossa Valley a lot!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here and found our hosts to be very welcoming. The accommodation is fantastic and well positioned for those planning to explore the Barossa valley. We would definitely definitely hope to return here in the future.

We really enjoyed our mini break at The Sculptors Shed. We needed to make several changes to our booking and Alice was so accommodating with them all! And super quick to reply. The room was really cosy with a great ensuite and had everything we needed. We used the kitchenette as well. Perfectly located with warm and welcoming hosts. Thanks for having us!

Tony and Alice are beautiful and welcoming host. Tony ensured that we were arrived at the right place upon our arrival at the gate of their place. The room was warm and cosy, perfectly clean, well functioned heater in a cold winter night. We were able to use the kitchen next door with everything we need, TV was the company of our dinner.  On our road trip to one of the winery which we went on the wrong road, that was not suppose to be drove in under rain, and we got stuck in the muddy road. We called Alice immediately for help and Tony was then came over to rescue us in the rainy and freezing muddy road. He tried to use all his skill and equipment to toll our car out and finally got us home safe. he was so thoughtful that tried to minimise the damage of our car!!! He even offered to help fixing the little broken part of the car (perfectly) for us in his workshop. We won't be able to survive without his generous help. They are the superhero to us and we highly recommend Tony to anyone who got stuck in the muddy road!!!!! THANK YOU TONY AND ALICE!  THEY ARE THE BEST AIRBNB HOST THAT WE HAVE EVER HAD!
Warm, cosy, extremely clean and very friendly hosts - perfect for our night's stopover after sampling the gorgeous Barossa fare. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again - thanks Alice and Tony !

The Sculptures Shed is the perfect Barossa getaway for a night or two.
It's small but comfortable, clean and altogether lovely.
Close to all the main sites and wineries, easy to get to and most important - wonderful hosts!
Alice and Toni were so accommodating, helpful and friendly.
Unfortunately had only one night this time.
Next time I'm Barossa Valley I'll make sure to book a couple of nights at the Shed.
Alice and Tony were perfect hosts and the 'shed' was equally perfect. It was all we needed for a relaxing evening. Thank you to you both!

We had a great time staying at The Sculptors Shed. Very cosy and clean. The hosts Alice and Tony were very welcoming. Location was great plenty of wineries, restaurants and cafes within a short distance. Would definitely recommend this accommodation.
Great cosy stay in Angaston! :)

Was only at Alice and Tony's for a short time but our stay was perfect!
Hosts were very easy to communicate with and always responded promptly. The shed has everything you need for a short stay. We arrived late and left early in the morning but this was not a problem for our hosts.  Would highly recommend!
Both alice & tony were lovely hosts! The rook is perfect for our overnight stay has all you need and the rook was so nice and warm and electric blanket was perfect too =)

Had the pleasure of staying here last night.... Tony was a fantastic host-very hospitable and friendly made us feel right at home.. We can't wait to go back and would definitely stay again. Was a lovely clean room with brilliant heating and clean bathroom and a close stroll to the angaston markets and vintners bar and grill.. Highly recommended...
Shed was unique as advertised. Room was small but very comfortable.

Cosy little room in the heart of the Barossa - you sleep about 3-4 from Barossa Vines! 

Alice and Tony are lovely as well!

We enjoyed our overnight stay at Alice and Tonys' Sculptors Shed. Excellent location to experience the Barossa. The accommodation was great and perfect for our needs. Alice and Tony were friendly and accommodating hosts. We happily recommend the Sculptors Shed for a great spot to stay in this region.
Alice and Tony were very welcoming and the Sculptors Shed was cosy and suited us perfectly. It was a great central location from which to explore the Barossa.
Great location, lovely hosts. Highly recommend staying here!
A wonderful base to explore the Barossa from

Alice and Tony were great hosts! Very prompt with replies and always ready to give recommendations if needed.

The sculpture shed was cute, the bed was comfy and it has everything u need for a quick get away. 

It is situated in the heart of the Barossa and was a quick drive to all surrounding towns and wineries which was perfect! 

Perfect for a few nights :) and if you love dogs, Rosie their dog is beautiful!
Comfortable and clean budget accommodation in a beautiful and central location. Lovely hosts too. Enjoyed our stay in the Barossa and would recommend this accommodation to others.
The accomodations were fantastic. Alice and Tony were very welcoming hosts and we very much enjoyed our stay. Would recommend staying there to anyone visiting the Barossa Valley.
Awesome modern place well located for all that the Barossa has to offer. Very friendly and helpful hosts. Highly recommended.
The Shed was comfortable though smaller than expected, also quite close to a main road.

Alice & Tony were very helpful and hospitable, great communication! The shed is small as expected but exactly what we wanted - a comfortable bed and hot shower so we could spend our time discovering the many wineries and restaurants in the area. The location wasn't in the main township as I thought it might be, but it turned out to be perfect as it was minutes to everything! Close by is Vintners for a beautiful meal, and we loved heading to the farmer's market (very close) for breakfast and shopping. The shed is close to the main house, but we felt as though we had enough privacy. Excellently comfortable, clean, and a great price! Thank you for making our trip extra special.

We only stayed here for one night but we found this place very convenient, nearby to Angaston town. The place is small and off a main road (which surprisingly can be quite noisy) so would be good for a short stay. The WiFi works outside the shed only. 

Although we didn't get to meet Alice, she was helpful leading up and during the stay.

Perfect for our overnight stay in the Barossa for a wedding. We were greeted warmly by Tony and communication was great leading up to the stay. Accommodation was very clean, comfortable bed and had all the amenities we needed for our short stay. Peaceful rural location overlooking the vines and close to the site for the Barossa farmers market. Also a friendly dog!

Alice and Tony were very cordial and warm hosts, and we were so glad to have found this little gem in the Barossa! 

The Shed is cosy and comfortable, everything we needed for our (unfortunately, extremely short due to travel delays) trip; we loved the character and warm reception. 

We will absolutely return another time, hopefully longer ...
Friendly contact - no surprises
We were made very welcome and the area was perfect for travelling to all parts of the Barossa.    The shed was cosy even in cold weather!

Tony received me very warmly and described the unit. 
Very cosy! The neighbour is very calm.
Great communication, location and room in the heart of the Barossa wine country. Friendly and very accommodating hosts.
The perfect choice, beautiful place and beautiful people. Thanks to Alice and Tony for making our trip special.
We loved the sculptures shed, a quirky space surrounded by vineyards, beautifully decorated and clean. Tony was incredibly welcoming and had lots of useful recommendations for us.
Very welcoming and generous!
Very warm welcome from Tony and Alice - a nice and clean room, small, but sufficient. Would definitely stay here again.
Great location, very close to the Barossa Farmers Market and Angaston is about 5 mins drive. Nice little studio, clean and bright

The Sculptor's Shed is a shed converted for accommodation for two. Still a work in progress it nonetheless has a comfortable bed and clean, modern ensuite. Access to the rest of the shed allows use of microwave, toaster, sink, coffee maker.
Alice and Tony are really friendly and laid back, and happy to share their local knowledge with you. They have 3 kids and a kelpie/Staff cross, Rosie, who is as welcoming as Alice and Tony themselves. Do try Vintners Restaurant (walkable), and the Saturday Farmers' Market, situated behind Vintners. Another great experience for local wine tasting and locally produced nibbles is Taste Eden Valley, Washington St., Angaston.

Cute and cozy private retreat bounded by vineyards in the heart of the Barossa. Central to vineyards, restaurants, cellar doors and the awesome Anguston farmers' market. Take a walk around the property and check out Tony's fantastic metal sculptures. Highly recommended place to stay!
Great accommodation and friendly hosts, tidy set up with creature comforts to make the room a very enjoyable overnight stay.

We only stayed 1 night at Alice and Tony's place but it was great. Beautiful little spot and the accommodation is everything you need, nice and clean. Great place to base yourself for exploring the Barossa. Would recommend.
Had a great time at Alice and Tony's. A great base for exploring the barossa.

We had such a lovely stay at the sculptors shed! Tony and Alice were so lovely, chilled out and very helpful. Their place is really close to the bike tracks which was great for cruising around on our bikes tasting wine. The shed had everything we needed for a low key getaway. The location is great, just out of angaston, and the place itself was clean and comfortable. Awesome value for money, we'd love to visit this part of the country again. Thanks for having us!!

Amazing location, beautiful place. Great hosts! 
Would stay here again and again.
Alice and Tony were lovely welcoming guests. Their Sculptors Shed was as described and in a beautiful location. Thanks for the short but lovely stay
Had a great stay. Ideal plce to stay and explore some great wineries and resturants. Alice and Tony very friendly and Tonys art work is sensational
Centrally located in the Barossa and easy access to many attractions.

Thanks to Alice and Tony for providing a wonderful space for our short stay in Tanunda/Angaston. We were greeted on arrival by friendly hosts (and the family dog) and were provided all that was described in the profile. A lovely stop right in the middle of the Tanunda/Nuriootpa/Angaston triangle - close to everything.
Lovely studio in the middle of the Barossa area. Close drive to nearby restaurants. Helpful information all supplied!
The hosts were lovely, and full of good advice. Everything was very easy and we really enjoyed staying there.
Alice and Tony were great hosts. Place was cute and clean, perfect location for our drinking needs. Looking forward to staying here again.
A very pleasant stay, friendly hosts.
Great place to stay, very comfortable and pet friendly. Host we're very friendly and accomodating and would we would definitely recommend the place to future guests. Thank you for having us!

Great stay in this granny flat just outside Angaston, well appointed with everything we needed for our short stay. Alice and Tony were lovely people and even did us a favour and allowed us use of the washing machine. Highly recommend this place for trips to the Barossa
Such a lovely couple and a great spot to stay whilst touring the Barossa.  Highly recommend!
Friendly hosts, central location from which guests can explore the Barossa Valley. Good communicators, helpful suggestions from Tony who welcomed us.
Great stay with Alice and Tony. Lovely people and cosy shed - perfect!
Great place, clean, modern and private. Really comfortable bed! Tony and Alice were great, helpful and friendly.
Great place. Clean, good location. Alice and Tony were very friendly. WiFi didn't work in the room, but worked on the verandah and were also offered to go inside the main house to use it too

Great little spot, close drive to all the wineries. Vitner's bar and grill is about a 10min walk and offers up some yummy food (they were also accommodating for vegetarians). The place has everything you need for a night or more in the Barossa. Alice and Tony were away for the night but we're really friendly and helpful. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Alice and Tony were lovely hosts, the accommodation is exactly as described and good value for money. The room is cosy with an ensuite bathroom and is a great base for exploring the Barossa.  Firm bed, fluffy pillows, hot shower with good water pressure. Basic kitchen amenities in the shed next door. We had no problems with the wifi but some people do (reading reviews). Alice and Tony were great communicators and very helpful with things to see and do while visiting the Barossa if help is required. I had researched what we wanted to do and they confirmed I was on the right track. Our main reason for choosing to stay here was being able to walk to Vintner's Bar & Grill. Absolutely fantastic restaurant just 10min walk down the road. We would happily stay here again.
Lovely room in the heart of the Barossa, wish we'd stayed longer!
Perfect spot from which to explore the Barossa.

A great place for a stopover while visiting the area. The shed is basic and small, but modern, comfortable, very clean, and just what I needed at the end of a day touring the area. It was sweltering hot when I visited (thank goodness for airconditioning)  and Alice was kind enough to drop me at Vintners bar and grill so I could enjoy a couple of wines with dinner. Would definitely recommend as a good value option. Alice and Tony were lovely hosts.
Alice and Tony were lovely and very hospitable and their accomodation was perfect for our weekend of exploring the Barossa region. Exactly what we were after. Thank you

We stayed at Tony and Alice's place for two nights - and was exactly as described. They were both lovely and greeted us on arrival and gave us some tips about which wineries to visit and places to eat. I would stay here again. Having access to a fridge and somewhere to make a sandwich (simple food prep) etc was great.
If you are looking for somewhere relaxed and easy going this is the place.
Enjoyed our stay in this comfortable accommodation.  Great location, short walk on a Saturday morning to the fantastic Barossa Farmers market.  Can definitely recommend.
Apologies I couldn't really rate the stars accurately because the website isn't allowing me functionality. I thought your place was clean and accurately described. Thank you

Alice and Tony are great hosts, super friendly and helpful. Their place is a great spot to stay, very clean, has everything you need and a convenient location to explore the Barossa Valley from.  Highly recommend staying here.
非常感謝

Thanks Alice & Toni this was our first Air BNB stay and first visit to the Barossa, and the perfect place to stay.  Great location and accommodation, and lovely welcoming hosts. Hope to be a back again in the not too distant future.

Alice and Tony are a delight! They are both so welcoming and the Sculptor's Shed was a welcome retreat for a long weekend in the Barossa. The room is so charming, comfortable, and beautifully kept – I only wish it could have been a longer stay!
Great place to stay with Alice, Tony and the kids and their beautiful dog. Comfortable and relaxing and a beautiful location.
