Alice and Tony's place is wonderful. Conveniently situated near the Saturday Barossa Farmer's  Markets and less than 15 minutes away from some great wineries, you won't have to go far to explore the best that Barossa can offer. Great house with a lovely view and helpful and kind hosts.
Great spot for the Farmers Market and The Vintners Restaurant. Helpful hosts. We enjoyed our stay.
Great location, great outdoor area for reclining back and relaxing!! Just what we needed. Thanks so much for your great hospitality Alice and Tony!!!

We loved our stay at the Sculptors Shed in Angaston as the hosts were both welcoming and interesting.
The amenities were as stated and all in new & working condition. Beautifully decorated room plus and outdoor undercover lounge area in the garden. We loved Rosie the kelpie x's company too ( well behaved).

Alice and Tony were great hosts, super friendly and full of recommendations on what to do in the region. They have a lovely home only a few minutes walk from a very nice local restaurant, perfect for a nice dinner after a full day of wine tasting!
If you love dogs, you're in for a treat, Rosie is just adorable and super friendly ☺
Very clean and comfortable, delightful hosts and great position in the Barossa for exploring.
Alice and Tony responded very quickly to my questions and were kind and generous to cater to our needs and requests. The room is detached from the main house, clean and comfortable. =)

We had a great stay during the Vintage Festival - Alice and Tony are lovely hosts. They were very helpful and fast in responding to any query we had. The shed is cosy and clean and it's great to be able to use the kitchenette and fridge next door. Rosie, their dog is cute and loves cuddles. Great location to explore the wineries from either by car or by bike - the bike path to Tanunda is not far and the farmers market is close by.

Great little shed. Small but perfect for what we were after. Comfy bed, generous sized bathroom for the size of the room. Close to everything. Alice & Tony (& Rosie) were great, easy to communicate. Would stay again.
Tony & Alice were both super friendly and had great tips on the Barossa area. Their home is close to all the Barossa essentials and great wineries. Would happily stay again! Thank you for having us!

A delightful place to stay. Alice and Tony were so helpful and warm. The accomodation was perfect for us and snug. We enjoyed a lovely bike ride along the trail near their house and visited some great wineries that Alice suggested. I would highly recommend this airbnb

We enjoyed the new  and stylish bedroom  and bathroom accommodation with the unique outdoor additions. The outdoor lounge area, still being added to, is very interesting and innovative. Thanks for a delightful stay Alice and Tony.

Excellent place to stay for a couple of days of exploring the Barossa. Tony and Alice were very welcoming and it was a lovely warm room for our autumn stay. We got to walk through a vineyard to get to the bike track between angaston and nuriootpa

Really cute little place right next to the vineyards. Had an almost camping feel as you exit the room to go into the shed next door for tea or kitchen items which is actually quite nice as you get some fresh air. The hosts are really lovely and they have a sweet little dog too  Only downside is that it's not very private as it's right behind the back of their house so you don't really have much space outside if you want to hang out on your own but they tell you this in the description so just beware. The room itself has all the basics you need with a comfy bed, heating for the cold nights a little bathroom. All you need for a good rest before exploring the Barossa
Great character setup, Alice and Tony were very helpful, and great value in the heart of the Barossa.
Great place with privacy and very friendly but unobtrusive hosts.

We had such a memorable stay at 'the sculptors shed'. The accommodation was modern and cosy, Alice and Tony were extremely hospitable and made us feel very welcome. Their children are also delightful. Tony's sculptor work is outstanding, very talented man and it was great being surrounded by his master pieces. Thanks for making our stay in the Barossa so fabulous and we really enjoyed getting to know you both over a few glasses of wine!

A nice, clean and comfortable place to stay in the Barossa Valley. Close to restaurants, especially if you are also looking to have dinner in the Barossa. Tony provided great recommendations for places to visit and dine.

Alice and Tony's home is superb. The room is completely self sufficient and brilliant if you are looking for some peace and quiet. I staying for one night and left wishing I had stayed for more! It's in a brilliant location and even has a restaurant 800m up the road! It's the perfect place to stay and explore the Barossa! Thank you for having me and for being such attentive hosts!

Alice & Tony were super friendly and hospitable, and they were really accommodating when I had a last minute schedule change.  The accommodation is lovely and well located for a stay in the Barossa. Recommend.
Lovely little ensuite room! Tony was friendly and helpful. Great communication with the host! It was a perfect getaway for us. Thanks!
The studio was comfortable and tidy, and only a short drive from the centre of town. The hosts were very helpful with local places to eat.
Staying at Alice and Tony's shed was the perfect quaint spot for us. We will be back!
Very comfortable and private. Great location to all spots in the Barossa. Hosts were great and easy to communicate with. Would highly recommend!
Excellent place to stay, Alice and tony were fantastic with communication, and the place was great. Would recommend 10/10
Quiet cute little place well located between Angaston and Tanunda. 5 min walk to Vintiners Bar and Grill and Farmers market on Saturdays.....

Thanks Alice and Tony for hosting us, the heating and electric blankets were great for a cold Barossa winter, made the room nice and cozy. Tony's tips on the Barossa were great, especially highlighting some smaller vineyards that we had not considered. There is also a great array of brochures for local attractions which helped us out.
Check in and check out were a breeze, thanks again for a memorable stay!
Amazing hospitality and such a beautiful place to stay! Highly highly recommend and we will be returning many times!!

The sculptors shed provided us with a simple but cosy base from which to explore the Barossa. We had our own car which made all Barossa wineries and restaurants very easily accessible, it is a great central location. Alice and Tony were very welcoming and friendly, despite the shed being in close proximity to the house we didn't feel like we were intruding nor did we feel it was lacking any privacy. Thank you!
Alice and Tony are great hosts and can be as public or private as you want. The place is clean, warm and central to so much that the Barossa has to offer. We loved it.
Well fitted out; new and clean

The Sculptor's Shed is a cosy, clean, up to date and relaxing place and is a credit to it's owners. It is central to all of the Barossa's winery's and restaurants, but secluded enough to relax and unwind. I will have no hesitation in returning in the future.
Alice and Tony have a lovely little set up in their backyard and the room was quaint and comfortable. There was lots of information on the region provided as well. Would recommend!
Alice and Tony are fantastic hosts and have a lovely home. The accommodation was small and tidy, with a beautiful outdoor area and in a stunning location close to the town centre.
Great little place, Alice and Tony are great people and very welcoming.
Great as ever guys, thanks!

Maybe good for one or two nights but no more, as very small with limited storage space for baggage.  Wi-Fi not working in your room is inconvenient and no where for a couple to sit in room to eat or drink, so your bed is used for everything from eating, sitting, sleeping and watching tv.
Great experience staying pretty much in the middle of vineyards. Alice and Tony are great hosts. We were traveling with our two year old son who had such a great time with the family dog and hens!

We stayed at Alice and Tony's place for 3 nights. It was a great base to explore the Barossa from. Alice and Tony were great hosts. The Sculptors Shed  was small but worked well. Had the weather been warmer we could have taken advantage of their large outdoor lounge area. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend The Sculptors Shed
Great property. Views of the vineyard with great outdoor area.

We loved staying in Alice and Tony's shed, which was clean and comfortable and well-situated for exploring the Barossa on foot or by car. (It's a 25-minute walk into Nuriootpa.) Alice and Tony were both very friendly and made us feel at home, giving us lots of information about local attractions and restaurants. They were also great at communicating beforehand and being flexible with check-in times. Would definitely stay again!

Great little room at the back of Tony & Alice's place. Quiet location and yet still close to town. A gorgeous little studio and the premises are surrounded by amazing sculpture work. 
Alice and Tony were very welcoming. Thanks again for making our stay easy and recommending the best coffee in Tanunda at Artisans!
Great place to stay with really friendly and helpful hosts.

Alice and Tony's space is very comfortable and as described.  The hosts are very welcoming and friendly and their place would be great as somewhere to be based while exploring the Barossa.  A car would be needed though.
I only had one night on this trip but would definitely look to stay again on my next and longer stay.

Communication was always prompt and helpful. Easy to find. Room is clean and comfortable though small. Has everything needed for an overnight stay. 
No tea / coffee provided and kitchen is not set up for cooking. Fridge access appreciated.

Imagine vast skies, rows of vines, distant hills, fresh air, rustic art and a friendly dog at your feet. This is what I'll remember about Tony and Alice's place.

The room itself is compact and cozy, with a picture window and a fab vintage door. The bed is comfy and the bathroom clean. All you could need after days out exploring. There is a small kitchen in the big shed next door. Perfect for storing the gourmet bites and wine you will definitely pick up while in the Barossa.  We made tea/coffee and a basic breakfast each morning. It is a shed with a kitchen so you probably wouldn't want to cook a big meal. But with so much to eat nearby I can't imagine why you'd want to.

Possibly our favourite part was the veranda with big old table. You can sit out enjoy the view and plan your next outing. The yard is also filled with Tony's amazing metal work art, which is well worth a look.

Location wise, the shed is between two towns.  One of the bike paths connects them and you can join it easily just around the corner. We rented bikes one day (ask Alice and Tony for a recommendation he was great and offered delivery and pick up). Do note one direction was nice and flat the other is quite uphill. There is also an amazing restaurant just down the road (walkable).

Finally Alice and Tony are amazing hosts. There when you need them and happy to chat and offer great local insight. But also respectful of your privacy and space. We would return in a heartbeat.

Good location, close to restaurants and wineries. Small room but this was no issue for us as we were out sight seeing most of the time. Hosts were friendly but did not intrude on our privacy. A dog is on site but is ultra friendly and remarkabley quiet. There is access to a small kitchenette in the shed next door but be aware there is no breakfast provisions provided. Overall a good experience would recommend for a couple for a short stay.

Alice and Tony's place is totally lovely.  It's in a fantastic location to explore the delights of the Barossa.  The shed itself is clean and comfortable, overlooking vineyards, we wish we could have stayed for longer!
Beautiful place to stay! Comfy bed, great location, quiet, great surrounding scenery, very clean and kind/knowledgable hosts. Highly recommend.

We loved staying at The Sculptors Shed! Alice and Tony were great hosts - their house is situated perfectly to sample everything that Barossa has to offer. The room was clean, tiny and comfortable and so so quiet, it's very separate from the rest of the house so you have your own space. Highly recommend!
Gute Übernachtungsmöglichkeit, Strasse hörbar, sauber, nette hosts!

Great little place, very relaxing staying right next to some beautiful vines. Plenty of space to wind down in the outdoor spaces too, there's a nice patch of grass next to the "shed" to read. We had everything we needed to have a great stay in the room and the kitchenette. Alice and Tony were great hosts!

Alice and Tony's place provides a great base to explore the Barossa. The local farmers market is only a short walk from the house! The Shed is very clean, comfortable and secure. Alice and Tony were lovely hosts - very friendly and responsive, check-in and -out were a breeze. Highly recommended.

Alice and Tony's place was a brilliant stop off point! The shed / studio is simple but has everything you need. Comfy bed and spotlessly clean. Set on their family property with a super friendly dog & chickens next to Tony's sculpture shed. Great location close to all the vineyards. I had a beautiful dinner on their recommendation at Vinters literally 200m up the road. Best lamb I've ever eaten! Tony & Alice are extremely friendly & down to earth. Highly recommend.

Alice and Tony's place is unique. You can see how they love the place and they made it for us to love as well.
They gave great advice on what to do around there and where to eat. The place is not to far from 3 city centers where you can find shops and restaurants and there are a lot of cellar doors around there.

We had a great one night stay on our way through the Barossa. Perfect location, lovely room, friendly hosts and a very cute dog! Would definitely recommend Tony and Alice's place for any single or couple on an indulgent wine trip.
Very quaint room in the owners property, close to most things in the Barossa. Lovely garden to walk around & very friendly hosts.
Lovely place, clean and tidy

We had a lovely stay at 'The Sculptures Shed' in the Barossa Valley.  Alice and Tony were wonderful hosts and we felt very welcome.  The room was extremely clean with a comfortable bed and everything you need.  The location is right in the middle of the Barossa with cafes, restaurants and cellar doors within 5 minutes drive.  We would love to visit again and would highly recommend.

The sculptor's shed was clean, comfortable and had everything we needed for our short stay. The bathroom looked new and was very clean. The bed was made up nicely and was comfortable. Alice and Tony were lovely.. We only spoke briefly as they left us to it but were kind enough to let us use their iron as we had a party to go to.

The Sculptor’s Shed was delightful, the space was lovely, comfortable and clean. So close to the Barossa, an excellent base for wine tasting! 

Alice and Tony were extremely friendly, welcoming and great hosts!
The facilities are at present a bit basic but the location and the hospitality of the hosts makes up for this
The room was small but lovely and clean, there was use of a kitchen in another room. Overall a very comfortable night but a little small for us.

Lovely time staying at The Sculptors Shed , great space and location . Alice and Tony were really helpful , loved cooking on the BBQ on an evening as there is some great local produce available . Would highly recommend staying here it made our experience in the Barossa Valley.

Great spot to spend the night! Alice and Tony supplied lots of flyers/ pamphlets on wineries and the Barossa Valley, which was very helpful for us, as first time visitors. The bed was comfortable and the room was fine! Thanks for having us!
Absolutely great stay! Everything was clean and tidy
A very comfortable stay in the heart of the Barossa. Fantastic location and friendly hosts.
We had a lovely stay at Alice and Tony’s place. They were really friendly, helpful and full of useful tips.
A great place to stay and enjoy the Barossa!
Alice and Tony were incredibly friendly and hospital. We would definitely recommend this place to stay. Much more than just a room in a shed.

The Sculptors Shed is a really nice little place, it's located a couple ok K'ms from the Angaston city centre so best to have a car or taxi to get to and from. The Barossa has a lot to offer, highly recommend at least a couple of nights stay to get the most out of it.
2nd time back here, and will definitely come again! Great location, great space, friendly tips and advice from Tony and Alice :)

We had a lovely time at the Sculptor's Shed! Very central location, we loved that it was close to the bike track.
The space is beautifully decorated with lots of personal touches, and Alice and Tony were lovely hosts.

We stayed here for one night to attend a wedding in the Barossa Valley. The accommodation was as described and was an ideal place to base ourselves  Location wise, it is close to everything. The accommodation is small and basic, but it is clean and we knew this before we stayed. If you're here for a night or two, I'd recommend staying here, however for longer stays, you may find it too small. Communication before our stay was excellent.

Superb Airbnb experience. Amazing value, very clean and tons of character. It was great to have access to kitchenette space and a large and comfortable outdoor living space. Alice and Tony provided great resources for local restaurants and wineries.
Very friendly hosts with lovely accommodation.
The bedroom was comfortable and it was enjoyable to sit around in the garden. Great place!
Perfect location for everything in the Barossa! Lovely couple, a pleasure to deal with!

Alice & Tony were wonderful, friendly hosts - they were very communicative from the start and went out of their way to help us as we asked. Their lovely cottage was very clean, comfortable and well appointed, and just what we needed for our trip. Thank you for a great stay!

Alice and Tony were wonderful hosts and the sculptures shed was the perfect Base for our Barossa adventure. Ideally located in the great of the valley and walking distance to vintners restaurant and the farmers market.

Alice and Tony made us feel at home and had a bunch of local knowledge to help us decide what to do. Rosie the dog is very friendly.
A wonderful basic accommodation perfect for checking out the local Barossa area. We were amazed at how welcoming and accommodating Tony and Alice were. Highly recommend.
Great location. Hosts were super flexible with check in time.

We stayed at Alice and Tony’s as we had a wedding to attend at Saltram Winery down the road. It was a very short taxi ride and the room couldn’t have been more perfect for what we needed. Thanks again Alice & Tony for your hospitality, if we ever have another wedding in Angaston we’ll be back for sure!
Alice and Tony are great friendly hosts with lots of local knowledge

Alice and Tony are absolutely lovely! The communication in the lead up was so quick and really clear re: checking in. I especially appreciated the advice for local services (such as bike hire etc) and the room was nice and clean.

It’s not a huge room, but it’s totally perfect for 1 or 2 nights to rest your head and refresh after exploring the local area. 

Wine glasses in the room are a nice touch (as we definitely stocked up on wine on our travels that day!) and we had access to a microwave and fridge etc. 

Very clean, and a nice big shower and pretty decent sized bathroom!

Alice and Tony are excellent hosts! Although our stay was a short one, it was clear to see how friendly they are and nothing you asked would have been too hard. The room was very clean and tidy, for a shed you would even know your in one! Thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would stay again in a heartbeat. If your a dog person, make sure to give Rosie a pat, she has a fun and friendly nature :)

While we didn’t get to meet Alice and Tony, they communicated very clearly and check in was very easy! Location is very close to the farmer’s markets and lots of great wineries. Would definitely recommend their place to others!

We just used the Sculputors Shed for a bed for the night, and it suited us well for that purpose.

The room is fairly basic, as clearly explained on the listing, but on top of that it is stylish and comfortable.

We enjoyed our (brief) stay.
Next time we are in the Barossa Valley will be booking this accommodation.  Great hosts and very comfortable and convenient to everything.
Clean, neat and tidy, and such lovely hosts

The Sculptor’s Shed was the perfect getaway for our  3 day sojourn in the Barossa. A private bedroom/bathroom accommodation was compact but enough for our needs. The basic kitchen next door was adequate for our breakfast requirements. Our lovely hosts Alice and Tony were quick with responses and very welcoming. Their local knowledge was extra helpful. Location was ideal being close to Nuriootpa grocery stores, great coffee, brewery, and fantastic bike trail. The wonderful restaurant, Vintners Bar & Grill is just down the road plus local Saturday markets! A great central location for wineries. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!!
Alice and Tony were great hosts, friendly and helpful, and their unit at the rear of the house was very comfortable. Their location is very central to a lot of attractions in the Barossa region.
The Sculptor’s Shed was very cosy and clean. Everything you need for a great short break is there. Alice and Tony were great hosts.

Tony was very welcoming, easy going and helpful. The location is really convenient as well as quiet and the shed is cosy and warm. Overall it was a very easy and enjoyable air bnb experience! Thanks again.
Gorgeous place, great location, close to wineries and good restaurants. Alice and Tony, were great hosts and very accommodating.
A perfect little home away from home. Close to town and great food. Alice a d Tony were the perfect hosts! Everything was clean and everything was provided. Awesome local knowledge too!

A great stay in a stylish clean unit. Communication was great. Was close to the local market, which we enjoyed but a bit further from the main areas. Wifi was accessible but had to go outside. Overall a lovely place to stay.
Perfect studio, ideal location for the Barossa experience! Hosts are friendly and helpful.
small room but had everything needed , lovely friendly hosts and lots of interesting iron and steel artwork scattered around the property
Great location, great hosts, great place, individual and beautifully done
A quaint place in a good location for those wanting to make the most of the Barossa Valley.
Clean and tidy. Great local tips.  Friendly hosts. We'll recommend to family and friends.
Cosy stay in Angaston with everything you need and close to many wineries and the main shops in Angaston. Thank you for having us!

Great hospitality from the host and the local recommendations were spot on.  Simple but clean room for a couple and the house dog was great.  I would definitely recommend staying here if you are spending some time around the Barossa Valley and not trying to blow your budget on accommodations.  Thanks again Tony!
Alice and Tony’s place is lovely, and so are they! Thanks for the stay!
Great stay here,very clean and had everything you could need. in a amazing location to explore the Barossa. Highly recommend staying here.
Very comfortable and well situated. Recommend!

The space is exactly as described.  It is beautifully decorated, situated in a lovely and artistic garden with kind and knowledgable hosts.  It was comfortable and the space has everything you need for a very comfortable stay.  It is close to several vineyards and cellar doors as well as delicious restaurants.  Remember, you do need a car to get around and head into town for breakfast or bring some items with you and use their additional kitchen space.
Debbie was great, the house was lovely and we had such a perfect stay

Such a beautiful, quaint and cosy little gem in the heart of the Barossa. Incredibly close to vineyards and cute local townships for coffee, food or just a little exploring. The room was everything we needed for the night, including a thoughtful selection of brochures and information about the local area. We were greeted by Alice's parents on arrival and were incredibly friendly - made us feel right at home. Will definitely be returning if we find ourselves in the area in the future.
Nice room with a private bathroom - perfect for a quick getaway to the Barossa
Beautiful and stylish place in a great location close to the Barossa. Would stay again!
Great location.
We enjoyed Tony’s place after a months camping, he gave us great advice on where to eat out.
We had a great stay at Alice and Tony's place. Fantastic location, and great little personal space - it was ideal. Wish we could have stayed for longer!

The Barossa is an expensive place to stay - much more so than Adelaide, so it was nice to find simple but clean, comfortable and reasonably priced accommodation for a night there. 
Alice and Tony’s place is just as described so you know what to expect and we felt very welcome. We particularly enjoyed the spacious shower and electric blanket on the (Website hidden by Airbnb) was a very chilly night! 
The heater took a while to warm the room but got it toasty eventually. The house is on the main Nuri-Angaston Road so we heard some traffic noise, and as other guests have pointed out, it’s a small space but fine for a night. Hosts have an excellent attitude!
Great room for a one night stay. Small but perfectly equipped with everything you need. Lovely hosts with great advice of the area!
Great place. Loved the sculptures everywhere. Tony and Alice were very helpful and hospitable. I will recommend this place to my friends.
Absolutely loved our stay at Alice’s and Tony’s place. Perfect location to explore the Barossa by car. The room was nicely presented and very clean. Prefect spot! Will be back.

Gorgeous space; perfect for two. Location is easy to find and is convenient for exploring the Barossa. Tony and Alice were very prompt with their communication and offered good local advice. We'd stay again!

Great spot, close to the little town and Vintners- a lovey restaurant. 
Alice and Tony were great. Would definitely stay again :)

A lovely place for a couple or single person to stay in the Barossa as a base to visiting various venues in the Barossa.
Tony has on display metalwork sculptures he has created.

This is our first time in Australia and our first Australian AirBnB experience. It was exactly what we needed! The room and bathroom were all we really needed as we are making a roadtrip all over the Southeast, but the veranda made us want to stay longer! Tony met us in the morning to say 'hi', and to make sure everything went well for us. Thanks again!!!
Great location for exploring the Barossa

This a beautiful hideaway in a great Barossa location. Alice and Tony are excellent hosts and can provide good recommendations, including to local restaurant, Vintners (we were not disappointed!). Gin tasting at the Barossa Distilling Company ( at Penfolds winery) was another highlight. The sculpture's shed is super comfortable and a perfect base for a weekend /week away.
Lovely space and hosts would definitely recommend.

Tony and Alice was very knowledgeable and their hospitality was exceptional. Their location is very central to all the wineries that we wanted to go to, also lots of good food in the area. Highly recommended.
A cute little place with friendly hosts.
The photos don’t do this place justice. It is quite lovely and excellent value for money.
Perfect little room with a good bathroom. Tony greeted us and showed us the details of the room and there was drinking water available on arrival
What a fantastic place to spend the night. Hospitality was amazing and room was beautiful we will be back for sure. :)
Such a beautiful, clean and quaint little place! We only got to stay one night but hopefully will be back soon!
A Very convenient location for access to the Barossa cycling rail trail ,  and a great relaxing outdoor area.  Tony and Alice were great hosts.

Alice and Tony are friendly and relaxed hosts happy to have a chat or to leave you to have some quiet. We felt very welcome and they were always happy to help. The bed was comfy and the room was very neat, clean and cheerful.

Alice and Tony were amazing hosts. The room was clean and tidy, had everything we needed and is conveniently located. Alice and Tony were there to answer any questions, and even provided great company. Thanks for a lovely stay
Such a great place, Alice & Tony were very welcoming and we had everything we needed for a nice stay in Barossa!

Perfectly located place to stay in the Barossa! Close to the main towns but secluded enough that we had a quiet and private sanctuary to relax at the end of the day. Alice and Tony greeted us warmly and gave us suggestions on local eateries which we immediately took on board and which far exceeded our expectations. Everything you need is here!
A small room but had everything we needed as we weren’t in the room much. Good position to be located and check in was very easy.
Great little place with convenient location to a gorgeous town.

A delightful spot in the heart of the Barossa. Very convenient and close to the attractions of the valley. I appreciated the freedom of the self-contained space, separate from the house. The relaxing outdoor area and was great too, with interesting sculptures and a view out to the vines. Alice and Tony were very thoughtful and helpful hosts. 
Highly recommended.
Good choice if you want to spend a weekend in Barossa Valley :)
Alice and Tony have a lovely place and are friendly hosts, happy to chat or give you space as needed. Been twice and would be happy to stay there again.
Great friendly host!
Tony and Alice were extremely welcoming and we enjoyed the time we had at the Sculptors shed

A small but great little place to spend a night or three. Neat and tidy and friendly hosts.  Great location for day trips around the region. And really friendly hosts with some intersting metal artwork around the property. We will be back when the opportunity arises.

Had a wonderful weekend at Alice and Tony’s place. Was a great location and a very comfortable room. 
We didn’t spend much time there, as we were out ::all: weekend but it was very nice and private to come back to at the end of the day. 
The kitchen amenities are in a shed attached to the room and were very rustic but fine for us to grab a quick breakfast in the morning, which we brought with us. There was everything we needed as far as kitchen utensils and also some tea bags (essential requirement after a journey!).  
The outdoor space is wonderful as well for enjoying a cup of tea or a glass of wine. Alice and Tony were extremely accommodating and although we did not need their help, were very great for local knowledge. 
Although the space is located in their backyard and they have kids and pets, we didn’t see them all weekend! 
Highly recommend for a stay in the Barossa if you have a busy weekend of wine tasting planned ❤️

The Sculptors Shed is ideally located in the Barossa Valley. Tony and Alice are amazing hosts who make you feel welcome and open up their property to make your stay a memorable one. So good to spend a day exploring the Barossa then return to a beautiful clean room and common area to unwind.
Alive & Tony’s place was wonderful - perfect location and sparkling clean. Would definitely stay again.
Perfect set up with everything you’ll need. Cool space and lovely hosts. Thank you!

Alice and Tony’s place is perfectly located in the middle of the vineyards. This is the perfect place to enjoy wine tastings and drive around the region. Our room was very well decorated and sparkling clean. We definitely recommend this place to future guests.
Great little place with friendly hosts
Alice and Tony are very welcoming and easy going. Tony gave us a lot of local tips. The space was clean and comfortable, and the place is conveniently located.  We had a great time staying with them!
Alice and Tony's place was close to all the places we wanted to go. Alice and Tony were very easy going, friendly and kind. It was very cosy yet compact place which was just right for us.
Only stayed one night as we had a wedding in Angaston, it met all our needs, clean and easy check in. Will stay again.

Although we were there for just one night we really enjoyed our stay at Alice and Tony’s place! The communication regarding the location was super easy and the place looks exactly like it does a n the pictures, nice and cozy , it made us feel like home! We were greeted by Tony and we got some recommendations about the area. Thank you for the lovely stay!
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We had a wonderful stay, Karen made us feel so welcome and at home and gave us lots of helpful suggestions on where to go during our trip.  Absolutely fantastic location, just a short drive from all of the wineries and town centre.  We especially loved the indoor fireplace, fluffy bathrobes and that the pantry was so well stocked with farm fresh produce - we didn't have to go out to get anything. Karen was easy going and really helpful - always just a quick text or call away.  The house was spotless and made a great retreat. We would definitely come back!

Is there a better place to stay in the Barossa Valley ?? Nestled in a beautiful little vineyard, you are just a few minutes from Tanunda and Nuriootpa and all that they have to offer. The cottage has all you could possibly need and Karen stocks the larder with sensational local produce. Would not hesitate to recommend the Vineyard Cottage to friends and family.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at under the vines. Karen was very welcoming and there is lots of local area info available at the property. The local produce provided for brekky was fantastic, and loved chilling out with a wine by the fire in the evenings. Location is close to lots of wineries and eateries. Would definitely recommend this awesome spot!

Was a wonderful experience staying at Under the vines. When we arrived there was a little chocolate on the bed for each guest and there was even a treat for our 18 month old toddler. The description and location were accurate and we really enjoyed staying here. Overall it was a very enjoyable experience.

Karren was lovely she was very welcoming and the place was much as described and more. She helped me out great sorted out wine and a platter for me for a special occassion it was close to wineries as we rode our bikes around for the day. I would very much recomend karen and her cottage we will certianly be back. Lovely spot.
Great house on small vineyard, with an incredibly well equipped kitchen, with local milk and cream in the fridge! Great location, only a max 15 minute drive to all the main attractions of Barossa.

Karen made us feel very welcome, by greeting us at the property and showing us where everything was. She gave us some excellent local tips - where to eat, which wineries to visit, etc.

The property was great. Very private and truly under the vines - gorgoeus, handy location. It was clean and well appointed with comfortable king sized beds, excellent breakfasts and AC (much needed on our 40+ degree mini break!).

I really enjoyed my stay at Under the Vines. A very cool venue, complete with jacuzzi bath and surrounded by the vines. Karen made the process very smooth and we'd be happy to recommend it to friends.

What a fantastic spot! Thanks to Karen for meeting us on a tricky timeframe as we raced across NSW, Victoria and SA, but the trip was well worth it. Well-appointed for our group of five, with beautiful local produce for breakfast waiting for us. Sitting on the back porch looking over the vines to the Barossa Ranges was amazing and everywhere we wanted to visit was within easy reach. Bathroom and exterior toilets are fine - just watch out for the spiders.

The perfect location for a weekend in the Barossa - quiet, set amongst vineyards, and close to Tanunda. The breakfast supplies were phenomenal and there's all the basics you need if you're going to cook a meal for dinner. Karen and Russell were great hosts, and very receptive to our individual requests. We totally recommend Under the Vines!

Two big thumbs up!  The description and photos are entirely accurate.  This is a delightful, spacious, fully equipped and comfortable home.  That it's smack dab in the middle of a vineyard is a bonus.  It's about halfway between the villages of Tanunda and  Nurioopa, so a car is needed for shopping and restaurants. The location is otherwise perfect as a base for wine tasting in the Barossa.

Under The Vines was a perfect little spot for a relaxing stay. Everything was provided and the food provided was of exceptional quality and taste.

This is definitely a hidden gem among quality Barossa accommodation. 

I most certainly recommend staying here.

We stayed at Karen's vineyard cottage at the beginning of March and had the most wonderful time.  The accommodation was exactly as described and the kitchen was so well stocked with equipment it was like being in my own kitchen at home.
The locally sourced breakfast items that were provided were amazing as were all the little extras like leaving a little box of smarties for our toddler.
It was great to have all the entertainment equipment as we loved being able to plug our iPod in and also watch some movies.  
The beds were very comfortable and huge and we slept very well there.
It was vintage during our stay and Russell was so good at ensuring that we were not disturbed; often we didn't even know he was around.  However, after he discovered we were genuinely interested in what was happening, he spent quite a bit of his time explaining everything and was so friendly - it was a highlight of the trip!
Karen was a fantastic host who from the beginning answered all our queries very quickly and was there to greet us when we arrived.  The actual location was super convenient, close to lots of wineries and very peaceful but with only a short drive into the centre of town. We are very much hoping to come back and spend some more time here.

My stay at Under the Vines was just perfect! I was part of a group of 5 girls that stayed at Karen's cottage and we all loved our time here. Everything was set up beautifully for us, even 'female' themed with pink balloons, chocolates and pink champagne. The cottage has a great living area, separate spacious kitchen and 2 large bedrooms. Beautiful big bathroom too. The back of the cottage overlooks the private vineyard which added to the feel of being in the Barossa wine region. The cottage was in a great spot in the Barossa region, on 5 minute drive to the Tanunda town centre. 
Karen is a wonderful and welcoming host. I wish I could have stayed longer in her beautiful cottage!!

Under the Vines was an absolutely delightful place to stay. The location was ideal for exploring the Barossa, dining out and relaxing in an ideallic setting. Karen and Russell were marvellous hosts, who ensured we wanted for nothing. We highly recommend staying here and we will be back.

We loved our time at Under the Vines. When we arrived the kitchen was stocked with milk, eggs, tomato, mushrooms, cereal and some of the best bacon we've had in a long time. Not to mention locally roasted coffee! The house is clean and spacious with a huge shower and spa bath. The kitchen is well stocked with utensils, glassware etc. Even had sharp knives! Setting is beautiful being surrounded by a working vineyard (didn't see anyone the whole time so still felt private). It's about 5-10 min drive from Tanunda town centre, which suited us. Seemed to be plenty of taxis around so popping to town for a few drinks with a meal wasn't a problem.

Beautiful property and very welcoming host. We really enjoyed the time, particularly drinking wine on the grass in the middle of a vineyard. The house was warm, tidy, modern and the fireplace was a nice addition for the cool evenings.
A perfect position and setting in the vines. The house had everything we required and was very well provisioned. Right in the centre of the Barossa. We would definitely come back again.

Karen's cottage was the perfect spot from which to explore the Barossa.  She was very thoughtful about every detail and it made the difference to our stay. The beds are cosy and warm, and the fireplace keeps the whole cottage nice and snug. We had a wonderful time there.

We had a wonderful stay at under the vines. We had absolutely everything we needed and the accommodation was just perfect. We have spent our days since returning lamenting the lack of a fire place and spar bath in our lives. I would highly recommend this property as an ideal location and luxury accommodation in the Barossa!

Karen's place was absolutely perfect! She made us feel totally at home. 

There was a goodie basket of local produce for breakfast. We had a choice of toast with local jams, muesli, cereal and of course the important bacon and eggs. She'd even left us some orange juice!

The location is great. We thought at first it might be a bit far out of town but it's a very short drive and actually conveniently located between both Tanunda and Angaston. It's set in its own private vineyard. 

The photos don't even do it justice. It was very comfortable with great beds and the best bath!

I would thoroughly recommend Karen's place. Will definitely stay again.

We had a wonderful stay at Under the Vines. Karen is an accommodating host, who had a clean house warm and ready with a fridge stocked with delicious food for breakfast. Highly recommend staying here.

A truly wonderful experience. It had all the comforts of home and then some. The breakfast basket was full of local produce ... enough for two days for my wife and I. The woodfire was prepared for us and well stocked for a cosy weekend. The house itself was spotless, well equiped and included a large range of fun things to do. In a great location for getting around the Barossa. All in all, a perfect spot for a romantic weekend.
Karen met us just after we arrived and made us feel very welcome. The house had all the amenities and was very clean.

We had an amazing stay at Karen's property in the Barossa. 

The house is situated perfectly, only a short drive away from many restaurants and vineyards. Karen was a great host, met us upon arrival and showed us around the property. 

It has everything you would need for a great stay including fresh food for breakfast, a selection of coffee and milk and every utensil needed. 

Overall it was an amazing stay and would love to stay here again next time we visit SA!

It is set in vineyards with an amazing country feel to the place. The host displayed generous hospitality in supplying an outstanding locally produced gourmet breakfast. The cottage contained up to date comforts to a very high standard including wireless Internet. A great destination for our wedding anniversary. Well located between Nuriootpa, Tanunda and Angaston. A short drive to all the tourist spots including wineries.

Excellent location and beautiful property. Large bedrooms with black out blinds which made having a lay in far too easy! Well stocked Kitchen meant that we were able to cook easily.
We also loved sitting in the garden in amongst the vines watching the sun go down - beautiful! Would definitely return again in future.
Everything we could've wanted (plus more) was there. Very clean and well appointed throughout ... 6ft husband easily relaxed in the spa. Generous thoughtful hosts. Perfect 2 day honeymoon venue.

Under the Vines is a quaint but luxurious retreat. It feels very private but is just a few minutes' drive from towns, between Nuriootpa and Tanunda. We stayed here on the first really warm weekend of summer and it was a lovely and cool oasis to return to after visiting wineries and other sights. Drawing the thick curtains allows for easy sleep-ins the next morning. The kitchen is very well stocked with excellent local produce for cooked breakfast, including locally roasted beans to use in the coffee machine. Being surrounded by vineyards makes adds to the feeling of having an authentic Barossa experience. Our host Karen was great in her communication, and even offered to post back a pair of sandals and a Lego piece my children left behind! Much appreciated.

We had a lovely 5 day stay at Karen's Under the Vines cottage. Karen was a fantastic host and very personable. From booking the cottage to greeting us when we arrive, Karen was very responsive. The cottage is lovely and secluded but was only a 5 min drive into Tanunda. I recommend visiting FermentAsian for excellent dining.  The breakfast provision provided were plentiful and very generous and 5 different types of milk to choose from! This airBnB was probably the most well stocked place I have stayed in.  Clearly much thought has gone into what traveller's might need; this place felt like you were visiting someone's house. Thank you for hosting us Karen and i hope many more visitors have the opportunity to discover this lovely area of the Barossa and your lovely hospitality.

Karen's cottage was in a great location almost situated halfway between the towns of Tanunda and Anguston. Very quiet location.  Good size cottage although there was only two us.  If two couples stayed, having the toilet in the bathroom, may be a little difficult. However, with just two of us, the bathroom was very adequate. Very comfortable bed.  Two huge bean bags to sit on the lawn, everything very clean and the kitchen well stocked including tasty breakfast goodies.  We had a relaxing week in the cottage.
A beautiful place. Loved it!
Fantastic, comfy and clean home located in a perfectly peaceful and private vineyard, managed by the wonderfully prompt and pleasant Karen. Thank you for helping to make our stay so very memorable.

Karen is the most attentive and friendly host.  She greeted us upon arrival and showed us around her lovely property.  Communication was extremely easy and efficient.  The cottage is well located just outside Tanunda, with easy and inexpensive cab ride into the town centre. 

The cottage has everything one needs or wants for a comfortable and cosy stay including tasty breakfast provisions from Barossa.  Lovely vineyard views from pretty much every window.  Would definitely return.
Awesome place to stay in the Barossa. Amongst the vines at its finest.

Exceptional host and accomodation. The house is on the outskirts of Tanunda so easy access to everything in town while also feeling secluded and private. Also a quick 10 minute drive to Angaston. Location is fantastic. The house had everything we needed, a big comfy bed, aircon in each room, a big lounge, a huge luxurious bathroom and a great kitchen stocked up by the host with local produce for us. We will absolutely come back to stay here.
Fabulous accomodation. Would recommend to anyone visiting Barossa. Karen is a great host.

The photos of Karen's Vineyard Cottage on the website don't do it justice at all.  It is very peaceful and quiet. Karen has outfitted the cottage and provided every possible comfort, food and essentials you can think of to make your stay at the cottage very pleasant.  She has exceeded our expectations........definitely 10 out of 10 and beyond :)
The accomodation is suitable for couples and families.
We highly recommend staying at Karen's Vineyard Cottage when you visit Tanunda.  It is also very centrally located but still offers quiet and peaceful surroundings.
Too many details to comment on and the only way to experience what we experienced is to stay at Karen's Vineyard Cottage.  You will not be disappointed.
One of the best BNB's we have stayed in and we have stayed in many BNBs

What a wonderful experience we had. This place was absolutely amazing! Quiet and scenic. Tucked off the road and with 5 acres of vines, this house was just beautiful.
I can't recommend Karen and the place more. There was everything we need there and it was so close to all the wineries and vineyards. Simply stunning! Can't wait to come back!
Beautiful location. Peaceful, great being in the vineyard. Walk out the door in your in the Barossa. Great.

Under the Vines is the perfect place to stay for a Barossa visit.  Comfortable, peaceful yet close to all the major Barossa highlights, everything you need has been thought of and Karen is a great host.  Central location a real plus.  Highly recommended!
This is an stunning location and a great place to relax.  Everything has been thought of including some of the lovely local produce for brekky and cheat sheets for top places. Enjoyed the stay!!
Our stay was wonderful, the provisions Karen made for us accommodated our stay with ease and comfort. I was overwhelmed by the beautiful produce and selection of food for our stay. Cosy and cute!

Loved our stay Karen - thank you - fantastic location and loved the beautiful produce and the abundant choice of breakfast foods and milks - thank you for being so accomodating when we had friends join us at the last minute - will definitely be staying again
Beautiful place with a very friendly host. The wood burning fire place on a cold night was divine. Will stay here next time I'm in the Barossa valley.

We had a great stay at Karen's place over the long weekend. The place had everything you need and very close to some really great wineries making it easy to ride around on bicycles for the day.
The fresh produce was lovely, the coffee delicious, access to some port in the barrel also a bonus and the fire being ready in the fireplace a great touch for our wintery getaway.
We couldn't fault our stay in this place and would recommend to all that want to discover the Barossa!
Our stay was great, it was a lovely quiet relaxing getaway.
Fantastic place to stay!

Quiet base with everything you need for a relaxing stay.  If only there was nothing else to do in the Barossa, we would have just been happy to enjoy the little home in the vineyard.  Karen greeted us personally and encouraged us to relax and treat ourselves which was easily done.  The country breakfast goodies provided were a delicious start to our day.  Yum.
Lovely, thank-you!

Under the vines was truly amazing. A location that's central to everything nothing was more than 10-15 mins drive away. You get a well appointed home with plenty of amenities to keep you comfy. The house is tucked away in a little vineyard and the backyard faces a pretty spectacular view. I thoroughly enjoyed the breakfast spread that Karen stocked up in the pantry and the fireplace kept us warm throughout our stay. Make sure you lounge in the outdoor beanbags with a blanket, a hot cuppa and a good book.

Such a great location and atmosphere. It was a cold wet time we spent in the Barossa, but the warmth and coziness of the wood fire and interior made it so welcoming and comfortable. The little details and effort really made it for me, like extensive fresh and local breakfast ingredients supplied, fireplace built and ready to go, tv and entertainment, and detailed easy to read information about everything in the area. Will definitely be recommending to friends who stay in the Barossa.
10/10!

We had a fantastic stay at Cottage in the Vines. We loved the local produce provided for breakfast, the wine and other lovely touches that made our stay so memorable. A perfect place for a weekend in the Barossa.

Karens house was DROP DEAD BEAUTIFUL! You're minutes from 30 different wineries, from the shops and restaurants, and just dream like country drives. I highly recommend renting a car so you're able to drive around. Karen leaves several taxi and shuttle information so you can spend a day safely traveling between the wineries. We will definitely be back!
We loved our stay here. Karen had thought of everything we could possibly have needed. My only regret is that we didn't stay for longer.
What an amazing place to stay! We had an unbelievable experience and can not speak highly enough of the property. Next time we are back in the Barossa we will be staying here again.

We really enjoyed our stay here. Great location close to everything, lovely little cottage on a beautiful vineyard. Very clean and modern. Loved having the fireplace and spa bath. The breakfast included was fantastic. Thanks for making our trip so memorable!
Close to everything, has everything you could possibly need for a very indulgent getaway!

Absolutely gorgeous! 
Karen has gone above and beyond with this little gem! She provided so much fantastic breakfast food! And the barrel of port and chocolates on the bed was a beautiful added touch!
Wouldn't stay anywhere else if we return to the Barossa!
Great location, great house and great host!

My partner and I visit the Barossa often and throughly enjoyed our stay.  We loved being amongst the vines and appreciated the fireplace on a chilly evening.  Karen has thought of everything, especially for breakfast.  And the place was immaculately clean.  We highly recommend the cottage and would definitely love to stay here again on our next visit to the Barossa!

Had a fantastic stay here! It’s a very comfortable house, well set up, and a beautiful spot amongst the vines. We enjoyed being able to relax outside in the sun during the afternoon. The provided breakfast food was great with both cooked and non-cooked options. Would definitely recommend to friends!

We stayed at under the vines with our 18mo toddler and had an excellent stay! It is a great location, close to wineries & barossa towns. We loved hanging out in the back yard overlooking the vineyard. Thank you!
Everything was perfect! Will definitely be back. Thanks Karen!

It's all been said before but I'll say it again - great place, great location, great service. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Karen's place. She really has thought of it all - anything you've forgotten she's probably provided a spare! Kitchen stocked, comfortable beds, amazing bath. Delicious breakfast and coffee (although my barista skills didn't do it justice). If this place is available for your dates then I highly recommend booking it while you can!!!

Thanks so much for being a great host, really appreciated the quick communication. Loved the little touches of candles and matches, amazing coffee, beautiful breakfast also provided. Easy to relax in, and so easy for day trips out. Thanks so much. We will be back.

Would have given a 6 stars if there is an option to it.

Karen's place is well situated in the Barossa valley with almost every major vineyard & attractions less than 10mins drive away. With a vineyard just right outside the house, one can enjoy their meals/drinks at the backyard while enjoying the vineyard views. 

And if u enjoy cooking, do look forward to a well stocked full kitchen & the fresh food supplied by Karen for breakfast.

I must say, to have a full Barossa Valley experience, one would have to stay at this place to complete it.

This is the best airbnb house I stayed so far! Karen has gone extra miles to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. This is a lovely house in the vinyard, with thoughtful touches of welcome candies, fresh food, tour information, etc. Highly recommend to anyone who wants to travel to Barossa.
Great location, and rooms are big and clean.

Excellent comfortable and well equipped accommodation in a very peaceful location. A former commercial building has been remodelled by the owners as a stylish modern apartment that is genuinely situated amidst the vines.

Karen was really prompt with communication from the beginning. The accommodation is located in close proximity to all the wineries and other attractions in Barossa Valley which was really good as well as the fact that it's in the middle of a vineyard!!! It was such an experience to stay right in the midst of growing grapevines! We wished we could have stayed for longer. Everything was well laid out for us and Karen provided us with amazing breakfast and so many options such as juices and different types of milk!! Air conditioning in every room provided us with so much relief during 43 degree heat days and were on when we arrived. There is a spa and also a tv in the bathroom :) what an experience!!! Karen and  co. thank you so much again for your amazing hospitality. Definitely choose this place if you're heading to Barossa Valley to maximise your experience!
Really great place to stay - it's very cosy, the breakfast, tea and coffee that were provided were great, and the bluetooth speaker had really good sound which was a bonus!

We loved Under the Vines - the photos really don’t do it justice.  I don’t know many places where you can sit in the back garden next to growing vines.  All the little touches made our stay extra special - the chocolates on our bed, the beautiful breakfast supplies (it really was next level) and the ability to check in and out early/late.  This place is great and Karen was delightful.  I highly recommend it.
Fantastic stay.  Facilities, location and easy of dealing with Karen just made the stay even better.  highly recommend
Great location, beautiful neat and tidy space and delicious provisions made our stay in the Barossa even more enjoyable!
Great place. Very private
We really enjoyed staying at the Barossa at Karen's place. It really exceeded all our expectations. We will definitely come back again

Karen’s home is a lovely getaway in a gorgeous setting w a vineyard. Two bedrooms make it good value for two couples or a family. Short drive to shops and restaurants. Karen left is some ingredients for a breakfast cook up too - so lovely and thoughtful!
Convenient place to base yourself for the Barossa, lovely being surrounded by the vines!
We had an amazing stay. The house and surrounds are absolutely stunning. 11 out of 10 perfection.
2nd time here, loved it just as much as the first.  Great location with all you need for a great time away.
Beautiful and clean house in winery, quiet and peaceful.

We had the most amazing stay in Karen's place. The cottage, the grounds and location were superb, but what we loved most were the unbelievably thoughtful touches - fresh bread, local coffee, bathrobes. Just awesome. Thanks for thinking of everything, Karen!

Under the Vines is the perfect Barossa getaway! While we felt secluded in this location with plenty of privacy and quiet, it was only a 5 minute drive into Tanunda which was perfect. We enjoyed a lovely afternoon in the sun surrounded by the vineyard enjoying local cheeses and wines. 
Karen is a great host, super prompt with all communication and the little touches left around the place were so thoughtful! 
Our group consisted of 2 couples and this place was big enough that we never felt like we were in each other’s way. 
We would recommend Under the Vines to anyone looking for a Barossa Valley experience!
Karen was great! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

A beautiful little house, perfect for two couples, great for just the two of us, handy to both Tanunda and Nurioopta. Karen has thought of everything for her guests’ comfort and enjoyment. We’ve stayed at a lot of Airbnb’s here and overseas but none that could match all the little touches Karen has added. Five stars plus another for Karen’s communication and enthusiasm.
Fabulous place to stay - clean & cosy with lots of lovely touches. Great location... Secluded but central!

Lovely place to stay in Tanunda. Very comfortable and relaxing with lots of tips on where to go, as well as breakfast included. Also very close to many of the best wineries in the barossa - would highly recommend!

This was our second time staying here. We absolutely LOVE coming back here - the view of the vines is spectacular and Karen really has everything stocked up around the house. It’s all about those little touches - like the local produce for breakfast that she arranges and the local coffee beans. The place has everything you need. It’s so tranquil and secluded but is centrally located so you’re still a short drive away from all the wineries, supermarket and local restaurants and cafes. Can’t wait to come back! :)
Lovely cottage and a very accommodating and hospitable host :)

Karen is an outstanding host, who thinks of the little things to make your stay extra special, from the bowl of Minties on the table, to candles next to the spa. We loved an evening walk through the vineyard and curling up in from of the fire. This is definitely a place that we will come back and will happily recommend to others.

Thoroughly enjoyable mini escape thanks Karen, we look forward to returning. Loved the location, spa bath, wood fire, brekky goods and your local tips. Perfect winter holiday! We appreciated the porta cot being available also, cheers!
The cottage is beautifully fitted out with everything you could need for a comfortable stay. It is located close to many vineyards and cellar doors and to Tanunda.

I would highly recommend staying at Under the vines B&B, the place is perfectly located to explore the Barossa valley and is set on a beautiful vineyard. The place was clean and had everything you could think of including a spa, tv, Foxtel, and lovely kitchen. It is the perfect place to relax after spending the day wine tasting and eating!! Karen also sent us a fantastic list of wineries and restaurant recommendations which were much appreciated!!

The property is set in a vineyard and a little bit out of Tanunda town centre. It is perfectly located for touring the Barossa. Karen is a fabulous host supplying the most amazing breakfast provisions of local produce and setting the fire ready to light in the wood stove upon our arrival. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

This is our second stay at Karen's, as we simply had to come back after our first stay was far too short.  This cottage is easily the best we have stayed at in airbnb; Karen is very generous and has everything you could want to have a comfortable stay.  The wood fire and large spa bath was particularly great for our winter  visit. Absolutely lovely, and definitely recommended.
This place is right in the heart of the Barossa, such an amazing location. A lovely place with with plenty of room and everything you need to enjoy your stay...

This place was killer. Photos don't do it justice. Karen bent over backwards to accurate our needs. Breakfast goods were the best quality as was the port and coffee. Loved every second and wanted to stay forever. This is the place to stay in the Barossa, with that personal touch and vineyard feel ❤

Under the Vines is an amazing place to stay, being close to Tanunda. Set on a working vineyard, but so quiet and peaceful with great views. The fireplace in winter is awesome whilst sitting on the lounge and enjoying the surrounds. A great comfortable 2 bedroom place to stay, with a large modern bathroom, with a spa and large double shower.

Beautiful stay in amongst a working vineyard. Clean and quiet with great amenities, beautiful spa and a wood fire heater. It is equal distance to both Tanunda and Nuriootpa but also away from the traffic and very relaxing. Highly recommended!

We absolutely loved our stay at Under the Vines! Karen had thought of absolutely everything that we could have wanted and needed and so much more! The place is just stunning, and if you are looking to relax and unwind in a beautiful spot of the Barossa, then this is the perfect place!

The cottage is a unique and peaceful place. The location is perfect for visiting the wineries, and there were so many thoughtful touches like fresh breakfast ingredients and the log fire ready to light. Having a cup of tea in bed looking out on the vines was so relaxing, and we will definitely try to come back!

Thank you Karen, especially for all the lovely breakfast food. As advertised, this gorgeous cottage is truly "amongst the vines", and was extremely peaceful and comfortable. We will be back for a longer stay.

Beautiful place nestled amongst the vines, secluded yet very central and close to everything. Great place for two couples or two friends. Karen was very accommodating with early check in and late checkout... also very quick with communicating. There were lovely touches with chocolates and also a large amount of breakfast supplies. Unfortunately we didn’t really take advantage of the fresh ingredients left for a hearty big breakfast. Would definitely recommend this place to others. Thanks again Karen.
Loved our stay. Very clean and perfect location for us. Karen was very friendly and helpful with suggestions on what to do. Ten out of ten!

Beautiful place. The building looked small from the outside as you would expect for an Airbnb guest house, but inside its so spacious. The beds and the bathroom are big! Spa bath and double shower are both a treat. Breakfast kit was left in the fridge which was so nice! Wife and I might come back just for the Airbnb.

Only downside is, as mentioned, the bugs. There are quite a few spiders and centipedes and all so if that's a deal breaker for you, be advised.

Definitely would recommend

Karen's B&B was a perfect retreat in the Barossa. The two rooms had large beds and ample linen and towels. The bathroom is very large too and is perfect for couples. We had a delicious breakfast daily consisting of fresh vegetables, eggs and bacon with fresh bread and oats. The little touches around the place with the barrel of port make it very divine! Dinner and breakfast with the view of the vineyard made our stay extra special. Would definitely come back !
Great place to stay and everything you could need!

A fantastic property to use as a base in the Barossa. Stunning surrounds among the grapevines! Really spacious and great spa bath to relax in after a day of exploring. Only a few mins drive from Tanunda and close to lots of excellent wineries. Breakfast ingredients were a lovely touch. Will be back next time we are in the region! Thanks again!

What a great place! The location is so peaceful amongst all of the vines and surroundings. The breakfast package was so welcome before our early start and the spa bath was the perfect way to relax after a long drive. Thanks Karen for such a great stay!

Five star ⭐️ 
Excellent experience

If you come to the Barossa......stay here. The accommodations are perfect, the host Karen is attentive, the setting in a vineyard is exceptional, the location to all that is Barossa is central, and the value is unbeatable.
What a great place to stay in the Barossa. All the amenities (wineries) of the Barossa are a short drive. Under the vines is simply exceptional, I promise you will have a great stay. Paul
Great hosts, lovely spot, great base for a Barossa holiday.

This place has everything! Cozy, clean, quite, amenities, location, amazing spa, generous breakfast offerings, friendly host and much more. The pictures don't do this place justice. Which i kind of like because it was such pleasant surprise apon arrival. We will book again. Thank you Karen.

Karen’s place is a short drive from Tanunda, sitting privately amongst the grape vines. With beautiful views from every window it is the perfect spot for a getaway in the Barossa. 

The accommodation was very clean with everything you need for self catering if you feel inclined to cook. Karen kindly left us quality supplies for a cooked breakfast along with milk, juice, tea, coffee and a big bowl of sweets.

Bed was comfortable and we both slept soundly. Karen’s attention to detail is excellent with lots of small thoughtful touches which made our stay really special.

Whether you’re in the Barossa to tour the wineries or just relax in the country I highly recommend this spot. Thanks very much Karen, we’ll definitely be back.
Endroit très joli et paisible aux milieux des vignes. Très confortable. Je recommande vivement de ce lieu pour explorer les vignobles alentours

A beautiful cottage located in a great location of Tanunda! A warm, homey and inviting house, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay we couldn’t vault anything. The spa & fire were perfect for the winter evenings. We will definitely be coming back!
Lovely hacienda amid the vines. Breakfast feast was particularly tasty.
The property exceeded our expectations and the little touches from an experienced and gracious host made the visit extremely enjoyable.
Fantastic little extra touches that made it a warm inviting home away from home

We had a great, relaxing night here. Everything was lovely and clean, and the fire was laid ready to light as soon as we got in. Breakfast provisions were ample and delicous. We will definitely be back.
This is a pretty cottage and we had a very nice stay.  Well planned and stocked kitchen;  equipment and crockery and coffee plunger and espresso machine. The port barrel a lovely treat.

One of the best Airbnb’s we’ve ever stayed at. Situated in the middle of a vineyard with stunning views from every room. Sparkling clean, fridge stocked for breakfast, espresso machine with locally roasted coffee and a great location for visiting the Barossa Valley wineries. Did I mention the jacuzzi tub? 10/10 - book this one!
Karen’s place is modern and spacious with a beautiful, peaceful outlook across the vines. Close to town for an evening meal.

Just gorgeous, luved the setting amongst the vineyards very quiet and peaceful, although nice & close to town. The fire all ready to go was perfect to relax in front of after our day of sightseeing. Generous brekky provisions & all  the extra little touches ( choccies, magazines, candles etc) made our stay extra special would definitely recommend and stay again. Thank you Karen
Lovely spot with great breakfast provisions.
Great place. Would definitely stay again

Karen’s property is stunning. It was perfect for our getaway to the Barossa. Waking up to the views of the vineyards was a beautiful way to wake up. Also, the food supplies in the fridge were great and we loved that they were all locally sourced. This property should definitely be considered by anyone coming to the Barossa.
Great location and amazing views. Karen’s place was perfect for a weekend getaway.
A great location and everything you need for a perfect stay
Amazing place. Wonderful stay in an incredible setting.  We loved every minute of our stay and can’t recommend enough.  Everything we needed and more.  We can’t wait to return.  Thanks Karen
A lovely night in a peaceful setting. The cottage had great facilities and an extremely well stocked kitchen.  Great for kids, they loved the PlayStation and spa bath!! Thanks Karen
This little cottage is just lovely, I can't fault it... and I would definitely recommend it to friends and family. I was sad to leave...
Nice amenities and nestled in the middle of a vineyard.

The property is a really nice place to stay, we really enjoyed walking around the vineyard and going to local attractions including the barossa museum and the whispering wall, we also went on a helicopter ride. The spabath was perfect and great with the tv in the bathroom. Breakfast provisions were very nice! The house has everything you could need for a trip away! Very clean and tidy. Thank you.

Such a beautiful location to spend any special occasion with a loved one, or even just to escape for a few days. 

Even though you are a little further out of town, it was 100% worth it to be amongst the vines and such beautiful scenery. Plus taxis weren’t too expensive, and close by. 

We will definitely be returning to Under the Vines in the future!
Lovely accommodation . Everything we needed. Clean and easy access and departure. Great little touches.
Wow this is truly a fantastic place to stay I highly recommend this B&B
Perfect location and offering all the comforts of home. Karen's additional touches were a warm welcome and would highly recommend this property, for value, comfort, location plus much more
Wonderful location surrounded by vines and sparkling clean right in the heart of Tanunda!

We had a wonderful weekend stay at Karen’s and greatly enjoyed ourselves. The spa was amazing and curling up in front of the fireplace was so cozy. Fabulous provisions left for breakfast and we loved the espresso machine!
Fantastic home, Karen thought of everything to make it incredibly comfortable. We loved our stay and we can’t wait to return again soon!
Can not recommend enough! Will be back again, it was fantastic!

If you've been thinking of staying here then stop and just do it - this is a gorgeous little place with so much character and so many little touches and additions.
The location is fantastic (I live in The Barossa so may be a little biased but it is a great central location).
Finally, Karen is an amazing host who goes above and beyond and we will definitely be back again xx
We had an amazing time at Karen’s and we hope to be back soon!
Accommodation met all our needs. Breakfast more than adequate and spa very relaxing. Very clean property with lots of additional touches that helped make our stay enjoyable.

Amazing place. Loved the setting. It’s just off a fairly main road but you’d never know. It’s little like being in the middle of nowhere. We had one night and wished we’d stayed two. Beautiful place for a romantic getaway with a spa and fire. Karen was easy to communicate with and the extra touches where brilliant. First place I haven’t had to use my own candles in the bath. Lovely. Breakfast was plentiful and fresh. Thanks for everything.
Phenomenal place to stay, better than I couldve imagined

This accommodation has everything you need for a relaxing getaway. Very comfortable beds, comfortable lounge, peace and quiet, great spa, huge shower, kitchen with every utensil you need, lovely breakfast provisions, excellent heating/cooling. We had a very enjoyable stay and were happy with everything. Highly recommend.
Wonderful stay. Great features throughout. Spotless, absolutely spotless! Thoughtful touches. Beautifully quiet. Highly recommended

We couldn’t have picked a better place to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary! Private and secluded (yet within easy driving distance to just about everywhere you want to be in the Barossa Valley), and very scenic setting amongst vineyards. Bedding was super comfortable, shower and spa bath just lovely, and a well stocked kitchen with everything thought of. Karen was extremely quick and helpful throughout all correspondence. Highly recommend!

A fabulous place to stay for one or two couples close to Tanunda and all that the Barossa has to offer. Easy communication with host who is very attentive and obliging make staying here a great experience.
Great host highly recommend
We were unable to stay due to Covid-19 but Karen was helpful/good communication & able to give a us a refund which was much appreciated. :)
Thanks Karen for a perfect little getaway. The house was extremely comfortable and had lots of nice touches. Breakfast was amazing. We would definitely recommend this place.

Gorgeous bnb set in amongst a working vineyard. Beautifully renovated inside. Double shower and spa bath definitely highlights! Beautiful for a little private, quiet, romantic getaway, albeit large enough that can accommodate a large group to. Easy check in and out, and late check out an added bonus ♡
Beautiful presentation in an amazing spot

From the moment you drive in you think you’re at another cellar door, this place is outstanding and highly recommended. A great location to head either into town or out to the Wineries. The finishing touches here are very thoughtful and every need is covered. Thank you Karen for our memorable stay.

Thankyou so much Karen! The location and grounds were stunning and you have so thoughtfully provided all of the little touches that you wouldn’t even know you wanted! We had a truly amazing time and Thankyou so much for your generous hospitality

This is a beautiful spot surrounded by vines. We saw kangaroos hop through the vines at dusk and it's easy to find, but feels a million miles away from anywhere. I truly memorable spot to celebrate my birthday and I hope to get back there soon!

Karen is prompt to reply and eager to assist in local recommendations, if you need. The breakfast provision were lovely and the spa bath is definitely a highlight!

What a fantastic place to stay. Karen provides visitors with a welcoming, comfortable place to stay with fantastic provisions so you can relax and enjoy your time while feeling completely spoilt. Fantastic location to be able to easily visit all the Barossa has to offer.

Just book in for a good Barossa stay. Great base for exploring. Watching TV in the spa Bath is a nice place to spend an evening with a wine. We will be back. Has everything you can think of to self cater some meals if you wish.

We absolutely loved our stay at Kathryn and Johns place over a long weekend in August. We were made to feel very much at home and they were very helpful with questions we had. They were so generous to  offer to take us to a local wine show which was one of the highlights of our trip. The house is an old classic with high ceilings and lots of room. The room itself was large, the bed was very comfortable and it had stunning views out over the acreage and some vineyards. The property is in angaston, a pretty little town in the barossa valley which is a short drive to many surrounding vineyards.
Would recommend to anyone looking for a more authentic experience when experiencing the barossa valley.

Kate and John are very welcoming and friendly.
They've good knowledge of the local area and the winery's located around the Barossa area. 

I really enjoyed my stay with them felt like part of the family. 

Will definitely stay again when I'm back in the Barossa!

The room is with amazing view, the backyard is great, we had lots of fun there especially my little boy, he loved to play with Baxter. Kate and John are very nice and helpful, gave us rich information about the place.

Kate and Jon were very welcoming. Kate provided us with helpful instructions and directions to her place. Upon arrival, we were greeted by their lovely dogs, Baxter and Sally! The room was very clean and comfortable, the view from the window was peaceful and beautiful. Kate, Jon and their daughter were friendly and made us feel right at home. Succinctly, great hosts, lovely place  comfortable beds, cute dogs, wonderful airbnb experience. I would highly recommend it!

Glad we found this beautiful home to stay in. Jonathan and Kate were very welcoming and allowed us the use of their home as if we were long time friends. Their home is close enough to stroll into the main street of Angaston and still be surrounded by picturesque vineyards and hills typical of the Barossa. We'd love to return.

Staying at Pembury Homestead was a delight. The hosts were friendly and warm, conversation flowed with ease and the facilities extremely comfortable. Definitely of a high standard (I slept wonderfully) and the location picturesque. The resident dogs were friendly. I'd return again in a heartbeat. An all-round positive homestay experience. Thank you for having me!
