My sisters and I absolutely loved our stay at Bridget's place. The home is beautifully decorated and has all the amenities and finishings to make for a gorgeous weekend away. Bridget was a gem to communicate with and thoughtfully provided us with suggestions on the area, and a beautiful breakfast (we ended up going back to Apex Bakery a few times for that stunning bread).

Stunning 2 bedroom house set in a lush garden of orange and lime trees, organic herbs and green plants. Huge couch and tv. Comfy beds, huge kitchen with all modern amenities :)

Perfect for a solo visit, or a weekend with couple and/or the family, I couldn't recommend Bridget's place more.

The moment we arrived at Bridget’s place we felt like we were coming home. From personal touches like fresh milk and bread, to the amazing deck and day bed, to the beautiful garden that the kids loved exploring- we didn’t want to leave.

Bridget’s place is beautiful, cosy and sparkling clean and in a great location, walking distance to shops and restaurants.
Communication with Bridget is great and check in a breeze.
Would highly recommend this lovely home to anyone looking to stay in Tanunda

We absolutely adored this home!  It is welcoming and warm.   The backyard and deck area were icing on the cake.  Perfectly situated in town, it’s an easy walk out the door to shops, cafe’s, and restaurants.    Bridget is the perfect hostess ~ easy communication, very accommodating and attentive.   We wish we could have stayed longer!
Great location.  Exceptionally clean and tidy.  Had everything we needed.  Cute cottage with a lovely deck and garden.

Bridget's home was a lovely place to base ourselves in the Barossa. Sunfilled garden with deck and comfortable and stylish home. Less than 100m from all of the high st amenity in Tanunda. Bridget was easy to communicate with . Would highly recommend to anyone.

Go and visit, you will not regret it, and stay a few days.
Bridgets house is a home away from home, we felt welcome and looked after and yet had complete privacy.
We can recommend it highly to anyone.
Stylish house just around the corner from Vino Lokal - great wine bar. Lovely host with good local knowledge too.
A great base for exploring the Barossa. Thank you for having us Bridget!

Thanks so much Bridget!! Your place was the perfect place for us to unwind after a fun day visiting wineries. It was super cosy and that couch and fire made it super relaxing!!! Bridget’s place is central to everything in Tanunda and is in walking distance to the Main Street, literally one hundred metres, so coffee and food are at your finger tips. Perfect stay in the Barossa!!

Beautiful home, a short walk to the Main Street & close to the wineries. Nice & clean, We loved the extra touches in the home, the eggs & bread were perfect for our breakfast before our winery tour the next morning :) we would definitely stay here again

We loved Bridgets place. It is close to the main strip in Tanunda  which meant we were able to get most places on foot. We were provided with everything we needed during our stay which made it very comfortable.

Great quirky cottage, close to everything in Tanunda.  Fresh bread, eggs and milk  left ready for our visit. At the right time of the year, fruit trees with abundance of fruit. 2 minute walk to Main Street, coffee places etc. can not fault cleanliness and linen etc supplied. Highly recommend.

Bidget's house is 3 mins walk from the main street of Tanunda's cafes. Great outdoor lounging area, onto a lovely back garden. Very clean and well set up. Great kitchen to sit at the huge butcher block by the fire, drink wine and coffee.  Great kitchen to cook in with really top recipe books to ponder over.  Comfy beds, lovely linen. Long deep bath. Candles. Good books, art and house design magazines. I could move in. Thanks Bridget

A well equipped, quiet  comfortable home, lots of goodies for breakfast and so close  for walking access to restaurants  and shops.  It was very clean, and has comfortable beds with lots of pillows.  We would certainly highly recommend  this venue.
DON’T look else where - Bridget’s house is beautiful! Great backyard, good location and comfy beds. Walking distance to great shops and cafes. Driving distance to amazing wineries :)

We loved our stay. 
The location is amazing, place is immaculate and walking distance to everything.

Bridget's place is fantastic, my husband and I stayed for a couple of nights to explore the Barossa Valley. It's in a great location and has everyone you need. 
Bridget was very quick at communication and was super helpful with my questions. I'd highly recommend her place, thanks Bridget!

Lovely cottage in Tanunda that is very close to the main street. Lots of cafes, restaurants within walking distance. The cottage is like a home away from home with all the comforts you need . Plenty of room to relax at home if you want ,but in close proximity to all that the Barossa has to offer. Bridget was very quick to respond to all our communication
Comfy house full of charm and style! Great location, close to the main street of Tanunda's shops and restaurants.  We really enjoyed our stay there.
Terrific location and really comfortable.

What a perfect location and great host. Being a stones throw from central Tanunda was good enough for us BUT an impecible home with all the amenities as an extra, what a happy bonus. Cant recommend enough!
Fantastic location,  walking distance to main street.  Great base to explore the Barossa. Cosy home with some thoughtful touches (Nice loaf of bread,  milk and eggs).  Enjoyed our stay!
Accomodation central to Tanunda, cozy small cottage for a relaxing getaway.

Bridget’s place is an absolute delight! We had herbs and salad from the garden, we lounged on the sunny back deck and each night as we came in, delighted in all the lovely stylish furnishings that made it feel like home. And practically the kitchen is a treat and it was an easy walk to excellent Tanunda shopping and eating. Bridget herself was so helpful to us that really ‘super’ doesn’t quite cover it! Amazing might be better. This is a lovely place to stay in a very very special part of Australia. We loved it and warmly recommend to all.
3 friends and I visited Bridgets home for a girls trip in the Barossa!!!! Everything was perfect from the location to hospitality.
We love our stay here. Beautiful house in the centre of town. Very homely with nice art and a sweet garden out back.

Bridget's house is a delight with close proximity to the centre of Tanunda yet providing a peaceful retreat with a lovely outlook over the back deck to the gardens. The house is stylishly decorated and is roomy yet cosy. A great place to launch an expedition into the Barossa Valley with its many wineries and a short walk to award-winning restaurant 'fermentAsian' while in under 10 minutes you can visit Maggie Beer's Farm Shop & Eatery. Definitely worth a visit as Bridget is an attentive and thoughtful host!

A cosy traditional cottage home, a few houses from the main street of Tanunda. Comfortable beds and facilities on the deck for a relaxing wine in the outdoors country setting or small wood fire on a cold night. Lots of parking under cover, large country style kitchen and large lounge are unexpected extras.
The perfect place to stay when you're in the Barossa

Bridget’s place was in a central location in Tanunda. We loved the styling and reminded us of Fitzroy in Melbourne. Bridget was a great host and included additional touches with breakfast food and bathroom products. She provided great local tips which we put to use!
Fantastic location
Great house, super clean, super quiet and private yet only a 2 minute walk from the best restaurants and wine bars in Tanunda!

Such a beautiful house, full of love and warmth. Very close to the Main Street. Close to vineyards. 
Beautiful garden.
Lovely house, great location.

Thanks so much for a lovely stay. Your home is so comfy and welcoming. If we come again we shall certainly stay again. Loved the location too, so close to walk to everything in the town centre. It was quiet too. Thank you.
A lovely comfortable home to enjoy a stay with friends. Great location and sitting on the deck in the sun was just beautiful.

Excellent location. Fantastic base for exploring Barossa Valley!!
Comfortable stay, we enjoyed ourselves.
Quirky, stylish and so close to vicinities. The deck was wonderful for sunny breakfasts and an evening glass of wine.
What a truly beautiful house. Has everything you could possibly need and such a brilliant location. Would definitely stay again
Had a wonderful stay here over the weekend. Great location and loved the back yard and deck. Highly recommended.

Bridget’s place was perfect for our time in the Barossa. The house was spacious and clean. It was a short walk to the Main Street & many local attractions. 
Bridget was easy to communicate with & quick to respond.
Would definitely stay again! Thanks Bridget
Great location to the local shops and Bridget is incredibly welcoming! A very comfortable stay.
Terrifically located, lovely, comfortable house with good amenities. Felt like home.

We had a such a lovely stay at Bridget's place. The house had all the amenities we needed & it was very convenient for accessing the Barossa Valley. The garden was in full bloom & it was so relaxing sitting outside on the back porch.

We loved Bridget’s place. Its walking distance from everything we could need in town and 5-10min drive from some amazing wineries. 
The garden is spectacular and the place itself is stylish and very clean without the use of chemicals. 
It’s got a great kitchen for cooking some local foods, we can’t recommend it highly enough.

Bridget's place is ideally located just off the main street of Tanunda, in walking distance to everything in town and you can drive to countless wineries in minutes. The house is very homely, with a lovely outdoor area in a peaceful garden (and a very cool indoor when the temperature rises!!). Bridget is a wonderful host who welcomes you to her home with little extras that really make your stay. It was great for us (two friends) but plenty of room for two couples as well. Highly recommend this place as a base to the delights of the Barossa.

This is a wonderful area to visit and Bridgets place was centrally located. It was comfortable, spacious and exactly what we wanted. The extra touches like breakfast made it seem like a cosy home. We loved our stay here.

Bridget’s place was just perfect! A beautifully styled house with lots of character and charm in the perfect location - walking distance from the main street and a short drive to a gateway of wineries. A truly lovely place to enjoy some downtime.

Bridget’s House is very conveniently located only a very short walk to the Tanunda shops and restaurants.  We found the kitchen very well set up and particularly appreciated the delicious cheese left for us in the fridge.  We enjoyed a wine on the deck on more than one occasion overlooking the lovely garden and hope to return to enjoy more of Bridget’s hospitality.
We are fussy about beds and linen and these were as good as it gets! Amazing location, will return.
Amazing.
Bridget’s home is so lovely. Lots of homely touches and great outdoor space. Location is so close to town you can walk to shops and restaurants. A great place to stay when visiting the Barossa.
Great location, stylish and comfortable house. Highly recommended.
Incredibly cosy and inviting. The back porch invites lazy mornings and long afternoons in the shade. Incredibly peaceful--wish we could have stayed longer!

Bridget’s place feels like a home. It has an awesome kitchen for cooking a delicious meal, a gorgeous patio for enjoying breakfast or a few drinks in the sun and is within walking distance to all the major Tanunda shops. Short drive to all the wineries and taxis will take you anywhere for dinner too.

We spent 2 nights at Bridgets house in Tanunda which was a perfect base for our Barossa weekend getaway. The house was very cosy and inviting and the back deck was the perfect spot to sample some of the local produce. Bridget is also a fantastic host, very responsive and easy to communicate with. Highly recommend!
Great host, location and value. Loved the eclectic style. Host was very responsive.
We really enjoyed our stay. The house is very stylishly furnished. It was great to enjoy the garden from the back deck. Highly recommended
Really enjoyed our stay. Excellent location!

Lovely peaceful garden and great outdoor spaces. House was fantastic and well appointed as well. The pick your own fruit was a real treat. Location was excellent and would definitely stay there again.

We chose to stay at Bridgets place in Tanunda so that we could spend time checking out the Barossa Valley.  We were also able to join an organised winery tour from Tanunda. 
Bridgets place was a lovely space that had everything we needed and was only a couple of minutes walk from the town which had a number of good cafes, restaurants and wine bars as well as a tourist information centre for the area.
An absolutely gorgeous home! Beautiful location and super convenient for everything ! Loved our stay !

We, my husband my parents and our 10 months old son stayed at Bridgets  place for 2 nights while visiting the Barossa. It’s a beautiful place- you feel like at home when you enter the door. There’s a wonderful garden (a lot of fruit trees, herbs etc) in the back and it’s just beautiful. Would highly recommend her place. It’s also a perfect location for exploring the Barossa and with a lot of options for dinner just around the corner
Great location, very relaxing laying outside on the day bed. Great location with the main Street just around the corner. Friendly host. Would stay again
Bridgets charming and warm place is in the perfect location. We were lucky enough to meet Bridget on our stay, offering gplenty of great tips and suggestions. Will definitely stay again!
Bridget’s place is absolutely delightful: cosy, clean and beautifully decorated. It’s in a perfect spot, so close to amenities, but the backyard feels lovely and tranquil. Highly recommended.

This place was a real find, a stroke of luck since we booked it last-minute. My friends and I couldn't have been happier with the accommodations - we much prefer the feel of living in a real house instead of a company-managed property. The back deck was perfect for sitting in to enjoy the lovely weather, and the fruit trees and herb garden were an extra-special touch. There's a nice full bookshelf in the living room, and the rooms and beds are very comfortable. In short, the perfect place to recharge one's battery and the perfect base of operations for exploring all that the Barossa Valley has to offer. Bridget was very welcoming and available to answer any questions, we couldn't have asked for a better host.

Bridget, it was truly an absolute pleasure to have stayed in your home. Ourselves and our friends felt very welcomed and comfortable in the sanctuary that you have. We loved the garden and fresh produce that was seasonally on offer in our own little paradise. 
We cannot recommend this experience at Bridgets house more highly. Fabulous location, sparkling clean and tranquil. The Barossa is a magical region to explore and well worth the efforts of making your way to this town. Thornby Butcher is a must, to purchase an amazing cut of meat or roast in the Weber. Together with so many wineries and wine styles on offer makes this a perfect degustation destination. 
Wishing you all the very best Bridget. We’ll be sure to return someday.

Thank you Bridget! We had a great stay at your house. We found everything we needed and the space was so clean, well equipped and comfortable. We found the kitchen especially was well stocked with crockery and a good supply of pots and pans. We appreciated the fresh eggs, bread and milk. The beds were super comfy an the location was excellent too.

Bridget’s place is a lovely home in the heart of Tanunda which is perfect for a weekend getaway. We enjoyed the slow combustion fire and having a glass of wine in the lovely garden. Bridget has provided thoughtful touches and the lovely art throughout the house is very welcoming.
Perfect house for what we were after, ideal location for winery visits
Fantastic location and Bridget is very responsive and helpful! Place is perfect for visiting Barossa and offers a nice, quiet and relaxing space.

Bridget’s place is a cosy little cottage, a perfect get away close to the main st and walking distance to all the best restaurants. The garden was a perfect place for photos before a wine tour and the kitchen perfect for cooking up a snack when you get back. Would highly recommend the house to anyone looking to explore the Barossa Valley.
Great home base to explore the Barossa

Bridget’s house was beautiful, perfect location and her communication was great. HOWEVER, the issue we had in the end was when Bridget tried to make us pay an extra $100 cleaning fee saying that we left the place so filthy that her cleaner had to stay an EXTRA 3.5 hours on top of her usual 2 hours to clean up after our supposed huge mess. This was completely fabricated! We left the place extremely tidy, as my reviews always suggest, and we tried to explain this to Bridget advising that this was not the truth and that if she thought it was that her cleaner was potentially trying to get paid more. Bridget would not believe me, even though her cleaner had no proof or evidence of said mess. I would believe that if she was cleaning for 5.5 hours she would have taken photos of the mess. It was extremely disappointing and very stressful for us when we know we did not do what she was saying we did. Lastly, the back door lock was broken, which was entry into the property, and we had to fix this ourselves. 
However, if this issue didn’t happen it would have honestly been the loveliest stay as the house was amazing.
We really enjoyed staying here. Such a lovely house, a pleasure to be in and really well located. Could have hung out in the cheery kitchen in front of the fire for hours :)
Clean and tidy house, fast and friendly communication, Great location and a lovely place to stay! Highly recommended!

Lovely period home in the heart of Tanunda. A very short walk to the main street and amenities. We would love to see this house with all the fruit trees in their full glory and really make use of that wonderful garden!

Our stay at Bridget's was absolute bliss from the moment we booked, and further exceeded ALL expectations when we walked in the door! The house is so beautifully styled with the most amazing eccentric pieces and the homeliest of touches to top everything off. 
I am already planning my next stay to come back!! The cleanliness was outstanding as well as the best ammentaties I have experience within an Air B'n'B or self contained stay.
I absolutely cant wait to come back, I really didn't even want to leave haha!!  
I couldn't recommend this place any higher
Cutest little house, but big enough to have your own space. Garden is so cute too. Too many lovely spaces you won’t know where to sit, and not want to leave!
Beautiful and calm home. Very clean with very thoughtful touches. All the amenities you could think of and a lovely garden which we enjoyed during our short trip. Location is 5 stars

What a great home that we got to stay in. Super clean; comfy beds and a fire place to keep us warm. Great central location to everything. Bridget's house is really homely and Bridget has a great vege patch; the rocket was beautiful. Eggs for breakfast and some bread a welcome touch. Definitely love to return. We also loved all of the artwork which I believe is also one of Bridget's talents. Thanks so much for sharing your lovely home.
Amazing location and excellent place to stay in the barossa!

If you want a comfortable house-stay in the centre of the Barossa, then look no further. In the middle of Tanunda, it’s a very short walk to all the amenities you need and a short drive to the great wineries. If you’re lucky to get here at the right time, the garden has an array of fruit and herbs you can snack on, it’s all very nice. 

Highly recommended

Bridgets home will become your own. It’s sparkling clean and safe but also feels homey and comfortable. Barossa has SO MUch amazing stuff and Bridget pointed us in the perfect direction for our 3 day stay (+ consulted us on where to go in SA following our stay!). My partner and I had plenty of space here just the 2 of us, but also would be perfect for multi couples. The garden was a dream and we made salads and mains spiced with the fresh herbs from the backyard. Thanks again Bridget, I may venture to say it’s the best Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in (and I’ve stayed in many!!)
A great quiet place to stay with a fabulous “ homey “ feel about it

Couldn’t have asked for a more welcoming and comfortable home to use as a base for a few days in the Barossa. The location is excellent, just a short walk to the Main Street on Tanunda and all its cafes/restaurants/shops and very central for day trips around the region. Can’t recommend Brigit’s place highly enough.
Lovely house in a great location
Very clean and comfortable rental

A cream brick special with a wow factor once inside! Very comfortable with really interesting and tasteful pieces of furniture and art work. Bridget’s place felt like home to us. Very generous supplies, super comfy main bed (there was only two of us), great deck with a huge day bed and lots of seating over looking a lush and productive back garden. The location is superb... a very short walk to the Main Street with many places to eat and drink or just have a browse. Bridget was very quick to respond and left a very comprehensive folder of her favorite places and things to do in the Barossa. Highly recommend.
Perfect for two couples , very clean and comfortable we found the garden quite tranquil as we like gardening. Perfect location , just a short walk to the main shopping area ,we enjoyed our stay .
Bridget’s place was extremely central to the Main Street of Tanunda! Great place to relax with family and friends. Would highly recommend!
Terrific location and a lovely place to come home to after a day of wineries and sightseeing

Absolutely wonderful place to stay. Beautiful interior design and lovely garden. Very clean and a really comfortable and cosy atmosphere. Also, 2 minutes walk to the main Street of Tanunda. Can highly recommend Bridget's place.
Great little spot, cosy little place, well played Bridget!!
Beautiful home and in the best location !

We loved our stay at Bridget's place! The rooms were stylish and comfortable but most of all it was great to have a kitchen to cook breakfast in and a beautiful deck area to enjoy your wine after a day out at the wineries. Would definitely reccomend and stay here again. Loved that it was a 2 minute walk to the main street for amenities or eating out! Thanks for having us Bridget!
Would absolutely recommend staying at Bridget’s place. Lovely house and very close to the main street ! Outstanding hospitality !

Bridgets house is in an amazing location, walking distance to cafe’s and restaurants. Beautiful outdoor space to enjoy a meal and drinks. Bridget responded to messages immediately and was able to accommodate our extra requests. Would highly recommend!

Absolutely delighted to find Bridget's place in Tanunda. It is quite simply like staying in the home of a good friend. The furnishings are comfortable and stylish, great art, and funky features. The garden is enchanting and private and the proximity to main street is just a sort stroll from the front gate.  Would have loved to have stayed much longer.

A quirky stylish house in an excellent location. Park the car up and enjoy the Main Street and all it’s amenities. 

The fresh bread and eggs for our first breakfast were a lovely touch. 

Thank so much for having us.

Bridget's place is charming, cosy and full of character! We spent so much time in the outside seating area, perfect for an afternoon wine!

Comfy beds, good linen and lovely touches all over the house. Seconds away from the Main Street for shopping and dining. 

Highly recommend!

Bridget's place is just delightful. The atmosphere is beautiful. The kitchen area is so cool, the art work and homely touches are gorgeous. The outside area is relaxing and the location is terrific. Not only are the beds comfy the lounge is so easy to nap on too. A+++. Thankyou for sharing your house.

I loved staying in Melanie's house, it's very tastefully decorated, and one of the most well organised AirBnBs I have stayed in. There was no need to look for things,  everything was where you expect it to be...space in the fridge with a marked guest section and on the table, a continental breakfast.  A great place to stay for a Barossa visit.
Fantastic location, great communication, we had a wonderful time in the Barossa at Melanie’s

Melanie was a fantastic host, very friendly and welcoming. The place is super clean and central if you are planning on visiting the wineries around the region. You can even walk to a few nearby ones, and walk to the main street for cafes and restaurants. A car is needed to see the rest. Good value overall. Good for couples or solo travellers.
Melanie was a great host and the her house is beautiful. Would highly recommend.
Melanie was a wonderful host going above and beyond our expectations. Her house is lovely and we would definitely recommend it.

Melanie was a amiable host of a well presented cosy and Retro themed house. Very welcoming and close to shops and travel targets. Wonderful airconditioning a delight during the hot periods of the unusually high temp Summer. I would highly recommend Melanie and her home to any travellers to Tanunda and the Barossa generally.
Lovely room, lovely house and a great central location in Tanunda.

Really enjoyed our stay in Barossa. Perfect spot located in the central town within a short drive to most of wineries. Very nice and very clean house. Melanie the host is lovely and very organized. Would definitely come back

Melanie was very friendly and her place was clean and everything we could ask for. Great space and extremely homely..awesome spot and will definitely stay here again upon our next visit! Best priced accomodation in the area

Our stay at Melanie's place was excellent. She went above and beyond as a host and was friendly from our first communication. Melanie's house is lovely, spacious and comfortable. The room was quiet and we both slept soundly. The house is very close to the main street making the location very convenient also. Thanks Mel!
What a great spot - nice and close to the vineyards and Tanunda central area. A clean, spacious fun space. Can't fault the stay! Big cheers Melanie! A+

Melanie was a great host. She immediately made me feel welcome, and encouraged me to use the common spaces in her home. The room was very comfortable and everything was sparkling clean. I enjoyed travelling around the Barossa in the daytime, and coming back to Melanie's comfortable and welcoming house in the evening. The location 10 minutes from the main street of Tanunda is very convenient. All in all highly recommended.
Great spot well situated with a friendly helpful host with good local tips. Room was snug and comfy. Just what we wanted.

Melanie has a very stylish house (lots of 60s decoration)  and the room was very neat with our own bathroom to use. We made use of the pool table in the living room when we weren’t out tasting wines. Melanie was friendly and quick with communication, we didn’t actually see her much at the house as we and she were our most of the time but she was friendly when we did.

Maria's house is stunning.  A true holiday house - spacious, beautiful and homely.  The bottle of wine and breakfast supplies were a generous supply.  Outdoor dining looking over some vines was stunning in the warm evenings.  We were there to cycle the Barossa trail and the house was well positioned for us to achieve that.  Many thoughtful touches to the house including magazines and kids toys.  Highly recommended.
Great location, beautifully fitted out house with easy access to the whole Barossa area
A beautiful place to stay and enjoy what the Barossa has to offer. Wonderful hospitality with breakfast supplied.

Amazing house, lots of character. Comfy, quiet and peaceful. Vinyl collection is a bonus!
I recommend it!

Casa Rossa is a great space. Definitely feels like a stylish, contemporary home rather than a cold holiday place top sleep. Great beds, movies and cd's, good provisions and all of the utensils to cook. Highly recommended.

Definitely a 5 star host! Communicative, clean, responsive while being incredibly friendly. Couldn't ask for a better host! I would be happy to recommend Maria's place to all my friends and family we can't wait to return. We had an awesome time.

A really wonderful country location with great bird life. Quiet but so close to so many great wineries and restaurants. The house has been modernised to a high standard and was spotlessly clean. The welcome pack was very comprehensive and saved us doing any food shopping. An unexpected bonus was a visit from a family of kangaroos on our second evening.

Great place, well located, fantastic outdoor eating area and vineyard gave a truly Tuscan feel to the place. Many interesting and novel touches and more food provided than we could eat. Well done, nothing could be faulted and highly recommended.

We stayed at Casa Rosa for three nights. It was wonderful. The location is close to the town, but private, with a lovely outdoor dining area, over looking a vineyard. The bird life was magnificent and kangaroos visited the garden. We found the house exceptionally well equipped with beautiful high quality crockery and cooking equipment. There was a very generous welcome pack. The bedrooms were very comfortable with good quality linen, the bathrooms had great walk in showers and nice toiletries. We watched films together in the evening on the comfy sofa.  We would love to return for a longer stay. Highly recommended, you could not fail to enjoy this lovely house.
Casa Rossa was a perfect weekend get away! Lots of thoughtful touches, great communication and perfect location!

Fabulous home in the Barossa. 

We loved everything about this Airbnb stay. Thoughtful provisions were left for our arrival, including bread and spreads, milk, OJ, snacks, and sparkling wine ready to chill. The house is tastefully renovated and well maintained, and appointed to a high standard throughout. We loved the many “extras” available including toys for the kids, board games, the vinyl record collection and turntable and the open log fire. We slept well in the comfy beds.  

The house is located in a secluded location with its own small vineyard. Our only disappointment was that we couldn’t stay for longer!
Beautiful place to base yourself while you explore the Barossa

I highly recommend Maria’s place if you are looking for a quiet get away or somewhere to stay near the Barossa area. The house was stunning and extremely clean. Maria additionally provided a very generous amount of breakfast supplies and wine and chocolate on arrive. Cannot fault our experience or this house.

An Absolute 10/10 
A very large well appointed home, beautifully furnished and great personal touches.  We greatly appreciated the trouble the hosts had gone to with a lovely bottle of wine waiting for us on the kithcen bench, if that wasnt enough there was also an ample carafe of port to enjoy whilst relaxing next to the fire place after a long day exploring the Barossa.  Fully ducted air con kept the place warm and cozy.  Wonderful rural position,secluded and peaceful yet close to shops at Lyndoch and easy access to wineries.  The outdoor area is amazing  youd swear you're  in Italy, surrounded by vineyards and great views over the Barossa  Plenty of stocks for brekkie and a little treat for those with a sweet tooth was much appreciated.  Maria is a wonderful host and has local managers to assist with anything you need, they were great to deal with and prompt with their replies.   Will definitely be back, thank you Maria we had an amazing stay.
Staying at Maria's was an absolute pleasure, and if I ever return to the Barossa, I know where I'll stay.
Great place.

A delightful stay in a spotlessly clean home with everything you would need to cook, BBQ, sit outside,  and look over the hills and vines on the property. The fireplace at night created a perfect ambience. A  great location for exploring the Barossa.

Wow surrounded by cellar doors.
Must pick one...or two...well three
Then home to the fire place to finish off the day
An amazing house for our weeks’ stay in the Barossa, can’t wait to return❤️

A very memorable first trip to the Barossa Valley!!
We visited the Barossa Valley with another couple.  We were all first time travelers to the Barossa and did we ever luck out when we chose Maria's place.  It was the first time I've booked an Airbnb where the pictures and description did not do justice to what we experienced.  To create that perfect first impression, Maria had left us a beautiful "welcome basket".  The location was perfect.  We could drive to anywhere in the Barossa and Eden Valleys in 20-25 minutes or less.  We hiked in the mornings at nearby conservation areas, toured several top notch wineries in the afternoons, and BBQ'd and ate 'al fresco' on the terrace while watching the sunsets in the evenings.  Our wives had a very relaxing and enjoyable experience at a Spa in nearby Gawler as well.  One evening we even had some kangaroos visit us right in the backyard!  An enthusiastic two thumbs up from all four of us!

Casa Rossa was the perfect Barossa base for our party of 2 couples. 

Stylish, comfortable and really well equipped with more bacon, eggs, juice etc in the breakfast pack than we could possibly eat in 4 days! 

Lovely, quiet, cosy, elegant home that we would love to return to and 100% recommend to anyone looking for a perfect, central but private base for a wonderful Barossa experience.

Great house, very clean, lovely towels and linen, nice little touches like wine and breakfast provisions. You do need a car but shops and wineries all within a short drive. We loved the peace and quiet!

We had a great week at this house, it’s in the perfect position for exploring the Barossa. It was quiet and private, plenty of space for six, very clean and comfortable and had everything we needed to self cater. Views across the vineyard towards to hills. The breakfast provisions were a lovely touch!

We had a fantastic time staying at Casa Rossa, loved the location and the house. So close to a lot of the wineries and beautiful scenery. Especially loved the morning and evening visits of the wallabies.

Lovely house with great facilities.  So much food provided as part of the welcome hamper that we could not possibly eat it all.  Wine was a lovely touch and we enjoyed the visits from the local Kangaroos.  Would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in the Barossa

Such a great little gem in Lyndoch! Had everything we needed for our stay. Lovely bottle of wine on arrival was a nice surprise. A glass of red by the open fire made our stay. Plus the kangaroos were a great treat for the kids
This a fabulous place to stay. Extremely comfortable, well appointed, accessible to allthe Barossa has to offer. Excellent communication. Highly recommended - we had a fantastic time.

Casa Rossa is an absolutely beautiful house in the perfect location to explore the Barossa Valley. The house was sparkling clean and the hosts were lovely enough to leave us with complementary breakfast and a bottle of port! My friends and I were thoroughly impressed and we look forward to returning in the near future. Thanks again!
I highly recommend Maria’s place it is very very comfortable,generously appointed includes full breakfast more than enough for our needs,great views with serenity

Casa Rossa is a fantastic place.  It is situated in the heart of the Barossa so you can base yourself there and plan wonderful day trips to many of the wonderful little towns & vineyards throughout the Barossa Valley.  The house was spotlessly clean, the breakfast supplies plentiful, the beds extremely comfortable.  As it was still cool at night, we made a beautiful open fire which was the perfect way to relax with the wonderful wines we purchased.  Equally as nice on a warmer evening would be to sit outside taking in the vines & view, peace & quiet of the Casa Rossa surrounds.  I would totally recommend staying at Casa Rossa, it was a wonderful way to start off a few days R&R.

This is the perfect house for families or groups looking for a comfortable home away from home in easy reach to many wineries. Lots of space for the kids to play outside as well as some toys and books inside, which were a big hit with our toddler. The breakfast provisions and bottle of wine were absolutely lovely and very handy to have after a long drive. The fire place kept us warm of an afternoon as we sat and enjoyed the view over the yard. Would stay again.
A beautiful place to stay. A lovely home, great hospitality, and incredibly thoughtful touches throughout the visit. Could not recommend more highly.
Gorgeous place, perfect for 2 couples or more as there is plenty of space
Great location and house with some nice touches with breakfast and a bottle of wine provided. House was very clean and well appointed with a nice outlook.

Maria’s house was a pleasure to stay in, it is tastefully decorated, clean and located well. We really appreciated the food items on arrival. We would recommend Maria’s house to anybody who would like to stay in the Barossa region.

A gorgeous, stylish home in a beautiful quiet location, close to many of the wonderful wineries that the Barossa has to offer. We really appreciated the breakfast provisions and complimentary wine, chocolates and port. Looking forward to coming back again in the near future.
Very clean and lovely outlook. We even had afternoon visits from a couple of local wallabies. Highly recommend!
Such a beautiful home with a lot of thoughtful touches

Very comfortable house, spacious and well laid out. We enjoyed the complimentary Casa Rossa wine (a Grenache and a very nice drop). The kids enjoyed the toys and teddy cupboard. Good location, close enough to the centre of Lyndoch but with a feel of being in a rural setting.
Great place to stay. Highly recommended
Beautifully decorated house in a lovely area.  The house was lovely and warm for a winter stay and had all the items we needed for our family stay.  Perfectly situated to enjoy the Barossa

Nice comfortable place to stay, Communication was easy and quick. Walk distance to some great wineries. Bedrooms are comfortable and kitchen is well-equipped. Nice vineyard a step from front door. Beautiful view of the valley. It’s a little bit noisy in the main bedroom while the air con was on. And The hot water tank is a bit small, had to wait for hot water overnight. Overall, it’s a great place to stay with couple of friends. Would go again.

Casa Rossa is a perfect base for a Barossa short or long stay. It would make a great retreat for a couple, family or even group with it’s three bedrooms, two lounge areas, large dining table and delightful kitchen space. The records were an absolute treat. The entire space was modern and stylish but with beautiful character driven and historical touches that added a lovely sense of charm. We woke up to a kangaroo with a Joey in it’s pouch outside our bedroom window the first morning there and had lovely kangaroo visitors through the vines in the afternoons as well. The fire was a perfect space for a cosy evening after a brilliant day of vineyard touring and tasting. The breakfast provisions were substantial and the extra gift of wine and chocolate added such a thoughtful touch. It was a comforting enough to feel like a home away from home, but well thought out enough to feel like a wonderful holiday. We highly recommend this property and the swift and friendly communication of Maria. My daughter was thrilled to find the toys in her room and I was thrilled to find the coffee pods! Enjoy your stay in a lovely Lyndoch gem

Lovely house and thoughtfully provided breakfast options and complimentary wine.
Would stay again!

Absolutely perfect house for anyone wanting to get away to the barossa. Everything you need and more. Would highly recommend to anyone. 
Thanks again.

Fantastic stay for my wife’s birthday. Group of 6 stayed for 3 nights and loved every minute of it. The Roos visiting at dusk whilst we enjoyed some Shiraz was a highlight. House is full of personality well equipped and well cleaned throughout.
Perfect stay with plenty of space for 6 guests.
We stayed at Maria’s house due to working in the area and would gladly recommend it nice part of the country perfect place to stay and explore
Nice place,relaxing environment,nice touches such as complimentary wine & provisions for breakfast.

Maria's place is clean, tidy and located in a quiet location. Waking up in the money to kangaroos between the vines is always a great way to start your day.

Its a great location to spend your week in the Barossa at as it is conveniently located near some of the best wineries. The space is large with plenty of break out areas and would work best for groups of 4-6. 

I would highly recommend Maria's place for people that are looking to stay in the Barossa.

We had such a wonderful stay in April. A beautiful home in a fantastic location. The attention to detail was shown throughout the house, from the decor and little luxuries scattered around the house to the Netflix and apple tv access. 

The kitchen is fully stocked, making the breakfast cook up a breeze. Oh, and the breakfast provisions, what a bounty! 

With fantastic restaurants and cafes at our doorstep it was everything we could have asked for and more from a weekend in the Barossa. 

We look forward to staying again, thanks from the Carraghers and the Nunans
Beautiful new maxing large house right in thecenzerif tanun

Bilyara house was fantastic. The house was homely, comfortable, clean & technologically well appointed with internet & entertainment options.
We had the most beautiful breakfast ingredients of locally sourced product; who knew mushrooms could taste that good.
The house is right in the centre of town and a 2 minute walk from the 2 best restaurants in town (1918 & Ferment Asian - best to book in advance. 
We visited the Langmeil & Peter Lehmann wineries & The Barossa Valley Brewery, in a 20-30 minutes walking distance from the house. 
This is the perfect House if you are staying in Tanunda. Enjoy!!
A fabulous house in a great location. Spotlessly clean. Loved the beautiful breakfast provisions from local suppliers.

This house is fabulous, it is in the best location possible, close to everything you could need and across the road from the best Asian fusion restaurant I have been to in a long time!! The house was exceptionally clean and the beds had beautiful linen and were super comfy! If you enjoy cooking the kitchen  has every utensil you need and a large oven to prepare a feast! I would not hesitate to book this place again especially knowing how well stocked everything is!
Such a gorgeous place. Lovely kind hosts and we thoroughly enjoyed it. Highly recommend it!!!!!

Bilyara House is an absolutely wonderful place to stay. It's a block from Tanunda, my favorite of the towns in the Barossa Valley, and close to many restaurants, wineries, and vineyards. The house is decorated in an adorable retro style and has everything one could need. The breakfast fixings were amazing addition to an already lovely stay (thanks, Andy!). My family and I hope to visit again one day!

What an absolute gem! Andy and Natalie were wonderful hosts and their home is absolutely gorgeous! All of the special touches, the amazing smorgasbord of a breakfast they left for us...I could keep going but you really should experience it for yourself! Highly recommend this place!

What a wonderful property in the heart of Tanunda! 
Wonderfully appointed with with everything you could ever need for your stay. 
We spent fantastic nights enjoying the wonderful open fireplace and beautifully appointed rooms. 
Fantastic hosts to liaise with and we absolutely loved the delicious supplies left for breakfast. 
Can't wait to return again! What a wonderful home away from home.

Such a gorgeous home, within walking distance of restaurants and stores. Had it been summer the backyard area would have been absolutely fantastic! Andy and Natalie were wonderful, and the finishing touches really made it a special getaway. Would absolutely recommend to anyone looking for a special stay in the Barossa.

My 2 friends and I had a wonderful stay at Bilyara house. The location couldn't have been any better. Close to wineries and restaurant's and everything else the Barossa has to offer. The house itself was awesome so well decked out with everything we needed. Beds were great and it was a wonderful home away from home. Thank you so much
Bilyara House was beautifully restored and had everything we needed and more. I would highly recommend this property for any family or group enjoying exploring the Barossa.
Bilyara House was great!  Close to everything, clean and very comfortable. And the owners were incredibly helpful. I would recommend this place to anyone wanting to stay in the Barossa.

What a perfect weekend! 
I visited Tanunda with a group of girlfriends to celebrate my 30th birthday and Andy and Natalie went above and beyond to make our trip unforgettable. 
We arrived to welcome champagne, a birthday cake, balloons and a card. There was the most amazing breakfast spread on offer - some of Barossa's finest produce - as well as toiletries and other amenities.
The house itself was big and beautiful The decor was trendy and we felt so at home, immediately. It was a great space to spend a girls weekend away!
There were two big bathrooms which made getting ready quite easy. (Even for 8 females!)
I also should mention the beautiful outdoor area where we enjoyed our breakfast in the sunshine. 
Location wise it is 10/10. We walked to the supermarket and some wine bars. We hired bikes and cycled from the house to many wineries around Tanunda as well. 
I would definitely stay at Bilyara house again and I would 100% recommend it to other guests. 
Thank you so much for being outstanding hosts Andy and Natalie!!!

What an amazing house  Bilyara is ! Not only are Andy & Natalie the perfect hosts it's the little touches that make it perfection . The house is so centrally located that you can walk to wineries /cellar doors and restaurants . Couldn't have asked for anything better . Will definitely go back and highly recommend .

Andy's place is a great house well located in the middle of town. It is spacious and well equiped with a gorgeous art deco feel. 
Thanks for a great stay.
This place was great!  Food was well catered and beds were very comfortable.  Very close to the main street, will everything nearby!  Would stay here again!

This place was perfection on many levels. It’s location can’t be beat and the house has so many great qualities. The breakfast that Andy left for us was a lovely touch also for the lazy mornings after touring the Barossa. We hope to be back again!

Well equipped and as advertised. Spoke to Andy upon arrival and he was very helpful amd informative. Set in the centre of town and walking distance to all attractions in town. Would thoroughly recommend to anyone looking to have a base whilst exploring the Barossa
Thank you for an amazing stay, so much space and amazing outdoor entertaining area. So close to everything in Tanunda!
Perfect location, stunning house, highly recommend. Will be back.
Great location, lots of nice touches, great amenities, lovely house and great outdoor space. A wonderful place to stay
Thanks for a wonderful stay and especially for the family friendly touches ref: cots and well stocked fridge. We had a wonderful stay in the Barossa. Thanks again. Derek
Wow what a great stay! Perfect location and the house was lovely! The hosts went out of their way to provide value and great service! Excellent breaky provisions and condiments. Highly recommend

Bilyara house was lovely. The amazing baskets of food and condiments were scrumptious. 
our hosts were always on hand when we needed anything . Beds were super comfy. We were right in the centre of Tanunda so walking distance to great restaurants and shopping. We loved our stay and will be back.
Beautiful house renovated to maintain the original charm and beautifully styled. Fantastic location. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will defiantly be back.
A perfectly located and appointed home for exploring the Barossa.
Thanks so much! Loved your place and all the special touches! Felt like home.
Fantastic
Absolutely amazing  - we were so happy with our stay! Your small touches did not go unnoticed. Location is outstanding!

Bilyara house is in the heart of Tanunda. The home was clean and very comfortable with loads of xtra little touches in the way of provisions for breakfast, a lovely decanter of Port for after dinner.
Superbly fitted out and in an excellent quiet location.
Would recommend this  stay definitely.

Brilliant home with everything you will need for a wonderful stay. We enjoyed the location, a hop skip and a jump from the main street where all the restaurants are. Also close to the wineries, right in the heart of it and my favorite restaurant 1918 is over the fence. The house is really well thought out and Andy and Natalie have made sure to make their guests very welcome. Beds are comfy, linen is excellent quality. Really appreciated the extras like breakfast including eggs, bacon, mushrooms, OJ, fresh bread, milk, cheese all fresh right from the Borossa... the list goes on. Over all this home is highly recommended!!!
Great location. Super clean and excellent communication.

I highly recommend this lovely house. It is in a great position close to the main street but still very quiet. Having 2 bathrooms it would be ideal to share with friends. The kitchen has the most utensils and equipment I have seen i (Website hidden by Airbnb) so would be ideal if staying for any length of time.
Excellent location in the heart of Tanunda. Clean and comfortable space, with thoughtful add on, the tawny in the evening was a real treat. Thanks Andy and Natalie !
Large comfortable home close to restaurants, pubs, shopping and central to explore the Greater Barossa Valley.
Great accommodation. Really loved the old record player!
An amazing home to spend Christmas in. Andy add the smallest of touches that made our stay that little be extra special. Will defiantly be back.
Great location and fabulous place to stay would love to stay here again

Fantastic house with plenty of space, made to host six people very comfortably but never felt empty with just the two of us for my stay.  Facilities were great, breakfast supplies were overly generous, and location was best by far.  Could not recommend enough.

This is an absolute gem. The house is very comfortable and stylish, equipped for a short or long stay. We felt so at home there and didn't want to leave! The bath is very large and deep which is a big plus. And the kitchen is huge, with everything you need to prepare meals. I would strongly recommend staying here!

Fantastic location, really nice place with everything you need, and a very responsive and helpful host.
Will definitely stay again!

We have had an excellent time, the location is brilliant, walk to so many lovely restaurants, the house so stylish, incredibly clean, very comfortable, could not recommend more highly, we will definitely return. Thanks so much!

Anthea and Stefan were fantastic hosts. We felt like we were staying with old friends due to the warm correspondence beforehand and how we were greeted upon arrival. The space was clean, well lit, and quite private, with the ability to interact with the hosts in the shared space if you wish or keep to yourselves. We chose to enjoy a wine and a chat in the evening when we arrived back from our winery visit. This location is great value for a person or couple enjoying the Barossa and surrounds.

I would highly recommend staying at this property it has a unique decor and I love the fact you can also take an art class with Anthea. Anthea and Stefan were very welcoming on arrival and their fur family were just gorgeous. Anthea also shared some great walks to do around Angaston of which I went on one after I checked out and loved every minute. It is a quiet, clean and cozy place to stay.

Anthea and Stefan are a couple of natural hosts who make you feel welcome and at ease very quickly. Our bed was very comfy and even had electric blankets for those chilly autumn nights. Even without that, the fire was going 24/7 to keep the whole house warm. We enjoyed the company of Merry (small dog). The 2 cats kept their distance, sadly for us. The house has Anthea's art work everywhere, which is just lovely and certainly adds a special touch to the house. Both of our hosts were accommodating, helpful and natural. We would highly recommend. The house is close enough for a stroll down town for a meal out, although the driveway is quite steep. Not for the faint hearted, but great exercise. Special little touches included a packet of local dried fruit blend and a bottle of red wine, should you choose to indulge.

Good location, nice warm house.  Loved having our own bedroom, tv room and bathroom.  Privacy if you want it, or join Anthea and Stephan in the evening.  Great artwork on display throughout the house.  Thankyou
Anthea and Stefan have a gorgeous home. Very comfortable and welcoming along with gorgeous surrounds in Angaston/Barossa! I highly recommend others stay here!
Great place to stay & great hosts. Loved it!
Super friendly hosts.

Anthea and Stephane are a great host very kind and welcoming. 
The house is beautiful, clean and comfy. You can find everything you need. It’s really close to the center of the City, you can go by foot. I recommend this place.
Wonderfully helpful hosts. Tranquil setting. Lots of private space.
Anthea’s place was beautifully clean and a pleasure to stay at. She was very welcoming. Anguston is a delightful village and Anthea’s place is just a short walk from the main street.
Was a great stay. Very welcoming
Good location , very helpful and friendly hosts.
Nice place with plenty of privacy ! Accommodating host
A delightful, quiet space with easy access and a relaxed atmosphere. Very convenient if you're travelling or working in the area. Highly recommended.

A lovely place to stay when visiting the Barossa Valley - the home is full of character (and art!), Anthea is a friendly, thoughtful and welcoming host, and there is still sufficient privacy for guests.

Excellent accommodation within easy walk of Angaston town centre. Great to have our own lounge room we could relax in and everything was very clean & well presented. Anthea & Stefan were excellent hosts and a mine of information about local landmarks & restaurants. Thank you for your hospitality and we would be happy to stay here again anytime.

I was happy to have stayed at Anthea and Stefan's place. Anthea is an outgoing and super friendly character that was welcoming and loved a chat. The guest area gives you plenty of room to relax and chill at the back of their house.

Anthea's place, "The Art Box" is in Angaston, within the wine region of South Australia and in picturesque surroundings. Pets and a few steps are within the home. The driveway is steep, but manageable. We found Anthea to be very warm, friendly and helpful. Check in was no problem. The bed was comfortable. There was a separate sitting room,  bedroom,  toilet and bathroom for guest use only. Didn't have to share anything, which we were very pleased about. Everything was very clean and neat. Anthea is an artist and has many pieces of her work on show. Very interesting.
Thank you for a very   pleasant stay Anthea.

Anthea  & Stefan are very welcoming and friendly. The bedroom spotless and bed is comfy!!! So important for a good nights sleep! It was so quite I slept really well & glad I did not opt for a motel room.  Was surprised at the extra cozy room with TV, fridge & sofa which I had not expected.

Anthea and Stefan were excellent hosts who were friendly and helpful with local tips. The accommodation was clean, comfortable and a short walk to the heart of town.

Couldn’t ask for a better place to stay on this occasion - would definitely stay again!

It was a wonderful place. We had our bedroom and an extra living room which was really perfect. Anthea and Steffen were really friendly and really heart warming people. We also had dinner with them and it was a nice evening with really good talks. Also their dog and the two cats were cute. We can definitely recommend this place. Anthea also gave us good tipps and spots what to do in Barossa Valley. She organised for us our wine tasting tour. 

All in all we had two wonderful nights in the Art Gallery Box with two wonderful people. Thanks Anthea and Steffen. :-) 
See you later !
Anthea's place is beautiful, great amenities and just a short walk from town. Anthea is a wonderful host- very friendly and thoughtful. Loved the animals too!

Many thanks to Anthea for the expert tips and advice which allowed us to make the most of our day in the Barossa Valley. Our stay was fantastic, made all the better by the added special touches.
Thanks again for your hospitality.
Anthea was a welcoming host, without being too attentive (well balanced).  Great suggestions for local eating
Anthea and Stefan made us feel right at home, very warm and welcoming hosts. There were lots of thoughtful touches to the room, thank you for a wonderful stay!

Anthea and Stefan are great hosts, making us feel at home in their wonderful, art-filled, quirky and cosy abode.

Heaters and an electric blanket disguised the fact that it was soooo cold outside and a couple of welcome gifts greeted us.

Be prepared for a very steep driveway, but you don't have to walk up, as there is a parking space at the top. Inside there are also a few steps, but very safe.

It's plain to see why Anthea and Stefan are Superhosts!
Clean room with beautiful view. Will go back again!
Beautiful space, private and cosy.
A lovely spot overlooking Angaston. Very comfortable and hospitable, and a perfect way to prepare for the Barossa marathon festival. Ember pizzas for carb loading are highly recommended!

Staying at The Art Box was a delight. Anthea and Stephan were great hosts offering great advice and tips about the region. There were lovely unexpected personal touches that were lovely. Location were great. 
Can highly recommend. We will stay again any time.
Wonderful hosts, plenty of private space, beautifully decorated home, close to main street area.
A comfortable, clean and  good value bnb only minutes away from Angaston and other parts of the Barossa Valley
Great spot to stay! Great location, very friendly hosts with great personal touches! Highly recommend!

Lovely space to call your own, bedroom, lounge area and bathroom. 
Beautiful art about the house to brighten the stay.
Great host clean and spacious

Anthea was very welcoming and accommodating, a lovely person with a cool house!
It’s a great location, perfect to get bikes and visit many wineries.
An art filled home that's vibrant, clean, and made better by the hosts kindness and hospitality.
Quiet and peaceful location. A cute, cozy home with a touch of the owner’s artworks. We enjoyed our stay.
Quick easy but pleasurable stay. Thanks for your hospitality!
Nice place, close to town, comfortable, nice little patio outside that gets the morning sun.
It was awesome to have our own  lounge room! Perfect country escape!
I had a great time at Anthea’s place. The bed is so comfortable and the lounge area is perfect for a cozy, relaxing evening in. Everything was really lovely. Thank you :)
Great little spot. Comfortable bed. Anthea and Stefan are lovely hosts. I had a great stay.
Anthea is a great host! I highly recommend you stay here. Very cosy room, with a comfortable bed and lovely hospitality. Thanks again Anthea.
We loved our (Email hidden by Airbnb) fortable & private area, with the unique touches of Antheas art work. The indoor pets were very well behaved. Definitely recommend.
Beautiful home in a beautiful location, Stunning views, still close to town and wineries. Everything about our weekend was just lovely. Def recommend this accomadation.
A beautiful property with spectacular views of the Barossa. Perfectly located and a great base to experience the region from. Thank you Dan and Matilda for being such helpful hosts.
Beautiful house; great hosts; perfect location.
Thank you Matilda we had a fantastic time! Great location beautiful views and gardens, everything we needed..
Beautiful house, amazing views, we had a wonderful stay and will be back!

Hoffman Hill is situated in a quite and scenic location with uninterrupted views of the Barossa Valley Hills. The spectacular 25 acre property not only boasts absolute privacy but is surrounded by beautiful rose gardens, a chicken coupe, sheep paddock and green lawns. 

Inside will make you feel right at home with warm and welcoming furnishings, comfy beds and well pressured showers. The home was immaculately clean and tidy, a well fitted kitchen with views outside made cooking a meal for my friends and family more than enjoyable. 

I highly recommend this property to anyone visiting the area, its close to all the wineries and good eating spots. It will surely make you want to return. 

Matilda, her partner and her and her parents will make your stay just perfect. So thanks again for their hospitality and making our stay so enjoyable.

A beautiful and comfortable house with a stunning view and outlook. Close to all the facilities of Tanunda (even walking distance if desired) and easy access to the rest of the Barossa. Real bonuses of separate bathrooms for mixed group stays and plenty of comfortable space. Comfortable beds are always important and those here were great. Would definitely stay again....

Thanks to Matilda who is a great host with great and timely communication throughout booking and check in.
The view out the back is outstanding. Lovely house to sit back, relax and unwind in.

Wonderful hosts, great spot to see the best of Barossa. 

Matilda very kindly helped us out when one of the party left a phone behind, and we were greeted with a bottle of wine and freshly laid eggs!

We had a fantastic mini-break at Hoffman's Hill in the Barossa. My two young boys had a ball exploring the enourmous estate. Comfortable and beautifully turned down bedrooms were a real feature as was the bath in the master bedroom suite. So relaxing and unique. 
The Chicken coup was a bonus with the chickens laying 14 eggs in 3 days!!!
In summary very close to all the wineries, comfortable, modern with some luxurious touches. Great experience.

Incredible find in Tanunda, we feel very lucky to have stayed here! Peaceful and serene and has everything we needed - only wish we had more time to spend chilling at the house and enjoying the spectacular view! Would definitely stay again

The pictures don't do the stunning view justice. You're minutes from town yet a world away in the surrounding countryside. We absolutely loved waking up to the birds, rolling mountain view and beautiful gardens.

The perfect place for a Barossa weekend.  The house is very comfortable with a great garden to relax in and an incredible view.  It's an easy walk into Tanunda and in very close proximity to lots of wineries.  I would highly recommend this house.
Fantastic place to stay.  Comfortable beds, beautiful gardens and thoughtful and kind hosts. We’d definitely stay again.

Matilda’s home is beautiful, especially the back garden area. Perfect spot to sit and relax. The location is only a few minutes away from Tanunda in a serene, quiet spot. The house has everything you need. Communication was also great, made for an easy stay. Would definitely come back again!

Matilda's house was clean and homely - a great size for 4 or 6 people. The well tended garden stands out as the best aspect of the property with a stunning view and everything you need - BBQ, comfy chairs and outdoor dining. Plenty of candles and even mosquito repellent is provided. Great location for exploring nearby wineries. Highly recommend.
Beautiful space in a beautiful location

Our stay was amazing, the home was exquisite with a uniquely peaceful sorrenity.
The home was in beautiful condition, the photos don’t do it justice!
Matilda left us handy tips to the local Barossa area and answered all of our enquirers in a short space of time.
Overall this was an amazing stay and would recommend this to anyone

The house was wonderful. It was incredibly clean, convenient to everything and the views were amazing. There were lots of special touches- bottle of wine, recommendations for places to dine at etc... flowers, fresh towels in every room. 
We are a family of 4 traveling with 2 adult children so we could all have our own space when needed. 
I highly recommend this property.
Couldnt fault the accom and the hosts were lovely.

Fabulous house with a beautiful veiw. The house was clean with lots of thoughtful touches such as fresh eggs, milk and a bottle of wine. The place was well equipped with everything you could possibly need for a comfortable stay. A great place to stay and explore the Barossa!

We visited the Barossa with another couple and Matilda’s place was amazing. We loved the gorgeous panoramic views over to Tanunda and across the valley. It was so peaceful and serene and the views and garden are even more special than the photos indicate. You could easily relax and unwind at the house all day, with a bottle of wine and some nibbles. The beds were super comfortable and the layout of the house is great for hosting 2 or 3 couples or group of friends/family.  Fresh eggs, brekky stuff and a lovely bottle of wine were a nice touch. We definitely would highly recommend Matilda’s place and would love to come back again in the future!

This is a fantastic place to stay in Barossa. Communication was extremely easy. Matilda had some nice little touches when we arrived that made us feel welcome. The view is incredible and if it had been warmer we would have loved to spend more time relaxing in the beautiful garden. I hope I get to return one day and would highly recommend to everyone.

A homey and spacious house with an incredible garden and view. We appreciated the  thoughtful touches that were left for us to enjoy and the local tips. Was a great location and suitable for kids. We loved everything about this home and it made our Barossa experience unforgettable. Thank-you!!!

Matilda and Daniel were excellent hosts. The place was perfect and the breakfast supplies were so thoughtful! The location is excellent to explore all the Barossa has to offer. The view from the backyard is spectacular. And if you’re lucky enough to nab the master bedroom you can enjoy a bath with a beautiful view. The hosts were very responsive and accommodating and would recommend this place to anyone.

Had a lovely long weekend staying at this wonderful home - the pictures of this place definitely do not do it justice! A great spot if you want to be in the heart of the Barossa Valley but still have your own private, secluded space to enjoy.

This is an absolutely idyllic location - you can sit out on the back verandah for hours and hours, on comfy sofas sipping the Barossa wine you’ve just bought, looking out over Matilda’s perfectly kept and just beautiful garden, over to Tanunda, its rooftops and church spires (and later, its twinkling lights) and to the hills beyond. Just magic. Our boys also loved exploring the extensive bush garden on the property. Plus there’s a very comfortable house to enjoy with everything you might need and lots of space for a family of 4 to find their own areas to retreat to when they need. It was the perfect base for this Barossa weekend away with children. I hope we’ll be back!
The photos do not do this place justice! Outstanding and Matilda was a great host. Highly recommend
Excellent place to stay when visiting Barossa. Matilda was extremely accomodating. We’ll be back!
Excellent accomodation, would highly recommend
This is the nicest Airbnb we have ever stayed in. The home is beautiful and the view just perfect. All amenities great, we wanted to move in. Would thoroughly recommend

We stayed at Matilda and Daniel’s house for the Easter long weekend. There were 4 of us in total so we had lots of space to relax around their spacious house.
The house was clean, tidy and had everything we needed. Matilda and Daniel had organised some thoughtful touches like breakfast provisions, local wine and some toiletries. That was very unexpected and greatly appreciated!
We cooked breakfast each morning and a few dinners during our stay. The kitchen was well appointed and there was also an outdoor BBQ we used.
Their house was very homely and comfortable to stay in. The back garden and view was gorgeous!
We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend Matilda and Daniel’s house.
Perfect location for those wanting to experience the Barossa and surrounds. Close to town but far enough away for privacy and peace and quiet. Lovely house with awesome views. Highly recommended.

Hoffmann's Hill lodging is a spacious and functionally well laid out house for several couples / children.  For those seeking a nice rural view proximate to the township of Tanunda with its tourist activities, shopping and restaurants,  you can do no better.  A wood fire was a highlight for the cold evenings.
It was very well presented and provisioned.  Matilda is a thoughtful host who made herself available to ensure our stay was memorable.
Lovely house with a fantastic view.

Two thumbs up! This a beautiful home away from home. Easy to book, communicate and check in, Matilda made us feel really welcome as soon as we walked in the door, a sign 'Welcome Nuno and Friends, we hope you enjoy your stay', along side a bottle of red wine welcomed us. We were even treated with supplies of fresh eggs, milk and bread for breakfast. The house is immaculately clean and fitted out with everything you would have in your own home. There is a beautiful fireplace, piano, magazines, kids toys and a great range of books and dvds to enjoy! There is this amazing glass room off the main bedroom with a bathtub overlooking the manicured rose garden and rolling green Barossa Hills. A must book for anyone looking to stay in the Barossa Valley. Thank you for sharing your home with us Matilda :)
A stylish home with incredible views of Tanunda town, all the comforts of home and some nice surprises to boot!

Matilda has a lovely home and is a wonderful host. It is super clean and very spacious, with lots of thoughtful little touches including bacon & eggs in the fridge and sleeping masks. Despite it being a little cold dying our visit, the heating made the whole house toasty warm. The location is perfect - just overlooking the town and very central for visiting the wineries. Recommend thoroughly!
Absolutely beautiful and clean home with amazing views. Host was very responsive and kind. The perfect place to visit the Barossa and can’t wait to come back! Thanks!!

We had such a lovely stay at Hoffman’s Hill. It’s in the heart of the Barossa with beautiful views of green rolling hills and loads of things to see and do near by. A perfect country stay for my friends and I.

Fantastic location overlooking Tanunda. Lovely touch with the fresh eggs from the chickens up the back. A beautiful home with amazing views and great for children given the expansive gardens and climbing frame to the side. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend it.
Fantastic and clean accommodation, beautiful setting.  Great hosts that left fresh eggs and bread (and a few other bits and pieces) in the fridge.  We really enjoyed our stay.

Matilda's place was very comfortable, sparkling clean and has all the amenities for an amazing stay in Barossa Valley. The location is very convenient, just a stone throw away from all the wineries, cafes and supermarket! 

We definitely enjoyed relaxing in the backyard and soaking in the incredible views! We would definitely be back!!
Beautiful location and great amenities. We loved our stay at Hoffman's Hill. Our hosts responded promptly to our questions and provided a lovely home for our stay.
A lovely, comfortable home with an amazing view. Great location, just minutes from the centre of Tanunda but very quiet and peaceful. Great hosts - thoughtful and responsive.

Matildas place was in the perfect location with amazing scenery and views. Matilda was easy to communicate with and the house was lovely to stay in for the weekend! Would definitely recommend for any groups looking for a place to stay that is central in the Barossa!

The property and location is second to none. We are very fortunate to find this gem in Barossa!
The communication with the host is flawless and this place has everything you need to make it your own house!
Highly recommend it to anyone visiting Barossa. 2 nights stay isn't enough, a week would be better!

Hoffman's hill is an absolutely beautiful home. We had 3 nights there and thoroughly enjoyed it. Feels like we were away from all the hustle and bustle and in a very remote place , yet we were close to all main attractions in the Barossa Valley. 
We really appreciate Matilda's help with suggesting the best restaurants, local eateries and even leaving us some local products.
We will definitely return. 
I can recommend this place to anyone who wants a peaceful , relaxed break.

None of us could fault a thing with our stay here. The house was well stocked, very clean and had an amazing view. Local eggs and bacon on arrival and fresh eggs from the chickens every morning, plus plenty of advice on local food and wine. If we ever end up back in the Barossa we will be staying here again.
Great host. Great location. Some nice touches like locally sourced breakfast provisions (incl. fresh eggs from the property). A lovely stay and wouldn’t hesitate to stay again.

We spent 2 nights at Hoffman’s Hill and loved every minute of our stay. 
We are 2 couples and felt completely at home. The views from inside the house and the outside entertaining area are magnificent. 
The house was so clean and comfortable with quality furnishings and amenities. 
Great additional comforts like the Nespresso machine with pods, bacon, eggs and bread for our breakfasts were so welcomed. 
Would be delighted  to stay here again as the house is very convenient to everything in the Barossa Valley region but is on a private secluded block.

We absolutely loved this place. It was a perfect little getaway in a gorgeous setting. Secluded enough to be peaceful and private yet less than 50m from the main rd and coffee shops. Absolutely anything we could think of was supplied, including eggs,bacon and tomato for breakfast and even ice in the ice trays. The spa bath was bliss and the aircon was super effective. We will definitely be coming back again!

Our stay was relaxed and lovely. We had so much fun having breakfasts in th e courtyard amidst the beautiful garden and fruit trees. Everything that was needed was provided for, plus more. The property is also right in the heart of town so it was very convenient getting around. Highly recommended

The Cottage is right in the middle of Tanunda and equipped with everything you need and is a walk away from anything you might want.
It has loads of character and is a really easy and convenient and value for money place to stay.
It was also wonderful having the completely flat access from the car to the house.
And we made us of the covered outdoor area and BBQ.
We would definitely stay in this wonderful character cottage again.

Amanda's place is perfectly located in the centre of Tanunda village, but feels very quiet and private just a minutes walk from the Main Street
There was bacon and eggs, plus cereal, toast, butter and spreads provided which was a lovely touch.
Great location really conveniently located to everything. Ample provisions for breakfast and lost of extras.

What can I say? Staying at Elsie's cottage was lovely. Only 1 minute walk from the Main Street of Tanunda and just around the corner from the best coffee shop in the Barossa. The cottage was clean on arrival and the fridge was handed over full of eggs, bacon and goodies; perfect for a weekend spent touring wineries.

The beds were comfortable and the cottage itself very cosy, this place is perfect for friends and families alike. Would definitely stay again.

We loved our stay here. It was very homey and cozy!
The cottage was right in the middle of town but very secluded. It was easy walking distance to cafes, shops, nice restaurants, etc. 
We were helped immediately when we locked ourselves out...and we hadn't even had any wine yet. 
The fireplace was great and there was firewood,  kindling, and firestarters provided. The fireplace was a major bonus to sit back and have a fire with a nice shiraz. 
Breakfast was provided. The bacon was fresh from the butcher and the eggs were delicious. We made our own brekkie easily with the ingredients and pots, panda, and utensils provided.
Thanks very much for a great stay.
Sarah and Daniel
Beautiful cottage and we had a fun time

This cottage is a great base for a Barossa getaway. Super location just behind the main street of Tanunda. Great facilities in an historic cottage. Amanda provides very generous breakfast provisions and the cottage is well cared for. Would definitely stay there again

This little cottage is a little gem and we loved every minute of our stay there! Unfortunately we didn't meet Amanda personally but communication via text and email was easy. The cottage is in a very central (but quiet) location only minutes away from the high street of Tanunda. The cottage has a really nice feel to it, all the attention to detail is amazing. There is also a nice outside area to sit down and enjoy a glass of wine. The food that was delivered for breakfast was plenty, we were positively surprised! I highly recommend Elsies Cottage!

What a little gem Elsie's Cottage is! Perfectly located close to the main street with restaurants, retail shops and the Visitor Centre just a stone's throw away but very tranquil surrounds.  It was beautiful to awake to birdsong and feel like you're miles away from city life. I would recommend staying here, kindly, Jodie @Evolution Concierge Byron Bay
Great location.  Beautiful town.  Really nice to have breakfast food provided.  Cute little cottage.
Great location

Wonderful house and location, everything was perfect as soon as we arrived, and there was clean linen, towels and breakfast supplies aplenty. Super close to Murray Street and walking distance to 4 great restaurants. We will be staying there again next time.
The house was perfect for our stay in the Barossa. It is ideally located and quiet and peaceful at night. Highly recommend!
