John and Jess were awesome hosts, super quick on replies and really homely touches in the house. Coffee, tea, milk, breaky supplies. The farm was fantastic; felt remote but was only a 25 min to the town centre and wonderful wineries. We had a great time!

What a way to complete your Barossa experience. It was so beautiful waking up surrounded by farm life and finishing the day with a picnic on the banks of the river. John went out of his way to make our sister holiday getaway extra special by including a happy birthday sign. We couldn’t recommend this little cottage more. Thank you

Beautifully restored cottage with all the modern appliances for comfortable stay in a hidden section of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Loved all the extra touches like fresh flowering orchids on the dining table, sumptuous Sheridan towels and all the makings for a delicious breakfast including smoked bacon and farm fresh eggs.  John and Jess have done a great job of combining a mix of the historic building with all the items to make you feel like you never left your home.  Would definitely stay there again.
Fantastic stay!!! All we could need in such a beautiful country setting. Will book again when we need a quiet getaway! Absolutely perfect!
Fantastic accommodation! The perfect relaxed location with everything you need :)

Buckbury End Farm Cottage is a rare gem! Nestling in a working farm, with your own path down to a peaceful picturesque river, you have your very own haven and refuge from which to explore this iconic wine and food Mecca. The cottage is recently renovated to a very high standard, charming classic luxury! All the facilities are perfect and spotless, the hospitality perfect and the breakfast to die for! We will be back and would not consider staying any where else. Private luxury 7 minutes from the first Cellar door - perfection.
John and Jess’ place was perfect for a weekend away, with everything you would need.
Relaxing country cottage, close to winery’s etc. Nice change from the city life.
Excellent little cottage. Great location. Great hosts and very clean.
Great location and launching point for the Barossa. Well thought out accommodation and beautiful views. Breakfast a bonus and it makes for a great couples stay
Great little hideaway for two in the Barossa Valley. Well located to explore the Valley, tastefully decorated and comfortable. Highly recommend.

As described - a cosy little cottage in the country.  The cottage was warm even though it was very cold outside with the temperature dropping to 1c.  The Air Con was enough to keep us warm, but the open fire added ambience, although you have to bring your own wood.  It was a nice base for a short break from the city and a day out on the bicycles.  The Barossa cycle trail isn’t far away and the Rosedale Scenic Road is worth a detour.  We didn’t need to contact the hosts during our weekend stay, even though they were just next door, because everything we needed was provided and there is a combination key box to let yourself in.
An amazing space in a great area. Great ambiance with a fireplace and a well equipped kitchen. Great communication from hosts. A wonderful stay! :)
We loved our stay at John and Jess’s cute and cosy cottage. Highlights were having wine and cheese by the creek and getting to know the farm’s  friendly pony! Highly recommend.
A perfect romantic country escape. Would definitely recommend using the fireplace, gave that special touch. Very tranquil and still convenient to drive to wineries etc. Definitely recommend!!

We absolutely loved our stay at John & Jess's adorable cottage. Our daughter LOVED the animals (esp the cow), and we slept better then we have since she was born. Amazing location (minutes away from wineries), and we really appreciated the thoughtful touches (fresh eggs, bread, milk and breakfast food). Thanks again! We will definitely stay again when in the area.
Great location,  perfect winter gateway

A great spot to stay off the beaten track in amongst the farms - loved sitting in front of the indoor fireplace while sipping Shiraz from a local winery. 
A good location from which to explore the Barossa region.
Great location not far from Lyndoch and Tanuda. Very peaceful in a rustic farm cottage, with enough mod cons to make it a pleasurable experience.
Quaint little cottage, with lovely touches, that make staying here idyllic. We absolutely loved the cottage!

John & Jess's hideaway is amazing! The property is beautiful,  and the homestead is so cosy and welcoming. John and Jess are lovely to deal with and very thoughtful. We could not ask for anything more, and will be back!

We had a wonderful time staying at John and Jess’s Airbnb. Gorgeous property with lots of land and animals around to say hello to.
It is an easy 15 min drive to the Main Street in the Barossa Valley.

John and Jess's cottage is absolutely lovely with a charming country feel, yet is fully equipped with all of your necessities. Its location is absolutely superb to many surrounding wineries and little towns for restaurants, shopping, etc. The cottage is situated in the back of the main house, but allows for full privacy and zen. We enjoyed the gorgeous scenery, the farm atmosphere experience, and ending our nights by the cozy fireplace. It was an absolute great getaway, allowing for full Barossa exploration and ultimate relaxation. We would absolutely be delighted to stay there again.

Wow wow wow!! We stayed here for two weeks and had the most AMAZING time! The cottage is clean and cosy, very romantic for a week/weekend away. The property is also stunning. We went for a walk down to the creek and loved it so much we had a picnic down there for a whole afternoon! I would HIGHLY recommend staying in this beautiful little cottage. Thank you John and Jess!!
My parents stay with John and Jess was lovely. John was very helpful with directions to finding the house, and the location and house were very relaxing and comfortable.
Loved our stay here!

This cottage is absolutely fantastic and John and Jess were brilliant hosts! I took my girlfriend for her birthday and they were kind enough to add a sweet birthday message on the bed for our arrival, and in the entertainment area on the property. The entertainment area was especially beautiful, a perfect place for a BBQ dinner under the stars, sunset, or by the fire. We absolutely loved the property and would recommend it in a heartbeat, John and Jess's hosting skills to add thoughtful touches, provide breakfast, and make sure we felt at home were great extras to make the stay extremely enjoyable.

This AirBnB is truly amazing! We absolutely loved our stay.  If you like the country and peace and quiet, this is the place for you.  The place is cute, comfortable and warm, you feel like you are at home.  I would highly recommend this Air BnB.  it is also very close to the great vineyards of the Barossa, with Tanunda at your doorstep and Adelaide not too far away.

I so highly recommend staying here! There were so many excellent little touches that made the experience so special. It's remote enough to feel private and secluded, but close enough to drive everywhere you want to go! There is a lovely walk down the back of the property with a beautiful tree swing by the water. The kitchen is equipped to cook delicious meals, or to have a picnic by the river. All the amenities are brilliant and big enough for two people comfortably. Brilliant!

This little cottage was perfect for a quiet weekend getaway and we particularly loved exploring the property and picnicking at the river.
The bed was super comfy and we slept soundly with rustling branches about the only thing to be heard.
John and Jess were super easy to contact if needed but we also felt as if we basically had a section of the property to ourselves.
Would definitely recommend.
Great place to stay to see the Barossa

A wonderfully private and safe space on the property 
Close to the Barossa with everything that you need
Tranquil and relaxing... ideal place to escape the city life!

What an amazing place to stay! We visited the Barossa to explore over the weekend. John and Jess’s place was the perfect location to explore the Barossa and also relax and enjoy the beautiful views from the patio. The cottage itself is very well appointed and the perfect size for a weekend getaway for 2. There were so many thoughtful touches and great information about the area which made it easy for us being first time Barossa visitors. Communication with John and Jess was easy and quick as well. Very highly recommended!
Everything was as expected. Very comfortable bed, and the accommodation was very cosy and clean. It's also an ideal location for exploring wineries. Would happily stay again and recommend to others.

We spent two nights at the cottage and were delighted with our stay. John was swift at replying and sent detailed info as to how to reach the farm. We loved the country feel of being on a working farm with accommodation reflecting its rural location but with modern amenities. A great spot to use as a base for visiting the many local wineries. If we lived closer we would be regular visitors!

The Farm cottage was conveniently located close to several wineries in the Barossa region. 

The hosts have thought of everything. The small details made for such a cosy and comfortable stay. The eggs, bacon, bread and milk provided was perfect for breakfast. 

Being located in a farm it is natural that we had several spiders visiting us. Additionally, we may have had more than the usual amount of visitors, due to the heat wave. It made it a bit scary for my partner who is petrified of spiders, even though she grow up in the country. We survived though and the hosts provided bug spray. 

Overall, it is great value for money compared to other offering in the region.
We had a lovely, relaxing and peaceful time. We really appreciate all the special treats and touch’s done to make our stay amazing. Hope to maybe return again one day.
The place was absolutely beautiful! Loved the small thoughtful touches and great location
Nice comfy little cottage on a quiet country farm. Roughly 20mins from Tanunda and all the major wineries.
Great stay!
Loved it.
Delightful little cottage, perfect place for a little getaway! Great communication from John and Jess too!
great air bnb in the Barossa, cute farm stay, nice and isolated but close to all the action, highly recommend it!

Waking up on a farm is one of the most magical, wonderful holiday experiences I've had traveling in Australia. John and Jess made the stay absolutely effortless, providing unexpected surprise amenities for us to enjoy on this beautiful property in the Barossa
The cottage was a very comfortable, peaceful place to stay. It was well located  and had everything we needed, plus lots of extra thoughtful touches.
A cute little cottage perfect for a weekend get away! We really enjoyed our stay x
John and Jess are amazing people that love hosting people. They will help in anyway they can and know all about the area. Furthermore, the Barossa Valley is amazing. Lovely cottage with cute details!

What a romantic little hide-away this cottage is, with heaps of thoughtful touches that made our stay even more enjoyable. If you're heading for the Barossa Valley, we definitely recommend this place!
A really cute, quiet guesthouse tucked away. It made for a really relaxing trip and a short drive away from some of the best wineries. We will be back in the future!
great place to stay for a cosy lovely cottage stay. great hosts. andre and pauline
Peaceful and modern on the inside one can fully provide for themselves in the cabin or go out to eat at the many places around the area property is quite central but you will need to drive.
John and Jess’ cottage was fantastic. There are so many thoughtful touches, they really have thought of everything to make for a great stay.  Perfect place for a weekend away in the Barossa.
After a period of isolation, it was the perfect escape to get out in to nature and still be so close to a number of wineries. A perfect weekend away
Lovely place to stay, close to all essentials, amazing views, very clean and cosy.
A lovely, private farm cottage with beautiful scenery. A very well thought out space and great location. Would definitely recommend this accomodation for those visiting the Barossa!

This cosy cottage is fantastic for a tranquil break, yet all the Barossa highlights are also close by.
The hosts had equipped the place with all we needed and everything from the fireplace and kitchen facilities to the bedding and towels were stylish and the quality greatly appreciated.
We loved strolling near the river and spotting the llamas among the sheep!
A great little cottage for a quick getaway.

John and Jess’s cottage is beautiful! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there! The cottage has a homely, traditional feel yet is newly renovated and beautifully decorated. The atmosphere on the farm is calming and highly recommend their place to stay.

We loved our stay at the cottage, amazing space and well worth a look. Location was great allowing for travel to a number of different tourist locations, but also provided a tranquil place away from the busyness if it all. John and Jess helped to make our visit extra special. Would definitely recommend staying here.
A beautiful place to stay with so many lovely touches to make you feel at home. John and Jess were lovely hosts. I will definitely be back!
The Farmers Cottage is cute, peaceful, homely and affordable! John & Jess are lovely hosts, prompt to answer questions and all round lovely!! This is our second stay and we will definitely be back!!

Beautiful little cottage, very cosy with the fire place going and a glass of wine in hand. Located on an amazing piece of property where you can un-wind and go for a walk down to the river and check out the 4 legged locals.
Awesome spot, cute spacious cottage with an awesome backyard. Only 10-15min drive from tanunda.
Great little cottage that is very spacious. Amazing location and great for a long weekend. Will definitely be back!

We absolutely loved our stay on John and Jess’ property. Our weekend ending up being a lot busier than we originally expected but being able to unwind the day on their beautiful property made up for it. The cottage is stunning, their land is beautiful and the homey touches made it very comfortable to stay with our 4 1/2 month old. We hope to go back soon
Had a great weekend here, the cottage was very charming and we were were given all the amenities we could have needed including breakfast. The location is beautiful too :)
The farm cottage has a wonderful with great facilities and a lovely location
What a great location and cozy cottage. We loved sitting on the verandah and using the kitchen for some relaxed cooking.
Our fifth visit to Buckbury End farm across forty years. We’ll be back again. Fabulous.
A lovely cottage for a getaway

This was a very enjoyable stay in the Barossa. It is a little bit further out, however was easy enough for us to find, and our Barossa guide was still more than happy to pick us up from here. As for the space, it was cosy and stylish, and the reverse cycle airconditioning was wonderful on the cool nights we had. It was a great bonus to be able to wander down to the river and experience the bleeting sheep and have a tiny taste of farm living. The breakfast provisions were also most appreciated (and delicious!) Would recommend.
Beautiful area, with amazing and thoughtful hosts. We loved our first nights in the Barossa! Definitely recommend for location, cleanliness and finessed touches.

Enjoyed our stay here, a unique and relaxing property close to all Barossa activities.

Sadly the power was off for most of 2 nights of our stay due to freak storms but that was not the owners fault. 

Would love to stay again.
Nice place to stay very comfortable and relaxing.

john and Jess were easy to communicate.  we were able to have complete privacy and walk around the farm and see all the animals. the nature was really beautiful and the little cottage was very comfortable. 
thanks John and Jess
Super cosy little stone farmhouse. Really cute, air con was amazing on the 44° days we had. Kitchen was perfect for cooking and wasn’t too far away from Tanunda and other towns and wineries.
Lovely farm stay cottage in the Barossa. Very well appointed and essential amenities made for a very comfortable stay.
A lovely space and cute cottage. Not too far from everything!

We had such a fantastic time staying on this property. It was exactly as described, extremely clean and we spent plenty of time walking to the river for sunset and having a picnic. The spot is utterly beautiful, highly recommended!!
Great stay
Beautiful place!
Amazing place to stay! Exceeds all expectations and John and Jess have gone above and beyond to make sure its a special place. Would definitely stay again!
Would recommend to anyone! Great location, beautiful setting, lovely restored cottage and lots of thoughtful touches.
Awesome little cottage, lots of privacy with plenty space to roam at your leisure on the property. Can recommend for. Couples retreat.
A great spot for a relaxing break and to explore the beautiful Barossa Valley. The cottage is nicely renovated, well equipped and very clean.
Beautiful space, cute little kitchen, really sweet stay

I have stayed at The Farm Cottage three times now... the cottage is super cute, peaceful and a home away from home!  John and Jess are amazing hosts and are very responsive messages.  Do yourselves a favour and stay at the cottage, you won’t regret it!
This is a lovely little country cottage, the hosts have created a very inviting, comfortable & clean space to stay. John was very a kind & welcoming host. Thank you John & Jess.
So peaceful. Great place to wind back

Great hosts! Made us feel at home with her hospitality. I had an interesting conversation  with Juliane with just about everything from county living to world affairs. Her husband David is great with wines too :).

Julianne and David are fantastic host's and there home was amazing place to be in. I would definitely recommend this to everyone who wants that place just a little  out of the city, but close enough to everything. Not far from the Barrosa or city if you have a car. Take a drive up Green Valley RD or take the B10 from Tea Tree  Gully. If you need time out to chill and take in a bit of country life this is it. Pub, shops 10 min down road. Dave knows his wines and can teach you a thing or two but nothing goes past the   (Cook) Julianne. The house is immaculate   and I felt at home and had a wonderful time here. I would recommend this to all future guest's
Julienne och David är det perfekta värdparet - väldigt omtänksamma och trevliga, glada och mycket hjälpsamma och tillmötesgående! Gården var en oas för den som föredrar lugn!

Julienne and David are the best hosts you can have! They showed great hospitality and made us feel at home as soon as we got there. Really the best you can get! I am sure that no one would be dissapointed staying with them.

Julianne and David's hospitality was above anything we could have ever imagined. Still new to staying in people's homes whilst they are there, we were warmly welcomed with food, wine and lots of friendly conversation. We'd strongly recommend a stay here, beautiful and very relaxing.
Julianne and David are very warm and generous hosts. I cannot recommend staying at their place highly enough, their hospitality and property are beautiful.

Julianne and her husband are wonderful hosts. We stayed just for a night (and also were a bit unorganised being last minute as we were on the road passing through and needed somewhere to rest). Very quick to reply, accommodating, warm and welcoming. They make you feel instantly at home and have so many interesting stories! We had dinner and breakfast cooked for us and a showcase and mini tour of their batch of wine and vineyard -  truly we felt spoilt! Their place is cosy and lovely. A real country cottage feel with a fireplace. The room overlooks the front of their property, is warm even when it was cold outside. It has a comfortable bed and you are provided with everything you need. We definitely will be staying again if we pass through. Highly recommend staying!
Julianne and David were wonderful hosts. They welcomed us warmly and shared their stories. We loved seeing the vineyard!
Fantastic hosts!! We felt at home straight away and had the best time staying at Julianne's place. Would highly recommend to anyone. Thanks again!!

Julianne and David's home is warm and much thought has gone into making their guests comfortable.  There are even fleecy bathrobes to cozy in on a chilly winter night!  It is obvious that they enjoy opening their home to guests and that part of the experience for them is to get to know their guests.  What wonderful and far-ranging conversations we had over breakfasts and dinners, which were a welcome surprise after our pondering of way too many restaurant menus.  If you want the experience of visiting a working vineyard and learning about the care that goes into it, if you are interested in the more scientific side to wine making, if you want to discuss the local flora and/or you just want to make instant friends, this is the place to stay!
We had a wonderful stay with Julianne and David. They were ever so welcoming and even wined and dined us. Their home is beautiful. I would highly recommend staying with them to anyone!

Lovely place in the heart of South Australia's wine country minutes away from Barossa Valley, Eden Valley, Clare Valley and Adelaide Hills and equally lovely hosts who went out of their way to make us feel at home. Both Julianne and David were more than generous with their time giving us the grand tour of their farm and vineyard the grapes of which made Charles Melton's "The Voice of Angels" vintage a delectable and incontestable winner. They shared with us their home, company, and food as well as a treasure trove of knowledge about the region's history, wine-making, award-winning vintages, and Aussie indigenous flora and fauna. Spotting wildlife in the vineyard was one of the many delightful surprises we experienced. Kangaroos were grazing and romping around on the farm and did not mind being photographed and going on (Hidden by Airbnb) . Actually, our first up-close-and-personal encounter with a live roo happened on the first day of our visit in Mount Pleasant. Also, we loved being serenaded in the morning by a mellifluous chorus of flamboyantly colored and plumaged native birds. Our plan was to spend just one day, but we loved it so much here that we ended up staying 4 days. A day is merely not enough for a complete immersion in the spirit of this awesome place Down Under. We cannot wait to come back before long and savor the flavor of Barossa Valley and its warm and friendly people.
Julianne & David were very hospitable and welcomed me into their home with open arms. It was a shame I didn't have much time to look around the rolling hills where they very fortunately call home.

Julianne's home was set in the most beautiful countryside and surrounded by a wonderful garden full of wildlife. We were greeted with a warm welcome and we shared a lovely meal over a glass of wine, (my first experience) thank you so very much for your hospitality, especially as it was booked at such short notice.
I wish you every success in your Airbnb venture.

Hi Julianne thanks a lot for the warm welcome at your place. Thanks for the hospitality and lovely chat with you and your husband. So wonderful and very nice. Love to come and stay during Summer and enjoy the wine country. Thanks once again and so beautiful your place is....cheers

Julianne's place was perfect in every way- perfectly located, close to Barossa Valley attractions and only one hour from Adelaide. A very peaceful retreat with a lovely vineyard on the property. 
Julianne and her husband David were very hospitable and beyond generous. My wife and I left their home full of gratitude! 
I would highly recommend staying here- you will enjoy it!

My stay with David and Julianne was faultless from booking to leaving. 
Their home was lovely, the gardens a treat and their hospitality couldn't have been better.
Cannot recommend this property enough, the bed was amazingly comfortable; I don't usually sleep well away from home but had no problem  . .  :)

Thanks guys, for a lovely stay.

Regards Sam

Sometimes you meet people and can easily say, wow the world is a better place just because they are in it,!
Julianne and David make you feel just that. Absolutely delightful hosts , they made us feel so at home and welcome , even our dear pony that was travelling with us. A delightful stay in every way. Thankyou indeed.
PS we have no hesitation in going back when next South Australia calls us.

We had an awesome stay at the lovely place of Julianne and David. 
Both were absolutely friendly, helpful and open-minded. The communication was easy and great, everything was clean and cozy. 

After showing us their whole vineyard (which is beautiful), they invited us for a delicious home made dinner. We were treated very well and enjoyed every minute. Furthermore, we got great recommendations for our trip.

Thank you for everything - we would definitely come back again!
Already missing your hospitality and the "Traktor" ;)

S & J

Julianne and David offered outstanding hospitality. They welcomed my mother-in-law and 5 month old son into the house with open arms and even went through the extra effort to make sure they were fed with a delicious dinner. Would recommend their place to anyone looking to visit the area!

Sehr warm-herzige Gastgeber, eine Umgebung die zum entspannen und Kängarus entdecken einlädt und das hübsche Barossa Valley mit tollen Weingütern! Wir hatten eine großartigen Aufenthalt, vielen lieben Dank!

This place is absolutely wonderful. My partner and I stayed for three nights, and we felt so much at home. We have been using Airbnb a lot and this is definitely one of the best experiences we have had. Julianna and her family are so welcoming and warmhearted, we had great chats and got really good recommendations about what to see in the area where they live. Highly highly recommended!
It's a beautiful vineyard with amazing hosts and a very cosy room. We stayed 2 nights and absolutely loved it! Highly recommended if you are in the area. Thanks a lot Julianne, David and Ian!
Lovely house surrounded by a beautiful garden.  The bedroom is neat and cozy with a very comfortable bed. Julianne and her husband were very welcoming and helpful. Highly recommendable.

Beautiful place and people-
I would recommend staying here to anyone who ever asks, we were treated like family, joined in for family dinners, and even had a full breakfast set out for us each morning! Not to mention the clean and spacious home that overlooks a beautiful vineyard.  
David and Julianne are amazing people and anyone would be lucky to have them as hosts!

Julienne and David are amazing hosts!
The house and the area are beautiful!
Everythjng was amazing.
We really enjoyed our stay and would stay again!
Thanks again!!
Nice location. Very friendly hosts
Lovely hosts. They were very welcoming and told me all about viticulture which was very interesting.

Julianne et David ont été très chaleureux et gentils! Leur maison est très confortable et propre. Ils ont été des hôtes parfaits et nous ne regrettons pas du tout d'y être allé. De plus, la région est très jolie. Nous recommandons sans hésiter de séjourner chez eux!

What a wonderful 2-days we had.  I booked this on the day and I’m really glad we did.  Julianne is a fantastic host and made us very welcome and she has loads of local knowledge and a great guide to the Barossa wineries.  The accommodation is spotless , very comfortable so quiet and the best view of the stars ever.  We were fascinated with the local kangaroos and the other wildlife.  This is a truly wonderful place to stay and I can highly recommend it.

Nous avons eu un très bon accueil.
Julianne et David ont été attentionnés et super sympas durant tout notre séjour !
Notre chambre était jolie, propre et bien équipée.
C'est un endroit parfait pour qui voudrait découvrir la Barossa Valley, le meilleur coin d'Australie pour les amateurs de vin.
Nous vous recommandons chaudement ce logement !

Julianne and Dave are the perfect hosts ! Welcoming us as friends, inviting us to dine with them and share their home and their vast knowledge of the area. It truly was home from home and we loved the peaceful remote country location...highly recommended and hope to stay longer next time.
The trip was cancelled one day before at our request with a full refund, Julie was understanding, she responded quickly and was very polite.

Loved my stay. Julianne was a wonderful host. Woke up to a cooked breakfast and had a personal tour of the vines and rose garden. Bedroom was stylish, clean and very comfortable. Easy to find and felt at home. Would recommend to other visitors looking to stay in the area.

This has got to be the best airBNB stay I've had, ever!! Julianne and husband offer warm hospitality, a cosy, comfortable room in a beautiful quiet setting, great conversations over a lovely dinner (much appreciated as I arrived in the evening), handy local tips for exploring the region, and a tour of their very own vineyard!! Couldn't ask for anything more & really enjoyed my visit here. Handy location to Eden Valley and the Barossa too. Highly Recommended!!! :)

It was lovely to stay with Julianne and her husband. We were welcomed with open arms and invited to share nibbles and drinks. The bed was super comfortable and breakfast delicious. We enjoyed our tour of the vineyard and gardens, too! Would definitely love to come back and stay a little longer!

Es war ein perfekter Aufenthalt bei Julianne und David! Sie sind wirklich super Gastgeber - sehr gastfreundlich und super nett - wir hatten interessante Unterhaltungen beim gemeinsamen Abendessen und sie haben uns die besten Tipps für Weingüter gegeben! Außerdem hat uns Julianne ihren schönen (Wein-)Garten gezeigt und wir bekamen auch gutes Frühstück mit Kaffee! Die Kommunikation mit Julianne war sehr unkompliziert und schnell, das Zimmer sehr sauber und gemütlich! Alles in allem hatten wir alles, was unser Herz begehrte! Wir würden definitiv wiederkommen!
An excellent stay. One night won't be enough, Hospitality is second to none. A very peaceful get away.

Lovely couple, friendly, helpful and understanding... their place is quiet and secluded and the bed was oh so comfortable! 
Highly recommended
Julianne and her husband were wonderful guests with a comfortable, welcoming and fantastic value for money room. Highly recommend.
Accueil magnifique, endroit calme! C'était parfait merci
A comfortable room with very friendly and hospitable hosts

Julianne and David met us at the door with open arms. We were made to feel so welcome.

We didn’t need to spend a night away but chose to break our day trip into an overnight stay and it was well worth it. 
Everything was clean and tidy and we felt like members of the family. 
12 out of 10 stars.
super comfy and clean house! Julienne and David are super nice. it was a great stay! felt like home!

Julianne and David are fantastic hosts who made us very welcome and comfortable in their lovely home ins a quiet corner of the hills. It was also great to get an insight (and taste) into their ventures in wine making! Can’t recommend them highly enough.
Spotlessly clean very cosy bed great hosts beautiful area and township highly recommend
A very lovely couple  who go above & beyond to make your stay comfortable & memorable. Thanks so much.Rob & Karen xx

Julianne and her husband David were very welcoming, and were a wealth of information for undertaking a speedy tour of the Barossa Valley. Their property is beautifully situated amongst their own vines, and I would be pleased to stay with them again.
Julianne and Dave are really nice and kind.  It's  definitely a good choice to stay with them.
Great place to stay. Lovely, quiet location

5 stars is not enough of a compliment for Julianne and David! By far the most amazing Air BnB me  and my partner have stayed in. Accommodating, informative, warm, funny are just a few ways to describe these amazing people.  Do not hesitate to book this place if you have the opportunity.
Wonderful gardens, fantastic hosts, and lovely home in a beautiful part of the Adelaide Hills.
Welcoming and delightful hosts.  Really enjoyed the country feel and the tour of the vineyard. Recommended.

We were truly spoilt by Julianne & David who welcomed us into their lovely home and treated us like family. The level of comfort and their hospitality could not be faulted. They are keen to share their extensive knowledge on the region , the environment and the wine industry. A special Airbnb experience.

We had a great experience in Julianne’s and David’s place. They are very easygoing and interesting people to talk with. They work around the vineyard and still have time and interest to their community. Highly recommend.

This place is fantastic! it's in a lovely rural setting.  the room is very comfy.  the hosts are super nice (Julianne even sewed my button back on my shirt before we were due to head to a wedding!). i would highly recommend this place

Julianne and David have such a cute little house out in the wine country. Their home is warm, welcoming, and comfortable. Their land is beautiful, set just outside a tiny country town. It is a bit remote, but that wasn't a problem for us with our own car. Seriously, go walk through their vineyards and gardens, it's so peaceful and breathtaking. It really relaxes you! We even saw a kangaroo hop on through :) David gave us a taste of his wine, but we also explored the wineries nearby and had a few tastings. 

Julianne and David were super accommodating and so sweet. We loved staying up chatting with them until we were all too tired to continue. It was much too short of a stay, and we will definitely be back again to stay longer with them! If you're passing through and want an affordable, comfortable, clean, homey-stay in the Barossa Wine Region, definitely book with Julianne and David!
Outstanding hosts, amazing value, you will not be disappointed. I can’t recommend them highly enough
Amazing hospitality ! Great tips on what to see in Barossa Valley! Amazing tea time :)
The stay at Julianne's place was wonderful! We felt like home there. Tasty food,  good wine and  interesting conversations. Couldn't get any better!

Juliane and David greeted us with a friendly welcome and made us feel quite at home The property is in a beautiful setting,and nothing was too much trouble for our hosts to make our stay a memorable (Website hidden by Airbnb) of the best airbandb in which we have stayed

we had a lovely stay with Julianne and David, we found the place easily, it was pleasantly cool, perfectly located for access to the vineyards and airport, the gardens and vines gave us an interesting stroll and the breakfast was ideal for us. Highly recommended
So so lovely, wish we could have stayed longer!!!!

Staying with Julianne and David is very much a 'sharing our home' experience. Their property is located in a beautiful area of the Adelaide Hills/Torrens Valley and you are made to feel like a visiting family member, rather than an air B&B client.

They have an extensive knowledge of their local area and are great tour guides/advisers.  Hearing the story of their property and its history, it's not hard to see why they have such a passion for what they do. 

Highly recommended and we'll certainly stay with Julianne and David again on our next SA trip.

The extremely warm hospitality and the extend of their truly sincere & extra ordinary generosity on all the physically instantaneous helps & valuable informations that they have kindly offered & shared with throughout all my 6D5N stays at their home were truly surprised & deeply touched. I am really speechless, wish I could find  a word that could express more than the ordinary huge 'Thank You' to both Julianne & David!!
Definitely will strongly recommend people to stay there.
热情友善的房东,安静干净的环境,很好体验,非常感谢,美好一天感受｡
Julianne is so sweet! She is very welcoming and takes care of her guests. The room is really nice, the location is beautiful, and we saw a kangaroo on our way up the road!
Julianne is very friendly and will accommodate your needs to help you in any way possible. Looking forward to catching up with her again.
One of the best airbnb experience that I had so far. Lovely family. Thank you very much!!

They were so kind and wonderful.
The wine they made was perfect and the breakfast was so wonderful.
Thank you for welcoming us.
I'd like to see you again.

Such a lovely experience. Everything was so wonderful - from my fluffy down comforter and bathrobe, to the interesting conversations, to the views of the vineyards. I just wish I could have stayed longer. The location is awesome- in the Barossa Valley but a little bit off the beaten track. Overall, I can not recommend this place enough. Thank you so much for the incredible hospitality!

What a lovely couple. Julieanne and David were the most caring hosts we've come across. We haven't been in a use of bedroom in a shared house before and were a little unsure how it would be. We were made you feel at home and enjoyed our chats. It was lovely to be on a farm too. Very enjoyable.
Julieanne's home and surrounds, her care and hospitality, set the gold standard for Airbnb
We had an amazing stay... Quintessential Super Hosts !!!
The host canceled this reservation 7 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

Both Julianne & David are such a sincere, genuine, generous, thoughtful & such a helpful host that honestly beyond words could descript!!  
Both my sister & I were so comfortable & happy during our recent stay there, so clean & warm with plenty of choice of breakfast avail, despite the cold & pretty miserable weather out door.
We certainly love to return & stay there again when next visiting the area.  We surely won't hesitate to highly recommend anyone to stay there!!!

A totally wonderful place to stay. Hospitality was above and beyond our expectations. Their home was central to so many areas around the Barossa  as well as the Adelaide Hills. Would recommend their place to anyone.

Julianne’s house is very clean and comfortable, she waited for us and made hot tea for us when we arrived late. Friendly and Easy to communicate with. She and her lovely husband gave us many local advices, We had great time there,looking forward to be back soon,thank you so much dear Julianne!
Value for money retreat where the hosts go out of their way to ensure their guests have a comfortable stay. Would go back again for sure! Thanks Guys!

If I could leave Julianne 10 stars , I would! It was hospitality at it's very best. Such an amazing, welcoming and warming stay, great conversations and so much laughter! Perfectly clean room with super comfortable bed. Thank you for this amazing stay!

We had a wonderful stay with Julianne and David. They were so friendly, helpful and easy to get along with. The house was sparkling clean and the breakfast and afternoon tea on arrival, delicious. It felt like we were visiting friends for the weekend!
Julianne and David were great hosts offering a warm reception and many helpful hints and ideas about the area and its wineries.We thoroughly enjoyed our brief stay in their delightful home

My parents stayed for just 1 night and loved it, Julianne and David were "extremely thoughtful and lovely" - mum pestered me to leave a review to note "how wonderful they were". Dad is usually skeptical of the private room option but was "very happy" with the stay!

No doubt they'll be asking me to book here for them again next time they visit the area

Can not thank them enough. Wonderful hospitality beautiful settings, comfortable room, outstanding company. Will return.
Thank you again
Lovely people, fantastic hosts more than helpful. Would recommend in a heartbeat.
My parent's second time staying with Julianne and David. I think a second stay speaks for itself, but another fantastic stay, another wonderful experience!

Perfect accommodation!! Charming house in the countryside. Perfect enviroment and perfect hosts. Julianne and David are really kind and easy to talk with. Great breakfast and confy bed. I will surely repeat
Fantastic warm hospitality from Julianne and David. Beautiful homestay, delicious breakfast, great conversations and lovely setting in nature. Plenty of birds and kangaroos! Highly recommend.

I arrived to a warm welcome from Julie-anne.  A wine was waiting for me. I was made to feel right at home.  Julie-anne and her husband, David made me feel very welcome.  A very clean and welcoming place and lovely hosts.
Such a friendly household, so quiet and peaceful and a super clean, cosy room!

Julianne and David are very warm and friendly hosts. They invited us for an afternoon tea and lovely chat when we arrived. Their accommodation offers more than what we expected and location is perfect for us. We look forward to staying with them again the next time we visit Mount Pleasant. Thank you Julianne and David.
Amazing place, would reccommend to everybody! Hospitality was outstanding!

Julianne and David's place was lovely, they are very welcoming and the hospitality was great. Only thing I would say is just message them in advance to check about using their cooking facilities if you are arriving later in the day. Their Internet can be a bit dodgy- but that's not really a problem!  Otherwise it was a lovely stay and I would reccomend people staying here!
Such great hosts awesome people. Very beautiful place and comfortable

Absolutely love the stunning well maintained private garden. Despite the low rainfall of the area, big variety of the blossom roses and the matured fragrant plants were a huge surprising bonus indeed!
The very safe, quiet and tranquility of the surrounding environment is the best place to sleep in and escape from the city's daily busy lifestyle!
The super warmth, helpful and friendly personality of the host do make the stay easy and comfortable!!
Julianne und David sind wunderbare Gastgeber. Die Kommunikation war einwandfrei. Wunderbare Basis um Adelaide Hills, Barossa Valley und Clare Valley zu erkunden. Sehr zu empfehlen!
Great staying on this beautiful, isolated vineyard with lovely company.  A good base for exploring the Barossa and beyond.
Can't recommend this place highly enough. Such great value for money and lovely location. Fantastic spot, especially if you are cycling the Murray to Clare Cycling Trail
WYSIWYG. Read the reviews people. This couple are outstanding hosts and the accomodation is great value.
Great friendly hospitality with local tip. Great accommodation in a good location. Prompt response. Love to go back again.

Julianne and David are friendly and very helpful giving us local information.  

When I left my sunglasses at a winery, she called them up to keep it for me.
Great experience.  Very flexible to cater to both of our plans for checkin and check out.

Wonderful hospitality. Lovely people.
Would highly recommend.
Fabulous  hospitality.. amazing location..very highly  recommend..
Very good value. I received excellent hospitality and would highly recommend. Very clean and comfortable.
We had a great quiet time in Mt Pleasant. Julianne and David made us felt very welcome and we enjoyed their  company and their garden views.

Julianne’s is a warm and welcoming environment. 
Just beautiful, nestled among vines and tall gum trees.
Julianne ensures that your stay is homely and nothing was too much trouble.
I can highly recommend to everyone that needs a home away from home to reset and explore the beauty of this region. 
It is close to all interesting hills sites and wineries.
Thank you again!
Beautiful spot in Mount Pleasant with a small vineyard and own veggies. Julianne and David looked after us really nicely had so much fun with them. Absolutely recommended by me!
Julianne and David have a lovely small farm, comprising mainly vineyard and gardens.  They were both very welcoming, hospitable, and informative about touring thereabouts.

Lovely place, very friendly and welcoming. Beautifully located in very peaceful property and with good access to local attractions. Communication was excellent and Julianne and David were fantastic hosts!
Really a wonderful place to hang one's hat for a night or two, very comfortable and the couple are a real delight. Very attentive to guests' comfort.

I was blown away. From the moment we walked in till the moment we left, it was clear that an incredible amount of care had been taken to provide everything we could possibly need - from milk, coffee and herbal tea to a complementary bottle of wine, fresh figs and strawberries. Not to mention fresh homemade biscuits on departure! 

It's very well positioned as well - a tranquil setting and right in the midst of the best wine region.

I'm already looking forward to my next stag and would highly recommend to anyone exploring the beautiful Barossa.
Such a lovely space! Very cottage yet funky decor and the owners are lovely!
Fantastic stay! Wonderful place to call home for the weekend while we explored Barossa valley. Highly recommend.
WiFi is not available no top bed sheet only 1 chair no table

Our stay at Tracy's place was outstanding and gave us the private little getaway that we needed, only a 10-15 minute drive to Seppeltsfield (where we had a spectacular dinner). We were so well looked after, with some lovely little surprise extras. The breakfast was spot on with homemade granola, yummy bread, fresh strawberries and coffee. The place itself was simple and beautifully presented and it was so lovely to lie in bed with the papers listening to the church bells on Sunday morning. Would highly recommend the hike up the hill to the quarry to take in the views back over Light Pass and the vines... followed by a dip in the pool! We will be back.
Such a beautiful spot nestled amongst the vineyards. Tracy was a lovely host and her homemade granola was delicious.
Tracy was a lovely host who ensured we were comfortable. The homemade granola and biscuits were a lovely bonus. We loved the peaceful surrounding and the country feel

We loved our stay! Tracy was very helpful in the run up and made us feel very welcome and comfortable during it. We were very impressed with the home made granola and fresh bread that was left out for us so we could have breakfast both mornings. The shed is perfectly spacious for 2, clean and has a modern yet quaint feel. Central location and access to all the main wineries.

This is a beautiful place to stay if you are visiting the Barossa. A quiet retreat with 2 very friendly dogs. Complimentary wine and strawberries, and delicious homemade muesli were a lovely touch. Highly recommended!
Quaint accommodation with beautiful decor and attention to detail.  The breakfast provisions were nutritious and tasty.  The shower was fabulous too.  Highly recommend.
Nice clean room. A close drive to all the Barossa has to offer

We loved the very scenic, quiet location with lots of history in a quiet village.  Great accommodation and lovely hosts.  Ideal place to return to after touring the area during the day.  Tracy was very helpful and a pleasure to meet.

Lovely home away from home in the beautiful Barossa. Comfortable, spotless, pretty & centrally located for exploring this stunning region. The owners Tracy & Matt were really welcoming & gave us lots of great tips & recommendations of where to visit, eat, drink etc. Would not hesitate to recommend.
The host canceled this reservation 68 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We absolutely loved our stay at Tracy & Matthew's airbnb, our little cottage was perfect, they are such helpful and generous hosts. Light Pass is perfectly placed to visit wineries and the farmers market. Highly recommend.
Lovely clean little room and friendly helpful hosts.

Tracy's place was outstanding. Impeccably clean, comfortable and nicely decorated. We stayed 3 nights while exploring the Barossa wine region. Tracy left us delicious homemade cookies and granola and left milk, juice, fruit and wine. There was a coffee maker with coffee pods and tea with fresh lemon from their lemon tree. The property is surrounded by vineyards in the small town of Light  Pass in the northern part of the Barossa Valley. Perfect for exploring. Highly recommended.

From start to finish, Tracy and Matt showed amazing hospitality and offered a truly unforgettable Airbnb experience. She allowed us to check in earlier. When walking into the cottage, we found baked cookies and sour dough bread, freshly prepared granola, fresh strawberries and a bottle of complimentary Yalumba wine. It was a very generous offering, not to mention delicious. The cottage was clean and cosy. Tracy and Matt were friendly and always available for any questions. Tracey even provided us crackers on the last night when we missed our chance to buy them as the local Foodland was closed. Thank you once again for the amazing hospitality. It made our Barossa trip unforgettable!

Enjoyed a peaceful and relaxing short stay at this lovely cottage at Light Pass.  Quiet area but close to vineyards and villages and an interesting original settlers cottage just next door.  Would recommend a stay at Light Pass.  Thanks Tracy

We had a great two night stay here. Very comfortable room. Room was immaculate on our arrival. Perfectly located for exploring the Barossa. Tracy and Matthew were excellent hosts. Would highly recommend staying here. Thanks!

Tracy and her husband were very considerate hosts. The accommodation is well appointed and very clean. It is situated within a few minutes drive to most winery within the Barossa region. Definitely well recommended.
Tracy was a lovely host, and we really enjoyed staying at her place. She really went out of her way to ensure we had a perfect stay!

The Old Manse Shed was a cute granny flat that is made to be very homely. Great little kitchenette with bread, granola and coffee included which we had each morning in the yard which was lovely. The two dogs and other family that we met were friendly and we were made to feel welcome. The shed is secluded in a quiet town but is close to Barossa vineyards (cab ride away, which was easy enough). The bed was comfy but very squeaky. The pool was great.
Tracy has set up an awesome spot next to her family home. Very relaxed and a nice little spot
Perfect little spot for a weekend in the Barossa; thoughtful touches throughout & all the amenities you need!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Tracy's. She accepted our last minute booking quickly, and we arrived to a cute and cosy place to stay. We both appreciated the wine, granola, fresh bread and the surprise delicious choc-chip biscuits left on the doorstop one morning! Not to mention the recommendations and local knowledge Tracy and Matthew passed on. Friendly pets too!

Great space to stay if you are visiting the Barossa.

Homemade biscuits and granola a real highlight.
Recommended for all travellers
A really lovely little place!

Beautiful little place, friendly animals. 
Nice touch with the bottle of red and the brownies and sourdough.
Highly recommended! Beautiful space in a great location. Warm and cozy with thoughtful touches to make you feel at home. Very easy to communicate with.

Tracy & Matthew are such generous and friendly hosts.  We really enjoyed staying in their lovely, cozy space and were delighted to find delicious goodies and a great bottle of organic wine waiting for us on arrival.  We were able to check in early, which we really appreciated and it allowed us to really enjoy our first day in the Barossa. Also, Tracy gave us fabulous tips on places to visit which we took full advantage of.  It was such a great location to explore the Barossa from - close to everything and lovely to come home to.
Many thanks for having us.

Everything as described. Nice quiet spot. We enjoyed the fresh and good quality breakfast items provided as part of the booking.

PS... Willow Wines and Tomfoolery wines worth visiting!
Great value and location. Close proximity to everything. Good local tips upon arrival. Thx!

Cozy room, very conveniently located for access to the general area. 
A nice sun trap in the mornings for simple breakfast outside.
Hosts provide excellent local knowledge of where to eat and taste.

Great place at Light Pass, ideally located between Nooriootpa and Angaston and just north of Tanunda. The courtesy wine, tea and coffee, cookies and breakfast were a great treat and Tracy was great to deal with. Two super friendly dogs a bonus! Squeaky bed the only drawback and keep in mind the accommodation is on the same block as the family house.

We had a very comfortable stay in Tracey's place which was in a great location for exploring the Barossa Valley. Tracey's personal touches and care made all the difference to our stay.  Looking forward to coming back!

Great spacious room which was very clean and comfortable. Tracey and Matt are great hosts who provided excellent knowledge about wineries to visit and where to eat. Nice bottle of wine on arrival together with delicious strawberries waiting in the fridge. Central and quiet location, close to a host of wineries and places of interest.
The host canceled this reservation 36 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

It's rare to find a host that represents so perfectly what travel can be about. Tracy's space is perfectly presented and immaculately clean as well as full of thoughtful touches. Tracey and her partner are filled with helpful advice about nearby restaurants and vineyards. A perfect place to base any trip to the Barossa.

Really friendly hosts and nice little place by their house with welcoming access to their pool. Friendly cat and Labradors. Suits well if you're only in for breakfasts and we've suggested darker curtains for sleeping in. Location was close to two lovely towns and everything in Barossa. Great experience overall.
We had a wonderful stay at Tracy's AirBnB. It is a beautifully fitted-out room and we really appreciated the thoughtful touches like fresh bread and biscuits.

We loved our stay at Tracey’s place. It’s very cozy and clean, and Tracey went over and above to accommodate my partners dietary constraints in supplying alternate breakfast options which was very much appreciated. The communication with Tracey was effortless. The property is in Lightpass so it’s perfectly positioned to access key points in the Barossa - such as Tanunda, Angaston and the wineries. Would highly recommend it - great value. Thanks, Tracy!

If you are into your wine and you like animals, this is the place to stay.  Tracy was very knowledgeable, not only about wine, but also activities in the general Barossa area, and you couldn't help but fall in love with Bentley, Paddington and Devon.
Exactly as listed, good value, perfect for your weekend get away in the Barossa on a self drive trip!! We will be back!

Very much worth every 5 stars given! 
Tracy was an incredible host and her hospitality made our trip extra special! Her place was beautiful and in a great location would recommend to anyone!

A wonderful little place to stay for a few nights when exploring the Barossa. The place is in a wonderful location, just a short drive to most places. 
We highly recommend staying at Tracy’s and loved the thoughtful touches like fresh sourdough and wine. Thanks agin
We really enjoyed our stay at Tracy‘s place. It’s a great base to explore the Barossa and Clare Valleys.

Beautiful property that was quiet and charming. Tons of wineries within a short drive and Barossa market close by too. Loved the heated blanket that kept us toasty during chilly June nights with the cool concrete floor. Simple but tasty homemade continental breakfast waiting for us in the room upon arrival. Tracy topped us up with yoghurt and cookies for the next morning upon asking. Bottle of wine was nice touch too although we didnt get a chance to enjoy as we were out at so many wineries!

Loved our stay! The room is very cozy and comfy with everything we could have needed and the dogs are beautiful and so friendly! It’s only a short drive to different restaurants and activities 
Would love to stay again soon.
A great private space, with generous hosts. Very friendly and eager to please. Comfortable and stylish furnishings, the place left us very pleased with our stay. 10/10 for us.
Fabulous airbnb to explore the Barossa. Tracey's place is super cosy and the homemade biscuits and granola were amazing.

Tracy’s place is amazing, it was a beautiful comfortable space in a great location. It was close to all the best vineyards and they were great hosts. We had lots of privacy, and the accomodation came with some beautiful personal touches like fresh bread, homemade muesli, yoghurt etc it was excellent. Could not recommend staying here more! We will be back next time we need to visit the Barossa!

Tracy's place is wonderful. Clean, exactly as described, and the breakfast provided is amazing. It is in a great spot for touring the Barossa, an easy drive to everything. We'd highly recommend Tracy's accommodation.
Tracy’s place is perfectly located to explore the Barossa.
Tracey has wonderful accommodation with lovely goodies to enjoy
Tracy was hospitable and shared great local knowledge of places to visit. The pets were super friendly and bonus to have breakfast provided. It was in a convenient location to wineries and shops.

Cathy was an extremely helpful host.  The accommodation was well equipped and comfortable.  We had 2 children 10 and 12 and there were games for them to play.  It was easy to walk to the centre of town however we had terrible weather.  We would stay there again, understanding that it is an old house that has tastefully been renovated.
Well located home with good amenities for a family to stay in the Barossa. Close to wineries and cafes and supermarket.
Perfect location for great food and transportation

Cathy's house was conveniently located and nicely appointed. Communication was hassle free and all the information we needed was provided well ahead of time. Although we did not get a chance to ride the mountain bikes it's a good option to have and would be a great way to explore the area. We had a comfortable stay and would recommend to others.
Great location - close to shops/restaurants in Tanunda. House was very clean and Cathy was a great host!
My stay here was great and very relaxing. The house is well furnished and supplied with a beautiful back yard area. Cathy was very hospitable.

Cathy was on the ball from the start! Emailing with very easy and clear instructions to get set up with the keyless entry (very cool!). The house is well located, walking distance to shops, eateries and visitors centre. The two mountain bikes saved us lots of money as we did not have to hire from the visitor centre who charge $44 per day per bike. Short drive, or scenic bike ride to Nuriootpa and Angosta with great wineries along the way. Would recommend! Thanks again!
Lovely home, very comfortable and central to town. The garden was a hidden gem. A morning coffee in the garden, planning vineyard visits while soaking up the sun was divine.

We had a lovely stay at Cathy’s place in Tanunda. The location was fantastic—walking distance to shops and restaurants and situated in the heart of Barossa Valley wine country. The house  is very spacious with modern kitchen and generous amenities including bikes if you’d rather ride than walk. There were only two of us but the space could easily accommodate a second couple or family. It also has a lovely backyard space for outdoor meals. Cathy was very responsive to our questions and check in was really east’s We would definitely recommend this space to others.
Highly recommended for all the right reasons!

Nicely renovated old house just a short walk from the middle of Tanunda. Lots of extras (WiFi, Netflix, bath products, Sheridan towels, games and kids’ toys) to make the stay more convenient and comfortable!

It was a great base to explore the Barossa and the hosts tips for wineries and food were spot on.
Cute little house with everything you need to enjoy your stay

Lovely house which has been recently renovated. Its relaxing and comfortable. Great location for a Barossa getaway as a couple, small group of friends or family. The local area has great shops and wider area has many excellent wineries, restaurants and attractions which are all within close proximity to the house. Cathy was a fabulous host and we would recommend her as a host!
A good base for exploring the Barossa

We booked this accommodation for my 40th birthday for 5 adults and 2 kids (1 sleeping in a portacot). It was perfect for us all and we were all really impressed with the place. The garden is gorgeous, the house is modern and with amenities that are current, the beds were comfortable, great shower head, open plan living/kitchen area where we could all gather, it's a quiet location and within close walking distance to the main street of Tanunda. It's a central place in the Barossa and close to all the great wineries. Cathy also has planty of recommendations of where to get good coffee, best restaurant etc. She was quick to reply to any requests and issues we had. It was a great weekend and you must put it on your shortlist of places to stay in the Barossa!
Very lovely house with a beautiful garden. Right near all the wineries would definitely stay again!
Great space. Everything you need for a cosy and comfy stay and an easy walk to the Main Street and all the amenities you need. Would stay again.
Great location for our fine dining experiences. Loved that we could walk or ride the bikes to the shops. Thanks for a very comfortable stay.
Extremely helpful and quick with responses. Many tips for the local area and made the stay incredibly enjoyable. Enjoyed our time at the place immensely!

Our stay at Cathy's place was fantastic. It's only a short walk to the Tanunda shopping strip, including the Barossa information centre. The house is perfectly decked out for a holiday, with a ping pong table, darts, pool table, board games and Netflix. We enjoyed watching TV after dinner and eating lunch on the patio.  Cathy provided a guidebook with info on things to do, and how to use the appliances. Thanks for hosting us Cathy!

Great home, perfect location to walk into Tanunda. 
Cathy was very friendly!

Cathy’s place is perfect for a Barossa getaway! The house has two large bedrooms and then a seperate space with bunks as well. All the appliances and glassware and cookware are of the highest quality and the house was sparkling clean. The backyard is a great place to relax after a long day of wine tasting.

Cathy is a great host, she communicate well with us and even prepare the place to be comfortable and cool upon our arrival on a very hot day. Cathy’s place is beautiful and we enjoyed playing the darts and pool in there too. The location is perfect, close enough to places that we planned to visit and quiet for a good night sleep. I’m definitely recommending this place to everyone who’s going to Tanunda
Great location for visiting the Barossa region, 5mis walking distance into Tanunda. Lovely quiet location
Beautiful house with excellent amenities.  Location is fabulous.
Great spot, great value, lovely little place to stay will stay again

Cathy is an outstanding host - great communication and looking after all the little things you need for a stay in the Barossa. Plenty of space for a family or two, or perfect for a couple like us. Close to everything this wonderful area has to offer - the use of the bikes was fantastic! A great place to stay - highly recommended!
We loved staying at your place and will use it as a base again when we are in the Barossa.
Comfortable well equipped house with great backyard and outdoor activities in a quiet street close to the main street

This house is set amongst some beautiful rose gardens. There was ample room for us and the big open kitchen suited our family dining perfectly. Games and a pool room for the children and a short stroll to town! Had a great stay.
A stylish,  and exceptionally presented place, with all mod cons. Definitely recommend if in the Barossa.

Great location and home is beautifully presented. Only 1 toilet but it’s separate to bathroom so we managed. Had 3 nights in Tanunda and could habe easily done more. Comfy home. Great laundry which is essential when traveling.
A great place to stay and a short stroll to nice restaurants.

A beautiful home in a great location. It was easy enough to walk down the main street when we chose to and close enough to drive to surrounding towns. The house had everything we needed to be comfortable like it was our own home. The provision of tea, coffee and toiletries was a lovely touch, as were the books, puzzles and kids toys. The backyard was a nice area for the kids to play too. I would definitely be happy to stay here again, or recommend this place to family and friends. Cathy was the perfect host, ensuring everything was just right for our stay.
Lovely, comfortable house in a great location. Very clean with a nice garden. Good value for money.
Beautiful home in a great location. The highlight was Cathy’s great communication and recommendations thank you
Superb, affordable, comfy coaches and a great outdoors space to utilise.
Great little spot
Centrally located right in the heart of the beautiful Barossa. Lovely warm & comfortable space... home away from home

Groomsmen used this house for the duration of our wedding. The house was perfect with a great backyard and good soacea for entertaining. Was so close to the wedding venue with easy access to Tanunda and the rest of the Barossa.
Cathy’s place is great everything as described and pictured. She was very accommodating and communication was excellent.

Cathy is a helpful host and place is nice. Two great double rooms and bunk beds good for kids. Place was warm when we entered which is always nice when you get a chilly winters days in the Barossa. Plenty of towels, pillows and extra blankets if needed and I loved the electric blanket.  Lots of lovely wine glasses so you can enjoy a glass of vino in, also all the local recommendations were great.
Beautiful property close to town and great place for the family. We really enjoy the home and hope to come back again for more wine touring

Cathy's place was lovely and perfect for our long weekend in the Barossa. We could easily walk to the main street for coffee and dinner. The house was perfectly set up with everything we needed - a lovely backyard, comfy beds, wifi, Netflix.
We had a great stay at Cathy’s place.  Excellent communication and a great location to both town and the wineries.  Highly recommend.
It was a lovely space to have the children. Great location with all of Barossa at your doorstep.
What an incredible experience. Cathy's home is equipped with everything we could have needed and more. We will certainly be back.
Great little but spacious house in the Barossa area, quiet and peaceful, very modern facilities, great games room with pool table and darts and lovely sunny well kept gardens. A pleasure to stay at!
Nice and large place with a responsive host.

The house was everything we needed and more. Well appointed, clean, spacious and walking distance to town!  

A special thanks to Kathy, for looking after our every question, you made our trip that much easier. 

Thank you for a wonderful stay.
We’ll be back when visiting the Barossa... hopefully in the not too distant future.
Great place with excellent amenities and excellent location.
Excellent spot, short drive to town and presented as advertised.

Such a wonderful place to stay in Tanunda - walking distance to the main street (including grocery shop and cafes), and easy drive to wineries. The house and garden were lovely, and Cathy had great communication with us.
A lovely home with all amenities in a quiet location close to the main st.
Our stay was fantastic. Perfect location the explore everything that the Barossa offers. Nice and quite street close to town.
Great place, great location, very comfortable

Great location to use as a central base for exploring the Barossa and an easy stroll into the main street for many cafes, eating places, shops.  Well appointed and renovated cottage with a luxury kitchen and lovely gardens.  I particularly liked finding a place with a pool table!
nice little house on a quiet street near the shops in Tanunda. Cathy was a real help to us in organising our stay in the barossa.

The accommodation was conveniently located, walking distance from centre of Tanunda. The check in was so easy and all communication from Cathy was prompt and accurate. One night we cooked a BBQ and had a very relaxing time sitting in the garden. Highly recommended.

This place is great! Cathy is great with communication, very organised with all the tips and instructions for the house. It's very clean, well stocked amenities in the house and thoughtful touches added to the house. Pillows and doona (although we didn't need it with the 40 degrees temperature) were good quality. We also had fun with the table tennis and pool table. A bit disappointed we didn't get the chance to use the bike due to the high temperature. Hope to come back again..
fantastic location, clean and well appointed. Cathy is an awesome host!

Nice place which is a short walk to the centre of Tanunda. Good value compared to other places we look at and ideal for our week stay in the Barossa with our young family. Good activities on offer to keep older children entertained as well. Cathy was great host making sure everything was setup for our stay in advance and gave clear instructions on how to check-in and use appliances etc.

We had a fantastic stay! The house is located perfectly, walking distance to the center of Tanunda and great for exploring the Barossa. House has great amenities, including lovely glassware and the air-conditioning worked a treat and kept the whole house cool during the heat. Beds a little uncomfortable, but aside from this would definitely recommend.
Lovely place with all the essentials. Hosts were more than a pleasure to deal with. Thank you for letting us stay.

Cathy was quick to respond to messages. It was perfect for our group. We would definitely stay there again if it was available. 
Great location to visit the wineries. 
Thanks Cathy.
Lovely house, great space and garden with pool table and darts and in an ideal location but still nice and quiet
Very clean quiet large  house close to Tununda. Great value. Would stay there again.

Cathy’s place was the perfect base for our small group for a girls weekend in the Barossa. It was wonderfully clean, well laid out cottage with nice local bathroom supplies and coffee pods. Would suit up to 2 couples or a small family in the main part of the house. Loved the local tips and responsiveness of the host.  Keen to visit again!

We had a great stay at Cathy’s place! The home is very well equipped, there’s lots of information for in the home and out, it was clean, spacious and extremely comfortable and there was lovely outdoor space too. Cathy was also extremely friendly and quick to respond with all communication. I would definitely recommend this home.
Great location, clean place, exactly as described.

Had a great stay here at Cathy’s place. Very clean and comfortable . Seemless communication and check in / out. 

Tanundas Main Street restuarants Are only 12 mins walk the correct way and about half that up the disused railway track. 

Asian Ferment restaurant is an absolute bucket list experience for wine , food and service , wow !!!
Beautiful home, close to all amenities. Communication from Cathy was exceptional, I couldn't recommend any higher.

This house was perfect for a Barossa getaway. It is close to all the big Barossa wineries, and an excellent coffee spot is just around the corner. The communication from Cathy was also excellent and she was very accommodating to us when we requested an early check in. Super comfortable stay. Thanks Cathy!
Cathy’s place was incredibly clean and is in a great location for exploring the Barossa region. The garden is beautiful. Was perfect for our little ones too!

This place is a must if staying in Tanunda. Was just the best place to stay if you’re wanting to walk up the street for eating out. And was just wonderful for just hanging out with a few wines and the pool table or table tennis. 
Perfect for the family or a girls trip. And wonderful help from the host. 
Thanks again Cathy it was just perfect.
Amazing place, if you wanna unwind play some pool, kick back and just unwind
We had a lovely stay at Cathy’s place! Everything was in close proximity and the house was filled with everything we needed! Highly recommend!
This is a fabulous place with a renovated kitchen and bathroom and is only a couple of minutes from the centre of town.

Access is easy and plenty of helpful communication from Cathy before and during our stay. Location is walkable to bars and restaurants. We were there in winter and found the back half of the house (toilet, laundry & bunk room) very cold and difficult to heat. Didn’t even check out the games room or bikes as found ourselves snuggled in front of TV on nights we stayed in. Appreciated the free access to Netflix. Bedrooms and living areas cosy and comfortable. House is not as contemporary as appears in photos but done up nicely.
A great place to stay! We will return!

Great place in central location. Lots of info provided on wineries/restaurants to visit. It was really cold when we were there and the heating did struggle to heat the house. Lots of room and things for the kids.
Wouldn’t stay anywhere else if coming back to the Barossa Valley!
Excellent place to stay, close to wineries and with all the cooking necessities with the added bonus of a pool table, darts and table tennis table. Warm and cosy with excellent internet and TV.
Clean, neat and little extras that make the difference.
It was absolutely fantastic - very clean and the location was fantastic. Very good communication as well including tips on where to go

Absolutely wonderful place to stay! Cathy was so prompt in answering my questions and so so accommodating. She provided some wonderful local recommendations. The house was so central to the Barossa wineries around and a really convenient place to be. The place was clean, home-y, and the backyard was beautiful. Thank you for having us!

Cathy was a wonderful and communicative host. All communication were quickly responded to. 
The property was well above expectations, with the idealic location, fantastic house with exceptional back entertainment area and ping pong and pool that the kids  took advantage of.

Would highly recommend and we will look to book again!! A++++ rating
Great location, excellent communication and recommendation on places to visit nearby.
We found Cathy to be extremely polite and very obliging and the location very quiet and close to Main Street. Thanks Cathy

We cannot rate our stay at Cathy and Carol’s place highly enough!!! The house and garden are immaculate and beautiful.  The location is great, easy walking distance to shops and in a quiet street. The little touches (especially the the kids toys, books, cutlery etc.) went above and beyond and enabled us to relax and enjoy our stay even more. The local tips and  recommendations were much appreciated. Thanks so much!
Cathy's place was stylish, clean and had lots of special touches. We loved our stay at Cathy's cottage and our weekend in the Barossa.
Wonderful place for a family to stay. Kids bunks and lots of lovely books. Beautiful garden and perfectly positioned within 2 mins of everything! Highly recommend this lovely place.
Excellent location and communication. Check in was incredibly easy and the house was as described
Cathys place was wonderful. Its clean, spacious and fully equipped for everything you might need during your stay. Loved the big backyard and the games room

Great cottage for a family or two couples with kids. Beautiful yard and gardens for kids to play in, close to everything in Tanunda, and beautifully furnished and appointed. We would definitely stay here again on our next trip to the Barossa.

Helpful friendly service. 
Regards
Ben
Clean, neat and tidy place in a great location. Cathy is a great host who is organised and very helpful.

We enjoyed our stay in this very comfortable home.  The additional activities for the children including games, jigsaws, pool table, dart board and bikes were an added bonus.  My family can recommend this lovely home for your stay in the Barossa Valley.

Great location, clean and comfy, nice garden spaces, lots of extras for entertainment in case winery  touring isn't your thing. Pack your own cheese board, or better still, grab a new one at Wohlers in the main street!

This was a lovely place to stay while my family and I visited the Barossa Valley. This house is perfectly located close to everything making exploring the region very easy. Cathy was able to provide some tips for local places to visit which proved a hit. The house was very clean and tidy and the board games provided kept us entertained for the night. I highly recommend Cathy’s place for anyone looking to stay in the Barossa Valley.
Nice and easy access to the main street of Tanunda. Good space for two couples.
Fabulous location with great local information provided. Perfect for a summer/spring break.

What a house! We loved every aspect. Check in was easy with the code on the door. The house is well stocked with anything you would want for basic cooking, and we were able to make our own breakfast and coffee daily an eat on the patio outside. The beds have different firmness levels so you can pick the one that suits you best. We enjoyed playing pool and ping pong in the early evening.  And did I mention the bathtub?!? The neighborhood is very quiet and we slept well. There are a/c units if needed; the first night was chilly and there were extra blankets in the closet, and the next day was 94 Fahrenheit and we were able to use the a/c to keep us comfortable. We got amazing suggestions of things to do and places to go when we arrived, and all the good stuff in the Barossa is within a 15-20 minute drive.  We would absolutely stay here again.

We loved staying here. It's so close to everything, and has a beautiful garden/outdoor space for down time between trips to wineries. It also cost us the same to stay here in a spacious and comfortable house as it did for our friends to stay in a cabin at the caravan park. We'll stay here again.

This place was perfect for our overnight getaway to the Barossa.
Comfy beds, coffee pod machine, lovely wine glasses to enjoy the day’s booty!
Beautiful backyard complete with table tennis table - lots of games and cards at the house, too.
Cathy was fantastic and clear in her communication - she even offered us potential early check in and late check out! Highly recommend!
Great location, neat and tidy. Included everything we needed. Soft bed in main room. Firmer bed in the other double room. Very nice!
Central location, easy access and stylish, clean house, beautiful garden!!
