Generous breakfast provisions had been left and Kate let us arrive early which particularly nice as we were travelling with my elderly parents who struggle with a full day out and about. 
The house is very well located and well equipped. We had 4 extended family members visit for lunch and there was ample crockery and glassware for a group of 8. 
The bedrooms are large, the beds are comfy and we even baked scones for our guests in the country kitchen. 
Highly recommended!

Pembury Cottage is a well appointed home with gorgeous rooms. A short stroll into town for coffee and delicious food options, the location is perfect. Would definitely recommend a wine tour with Jonathan as well!
Beautiful historic building walking distance to everything that Angaston has to offer. Highly recommended.
We had a wonderful stay, the house was perfect for three couples. Highly recommend doing the winery tour with Jonathan, it was a fantastic day!

Pembury Cottage is so sweet. We loved the location, right in the Main Street of Angaston. 
It was just immaculate and had the perfect spaces for our group of 6. The beds were huge and so comfortable & linen spotless. 
The air conditioning heat pumps in all rooms were a bonus with temperatures 45degrees on one of the day’s we were there.
A fantastic wee village to stay in while visiting the Barossa, wouldn’t consider  staying anywhere else. Angaston has the perfect quaint feel of being in the Barossa that we were looking for. We even drove to the Clare valley for the day, only an hour away and it was sensational.
We didn’t cook while we were at the cottage as there were pubs and restaurants just down the road 3min walk. There were all the bits in the pantry left for visitors to use if they did cook.
We even discovered the local gym who invited us in one morning for only $10p/p. Clair was the gym manager. Fabulous lady. Awesome facilities also.
Breakfast cereals, milk and a welcome fresh loaf of bread was a grateful bonus.
I would highly recommend you staying at Pembury Cottage to anyone wishing to have a perfect space in a stunning piece of South Australia. Only 1hr from Adelaide CBD.
Thank you for your Barossa hospitality.

Jonathan and Kate’s house was the perfect BnB for our weekend trip away to the Barossa. Conveniently located on the main drag of Angaston, access to all the best wineries and eateries is available by private car or taxis. An added bonus is the pet friendliness and we visited with three dogs. The setup was perfect and our dogs (a cavoodle and two dachshunds) were safe and sound whilst we went winery hopping! The house itself is stunning and very comfortable. Highly recommended!
Excellent location. Definitely try the thai restaurant 2 minutes down the road. Also the roaring 40s cafe for excellent pizza. Great hosts with excellent communication!

We really enjoyed our stay at Penbury cottage - it is very well appointed and extremely comfortable - convenient in the Main Street of Angaston- and has everything to make for a wonderful stay. We always appreciate high quality accommodation that is also dog friendly.
Excellent stay at Pembury Cottage ... we loved it!

This place is amazing. Anyone looking to come to the Barossa valley should consider staying at Pembury Cottage. It's in a perfect spot in Angaston, and 10 minutes to two of the other main little towns. Jonathon and Kate were extremely accommodating, and the property had everything we could have wanted or needed for our trip. Thanks again! Will be back for sure.
Beautiful cottage! Will be staying again!
Accommodating hosts, clean house, pet friendly, central location. A great choice when staying in the Barossa.

Jonathan and Kate are excellent at communicating in a timely way. We booked to stay 2 nights only to wake on the day of check in to find the border with NSW had closed due to COVID 19 and we could no longer travel. Jonathan and Kate have been excellent in assisting us with Air bnb ! We can’t wait to actually get there.

Pembury Cottage is a great sized property, beautiful decorated with comfy living spaces and beds.  The house was warmed nicely for our arrival with supplies to start the fire and enjoy our stay.  Conveniently located in the Barossa, walking distance to cafes and restaurants and the local supermarket.  Only 10 mins to larger towns of Nuri and Tanunda.  Highly recommend taking advantage of discounted private wine tour if you stay at the property - we've done quite a few and this was a standout!

We really enjoyed our stay in Pemberton Cottage. The decor was lovely, excellent location with lots of thoughtful touches, e.g breakfast provisions and even a welcoming port!  The bedrooms were stylishly decorated and the beds extremely comfortable. Would love to stay there again.  Thank you so much.

My family and I absolutely loved our stay in this cosy cottage. It was so suitable for 3 couples, the beds were super comfy, it was in walking distance of everything in Angaston as well as the farmers market. 
Even though it was the middle of winter, it was warm and very comfortable. It was also the perfect space for our little French bulldog to run around outside as well. Kate and Jonathon were very responsive and welcoming. Would highly recommend

Very comfortable cottage with everything you could want to make your stay comfortable. Great location to explore from. Easy walking to great Thai restaurant, plus many more food and wine options. Nice walking tracks  nearby. We found the locals friendly and felt very comfortable. I would highly recommend this stay.

Great location, comfortable beds and nice to laze in front of the fire on a comfy couch. Very nice to be able to take our fur baby with us. Thanks Johnathon and Kate for your hospitality:)
Gary and Kylie:)

Very cute cottage and walking distance to all the cafes and other eateries, supermarket etc. Also close to lots of wineries.  Hosts are fabulous and respond to any queries immediately and offer the extra little things in the bathroom and kitchen with breakfast Supplies, coffee etc. We really enjoyed our stay
So nice we’ve stayed twice!
Amazing cottage, amazing location, amazing hosts!
Lovely little spot, great location. Very comfortable beds and very homey feel. Great for a getaway, thanks again

Great for place for family stay. 

Close to all locations.  Good cafes and bakeries. 

Large bedrooms with comfortable beds. Very clean and well furnished.

We had a wonderful little stay at Pembury Cottage. It has absolutely everything you need and right on the Main Street of Angaston. 
Very clean.
Jonathan and Kate were super lovely and helpful.

Jonathan and Kate were great hosts, they made sure we had any information we needed prior to arrival.  Great communication at all times. 

The cottage was very spacious and beautifully set up.  We felt like we were at home and could really get a proper rest.  Great location near to places to eat and get groceries if you want to cook in the kitchen (which by the way has a fantastic gas stove!). Basic breakfast also provided, and wood for the fire which is perfect after a long day of wine tasting!! 

Overall, I’d definitely recommend staying here and will come back In the future!
a beautiful house, perfect for the family and a sanctuary for the dog
Amazing cottage walking distance to restaurants and shops in Angaston. Short drive to Barossa Wineries. Beautiful finishings, comfortable beds, will definitely be back!

Pembury cottage is a very clean and bright living space. The fireplace and big TV in the lounge room are great to come back to after a visit to one of the many nearby wineries or restaurants.
The location couldn't be better,  at the quiet end of the main strip of Angaston.

King beds and bedding are beautiful. 
Bathroom not ideal, especially with children. Quite underwhelming with no vanity or shower screen, everything gets wet in the bathroom including the toilet. 
Location is excellent and off street parking also great. 
Not open plan at all.

As a group of four friends we had a great time staying here. The house is in a great location for exploring the Barossa. It was homely, clean and had everything we needed for our stay. We particularly enjoyed our wine tour with Jonathan. Thank you!
Very comfortable house in the loveliest town in the Barossa.  Well located on the main st.  Plenty of room for 3 couples.  Generously provided for - towels, kitchen, pillows etc
Perfect place for a weekend getaway, super convenient for travelling to surrounding wineries and restaurants!

Jonathan and Kate's place is in a perfect location and is such a beautiful home, we had a very relaxing time. Very spacious, great comfortable bedrooms and lounge room each with heating/cooling. We loved our stay and very much appreciated the thoughtful details of having coffee, milk, muesli and wonderful shower products provided. We would absolutely come back to this beautiful home.
We had a really nice stay in Angaston while at Pembury Cottage. The house is great and presented beautifully. We hope to be back again soon.

We had a fantastic stay at this cottage along the main street of Angaston. easy walking distance from shops, cafes, restaurants etc. We also had our pup with us that loved the big and secure backyard. Everything was easy and convenient staying here which made for a stress free vacation.
If you are looking for a 'home' away from home Dnt look any further , Kyms place is all you need to still feel at home only difference is you are nestled in the Barossa amongst wineries cheers

Our stay at the Sanctuary in Nurioopta was very pleasant, the house was as described, and the home was very clean and very roomy.  It was well situated to tour the surrounding wineries and other beautiful townships in the stunning Barossa area. Shops and supermarkets were a short drive away.

Kyms place is just delightful! A beautifully appointed property in a very quiet spot. Just a short drive to all that both Nuriootpa and Tanunda have to offer.

Spacious bedrooms and wonderful kitchen facilities, comfortable and stylish living and dining areas. If you’re considering a stay in the Barossa this is the perfect spot!

Thank you for a lovely stay.
Great house and the perfect size for 3 couples to share for a weekend. A little bit out of Nuriootpa to walk but a quick drive away from all the attractions. Would stay again!

A beautiful home away from home
All six of us (three couples) had a wonderful four-nights stay here. It was clean, comfortable, well appointed and inviting. A lovely place to bring your family and relax while enjoying the beautiful Barossa Valley.
No complaints - what we saw in the pictures and the descriptions was exactly what we got; check-in & check-out process was easy; and interactions were always courteous, timely and efficient. Thank you Kym.
Beautifully appointed house, super comfy beds, super central location to explore the Barossa valley. Everything was clean and with all the little touches to make it feel really special. Thank you!
Absolutely loved this place. Very clean and fresh, very homely
Very clean and tidy !!
One of the most memorable places we have stayed . Absolute delight in every sense of the wor (Website hidden by Airbnb) MUST include on your way to the Barossa
Had an awesome stay. Loved the house, had great hospitality, and it was great to he so close to Mt Crawford.

We really enjoyed our stay here. Nestled away but still convienently close the house is charming and spacious and surrounded by a beautiful, peaceful farm setting. Super comfy beds, a warm fire place, and a spa bath makes it hard to leave.

Laura's hospitality and quick responses were outstanding.
And then the house and location itself was immaculate, if you love the concept of somewhere to get away from the stress this place is perfect for you.
Absolutely nothing negative to say! It was a delight.
Great house, calm and relaxed, exactly what we were after
This place is an absolute gem! Laura's hospitality was fantastic. Could not recommend more!

Beauchamps is a lovely old farm homestead in gorgeous surroundings.    

It's had the bathrooms upgraded to luxury style, with while & black tiles, chrome fittings & spa.

We had a wonderful relaxing stay.

The only thing to be aware of is that the overall presentation is more "take us as you find us"  than "every detail seen to".     If you're relaxed about that you'll have a great stay.

Such a beautiful house on a beautiful property! Was the perfect peacefulness I was looking for when going away for the weekend! 

Large rooms, 3 large bathrooms, fireplace and pizza oven... I really couldn’t have imagine anything better
Great place to stay with other couples. Very quiet country living, comfortable beds with the Barossa region a short drive away.
Great and beautiful place to stay if you are looking for a peaceful and relax get away. House was very clean.
A beautiful peaceful setting.  A lovely old farmhouse, beautifully decorated and well stocked with the essentials.  Very clean and a great place to get away and relax.

We really enjoyed our stay in this house. It was fully equipped with everything you could ask for. Perfect for a family or two couples for a longer stay, in the center of the beautiful Barossa. A quite and calm area. We would certainly stay here again when returning some day.

We were thrilled with how spacious and well appointed Teagan's home was. We could not fault a thing. We loved all the little extras like the coffee machine and the soda stream. We were made to feel very comfortable and would not hesitate in staying there again next time we visit the Barossa Valley.

Fantastic place to stay for couples enjoying a weekend away together. The house was perfect, had lovely finishing touches and was beautifully clean. We had the perfect relaxing weekend. Great communication. Thanks for a wonderful weekend!

We had a wonderful stay with Teagan at the Langmeil estate house. We were close to the local attractions and could walk to one of my all time favourite wineries- Peter Lehmann!  The outdoor space was great for dinner and breakfast. The house and service were exceptional and the whole family enjoyed it. Thank you for a fantastic stay.
The host canceled this reservation 275 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Great location great home and great host!!
A really nice home away from home - close to the main attractions. Loved the little touches and communication was amazing.
Teagan was very quick to respond and we had a great stay in tanunda!
Teagan’s home provided a wonderful base for our weekend in the Barossa. It was very clean, is spacious, and is equipped with several luxury features. This house is very good value for the cost.
A stunning home with everything you need for a comfortable stay! Tanunda is a lovely village and the town centre is a short drive away.
My friends and I love our stay at Teagan’s place, it was spacious, clean and stylish.

This place was perfect for what we needed. It had lots of space and good size rooms. It was well presented, clean and tidy. Teagan was very accommodating allowing us to check in earlier than the stated time.
Very well maintained property with large living areas and kitchen.

Teagan place is well situated in Tanunda. Her facility are next to none. Cleanliness couldn’t not fault. The little extras of crockery pots & pans glasses selection fantastic. Haven’t seen such a selection at any place we have stayed before. A full size fridge is always very useful with a group. 5 stars well deserved.

Very spacious living and bedroom areas. The outdoor area looked great but due to bad weather we couldn't take advantage of it. 
The place is well appointed with everything you need. A great home away from home. We would easily stay again, and for longer. We enjoyed our stay ( 9th to 13th May)

Teagan's place was beautiful and perfect for 3 girls having a weekend in the Barossa. We were walking distance to some wineries and also a local bakery for morning coffees. Everything else as supermarket, local town and wineries were closeby.
The house itself was spacious and clean with great amenities (including central heating and electric blankets)! I would definitely recommend this house to others.
Really super accommodation! Roomy well designed space offering lots of privacy between guests and super amenities, all in a lovely local neighborhood. Highly recommend!!!

Beautiful house, great living areas inside and out.
Bedrooms nice, house has two bathrooms - perfect for two couples on a weekend get away.
Wonderful place to stay. Close to everything and clean and tidy.
A lovely little house and the perfect base to explore the Barossa Valley. Spacious layout and multiple living areas.
The host canceled this reservation 58 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Home away from home with everything that you need to have an enjoyable holiday.
Good location in quiet neighbourhood. Large house , suitable 6 guests
Loved this house! Was great having a second tv room for the kids. Lovely spa bath and everything you need for a home away from home. Beds are comfortable and appreciated the central heating.
Great place, perfect location! Definitely would stay here again!
The host canceled this reservation 32 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Awesome location. Close to Main Street and lots of wineries close by. House was nice and big and very clean. Would definitely stay here again

Teagan’s home is in a lovely area, full of blooming roses, near to everything in Barossa.  Check-in was easy and there was excellent communication with the home owner.  The home was very clean,  furnished well, and the amenities were nice.  The home has three large bedrooms and two baths.  Beds were comfortable and the area is very quiet at night.  There is are two living room areas with televisions. There is a large covered patio area to be enjoyed in the mornings with coffee or for the evening meal.  You are close enough to walk to the Main Street in Tanunda for coffee or breakfast.  The kitchen has everything you need for preparing meals.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely book again.
This is a fantastic space for a few couples or a family. The location is perfect for exploring the Barossa valley vineyards. The house had everything you need!
Great space, great location lots of space. Ideal base for exploring the Barossa. Will book again for sure
Great home away from home.
Lovely House in such a  quiet location, House is well appointed and all the beds were very comfortable. Everything was perfectly clean and beautifully presentated. Thanks
great house

Fabulous, spacious house in a quiet neighbourhood, walking distance to bakery shop and vines. Very nice kitchen with however some missing items  such as ovengloves. And when there is only a Nespresso coffee make some capsules as a gesture would be classy in such a classy villa.

Great place to stay - very good location. Only a few minutes drive to most major wineries. 

Fast responses and accommodated an early check in which was incredibly helpful. 

Thanks so much!
very nice and very quiet
Amazing house, great location! Had a wonderful stay :)
Perfect place to enjoy Barossa! As described !
Lovely house, great location!
Accommodation was awesome, very quiet area with everything could possibly need.  Would definitely use if needed again.
spacious house in a great location.
Very a nice house and very clean, comfortable, highly recommend
Comfortable home, close to shops, cleanliness.
Thanks for great accommodation would recommend to anyone and hopefully can stay again.

Great spot in a quiet location. 
We stayed here for 3 nights and really enjoyed the place.
Good space for two couples. Lots of room both inside and out. Recommend as a base for 1-3 couples to explore the wine valleys.
A great space to stay with lots of space in and outside the house. Not far from the Main Street and set back in a quiet area.

The home was presented absolutely immaculately, vast amounts of room and common spaces for conversing, eating and making memories. In the heart of region, it makes a great base camp for trips out to the valley and as a base camp it's a warm and welcoming return. Highly recommended.

Teagan’s home was perfect for us! Very central to all of the wineries and close to the town centre too. There were 6 of us that stayed and we all had plenty of space. The house was clean and was great for our little weekend away in the Barossa. Thank you again for having us Teagan.
Great modern home, easy drive to most of the Barossa’s attractions.
Great overall value place. Big, spacious and close enough to some of the wineries you can walk
Well located, very clean and spacious. Everything you need. Thanks for a lovely stay.

Reagan’s Airbnb is highly recommended. It lived up to all of our expectations and comfortably accommodated our extended family. The location is quiet, centrally located in the Barossa Valley and well equipped.
Fabulous place, really close to the town and surrounding wine regions, only downside was the hot water didn’t last long, although that could just be a house full of females - long showers galore

Very spacious Airbnb with great kitchen and 2 living areas which was great. The ducted heating was awesome. Location impeccable.

The not so good things: small couches in each living area. The house fits 6 people, but 4 of us struggled to fit in on of the couches. A couple of chairs or another 2 seater in the living room would have been great.

The bed in the room at the back of the house was horrendous!! I ended up sleeping on the couch which was much more comfortable.

The place had a feel of stinginess about it - e.g. only 1 toilet paper roll in the bathroom, no paper towel in the kitchen and only 1 tea towel, very few coffee pods (lucky we brought our own!!!), only 1 bedside table in each of the spare rooms (not master bedroom), no bedside lamps, very scratchy old towels. It’s really not hard to invest a small amount in some nice finishing touches to leave a much better impression!

Overall it was ok for a short stay.
Great location

A really nice roomy home in a great location! Walking distance to some wineries and town. It would have been nice to have a bit of extra touches like breakfast stuff and some wine and cheese but that wasn't advertised so I didn't expect it but it would make this a super stay! As it is, you can't go wrong.

Teagan’s house is in a quiet suburban location within easy driving distance of everything the Barossa has to offer. The house is spacious and comfortably accommodated the 3 couples for our 3 night stay in Tanunda.
The home is large, clean and had all we needed for a great stay.
Clean, spacious house in a great location. We had a great stay!
Great location, quiet area and nice size home with a few extra supplies in the pantry.
Excellent house to relax and enjoy the comforts of a home.  Large space both indoor and out so you wouldn't be on each other's toes. Excellent house to use as a base for ther barossa.
A spacious and spotless home perfectly located for enjoying the wonders of the Barossa. We had a very enjoyable stay and would recommend!
Great place, nice size and clean
Fantastic base to visit the Barossa, well kept modern house, well hosted and everything you need, would happily stay again, Tom
A well laid out house that is neat, tidy and easy to access. A home away from home.
Beautiful house in stunning location - walking distance from beautiful vineyards

Pauline has an amazing place. Extremely spacious, we had 3 couples there and found it perfect for our weekend away in Tanunda. It's super accessible for the to main strip and also the surrounding wine region. Highly recommend and would certainly stay again.
Very spacious home in a beautiful neighbourhood. Well catered for a large group with 2 separate living areas & extra parking space. Thanks for having us!

Lovely spacious and well appointed house! Great amenities with thoughtful touches like a complimentary bottle of wine. 
Host was very responsive to some minor issue.
Overall a great location and lovely property.
Absolutely perfect house and a brilliant location. Close to everything
Beautiful house, clean and great location!
Liked the cleanliness inside home. Thoughtful gestures from the host

This is a great place, its spacious and clean. The neighborhood 
is very quiet and lovely as well. You are in short distance to wineries which is a visit you wont regret. There was a plethora of ammenities you could use, including a bluetooth speaker and xbox. Will recommend this place to anyone
Great location near numerous wineries and just off the Main Street of Tanunda! A nice spacious house and very clean. Very happy with our stay

Clean, spacious and in the perfect location for us to explore the Barossa.

Very accommodating, great amenities, beautiful and clean. Highly recommended!
Pauline was easy to contact when we needed assistance. Beautiful spacious and clean home to stay in. Good spot near the Barossa wineries, and Tanunda bakery just around the corner. Would recommend.
Perfect modern house in the town of tanunda. Great for a central point to go visit all the near by wineries. Host is also very quick to reply and accommodating.

This was a lovely house in a great location for the Barossa valley.
We all had a great time, thank you!
Great stay. Great communication from Pauline and loved the location of the house. Walking distance to some lovely cellar doors in Barossa. Cheers!
A perfect house for a relaxing getaway. Lovely host, excellent central location. Great value for money.

Pauline’s house was wonderful. Great value for money and the location is close to an abundance of wineries and local restaurants, which is perfect for a trip to the Barossa. Pauline provided lots of amenities to make the stay more comfortable, was very easy to contact and made our stay very welcoming and homely. Will definitely be returning!
Great central location roomy and comfortable pity it was winter as sitting out side to a bbq would have topped it off
Wonderfully cosy home that exceeds expectations. We enjoyed our weekend retreat thoroughly and would love to come back again.
Pauline's house is superb. Sparkling clean, centrally located and with some lovely extra touches. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would love to visit again.

great facilities and  location

Great accommodation close to town and in walking distance of a few wineries.
Clean, spacious, beautiful and in a great location! Would recommend!!

A very enjoyable stay. It was great to be left some supplies to get us started with a bottle of local wine. Found it easy to communicate  and collect keys etc which was really appreciated. The house was clean and tidy, lots of space with good heating/air conditioning.

A wonderful clean, spacious house that is ideal for families & perfectly located. We made use of the outdoor space too. There were thoughtful touches. Pauline was a fabulous host, easy to contact and communicate with and prompt to reply to      questions. Our stay was value for money, truly delightful & I would highly recommend this place.
Pauline’s home was very clean and well presented. The rooms were stylish and comfortable. The kitchen had everything needed for either a long or short stay. We especially loved the coffee machine!

Pauline was a lovely host and always responded promptly to any of my questions. The house was clean, well catered for and very comfortable. Easy check in & out. We were a group of 6 mums and found the house perfect for friends staying together.
This property surpassed our expectations and it is so well appointed.
Lovely home with everything you need, great for families , in quiet street , very well presented

Our family enjoyed our stay here. The house is clean and tidy. Bedding and towels were very comfortable. 

The house is fully equipped. 

Perfect for a family stay as the house is very spacious.

Pauline's place is very roomy, lots of light from the morning and afternoon sun. 3 bedrooms with decent space, bathrooms pretty big (except the showers) but that's how they used to get built. Kitchen was stocked with plenty of cockery and utensils, didn't have any issues finding anything. 
Master bedroom was the biggest room with lots of wardrobe space. Beds were a bit firmer than we're used to but I find that with most places I stay at. 
Home was in a quiet neighbourhood and walking distance to a few wineries on para road and the Tanunda Bakery. 
Overall very happy with our stay and would stay again.
Great spacious house, great location
Beautiful home wonderfully presented!

Pauline was an awesome host- the house was immaculately presented and had everything we needed to make our stay comfortable and easy. The house is very well located, so close to many beautiful cellar doors. Thanks again!

this was a wonderfulplace to stay over Christmas with the family. Pauline is a wonderful host. The house was beautiful,  comfortable huge and homely and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Would highly recommend a stay here. Thankyou Pauline for allowing us to stay in your home
This houses is very modern and spacious. Very clean and close to wineries and cafes. Very enjoyable and hospitable. Highly recommend
Pauline's place is immaculate, clean and sizable. Location is good and close to town. We only spent 2 nights but wish we could have stayed longer.
Great location for visiting wineries around Barossa Valley. House is big and was super clean when we arrived

A beautiful and really well equipped house. Situated perfectly to enjoy the best Tanunda has to offer. Pauline was such a lovely host and really easy to communicate with. A great place to stay if you want to explore the barossa some more

A fantastic place to stay for a family or one, two or three couples.
Excellent location, well-equipped, comfortable and great indoor and outdoor living spaces.

Such a great spot to stay while exploring the Barossa!! Comfortable and clean with a lovely garden and so close to everything. A special touch was the goodies provided for making your own breakfast! Eggs and bacon and even a bottle of wine!! Great value!!
Great place small place to stay in. Great location.
Awesome time in Barossa, best place to stay!

Amazing cottage perfectly located to explore Tanunda by foot and the beautiful Barossa with short drives. Spacious cottage for the two of us, very clean and exactly as described. We loved the local produce provided for a nice breakfast cook up. Thanks for an amazing stay!
Beautiful place, very cosy and convenient

Loved Goat Square Cottages. Everything we needed for two people and a lovely wood fire if it is cold. Bonus washing machine and clothes line if you need it and lovely provisions stocked for your arrival. 5 minutes walk to the Main Street and easy drive to most of the Barossa’s iconic cellar doors. Ngaire always on hand if you have any issues. Happy to recommend.
Excellent heritage accommodation in a very convenient location. We were provided with very delicious provisions. Had a wonderful weekend in the Barossa.
Very comfortable accommodation in a lovely historic property close to the centre of town.
Great accomodation and location!

A lovely house to stay moments to everything in Tanunda. Centrally located to everything in the Barossa

Thoughtful touches included fresh eggs and bacon for breakfast, fruit juice and loaf of bread

Thanks for a great stay!
Fantastic cottage with modern amenities close to the Main Street of Tanunda.
Lovely cute accommodation with all the amenities. Underfloor heating appreciated in winter
Incredible place to stay! Couldn’t ask for a better location
Beautiful space. We were well looked after in regards to supplies and amenities. Special old building with so much character.
Gorgeous cottage, all the historical charm with the convenience of being perfectly situated just off the main street. Stocked with the best local produce, a fabulous getaway from city living

Can't fault this listing one bit. This Host clearly has years of hospitality experience and good to see this work so well through Airbnb. Our stay was much better than the photos provide. Definitely book!

The Hutch Hilton was the perfect getaway for our family vacation in the Barossa.  John and Jan went out of their way in welcoming us and showing us around the farm.  The rooms are neat and clean each with an ensuite bathroom and shower.  The common living area is well equipped with the kitchen necessities to prepare your own meals and enjoy each others company al fresco.  The vintage cellar door is rustic and charming filled with local farm prepared jams, jellies, and chutneys, not to mention their incredible wines.  Guests are able to buy local farm products to enjoy like their incredible lamb that we enjoyed.  Our hosts went to the trouble of supplying us with wonderful farm fresh eggs, local bacon, bread and milk, which was a wonderful treat. This historic setting is a true gem and anyone visiting is fortunate enough that the Angas family shares it with the public.  We can't say enough about this wonderful property and delightful hosts.

A wonderful setting - beautiful views, wonderful trees, fresh air and unique decor. Jan and John's hospitality was outstanding - could not have asked for more. Each of the four couples had an amazing long weekend - we were sad to leave.

Honestly, we didn't know what to expect when we booked - but the location was suitable for three couples who wanted to explore the Barossa. But our serendipitous booking turned out to be so much more than that.

John and Jan were delightful hosts - warm, welcoming, highly knowledgeable and always looking to help you with advice. The working farm has been in their family for many generations, and John gave us a tour of the property (stunning by the way) before a wine tasting of what they make on-site (some of the best we tried all weekend!). We were even fortunate enough to partake in a grape pressing for the next seasons wine bottling!

The living space/kitchen is an outdoor/open plan arrangement, but really added something special to our stay. And the occasional visit of the two farm dogs was always very welcome!

Without a doubt, we will be returning here in the years to come.
Thanks for an amazing weekend Jan and John!

Hutton Vale is a wonderful Barossa experience. The farm is beautiful with views over vineyards and paddocks filled with grazing sheep. The farm is just like a setting out of Country Style ! Grape vines trailing over rough stone walls,rusty sculptures surprising visitors everywhere you look. The accommodation is very comfortable with lovely bed linen, heating, electric blankets, fresh flowers and clean adequate ensuite bathrooms. Every evening we enjoyed a roaring wood fire  while relaxing in our "Glamping" kitchen/lounge shed. The sun streamed in every morning to make this area a cheery place for the breakfast gathering.
Our hosts were so hospitable and welcoming and there were many thoughtful touches around the place to make us feel special and well looked after.  Our evening lamb roast came from Hutton Vale and we also enjoyed a magnificent wine tasting afternoon on the property.
If you have a group of friends that all get along and love red wine ,log fires and relaxed country living I can highly recommend Hutton Vale for a stay.
What an amazing place to stay. Host was so accommodating. Place was perfect for our little family. Thankyou

Great place for a weekend get away with friends.  Each couple had their own ensuite which was fantastic.  Even though the outdoor kitchen is not well sealed from the elements and we were there on a  very cold weekend the fire kept us warm. The lamb we purchased and cooked ourselves was amazing.

Jan's place is a home away from home!
That comfy feeling you get when you sit by an open fire, or gather around a table to share a meal are waiting for you at this fabulous place.
Beautiful views, majestic gums, a place to relax unwind, a place to share with friends or family.
Jan and John are excellent hosts, we felt special, nothing was too much trouble!
Hutton Vale Farm is a great place to connect with your surroundings, experience our beautiful country side and be part of something truly special.

our family went away for two days just to get away for the school holidays. We were blown away by the views and the wonderful hosts. our children had a great time even though there was no TV. Thank you so much to Jan and family for being great hosts. Also their wines are amazing a must try when in the Barossa Valley.

Guests are free to roam a country property, both old-style and diverse in nature. We really felt relaxed, and free to come and go as we pleased. Lazing in the rustic lounge space with the log fire and games with the kids, no devices, local produce and a bottle of Barossa wine was a wonderful taste of a life once lived. Thanks Jan and John
What a lovely spot to relax with friends or family . Highly recommend.

We were 2 families staying at Hutton Vale with 5 children.  The children had a great time running around on the farm.  It’s a beautiful property close to everything the Barossa has to offer.  We enjoyed sitting by the fire at nighttime.

The Hilton Hutch is unique & fun Hutton Vale Farm is beautiful  - watch the sheep, chickens , ducks from the hutch - the farm life comings & goings & enjoy the beautiful serenity of this amazing property.

A beautiful peaceful country stay - the hutch is so much fun - well appointed with everything needed for a lovely break from city life.
The bedrooms are light , bright & comfortable & to have an en-suite each is fantastic !!
Love the Hilton Hutch - & the Angas Family are amazing hosts.

jan and her family made us feel very much at home, a chilled approach to life around the farm. rustic living with an epic view. very comfy beds, open fire and big family dining table. our group of 8 fitted in perfectly.  would highly recomend for any group of friends or family. great place and lovely hosts.

Hutton Vale Farm was one of the most beautiful and unique experiences our group has had. The property is stunning, the rustic set up is cosy and well-equipped, and Jan and John made us feel like part of the family. Of course there is also some delicious wines to drink and lamb to eat, and a few dogs to keep us company while star-gazing, which all added to the experience. We all adored our stay and can’t wait to come back.
Beautiful location to get away from it all and stare at the stars. A true Barossa experience.  Loved it.

We had a really amazing stay with Jan and Jon. We loved the rustic kitchen and the comfy beds and the hospitality was above and beyond... The location was perfect for the many wineries! Thanks so much and hope to see you again!
Great stay!

What a special place! Our group of three couples had a fantastic time and loved the friendliness and warmth of Jan and her family. The farm was beautiful and so lovely with  a fire at night to sit by and a full kitchen to be self sufficient. Location was also excellent with a short drive into town and easy location to the wineries of the Barossa. Would absolutely stay again!

John and Jan were inspiring hosts! Their insights and knowledge of the Barossa were so interesting. We ate fresh free range eggs and lamb from the farm and walked around the beautiful property to enjoy the scenery. The location was superb and we were close to all the top wineries. We will 100% recommend Hutton Vale Farm to our friends and family.
Great place! Really fun and well set up. Incredible views to wake up to.
Highly recommend Hutch Hilton for a group. Top blend of shared and private spaces with the added bonus of a bathroom for each room. The fireplace is amazing!

An amazing place to stay - my family came here to celebrate a special birthday and it was the perfect place. Warm fireplaces, beautiful farm views, delicious lamb roast with vegetables and fresh produce from the Barossa farmers markets, friendly farm dogs, comfortable rooms and hot showers. Jan and John were perfect hosts. We will love to return again soon ;)
Fantastic experience at this magnificent property.
Great place, comfy beds, beautiful view, friendly dogs, amazing lamb/chicken, warm cozy fire - would definitely come back

What a wonderful place in the heart of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Jan and John made us feel extremely welcome and their knowledge and passion for their  farm and community are evident. Be sure to have a wine tasting with John - an experience in itself. The venue is rustic, but exactly as described, and a wonderful place for a relaxed getaway. Can’t wait for our next visit.

Just fantastic people. Really enjoyed our 2 days at this place. Jan, John & Stuart really made us feel at home and were generous to a fault. Will come back and certainly highly recommend this place to anyone. 5 stars all around.

Jan & John’s farmstay will not disappoint - rustic elegance at its absolute finest. The whole experience was exactly what we were looking for in an escape from the big city. Waking up to sheep grazing in the field outside the bedroom door and seeing kangaroos at sunset was very special. The family dogs Alfie & Mac also made us feel like part of the family. Extremely warm, friendly dogs who were always nearby and ready for a pat or play (huge bonus for dog lovers like us!). The main kitchen/dining/living area is fit with everything you could need and is perfect for dinner parties by the fire. Making time to visit the Hutton Vale cellar (located right near the accomodation) for wine tasting is a must - beautiful wines which we enjoyed during our stay. Jan & John went above and beyond to make sure we had everything we needed. We are already planning our return.
Awesome hospitality, great place and location, highly recommended!
A special place providing so much relaxation
Great farm stay, sheep up to your front door, beautiful outlook across the paddocks, very unique experience. Well worth a visit
Lovely hosts in a beautiful spot with great wine, gorgeous pets and plenty of fun experiences. Would go again in a heartbeat

This was the most amazing and unique experience we had in the Barossa/Eden Valley.  Must do's are to do a wine tasting and tour and to buy some home grown lamb for dinner. 

The wine tasting and tour is intensely intimate and you get a real taste of the history and the realities of farming and growing wine grapes. As the family tells you their story you can't help but feel completely immersed in it.  

It will be a challenge to find another place that delivers the same level of hospitality and warmth that we experienced.

This place provides a very unique and relaxing atmosphere! 
The hosts are very responding and careful to details and communication.  
And I wish I was still there by the fire!

We had the most wonderful stay. Jan and John were so warm and welcoming. We absolutely loved the indoor fire place, electric blankets, beautiful view and the delicious lamb for dinner. They also provided us with the most incredible complimentary wine tasting experience! This was a once in a life time experience that we will always remember. They also allowed us to check out later which gave us a few extra hours to enjoy this beautiful space. All the the special touches made our experience so enjoyable and we cannot wait to return. Thank you so much!

We had such a great time at Hutton Vale farm! The accommodation is so quaint and rustic. The out buildings are lovely to wander around with a wine in hand. Be sure to order a lamb roast to cook and do the wine tasting with John. He is such a great host and the tasting room was the most gorgeous old room with so much history. We all loved it!
Awesome place to stay
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Hutton Vale Farm. We travelled as a group of friends and it was a relaxing stay. Jan and John were wonderful hosts. We especially enjoyed our wine tasting.
We loved our stay at the Hutch Hilton. Such lovely people. The place is full of character and the farm is absolutely stunning. Would highly recommend.

Lovely stay, and big enough for a family. And bang smack at the start of tununda
Super clean, everything you need.  So great for kids with the parks excellent jumping bag and water park.  Lovely to be in a spacious, clean and modern house but with the facilities of the park.
A good family park
Thanks for having us, great location, loved the coffee van and central location. Unfortunately we did t get to try out the water park but hopefully weather will be better next time!
Good location. Looked really good, but unfortunately beds were not very comfortable. Kitchen also not fully equipped (oil, salt/pepper, dishwash etc).

Wonderful home and location to spend time in the Barossa. Amenities were amazing and well above expectation. A lovely space to take the kids and enjoy time away to relax and enjoy.
Perfect place!
AMAZING....we had such a great time...highly recommend staying at this bnb...
Spacious, comfortable and superbly appointed, a great location and wonderful hosts.  Highly recommended. We will be back.

What an absolute gem of a place to stay. Heather was absolutely fantastic and provided much more than we expected, from a beautiful venue to loads of little niceties. This is the place to stay for anyone wanting to be close to the wineries and have a truly relaxing experience. Highly recommend it.

Barossa Inn was a fantastic place to stay during our visit to the region! We felt so much as home, the hostess so warm & welcoming, the house very spacious, very clean and comfortable, the kitchen so well & thoughtfully stocked for our entire stay, the office area well stacked with information about the area, the bedding & linen excellent,,, all in all, a wonderful & very central place to stay!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay it was home away from home very relaxing ... the extra touches of Easter Eggs was lovely...we enjoyed going up to the chickens in the morning to find eggs for breakfast...Keller Meister winery not far up the road was fantastic as a family stop with great platters of produce around the area and games for the children to play while enjoying the view and wine. A wonderful time was had by all.
Beautifully kept house. Some lovely touches. Lovely welcome by Heather. Everything you need and more. Highly recommend this place.

An outstanding accommodation in a first class position to explore the Barossa.
Heather was most generous with her breakfast (and other) provisions. Cannot recommend more highly. Thanks Heather.

This place is huge! You essentially get a whole cosy country home fitted out with all the creature comforts and a very well stocked kitchen complete with farm fresh eggs. The perfect home away from home :)
If you like heritage you should consider this. Heather is very thoughtful hostess.

We had an amazing stay! Heather, the host, was super friendly and super accommodating. Hooked us up with a bottle of wine and food in the fridge in the pantry. Amazing house - heaps of history and very spacious, yet very cosy. The beds were very very comfortable! The fireplace was all prepared for us on arrival.  Loved every minute of our time there and will definitely be recommending to our family and friends. 10 out of 10!
This house is so cozy and comfortable and truely a delight to stay in. I highly recommend this property to anyone who wants a truely relaxing experience x

By far and away the best Air BnB experience we have had across Australia,  Europe and the US! The house is superbly located and the presentation is beyond amazing from the fully stocked kitchen and pantry to the fire being set and comprehensive instructions and tips. Communication fantastic. Very, very highly recommended.

Being brought up in SA but now living in Tassie I hadn't realised how much I loved waking up to the sound of Magpies warbling. A lovely, welcoming space with lots of thoughtful touches that made the stay very relaxing and memorable. Fresh farm eggs were such a lure that we cancelled going out for dinner and enjoyed them for dinner instead. Thanks Heather. If anyone is coming to do a Barossa visit from Tassie I'll pass on your details. Leanne

Heather Bitter was super Sweet!!! Best air bnb stat we’ve had. Heather was waiting to meet us and we immediately felt at home. The house was amazing, beds so comfy and the fire was beautiful! Thank you so much!
We loved our stay at Heather's house in Lyndoch.  Her home grown provisions and hospitality blew us away; as did her DVD collection!!  Thanks again Heather.

Heathers place was amazing!! Perfect location, perfect host and an all around comfortable and pleasant stay. Heathers place has a great history and is decorated beautifully.

Lovely old half house, part of a historic bakery. Lyndoch a pleasant small town, with quite a few historic buildings. Easy access to the Barossa. I can recommend the ballooning.
Great stop in the Barossa. We loved the old style and traditional features. Would highly recommend.

Heather and Gordon provide a very comfortable authentic cottage experience.  They provide lots of extra touches and the kitchen is very well appointed. The addition of breakfast items, plenty of condiments if you wish to cook were  well received as was the extensive DVD collection, library  and games cupboard.  A wonderful place to escape and relax .

Beautifully presented house that was very well thought out. Heather has everything available for a comfortable stay. From coffee machine to comfortable beds & beautiful books. Great night sleep in a quiet location was also a fabulous luxury

Super clean, super organised. 
A delightful little home away from home
we had a lovely stay and loved the personal touches. Heather was very welcoming and thoughtful!

We had a lovely stay here. Heather was really responsive and the hospitality and space was great.
The old bakery is stunning, spotlessly clean and very thoughtful touches and provisions. It was a privilege to spend a night here and I would recommend to anyone and everyone.
We had a fantastic stay. The home was so spacious and had beautiful touches. Great hub for exploring the region with a young family.
Heather's place is conveniently located for a weekend away in the Barossa. She was very friendly and her place is charming and very clean.

The experience was surprisingly amazing because we weren’t expecting anything too great for such a cheap price but it turned out to be one of the best places we have  ever spent our night at. The kitchen has everything you need for cooking, some drinks and food materials were even provided like eggs, milk, cereal and etc. The decoration of the entire place looks amazing, especially the living room. Definitely recommended :)
Wonderful home filled with history. Great location and close to town.    The home has everything you might need & presentation & respect to the character of the home is wonderful. Highly recommend
Such a welcoming host with great touches that make you feel at home brilliant all around
We had a perfect getaway . A lovely place to stay
Lovely place to stay ... given current covid restrictions call ahead as limited places to eat as we had to try 2 before we got in
Lovely place. Very homely and awesome antique decor. Thoughtful touches everywhere to make the stay very comfortable. Excellent position, easy to find and a great spot to explore from.

The experience and stay at the home was warm and welcoming. The house was sparkling clean and the little touches around the home made you feel like you were staying with family. The home had everything you needed and more and would definitely be perfect for a short - long stay.  We will be back. Danielle
A spacious place to stay central to many Barossa attractions. Toasty warm in the sitting room with heater on in winter and a lovely outdoor undercover space.
Such a beautiful property in a perfect location. Soo many personal touches that make your stay that little bit more special. Would highly recommend staying here
Everything you could need, lovely presented property with character.
Great place to stay! Everything you could need is provided
Great location and beautiful residence, spotless and great extras
It's in a great location, very comfortable space, very tidy,  host very helpful would highly recommend

Clean as a whistle, helpful host, perfectly situated period home. You feel like you've stepped back in time but with all the mod cons to make life easy. Highly recommend staying here. Heather even gave us a tour of the old bakery out the back that they're renovating. Would certainly stay here again.
Gorgeous homes with hosts to match! Communication was outstanding and the home has everything g you could ask for.
Wonderful stay!
An absolutely stunning house with beautiful settings.   Heather and Gordon have created a beautiful environment.    Highly recommend it as a must do and stay.
Thank you to Heather for preparing a lovely space. Really appreciated how clean the house was.
amazed at what was supplied in the way of condiments/food and how comfortable it was, like being in a home rather than just accommodation.

We really enjoyed staying at Heather and Gordon’s place. We felt right at home and would’ve liked to stay longer. We were so impressed by their attention to detail, and the house was incredibly well equipped - it had everything! It was also was 100% clean, the beds were comfortable, it was quiet and overall very charming. Absolutely recommend it!
We had a wonderful stay - thank you Heather!
fantastic stay, lovely house and very warm host. Thank you so much for making our weekend getaway exceptionally special
Last minute decision to go away for the night resulted in a stay at Heather’s place. Everything we were after and more. Great spot to use as a base explore the Barossa.
Fantastic stay in Lyndoch. Wonderful accommodation and thoughtful host. Highly recommended.

Having been in the travel industry for over a decade I am so happy to recommend staying here for a perfect stay in the Barossa!  Heather thought of everything to make us feel so welcome .. above & beyond our expectations, gorgeous heritage home in the best location to explore
A wonderful place to stay and in a perfect location!

This place is a hidden gem. The best catered for place we have ever stayed, not a thing in the cupboards you found wanting. Spotless, comfortable, spacious, great location and amazing hosts.
Highly recommend.
A wonderful, clean and beautiful home with absolutely everything you need catered for.
The house is charming and very well equipped. It was very hot when we stayed and the cooling system was excellent. The BBQ and backyard area were well used by us. Great stay.
Great place for a weekend in the Barossa
Perfect place to stay for the night. Heather was very accommodating, shared great local tips and we enjoyed learning a bit of the history of the old bakery and inn which has been lovingly restored.

Clean and tidy
Great hostess

We had a very comfortable stay at Heather’s place. Her property was really clean and we had all the amenities we required... and more!

We loved the historic feel of the property and that it’s old charm and antique furniture had been retained. 

The bed was really comfortable and we slept very well. Breakfast provisions were included, as well as some staple items. We found the office area & supplies a thoughtful touch.

Heather’s communication was excellent, and she couldn’t have been more helpfully. The property doesn’t have wifi, and Heather was kind enough to print out an urgent document for me. She also dropped off some dishwasher tablets when we ran out.

If you are looking for a charming, historic property to stay in, that is convenient to Gawler, wineries and other towns and attractions in the Barossa, you can’t go past Heather’s property.
Perfect, quiet country location, a wonderful property... peaceful, relaxing and all inclusive... lovely, friendly hosts, easy to deal with... overall, a delightful experience, highly recommended!
Enjoyable short stay in this great space and good location.

From the moment we walked inside Heather's place we were all in awe! It was so incredibly beautiful and it was truly home away from home. The kitchen was amazingly equipped and we cooked breakfast every day and had it in the back yard listening to the birds singing. Evening time was spent with the family again outdoors. It was truly  an honor being entrusted with Heather's gem! I would definitely stay again and again...
This is a great place to stay. Lots  of thoughtful extras greatly located to the Barossa and a short stroll to the local bakery and eateries.
Great location, very easy to access bike track and local wineries. Close to restaurants and a quaint place to stay.

This is truly unique Airbnb accomodation with everything you would expect to see in a 5 star hotel. Great location, excellently finished with amazing furniture and fittings. We’ll be back, I’m sure when revisit the Barossa. Thanks again Heather and Gordon

Wow ! Martinsell manor was incredible! Peter & Marijan were fantastic hosts and so helpful to all our needs. We had the most amazing week and look forward to coming back to stay again hopefully in the next few years. The property and grounds were just beautiful! Definitely recommend Martinsell Manor to anyone wanting to stay in the Barossa region.

AMAZING! Peter and Marijan were great hosts, so welcoming and helpful! the manor was so beautiful and we were honored to be able to stay here, it has been lovingly restored to a high quality. It really takes you back in time through a wonderful building with so much heritage. walking up the stairs from the pool made you feel like a princess.
Thank you again and we will be back

We stayed at the Martinsell Manor for our 10year Anniversary.

Marijan and Peter have worked hard to restore the lower level to its former glory. 
They've done a wonderful job keeping true to history - from the beautiful rugs to the beds to the decor. 
Amazing effort - it really shows.

Its a wonderful place to stay - quiet, relaxing and private. 
A pool all to yourself for the hot days, a garden and near by pathways to go for a stroll and lovely soft grass to have some fun on. 

We stayed in the Gold/White room. Restored and decorated beautifully - very large, with a large TV AND King size bed to match.
The bed and sheets were extremely comfortable.

Marijan and Peter were the perfect hosts - ensuring we had everything we needed. 
They supplied the little things that normal places don't such as toothbrushes and toothpaste - and as well as adequate toiletries.

One highlight to our stay was they provided us with fresh fruits from their garden and Marijan's delicious plum jam! (As well as other items to eat/drink)
Its these little things that make going somewhere enjoyable and it really did help aid in our relaxation.

Thanks again Marijan and Peter for making our 10 Year Anniversary memorable!

There is no denying that this is a stunning property. The gold room was gorgeous, well appointed and everything you would expect from a manor house. The second room unfortunately paled in comparison, with a literally a tv  the size of a laptop screen and electric blanket that was a single size and only warmed one side of the bed (I was freezing and Mum was like a hot water bottle ha ha). 

The main living space lacked ANY form of heating and we found ourselves utterly  freezing  in literally sub zero  temperatures. We were forced to eat and huddling around a heater in the main bedroom...not what you would expect from a property that charged over $1,200 for a weekend (I mean who wants to eat dinner in a semi circle around a heater  in a bedroom????)

Breakfast was scarce and there was a distinct sense of a lack of generosity about the place. As a long time Airbnb user, I’m used to small thoughtful touches   rather than 3 tiny packets of cereal for breakfast for a group. I’ve stayed in properties for $120 a night and they were so consumer focused, as well as places $2k a night which were sensational (thorngrove manor for example) 

The property is grand and stunning, but it’s not decked out for winter unless you intend to wear snow gear.... to BED...I’m not even kidding! ( the pool is covered so you won’t get the photos you see on the air bnb page etc). In spring/summer months I’m sure it would be magical. We informed our hosts we decided to find alternative accomodation for the second night we paid for due to the sheer freezing temperatures in the home-it was utterly inhabitable. We weren’t offered a refund, rather we were told if we wanted to visit again they would heat the home. I think they need a lesson in customer service. As a business owner I would never treat my consumers that way-that’s not how you treat someone spending that amount of money. 

There is no wifi codes provided so expect to not able to contact the outside world during your stay. I couldn’t receive  texts, check my work emails and there was nothing in the info books around how to access it. 

I think this place could be magical, it just needs a passionate manager who understands customer service, who is generous and genuinely wants their customers to enjoy the experience. 

It’s hard to determine whether or not to recommend. The building is lovely, it’s just not particularly comfortable. I think there are other manor houses who really understand the customer, are passionate, generous and decent, I don’t think this place is it. It’s not about the asthmatics alone. To be fair, it’s about how you utilise the property and how it makes you feel. My rating? 2/5 they need to lift their game and not focus entirely on profit. I’d rather pay an extra $200 a stay for those little touches to include those who care about the customer experience. I hope this is a realistic wake up call  to these guys. It’s a competitive (Website hidden by Airbnb) better!!! People will return because of the experience you created, not because your MO  is income generation. We should have been provided a refund for a second night after raising our issues you directly. . That would have been the right thing...but these people don’t do the right thing, they put them and thier bottom line first....and do we really want to support businesses like that? I think not, choose elsewhere until they learn the art of decency and hospitality.

We spent a very special weekend at this property and enjoyed the luxurious gold room in the manor, which is very private with a separate entrance. The furnishings in the room are in Georgian style with quality throughout. Also the bed is very comfortable with a high quality mattress. The old blends with the new as there is a flat screen TV, wi-fi access and heating. We also enjoyed the electric blanket which was working perfectly. The property has a beautiful large swimming pool set amongst majestic trees and pretty gardens with pathways. We enjoyed a tour of the property with a vineyard, sheep, llamas and chickens. Breakfast is provided in a modern kitchenette off the lounge area and is self service. There are tea and coffee making facilities and a fridge for personal use.

We enjoyed touring the wineries and eating in the Barossa as there is so much to see in the nearby vicinity. Our experience was very positive with such warm and friendly hosts. We would certainly recommend this accommodation.
Absolutely stunning views and a great location for our trip!!

My husband and I had the most amazing stay with our little daughter. It was definately a trip to remember ! 

We enjoyed walking around the property, playing in the pool, cooking dinner on the bbq and relaxing in the amazing house. 

We used the lawn games and had so much fun family time together. 

The best parts were the privacy on the property and views ! 

We also were gifted with a bottle of wine from the owners vineyard on new years eve. 

Highly recommend  !

We had an amazing time at Martinsell Manor, the house and surrounding gardens are stunning. The rooms are so grand and luxurious, Peter and Marijan have done a wonderful job renovating. They were excellent hosts, offering so much knowledge on the property and area. We had such a relaxing trip, highly recommend!!

We had a lovely few days here over New Year's Eve (spending quite a lot of the time in the swimming pool)! The area is beautiful, with nice walks nearby and further afield; the building is very lovely; there's clearly a lot of good wineries and restaurants within a 20 minute drive or so, though we mostly didn't venture far away as there were so many spaces outdoors in particular to sit around and read or look at the wonderful views over fields.

Lovely accomodation surrounded by beautifully kept gardens. Highlights were the pool, great amount of amenities (breakfast, snacks, cooking essentials and toiletries) and antique style interiors. Thank you for all your help and effort you put into making the space beautiful!

Loved staying at this cottage! Everything was so comfortable and clean. It is obvious that Deb has put a lot of time and thought into making sure that the place is “just right”. From the supplies in the kitchen to the way each room was set up - you really felt like a valued house guest. We started each morning with a walk through the videyards and enjoyed spotting kangaroos and other local wildlife - stunning! Steve was great too and nothing was too much trouble. Definitely make sure you visit their cellar door if you are there on a weekend - the wine and cheese platter were fantastic.
Such a beautiful home within an amazing setting. Every little detail exceptional x
Would highly recommend Linfield Cottage. Everything a much needed getaway required and much more.
Lovely well appointed place, Helpful and friendly host would certainly recommend the place and host to anyone.

Our family of four stayed at Sally’s place for 6 nights and had a really fantastic time there. Staying at a working vineyard, especially during harvest time, was a fascinating experience. Sally and Martin were wonderful hosts, they made us feel very welcome. We were able to walk around the vineyard, watch the harvest, feed the rescued kangaroos (and the geese and peacock), we borrowed bikes from them, enjoyed a complimentary bottle of wine from the vineyard, were given lots of tips on what to do in the area and very much enjoyed Sally’s homemade cookies and crisps and the chickens freshly laid eggs. 

The house overlooks rolling hills of the vineyard and has a lovely view framed by the garden and lots of native trees; we loved just sitting out on the deck and taking in the scenery and listening to the birds. The house has lots of character with artwork and thoughtful touches including fresh flowers. It was spotlessly clean; we had lots of space; the kitchen was suitably equipped for the several meals that we cooked there, the condiments were appreciated, plus the fridge was stocked with milk, butter and some local goodies on our arrival. Overall we really enjoyed our time there and would love to come back for another stay if we make it back to Australia some day. Thanks Sally and Martin for a wonderful time.

Whistler Vineyard Retreat is an absolutely fantastic accommodation in the heart of the Barossa Valley. We spent two days with Sally and Martin and cannot recommend their accommodation highly enough! 
From the minute Sally and Martin welcomed us to their retreat, the kind gesture  of a complimentary bottle of whistler wine and platter waiting for us on arrival and the perfect location to enjoy a glass of wine on the back verandah and watch the sun set over the vineyards we knew this was special and felt right at home. We loved every moment we spent at Whistler's Retreat, and hope to return again soon. Thank you Sally and Martin, just perfect.

We really enjoyed our stay with Sally and Martin.  The setting is beautiful facing out to vineyards, in a quiet winegrowing area that makes for a serene stay with quiet, dark evenings that highlight all the stars you haven’t seen since you were a child.  Their friendly menagerie wandered about the property; their gorgeous peacock would periodically check in on us, and their friendly dogs and cat would occasionally come by to greet us as well.  Of course there are geese, the orphaned kangaroos they care for near their cellar door, and the chickens that provide your breakfast eggs as well.   We appreciated the fresh flowers, snacks, breakfast goodies, local recommendations, and their sincere and friendly hospitality.  And when we reported a minor problem one evening, Sally and Martin immediately fixed it.    Internet worked perfectly well even while accessing some data-heavy spreadsheets for work.  Over a decade ago we stayed at another nearby property where we had sole use of a guesthouse, and we really preferred our stay here, as we had all the privacy we wanted while having access to the recommendations and company of 30+ year locals when desired.  Don’t wait,....book this guestwing now!

The experience was nothing short of extraordinary. A perfect getaway in the middle of the beautiful Barossa Valley. Starting with an amazing, very warm host [Sally] to the most scenic/beautiful property with deeply thought out amenities and, what deserves the most mention, a collection of adorable pets [incl baby kangaroos and peacocks!]. A true gem!
Very nice place, stylish, sparkling clean and quite .. highly recommended ! Thank you very much for your very much welcomed hosting!
Beautiful place to stay in the heart of the Barossa. Warm, comfortable and inviting and Sally is an amazing host with a wealth of local information to share. Loved our four days here!

One word: Superb. From the welcome platter and bottle of Whistler wine, recommendations on local spots to visit, to just sitting and gazing at the wind playing in the trees; this was  heaven!  Gorgeous accommodation with thoughtful and interesting touches.  We had three days and could easily have enjoyed more.  A fabulous property.

The Whistler is one of the best airbnb's I have ever stayed in! We spent the evening by a roaring fire and Sally's incredibly well stocked kitchen, complementary bottle of wine produced on site and heated floors kept us extremely warm and happy. The location couldn't have been better for wine tasting and in summer, taking a bike ride around the vineyards (bikes offered on site), would be lovely. Sally's hospitality could not be topped and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking to explore the Barossa.

Very clean and cared for rooms and property in a private vineyard setting.
Sally was an excellent host that provided us with everything we could possibly need including a bottle of their own lable of premium Shiraz on arrival together with a local cheese board.
We particularly enjoyed sitting around the fire in their garden at night sharing stories and a glass or two of wine.

Fantastic place to stay. Bottle of wine and platter on arrival. Cosy guest house in a stunning location.  Sally was an amazing host providing lots of lovely touches including the best homemade anzac cookies I’ve ever had.

From the very first message to Sally I knew I had picked a great place to stay! On our arrival she was so welcoming and offered us so much great advice about where to go and what to see, not to mention the lovely welcome platter and bottle of Whistler wine. It was also all the other touches, home made cookies, crackers and fresh eggs from the chooks in the back garden. We enjoyed a glass of wine on the back balcony overlooking the vineyard as the sun set, magical!! The accommodation is spotlessly clean and the beds are super comfy! Location is perfect and we were central to so many amazing vineyards and restaurants as well as the new Gin Distillery just up the road. We also enjoyed a wine tasting at the Whistler cellar door, beautiful setting on the lawns. All in all this place is the only place anyone should stay at when visiting the Barossa. Sally makes you feel so welcome as soon as you meet her and is happy to share her knowledge and love for the Barossa. We will definitely come back and have already recommended it to our friends.

Sally was a wonderful host. The personal touches (like home baked cookies, farm fresh eggs,  fruit) make you feel at home from the first moment. The home is located in the vineyard and is very serene, with the resident farm animals wandering about creating a very relaxed and familiar atmosphere. I highly recommend Sally’s place!

Amazing location to venture across the Barossa Valley. The host knows the area well and recommendations been great! This range from where to eat, drink, grocery etc . And she always response fast.

The stay been great with a nice kitchen to wipe up meals after Barossa Farmers Market, and having it on the patio, facing the sunset over the vineyard. Mornings are a delight to have the resident peacock going by, chickens giving freshly laid eggs and geese going by. 

The wines from Whistler packs surprises. Do spend time at their cellar doors, while children could while their time at the playground.

Lovely host and place.

It was absolutly amazing. I can't say enough about how beautiful the place was. Sally was such a lovely host and had everything we could have needed ready for us. If you love piece and quiet, animals, pizza and wine then this is the place for you.
An awesome place to stay and Sally is an awesome host, she left home made baking for us to enjoy and fresh flowers, awesome

An awesome place to stay . Sally was a welcoming host , from the plate of local produce on arrival , home baked snacks and fresh eggs to providing great information about the area . Sally provides the right balance between attentiveness and being unobtrusive.  We had a fabulous weekend hanging out at the vineyard as well as getting out and about . Highly recommended!

This was a beautiful little place to stay. Really loved watching the geese walking about the lawns and spying Roger the resident peacock.  Not only were the hosts very accommodating but we were welcomed with a lovely bottle of white wine and a cheese platter. Just a beautiful way to start a mini holiday in the Barossa. I would definitely recommend this lovely piece of paradise to anyone.

This was a peaceful relaxing place to stay. The setting was really beautiful. The apartment was stylish and well appointed. The wine, the platter and the eggs on arrival were really nice and very tasty. There were so many little extras such as condiments, home baked biscuits and books on the book shelf. We highly recommend this as a really lovely place to escape the city hustle and bustle. It was a good central location for sampling what the delights of the Barossa. Thank you for having us. :-)

Whistler is a beautiful winery in a fabulous location and it is a delight to stay there, Sally is a wonderful host who looks after your stay with great information and hospitality. Very enjoyable stay and will certainly be back soon.

Absolutely loved this, it’s what airbnb is all about! Sally is a wonderful host, lots of lovely touches and generous with her local knowledge. Willing to go above and beyond!
It’s even better than the photos ... we’ll be back!
Great location in the heart of Barossa. Good to stay on a working winery with Australian animals. Great knowledge of Barossa attractions.
Great place to stay if you are looking for peace and tranquillity.  Clean and tidy accommodation, loved the bottle of Red wine.

The perfect winery getaway in Barossa. Sally was very helpful and responsive during our stay, great hospitality. She’s also very knowledgeable about the region. We particularly enjoyed walking around the property and relaxing on the hammock! We will definitely be back if we are around this area in the future.
We had a great weekend at Sally’s place, great hospitality and an amazing spot to stay. Would love to go back and would highly recommend.

This place is in a beautiful location at a fantastic winery. Great walks around the vineyard, dams and animal enclosure were a great start and end to our day. The hosts are super helpful and very responsive to any requests.
The cottage is very well equipped with everything you could need and the hammock was an especially nice touch.
Thanks for the use of the push bikes and the local tips and advice. Can’t wait to come back.

Amazing! I could stay here for a full week!
There is so many things to do at Whistler from a walk around the vineyard to play equipment (for kids), roo enclosure and of course the great wine!
Wonderful hospitality, local suggestions and relaxing surrounds.

Sally's place is impeccable.  It is beautifully presented, charming with many personal touches.  Surrounded by a gorgeous garden and sited in a vineyard it is the perfect place to stay in the Barossa.  Sally herself is friendly and hospitable and has thought of everything to make your stay comfortable and to provide expert information about the area.

Amazing hospitality, delicious fresh eggs for breakfast, home made biscuits, platter & wine on arrival and a gorgous, sparkling clean place with all you could need. There was even a luxurious deep bath. Sally gave us loads of local tips and was always available when needed. The winery has delicious wines and a green open space for relaxing while tasting and plenty for the kids to do too.  Everyone we met there was friendly and helpful, we were also lucky enough to be there for one of their friday night food truck and wine nights.
The view from the place is of the vines and it is very easy to get to many wineries inc Seppeltsfield and Maggie Beers restaurant. I highly recommend staying here, it is a treat! Thank you Sally for ensuring our weekend was so memorable.

The perfect quiet getaway in the country. If you are after a private bonfire, with short walks, in a beautiful  location this is the place. Sally was generous in her supply of little extras. The underground floor heating during cold winter nights was fantastic.
We had a lovely stay during a rainy weekend. Cozy, warm and everything you need! Sally was lovely, we will be back for longer next time!

Absolutely loved staying here. Sally and Martin are excellent hosts and their property is stunning. This is a stylish and private space with all you need for a relaxing stay in the Barossa. Beautiful location overlooking the vines, awesome bath, great walking and cycling track and close to Tanunda.

We absolutely loved our stay at Whistler Wines, and are sure you will too, whether you are traveling with kids or without. Sally was extremely proactive with communications, and we couldn't have received a warmer welcome at checkin from Ellen. The location, just off Seppeltsfield Road, is arguably one of the best positions in the Barossa - you're just a stone's throw from Torbreck, Two Hands wines and Seppeltsfield, and a short drive from Nuriootpa and Angaston. The retreat was a warm, welcoming space, comfortably furnished and with amazing amenities (+1 for underfloor heating and a deep soaking bath overlooking the vineyards!). Our children especially loved meeting the friendly dog, Winnie, the geese and the rescue kangaroos down by the cellar door. Fresh eggs are provided from the well-fed hens on site and there are other amenities like freshly baked biscuits, great coffee and even Sal's home made tomato sauce. As our stay was mid-winter, we didn't have much of an opportunity to enjoy the outdoor area (including hammock!), but this would be divine once spring rolls around. Highly recommended!
