Fabulous welcome, accommodation and location. We loved walking with the dogs. A perfect break with the cellar door to walk to with fantastic wines to try. Sally is very generous leaving us a lovely bottle of wine to welcome us, a cheese platter, homemade crackers, I’d love the recipe please, and biscuits. Could not have asked for more and we’ll be back.

A perfect place for a long weekend, even in winter! A warm welcome from Ellen on one of coldest days. Lovely food provision - cheese platter, eggs, biscuits, fruit, coffee, tea, milk, butter and a bottle of Whistler wine. 

It’s a great location for many other wineries, and just two minute drive to Appellation for dinner. 

The kitchen is well equipped, we cooked a dinner with local produce from the farmers market.

The bedding is comfortable, soft and fluffy towels, and nice bath tub overlooking the wineyard. 

The underfloor heating is just perfect for winter, a mild and effective heating. It was a little wet to have an outdoor fire that weekend but it would be perfect setting on other cold days.

Absolutely love the geese! They are just gorgeous little things. (Not that little actually)

Highly recommended and we’d love to return on other occasions.
A truly fabulous place to stay!! Great location, atmosphere, full of comforts and personality. We’ll definitely be back again soon. Thank you!

This is a beautiful piece of paradise in the heart of the Barossa. Sally was a kind and thoughtful host and made sure we were comfortable during our stay. Her extra sweet touches, like fresh flower bouquets, rice packs to warm the bed, fresh eggs from the chickens and a delicious welcome platter and a bottle of delicious Whistler Wines are just a few of the fine touches. The beautiful scenery amongst the vines and all the animals made this a truly unique experience that I would recommend for anyone. I know we will be back.
A beautiful little spot with lovely hosts, great wine and close to all the best spots in the Barossa! Highly recommended. Thanks  Sally and Martin
A beautiful peaceful stay. Sally was very hospitable, the wine and platter were very thoughtful. A perfect place to relax.

We had a great stay here with our adult son and his partner. The house was very comfortable (the underfloor heating was a bonus as the weather became very cold) and the beds were also comfy. Sally provided little welcoming extras such as heatbags for the beds, homemade soaps, homemade biscuits, fresh eggs, a cheese platter and bottle of wine. There were also some basic but very useful provisions left in the cupboards (salt, pepper, oil, gladwrap, etc) which were great to have as we cooked a couple of meals. The view over the vines was very peaceful and the chooks, geese and roos provided some entertainment! The central location made accessing wineries and restaurants in the Barossa easy. Would definitely stay here again!

Such a great space and location. Guests are only metres from the vineyard with ample places outside to socialise and soak it all in. The attention to detail was outstanding with a welcome platter, homemade Anzac bikkies (yum), fresh eggs and cut flowers. Sally and Martin were fantastic hosts, and we’re looking forward to returning sometime in the future.

All round 5 Star stay we had. The BnB was stunning and super easy to get around to all of Tanunda’s best offerings.

Lovely personal touches like homemade biscuits and a welcome bottle of wine were wonderful, and topped off with a late check out. An all round lovely stay !

Very clean and comfortable cottage in a quiet village. The provisions were excellent and the linens and bedrooms very comfortable. The owner is very helpful and accommodating. There is no garden so if you have kids this is something to bear in mind. The restaurants and cellar doors are around 15 minutes drive (some may be closer).
Every fine detail is catered for and all add up to 5 star quality accommodation. Such a beautiful and romantic little get away spot!
Delightful cottage with luxury fittings and extras.  Gourmet local foods for breakfast and snacks. Handy to the prettiest part of the Barossa
The host canceled this reservation 67 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Lovely French style cottage . Cozy stay with full hospitality. Yummy breakie and lots of sauces for cooking. Mel is a Very thoughtful host !

This place raises the Air BnB standard. Staying here is a must for a Barossa Valley visit. Mel has thought of everything, including freshly picked roses, bath salts for the bath, amazing food and drink supply, candles, stocked firewood. I had no trouble communicating with Mel and she is extremely accommodating.
Beautifully appointed cottage in the middle of town. The breakfast and food and wine supplied was from local producers and excellent quality. Everything you could need a great place to stay

This place is beyond expectations. Every single touch had been carefully thought about and many surprises. We loved our stay and couldn’t recommend it more. Thankyou Mel for allowing us to stay. We will remember it forever

This is such a charming cottage in the Barossa Valley area.  Every vineyard is a short drive away.  Mel the owner has Queen's Cottage decorated in such a lovely way from sheets, towels and even the bed covers are 5 star.  The cottage is filled with supplies from chocolates, wine, breakast provisions, and many more.  The fire is warm and cozy with heaps of candles and wood is supplied for your stay.  Mel even supplies bath salt for the lovely claw tub.  Thank you Mel for the lovely birthday celebration I was able to give to my husband on our weekend trip to the lovely Barossa.
Could not recommend Queen’s cottage more highly. Mel goes above and beyond to make the stay as memorable as possible. 10/10.
Beautiful house, so well renovated and beautifully appointed with everything you need for a special trip. Lots of great little touches and extras. Have already been recommending to everyone!
The host canceled this reservation 47 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Mel's place is a real warm and cosy gem.

Like the other 5-star reviews, we were absolutely delighted with ALL that we found at Mel's Queens Cottage. The space is thoughtfully decorated and is warm and welcoming. There were gourmet delights for us from local businesses. Breakfast provisions were very welcomed and generous. The beds are firm and comfortable, with electric blankets (which was very appreciated during our stay as the nights were cold!). Having said that, the wood fire certainly warmed the living area beautifully and added a lovely ambience. The under floor heating in the laundry and bathroom was a welcome treat for bare feet and kept that end of the house gently warm. If you can't be bothered lighting the fire, there were 2 reverse cycle air conditioners that quickly warmed the living area, bedrooms and kitchen.
Despite being on the main road, we barely heard any traffic and being a country town, there really wasn't any traffic to be seen anyway.
We really enjoyed our stay in the Barossa and will be back to enjoy this fabulous find again.

My stay at Mel’s was amazing. The home itself was lovely, but it was the little touches that really made my time there really nice. 

There were fresh muffins waiting for us, as well as some lovely chocolates and port by the fireplace (which was already made up and ready for us to light!)

Mel provided a gorgeous spread for breakfast - fresh eggs, bacon, tomato, mushrooms, yogurt, fresh fruit, croissants, as well as some cereals. There was milk and orange juice as well and lots of tea and coffee options. 

The house was in the perfect spot to walk to the local pubs for dinner, not even a two minute walk. 

My weekend at Mel’s was amazing, so relaxing, I didn’t need to worry about anything. Highly recommend!!
Excellent with a lovely warm fireplace and lovely large hot shower for a winter retreat

We loved our stay at Mel’s bnb! The place was beautiful, and there were so many lovely little touches that just made it perfect (like the freshly baked cookies and breakfast). The underfloor heating in the bathroom was incredible and the fire was so cosy. Mel have really helpful tips on getting there and into the accommodation, and had super quick communication. I hope to be able to go again soon!

Your expectations will be exceeded above and beyond. My friends and I had an amazing 2 night stay at Queens Cottage and we were blown away. 

The place was clean and tidy and Mel thought of literally everything. From the provision on cheese and wine, right down to the paper bags that were available when we were looking for extra bags upon leaving. 

I would recommend this place to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in the Barossa.

Loved every second here! Such an inviting, clean and warm home. Hospitality is one of the best I’ve seen and received so far. 
So close to some beautiful hikes, we were spoilt for choice. 
I can’t fault this place or Mel’s attention to detail at all. Thanks!
Absolutely beautiful. All the little added touches made our stay extra special. Perfect for a little getaway and so close to everything.
Beautiful cottage, lovely cheese & wine provisions. Loved the fresh loaf of bread and breakfast aswell. Central location in Williamstown

If you could have someone think of your every holiday need or better still the things you did not know you knew, how amazing would that be?
Thanks Mel, that was how we felt staying at your cottage in the Barossa.
The cottage is so quaint and immaculately kept.
Arriving to a fridge of beautiful local produce, wine and chocolate is such a treat. Great size bedrooms with starched linen, like all 5 star hotels.  Living room with a real fireplace and comfy sofa and chairs and cottage decor. Great big bathroom and extra loo works well if you are a group of 4.
The detail is where Mel’s cottage sets itself apart from other properties.
I didn’t even think of a picnic until we stumbled upon a picnic blanket and picnic hamper. A picnic at Angaston Lookout was awesome! Plush Robes, history of the area, games, centrally located in Williamstown. 
So many positives, the only negative is that we had to leave!
Thank you so much Mel for such a wonderful stay! Highly recommend Queens Cottage!
Beautiful home! Lots of special touches (like candles, room sprays, beautiful outside furniture) and the bath is amazing!

Stylish, immaculately clean cottage with plenty of room for 3 people. Great amenities and so many personal touches. Lovely platter and wine on arrival with plenty of food for yummy breakfasts. Close to attractions and easily accessible. Lovely host who was easy to communicate with and very generous.

Amazing and well above expectations! The house was huge, clean and beautiful. We had a great time and loved the pool table and outdoor setup. There were 5 of us (adults) and we had ample space, with two bathrooms and two lounges. Just off the main street and a short walk from Peter Lehman and Langmeil. Would definitely recommend for big groups or families and hope to visit again!
Lovely place, the pictures dont do it justice! Host is very accomodating and helpful.

Tastefully renovated house, excellent for large groups, family or otherwise. Comfortable beds with nice linens. Polished wood and tiled floors. Very well set up kitchen with masses of cutlery, plates etc. Washing machine, easy access to line. Added extras include wine fridge and pool table. Two wineries within walking distance and easy access to town  and the rest of the Borossa. Fills a much needed gap in the market as a lot of Barossa accommodation caters only to couples.
nice and spacious

Heath’s property is a great place to stay while in the barossa especially if you have a larger group. Heath and Monica have awesome communication and the property is fully stocked with everything you need to enjoy your self and be comfortable during the stay. The house is huge and we loved using the back yard for a bbq with friends. Would definitely stay again!
Nice and roomy in a convenient location. Good communication from the hosts.
Beautiful home in a great spot. The place was clean and comfortable and had everything we needed. We'll definitely book again. Thanks! :)

This is the perfect place to stay for touring the Barossa Valley, particularly for a group. The location is perfect, the house is very spacious with plenty of bedrooms, separate spaces for relaxing, watching tv, dining and even a pool table area which was great fun. There is also an outdoor area with large table and chairs and bbq. The kitchen is also large with everything you could need and more. Our hosts also offered us early check-in and late check-out which was really helpful and a bottle of wine was waiting for us which was a lovely touch. I really can’t fault this place and highly recommend. We loved our stay and will definitely be back!

We stayed at The Entertainer for one night while attending a wedding in Bethany. We really wish we could have stayed longer. 
This house is huge! With 2 living rooms, 2 bathrooms and an abundance of bedrooms, this is the perfect home away from home for a big family holiday!
Check-in was super easy and the beds were comfy. Can't wait to stay again!
Great larger space for a large number of people to enjoy the surrounding areas. Would definitely stay here again, and the hosts were amazing with flexible check in and check out.
The host canceled this reservation 16 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
Spacious comfy house with everything you need for an overnight stay! Appreciated the en-suite, dishwasher and fire being set before we arrived.

Eight of us stayed here for a wine tour. Great location, walking distance to some wineries.

Massive house and huge backyard with plenty of space, beds and great facilities.

Monica was really helpful and was really understanding when we changed the booking earlier in the week.

Couldn’t have had a better stay. Highly recommend if travelling with a large group.
Great place, really spacious and clean.  Great location.
A great location and a generous home for a large group.

Beautifully clean house in a great location. We were a group of 8 and the house at heaps of room. Good location and a few wineries on your door step. The fireplace was a highlight. Monica answered any of my queries swiftly. Would stay there again. Perfect stay.
Five of us stayed for a girls weekend. It was a really stylish, luxurious and beautiful space. Extremely comfy beds and had everything needed!
Lovely home for the weekend.  Arrived to an already lit and cozy fire. We all got lord of enjoyment out of the pool table.
Great location & fabulous house!
A really lovely roomy and stylish place to stay with a group. Also in a great location!

Great spot for touring and exploring the Barossa valley. We stayed here with friends and family for my 30th birthday and we had a ball. The pool table and fire place are great touches, highly recommended!
The host canceled this reservation 68 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.

We loved staying here!  The house is so big, and all the spaces are really comfy - we loved the pool table.  It was really easy to get to, and our host was easy to deal with the whole time.  Thanks again for our stay!
Spacious and clean and comfortable and close to wineries and faclilties. An enjoyable stay.
Very clean and comfortable.
Great property! Spacious and modern with lovely facilities. Loved the pool table.
Great place with lots of space
Great place to stay, and a great location. Communication great. Done very well.

Thank you Monica; your house was the perfect get away for a girls weekend. The location was central and very easy to find. The home was very comfortable and suited our needs perfectly. Large entertaining areas to sit and relax with ample bedrooms and bathrooms. 
It was just what we were after!
Unfortunately I had issues with the host after there was a miss-communication on their side. Nice house and good location, however the abusive messages from the hosts ruined our stay.

Wonderful location - 5 star accommodation.  Abundance of bird life in the native gardens and surrounds. Every possible need catered for and then some.  Great getaway location but so close to town, wineries etc. Best value accomodation you will find!

My partner and I absolutely loved our stay here. Despite how luxurious everything was we felt right at home as soon as we walked through the doors. The small touches such as food, towels and toiletries were very appreciated. Staying here was an experience in itself and we really felt like we got to see what it was like to live in the Barossa.

Archery Road Estate is set amongst vineyards and special views. It is a truly beautiful country escape with many of the smaller details thought of. The breakfast provisions were plentiful and delicious, the outlook upon waking in the morning spectacular and the house itself was carefully looked after! For two families it was the perfect choice as it provided space, a beautiful wood fire in Winter and lots of outdoor space to roam too! Everything was comfortable and well presented. The location was perfect as it was just a short trip to many of the wineries and towns. We will definitely be back but for a little longer next time!
Everything you need is there, including wine.
We had a lovely weekend at Kim’s place with our 14 month old son and friends. Sparkling clean, close to great vineyards and lots of lovely fresh produce provided.

Kim and Matt were fantastic hosts at the Archery Estate. We couldn’t ask for more. When we arrived, Matthew kindly walked us through the house and explained everything to us. There was also a nice welcoming breakfast to compliment the stay which was beautiful. Their place was extremely clean and the beds felt like I was sleeping in a 5 star hotel. Sheets were super clean and bath towels were also. The location is also very central to all the wineries. I would definitely come back here to stay for our next visit. Thank you so much for having us !

A perfect escape for an indulgent, wine-filled weekend! The beautiful views from every window, fully equipped and well-stocked kitchen, super comfy bed and roaring fireplace created a charming balance of space and coziness. With a personalised tour on arrival, we felt welcome right away. Certainly the  most generous Airbnb experience we’ve had so far!
Great property in a beautiful location. Will definitely return. May make a habit of it.

We stayed for 7 nights and felt like home - enjoyed groceries left for our first night and breakfast- great thought -  very comfortable beds - and little extras in bathroom appreciated.  Great position- short drive to town centre.  Quiet and relaxing for some timeout.

We had a wonderful stay in this beautiful cottage. Much larger than it looks in the photos with great living area, wonderful sized kitchen, beautiful garden and lovely balcony to watch the birds from. The fire was already going when we arrived and all the personal touches made all the difference. The wine tour companies and taxis had no problem finding it. Highly recommend
Lovely, sumptuous tranquil getaway, fabulous bedrooms, fireplace, tennis court, gardens  and generous treats to enjoy. Sorry didnt stay longer

Our stay at Archery Road Estate was outstanding. Its location is just perfect being close to Tanunda but with big open spaces for a country feel. It provided ample room for a family group with lots of catching up to do. The property is everything as described, kitchen and rooms are stocked with everything required for a big cook-up and the booking process was smooth.
Lisa was excellent to introduce us to the property, provided great support and assistance during our stay. As well, the get started provisions were fresh and more than ample. Thank-you and we recommend this property to anyone.

Lovely big private house in beautiful, peaceful surrounds. Loved the big deck at the back where we could sit and look over the garden and trees. The surrounding vineyards are stunning and it was great to be able to wake up in the morning and play tennis! Thank you for a lovely stay
Great accommodation and very relaxing surrounds. Just perfect for our girls weekend. Would definitely recommend.
Beautiful peaceful location in this spacious well equipped house. Very warm welcome from our generous hosts Matt and Lisa. We wish we had planned to stay for another day.
Archery Road Estate is in a great location and we had everything we needed. Thank you Lisa and Matt, you are wonderful hosts!

The House is clean, looked after, contains every thing you need, and is in a quiet setting just outside of Tanunda. It is excellent value and well positioned for exploring the Barossa. Highly recommended.

Tranquil. Quiet. Peaceful. 
Tennis court is a real bonus
More than excellent. Couldn’t say enough good. One of the best Airbnb stays!

Wow! 3 mins drive from the heart of Tanunda. Amazing amenities. We were met on arrival to be shown around the property. Beautiful views, a tennis court, breakfast, red wine, chocolate. Very comfy beds. Not sure what else you could ask for! Highly recommend :)

What a delight to spend 4 nights at Archery Road Estate over the Easter break. Lisa and Matt were very accommodating and there to greet us on arrival. The house was sparkling clean and very comfortable. Many thoughtful touches made our stay exceptional, including the very generous breakfast provisions! The property is well located close to town and many wineries and our children enjoyed being able to have a game of tennis each day. Thanks Kim!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Archery Road Estate. The house was absolutely beautiful and all the little touches made it really special. Lisa met us at the house and gave us an excellent orientation. We were also supplied with a high chair and cot for our bub. The house is so central to everything in the Barossa it never took us long to get anywhere. We couldn’t have asked for a better place to stay for our long weekend away. Would definitely stay again.

Great location and excellent hosts. We were made to feel very welcome. The facilities are great, there is a washing machine and clothes dryer which we needed to make use of. Everything worked very well. There was a generous selection of local produce for breakfast ... lasted us for two or more days. Nice very garden and surrounds to have a walk around, lots of birds ... we heard kookaburras.
We had a great stay and delighted with the accommodation. It is very well equipped, the accommodation was well decorated and very comfortable. The surrounding area was beautiful and peaceful.

Our family had a fantastic stay at Archery Road Estate, it is the most beautiful setting with the gorgeous garden and vineyards surrounding the house and giving you plenty of privacy. The house itself it much more spacious than I expected and was very well equipped, the kitchen had everything we needed including some basics already in the pantry which was awesome. The fireplace was the other highlight for the chilly nights after a big day of wine touring!
Fantastic location. Beautiful property. Perfect place to stay and explore the Barossa.
Amazing
Lovely remote location in the vines not far from Tanunda. Great friendly hosts. Would book again.

Archery Road Estate is a lovely old building with modern touches. It was freezing during our weekend in the Barossa but we were warm and toasty by the fire. We definitely made us of the electric blankets and reverse cycle heaters also. The beds are really comfortable and the shower was excellent! Lisa and Matt made sure that our breakfast provisions were vegan and made us feel very welcome. I'd love to come back in the Summer to pick fruit from the many fruit trees! We also loved the seclusion of the property but so close to Tanunda.

A perfect venue for a romantic getaway or for a family group.
Beautiful surroundings, wonderful views from the main bedroom, generously sized living room and separate sitting room.
Excellent wood heater, very efficient and able to generate ample warmth.
Well appointed kitchen, and a separate dining room with a large 8 seat table, suitable for dinner parties using fine Barossa produce.
Very communicative hosts.
A wonderful experience all round.
Beautiful house, superbly clean, perfect location

Spent our wedding night at this beautiful house. It is in a perfect location to access Tanunda town and the rest of the Barossa. This house is massive and is styled really well. Would recommend and would definitely stay again.
Loved it! Great location and lovely touches throughout the house.
Beautiful house located near the town center. Immaculately presented.
We had a girls weekend away in the Barossa and loved staying in this beautiful house. Fantastic location walking distance to the Main Street. Would definitely recommend and we’ll stay again!
Great location, large immaculately presented house with modern appliances
A fab house in a perfect location.
Stunning home with fantastic amenities! Perfect base to discover the Barossa!

The place was fantastic! The perfect location and so much space! Only minutes from some great wineries, restaurants and breweries. 

Fantastic amenities and a really well stocked kitchen. I’d recommend staying here to anyone!
Perfectly located, pool was wonderful, spacious kitchen. Perfect for 2 families!!

This place is amazing! So central and comfortable. Our group of 5 girls were extremely happy with the house. And the communication and assistance with booking wine tours whilst in Tanunda was exceptional. Highly recommend the Highlights tour, we had a fantastic time. 
The house was beautiful and clean, with just about everything we needed to create a home away from home. Shops, cafes and restaurants only minutes walk but the kitchen was also very well equipped to enable us to enjoy meals at home also. 
The outdoor area near the pool was perfect for us to gather and enjoy a few bubbles, board games and laughs. 
We would absolutely stay again.

Beautifully redecorated and very well appointed large house just a 100m walk from the centre of town in Tanunda. Fabulous modern facilities including a new Sony 4K TV with Netflix which was great. New appliances in the kitchen and a lovely pool. Had a terrific stay it’s so central we will be back
a traditional home in great location- walk to your morning coffee.
Great house in an amazing location. So close to all the wineries that we wanted to visit. Everything we needed was in the house. Thanks for a great weekend!
Great house. Spacious king bedrooms.
Lovely kitchen, five extremely comfortable bedrooms all sparkling clean and a great location in Tanunda.
Beautiful house in the heart of Tanunda. Kitchen had everything we required to cook and was a very short walk into town.
Great location. Comfy rooms.

Wonderful location and spotless. So close to all places in Tanunda and a really perfect location for a girls getaway, wine and food Barossa trip. 
Note that both showers are in step in baths, if that is difficult and one is just hand held. Not a problem for us, but worth knowing. Great water pressure and lots of wonderful clean white towels. 
Very comfortable beds. 
Pretty garden, easy communication. Thumbs up!

This charming house is in the perfect location to immerse yourself in Tanunda. Very clean,  large,  great feel. Comfy beds, clean fluffy towels and the best shower ever! Enough spaces for a larger group to spread out and also areas to do things together. Excellent choice for time in Tanunda and Barossa
Beautiful home equipped with everything you can think of, perfect location for wineries.
Wonderful location and beautiful home
A perfectly clean beautiful home for our group of eight. Easy access to the Main Street yet quiet and private. 15 minutes drive to plenty of wineries and restaurants to enjoy the region.

We recently had a wonderful five days staying at Ambrosia for a girls getaway. We all throughly enjoyed the house, the pretty garden and the fabulous location to the main street. We really appreciated the five generous bedrooms and the comfortable beds. The kitchen was well set up for our cooking needs,  with plenty of cooking pans and serving dishes. We used the big metal trays for our charcuterie plates , which were perfect. Thank you for a great stay!
Lovely home in a fantastic location - so close to the main street of Tanunda
Perfect location for Tanunda. Clean and tidy, a lovely place to stay.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in the Barossa and both Tuoi and her beautiful property were exceptionally welcoming.  Villa Maria was spotlessly clean and very comfortable.  An extra highlight to our weekend was an evening meal at FermentAsian that was superb.

Toui's house is beautifully renovated with all the modern features. The rooms are lovely and each has it's own ensuite. The kitchen is great and gets the morning sun. It is a short walk to shops and restaurants and location is great to visit lots of the wineries. We loved our stay there and would definitely come back.

Thank you SO much Tuoi.  We absolutely LOVED your home and the stay was 10 out of 10 (or more!).  We highly recommend your place to anyone.  You have thought of everything and it is the height of luxury in the perfect Barossa location... so close to all fabulous restaurants and amenities.  Your home is truely beautiful.
Beautiful stylish space, great location and amazing hospitality
Thanks Tuoi for the short getaway from the farm!  A very relaxing beautiful house and garden in one of Tanunda best areas! Perfect location for those touring the Barossa and Dining around Tanunda!

Tuoi’s home is really, really comfortable
Lovely spaces and very clean
The old shade trees in the back garden are wonderful
Thanks

Extremely happy with the villa and service. Everything has been thought of, from amenities to breakfast in the fridge... Loved the central speakers and Spotify/iPad set up in the kitchen. Walking distance from main st of Tanunda. Will definitely be coming back!
Its a great place one must go to. Very spacious and the structure/house it self is a wonderful place. The kids loved it.

Nine mates and I stayed in the house in the house which is a grand old place and had a nice weekend but thought we had the house to ourselves. We were disappointed we weren’t made aware the house is sold off in sections like hotel rooms  with tiny kitchens and fridges in bedrooms and that we were sharing the house with other guests with only a locked door between us so at night had to be quiet and respectful to the other people  staying there which wasn’t easy with 10 of us. There are units at the back of the house also and all had access to the pool which at times made it difficult for all of us to go for a swim as there was a limit of 10 people in the pool area at one time. 
As we were taking away a friend who is terminal and we wanted to give him a great weekend with a lot of drinking and laughs but we were restricted in what we could do.
Kym as a host was polite and responded to all correspondence in a speedy manner.
David

Correspondence with this host that became an extremely horrible experience with her and Airbnb. I will not be booking again through Airbnb so I’m not concerned with a potential nasty review from this host. I do not typically leave reviews unless I have something positive to say, but here it is....

There have been a few issues since we arrived and it is rather disappointing given the price we are paying and how this property has been advertised.

- Booking suggests that we have booked the entire house, not that there are  multiple shared facilities with the apartments that are located on the same property directly behind the house.

- rowdy guests from apartments making inappropriate comments when we arrived. Then hogging the pool area being really loud, rowdy and putting us off going to the pool as their behaviour is quite disruptive and a bit intimidating.

- Random people from the apartments coming over onto the verandah and putting their empty bottles into the bins while we are sitting / chatting - no privacy or peace and quiet.

- Naked / screaming children were running through the back of the house / verandah area - no privacy or peace and quiet.

- apartment guests having a family reunion/ party for someone’s 30th -  no privacy or peace and quiet and as there is a “no party policy” this is not in keeping with that policy.

- Secure the dishwasher - it tips over when you are loading the dishes and the drawers tip out onto the floor injuring someone’s foot. This complaint was also on a 2018 TripAdvisor review but still continues.

- our booking says ‘entire house’ and we will have the entire home to ourselves. Yet another person showed up after the first 24 hours to stay in “the Ruby Suite”. This is not accurately represented in our booking.

- host said she would get back to us, but didn’t- this meant we were outside the Airbnb 24 hour window for resolution/ refund. 

- host refused a refund and despite multiple other reviews on TripAdvisor and Airbnb voicing similar issues (only found these after our issues as they are hidden amongst glowing reviews for the apartments) there remains a complete lack of transparency in there advertising.

- This host is exploiting every possible Airbnb loophole and getting away with it in a recurring manner.
A nice place to stay!

Crystal’s home was absolutely lovely! The house was clean, tidy, cosy and inviting. It was close to everything we needed and wanted to see in the Barossa.

Crystal went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable. The fridge was stocked with ingredients to make breakfast, and Crystal even dropped off a coffee machine to us the day we arrived, after it was replaced. The fire was set up ready to light as soon as we arrived.

My correspondence with Crystal before and during our stay was always friendly, polite & prompt.
Lovely house, great location, great host. Thanks Crystal.

A lovely clean house, close to everything for a Barossa get away. Great for a group of family and friends to relax and spend time together as well. Some lovely touches by the host were very much appreciated. I would stay again

Very neat property only moments into the Main Street. The host had the wood burning fire place lit well before we arrived so the home was already warm upon arrival. The breakfast and coffee provisions were also a pleasant suprise with ingredients for coffee and ham and cheese croissants. We also appreciated that the home had Netflix.
Great stay!
Crystal’s home was lovely and very spacious. Thank you for having us
A lovely quiet and cosy place to stay. A short distance to some superb Cafés and restaurants. 10/10 for cleanliness!

Loved staying at Crystal’s house. The location, bedrooms, cleanliness, atmosphere & my favourite the open log fire. The place was that warm and inviting that I almost didn’t want to explore The Barossa Valley as I was so completely content with where I was. Will definitely be staying there again.

Crystal’s place was very clean, well set out and equipped. Very comfortable for two couples. It was a thoughtful touch having the log fire set for us when we got home in the late afternoon, and it was very effective in warming the place up and keeping it warm. Crystal was a great communicator right through the process including excellent tip for dinner venue and quick and clear response to all questions.

I stayed at Crystals place with some girlfriends during the Gourmet Weekend.  Crystal was absolutely fantastic, she communicated with me from booking right up until the day of arrival, she had the fire going for us when we arrived, a bottle of wine and nibbles in the fridge - it was a great welcome.  The house was clean, neat and modern, it had everything we needed - including a great coffee machine! we were very comfortable.  Great location too, close to everything we needed.  I highly recommend staying at Crystals place when visiting the Barossa.
This is a very nice, well equipped home in a safe, quiet neighborhood. Great location for exploring the Barossa Valley. Crystal is a terrific host, quick with responses, warm and welcoming. 5-star!

A lovely house for a group of friends looking to get away in the Barossa. 

Crystal was great to deal with, and included a number of little extra touches which really made the stay for us!
Great stay. Had everything you could need. Loved the fireplace.

The whole house was lovely. The bedrooms were so beautifully made and were very clean, almost like we were in a hotel! Big spacious backyard space. It was our home away from home. Will definitely be back.
Excellent host
Crystal's place was perfect for a large group.  She was a thoughtful host,  and the place was very clean and cozy! Awesome backyard too!
Very spacious home kept in very good shape. Be sure to ask Crystal for local tips as she knows her stuff.
Sitting by the fire listening to the sound of the frogs nearby with a glass of wine or cup of tea at the end of the day was a delight. Superb hospitality and local tips were welcome.

We stayed at Crystal's place overnight and it had everything we needed and more. The house is well appointed, sparkling clean, and the king size bed ensured a fabulous nights sleep. We loved how quiet it was there and it would be a perfect place to stay if you are planning on exploring the Barrossa Valley. Crystal was extremely helpful and accommodating and we appreciated her booking us in at short notice.

Crystals place was great, very cozy and nice and peaceful. 
Crystal was an amazing host with fast communication if I ever needed. 
Will definitely stay again sometime soon

Excellent stay was exactly what we needed after camping for a few days. Lots of space to store car and camping gear undercover. Great for the kids and had everything we needed. Outdoor area and deck was great and location is close driving distance to all the Barossa attractions. 

Almost wish it was colder during our stay so we could have used the outdoor pot belly. 

Crystal was very accommodating and responded quickly, would definitely stay again, thanks!
Great, clean home

Nice and clean and in a great location.

Will be back
Great place to stay, super clean with nice little touches, great location

If you’re planning a trip to the Barossa, this bnb can be the perfect spot to relax after a day driving around the beautiful area. The fireplace is great and will warm up the whole house.

For those unfamiliar with the area, be prepared to drive to other towns to visit wineries (this is typical of anywhere you stay). 

Check in was a breeze and Crystal was highly responsive to messages. Highly recommend staying here, and it would be suitable for large groups too.
Crystal is a professional and a worthy super Host
A great back yard and deck, super warm fire and very comfortable bed.  Great food options.  Very lovely place.

Crystals' house is a modern, well-equipped property in a quiet cul-de-sac in Lyndoch.  The kitchen is functional with adequate supplies.  The location provides great access to the Heysen Trail in the Barossa region, and is also close to some great wineries.  The 'Table Cafe' in lyndoch is well worth a visit for brunch, and 'Kellermeister' is great for an indulgent platter for lunch.  Highly recommended.
Place was lovely and clean and the fireplace was amazing!

Crystal was an amazing host! 
I threw my best friends bridal shower at her property and crystal was more than accommodating allowing me to come set up decorations early before lunch which made the whole day go so much smoother. 
Everyone was so happy with the entire house. 
It was the perfect night away.
A cosy  comfortable home . Convenient access to all towns in Barossa.

Thank you Crystal,
The house is a lovely quiet area of Lyndoch, with a lovely back yard area to bbq and relax.
Comfortable beds and appreciated the little extras like breakfast provisions and the bottle of wine.  
Would definately be happy to stay again
We had a wonderful stay at Crystals. The place was just as pictured. Communication was great and will eagerly recommend if you’re visiting the Barossa
Beautiful place, wonderful hosts. An epic place. You must stay here
The house is the perfect space for 2 couples to enjoy without falling over each other. Very relaxing and enjoyable!
Great spacious house. A very relaxing stay.

Gorgeous house, great location and beautiful touches from the host. Spacious and clean, this house was perfect for a short getaway to the Barossa and had everything you could need. Internet, Netflix and cereal / milk were extra thoughtful touches we were not expecting but appreciated. Comfortable beds and tidy rooms, you wouldn’t be disappointed staying here!
Lovely space. Easy access and everything was just as advertised. Clean with everything we needed to make it a very comfortable stay.

Highly recommend this property, it’s spacous, has a great backyard and all the amenities you could need. 
The personal touches were especially welcoming. Crystal also gave us local tips and shared her driver’s details with us, which was very much appreciated.
A well equipped clean and comfortable house to stay close to town. Thanks Crystal.

Crystal's place in Lyndoch is a perfect base for exploring the Barossa. The house is kept very updated, impeccably clean, with an appealing big backyard  to spend some time in with a glass of wine in hand. Really appreciated the  little touches like extra conditioner, milk and cereal. We only spent a night and definitely will come back for a longer stay if there is an opportunity!

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Crystal’s  & esp the aircon in the 44 degree heatwave. Spacious & clean with thoughtful extras like Netflix, toiletries, cooking condiments. Even a bottle of wine, orange juice & cake. Thank you! The Pictionary & Jenga came in handy too! Crystal is a very kind host. Communication was super quick & clear. Highly recommend.
A very spacious, clean and well equipped house. The location is perfect for a stay in the Barossa.

Nicely located in a quiet area, close to all the wineries in the Barossa.
Lots of welcoming touch from the host.. super clean, Nice BBQ area.
Really happy with our stay
Clean and tidy house with a nice back yard for our dog to run about. Very close to nice winery's.
Nice yard for our dog!
Loved staying, was beautiful and homey. Super comfy beds to was out light a light.

Great place to stay for a family or just a couple. Nice back yard with decking and outdoor setting. Fireplace was great and unexpectedly used it on a summer night.
Crystal left some breakfast food and drink as well as coffee pods and soy milk which was great to have. Thanks again crystal was a lovely place

We had an awesome stay! The house was beautiful - clean, spacious, had everything we needed, we were even spoiled by breakfast items and a bottle of wine! Couldn’t recommend highly enough and will definitely be back!

Crystal's place is a great base to explore the Barossa. Whilst we were only there overnight for a wedding, Crystal was able to help with our transport and arrange a smooth check in for us. Very much appreciated! The place is great for a group or family and has everything you need to feel at home. If only we were to have stayed longer! Thanks again Crystal!
Clean, comfortable, great accommodation. Has everything you need and more!!
Great house in a wonderful location

Amazing house. So spacious. And was great to relax just geting married and spending  a week there for our mini moon. 
Used the bbq nearly ever night. Was great.
 Our pugs loved it too. Highly recommed. 
Not far from alot of wineries and the Barossa too.  Xx

Crystal’s place is very well located, clean, stylish, spacious and welcoming. The self check in process was easy and communicating with Crystal was always quick and friendly. 
Highly recommended - thank you Crystal.
Very nice and stylish house, very clean and comfy. Highly recommend!
Great location, quiet area. Perfect for family getaway for girls weekend.
Great spacious place to stay as a base to explore the beautiful vineyards of Barossa. The breakfast was a nice touch and the log fire! Would recommend anyone to stay here!
Beautiful place to stay!!! Spotlessly clean, great communication from the hosts and perfect for us and our fur babies! Would highly recommend

Lovely house and hospitality for our stay in Barossa. Everything was a close drive and our dog was welcomed and safe in the fenced backyard. The hammock was great for a nap in the afternoon after a day of wine tasting. 
The breakfast was an added bonus
Crystal was amazing to deal with and very accomodating!
Great location. Very comfortable. Amazingly comfortable beds. Everything that we needed. Highly recommend
Great stay, very comfortable and close to all the amazing food and wine the Barossa has to offer.
The place was sparking clean, well maintained and Crystal was so pleasurable to deal with. Would recommend without hesitation!

Really great place. Spacious, clean, and in a quiet location near loads of Barossa Valley attractions (short drive to wineries, pubs, restaurants, cafes, producers, and other towns). Breakfast items and complimentary wine were a nice touch!
Amazing place, close to all the wineries and super clean!
Such a great place! Amazing hospitality! Crystal is a great host!! Would highly recommend! Thank you:)

A perfect place for friends and family to relax.
Comfy beds, nice outdoor entertainment area. I Highly recommend

Crystal’s place is a spacious home in Lyndoch in the Barossa Valley. It was the perfect retreat for our stay in the Barossa. It’s got plenty of room, a great sized yard and deck for relaxing with a bottle of wine. It’s very clean and has a big kitchen for cooking and Nespresso for coffee! Communication with Crystal was easy and friendly. Would highly recommend staying here!

Lovely spacious home with great facilities, large rooms and a spacious backyard with BBQ area. Crystal had provided many thoughtful touches including local wine and provisions for breakfast (OJ and Banana Bread), and the neighbourhood was really peaceful.

The house was lovely and clean, it felt very private, so easy to check in. The knitted rugs, fireplace, books and breakfast provisions made us feel very spoilt. The location was great. We loved our stay

A lovely stay in Lyndoch. Very quiet country area. We found it very easy to get around the Barossa Valley by car.  Driving around 10 to 30 minutes maximum and we easily exploring the different sights and wineries in the valley. A very nicely decorated, clean and spacious home. Very easy to check in and out. Communication with Crystal was easy and very timely. Beds were very comfy and the bedding/linen was nice - kept us nice and warm. The included breakfast was a lovely extra touch. A great stay in the Barossa.
Lovely place. Great fire, wish we could have stayed longer.
Lovely house that had everything we needed for a small family. Great to be able to take our dog too :-)

We stayed at Crystal's place for 'one night only' but had a great time. We recommend a walk through the nearby Sandy Creek CP and breakfast at The Table Cafe was a real treat! The fire was an extra nice touch for the chilly evening :)

Gorgeous house, sparkling clean with lots of lovely thoughtful touches right through the house. Comfy couches, comfy bed, real coffee, breakfast provided, fireplace ready - just needed to be lit- and great location. We loved staying and will definitely be back.
A great cosy place to stay. Great base to check out the Barossa.  It was great for two of us without feeling too big . Crystal was quick to respond and very helpful. Recommended.

House was lovely and clean with nice touches, we really enjoyed the coffee pod machine, deep bath & wood fire heater was used both days and creates a beautiful ambience and all the warmth you need on the cold winters night..we really enjoyed sitting in front after we put our son to bed with a bottle of sparkling wine.

Banana bread was one of the best we’ve had and we really enjoyed! Bottle of OJ, cereal and a bottle of wine were lovely!

Master bedroom was spacious and easy enough to have the porta cot in room without tripping over.

Was extra special to be able to bring our dogs as one has to take medication twice a day so it’s hard to getway unless they are invited.

Fantastic location with a 15 minute walk to Lyndoch town, the town has a bakery and the vegetarian pasty was amazing!!! Also in town is the local pub with a bottle-o attached all staff lovely. The Lord Lyndoch for something a special was an enjoyable dinner with great staff.
God Hill winery is 16 minute walk and the view is one of the best I’ve seen a photo doesn’t do it justice..Charlie the wine maker and owner is so lovely and passionate he also made us the best Italian platter and Sharon was beyond lovely and gave us such a experience with our one on one tasting..our one year old son absolutely loved her! Lots of fantastic (Website hidden by Airbnb) a must but ring before to book.
Kies winery is a 26 min walk and you could spend the whole day there with a great grass area with activities and a gorgeous husky who is super friendly... wines are delicious. We then walked to Chateau Yaldara..there is no path for for about 19 minutes so walking is fine but with a pusher is a little more adventurous but definitely do it if your up for it, the landscape is gorgeous and plenty of photo opportunities. Chateau Yaldara is one of our favourites! Plenty of reasons location is breathtaking, great food and if you have kids a fantastic play area, and the wines are always good!


Overall we had a great experience and would definitely stay again, thanks for having us we made lots of great memories.
Beautiful location and house. Very warm welcome with the fireplace :)
We had a girl's weekend at Crystal's Lyndoch house and everything was as promised. We had a very relaxing time and would definitely recommend to others.

Communication with crystal was easy and fast response time. The house was immaculate with the fire place on as we checked in which was a welcoming entrance. Extras like a bottle of wine, banana bread, milk, coffee tea, cereal and OJ was supplied which was a treat. The master bed was comfortable and the bed linen was so soft especially the quilt . Electric blankets were handy during the cold winter nights.  Location was perfect with wineries/pubs/bakery being a short drive away. We loved our one night stay and will definitely will be back again. Thank you Crystal
Crystals place is really nice, spacious and clean! A perfect place to stay in the barossa valley- very relaxing. Crystal left us a bottle of wine which was a very thoughtful touch!
Clean place, quiet street. Friendly and responsive host.

Lovely house for a winter family (and fur baby!)  getaway in the Barossa. All mod cons and clean throughout.  Having the indoor fire burning nicely on arrival was so welcoming. Would thoroughly recommend.
Crystal’s house is warm, well appointed and full of thoughtful touches. Great linen, well stocked kitchen and a beautiful space.

We had a wonderful stay here. The communication beforehand was excellent and Crystal gave us some great tips about where to go and eat.

The accomodation was excellent, some lovely touches when we arrived and while it was warm enough with the log fire, the electric blankets were a great touch and really, we couldn’t ask for any more throughout our stay. We would come back in a heartbeat!
A really great space! A beautiful fireplace that was lit and warm upon arrival and the host was lovely and helpful.

Crystal’s place was beautiful. A lovely house for a short or long stay - with everything you need to feel at home. We appreciated the condiments in the fridge and having soap for the shower! The house was very clean and it had small touches all around to give it that homely feel. Beds are comfortable and the house is spacious. Thanks for having us, we would definitely come back!
Lovely space, really well presented

This was the perfect getaway for us and our furbaby. The self check in was easy and communication was always clear and easy. Crystal’s place was spacious and clean. It had many wonderful homely touches. We absolutely loved the fire place and the bed was incredibly comfortable. We definitely recommend Crystal’s place to everyone, and especially for those who are travelling with their pets. We look forward to staying there again! Thank you!
Great spot would recommend
Great space that was very clean! Chrystal was easy to communicate with and we enjoyed our stay!

Very comfortable for our weekend in the Barossa. Location was great for visiting the wineries. 
Was wonderful to find the wood combustion heater lit and warming the lounge when we arrived. 
Beds were comfortable and we had    a very pleasant stay.
Great communication very quick response. Beautiful home. 10/10 for cleanliness.

We had a great time staying at this beautiful, cozy, well appointed house located in a quiet and peaceful cul-de-sac.
Crystal is a fantastic host. The house has everything and the wifi is really good.
We were very impressed with the cleanliness and extra precautions being undertaken given the current times. Very dog friendly house, so much so that our dog actually didn't want to leave! And we are very thankful to the host for extending out check out time.
Absolutely recommended this place to anyone who wants a little getaway in Lyndoch
Really enjoyed our stay. Very clean and large space, extremely comfortable bed. Loved the fireplace. Everything we needed was there for us to use. Great communication too, thank you

Great location 
Every thing you need 
Crystal is a great host with excellent communication
Enjoyed our stay. House was presented beatufully and the welcome pack left for us was greatly appreciated.  House had plenty of room and everything we needed.
You will feel welcomed and comfortable in this accommodation with very easy and friend communication with Crystal
What a wonderful place to spend enjoying family and so close to local wineries for day trips.
Great place! We only stayed for one night and had a really good time. The house was perfectly clean and I enjoyed the provided coffee. Can highly recommend.
Tidy, clean and comfortable house with good amenities.

We had a wonderful time in Lyndoch nestled at the end of a quiet street and in walking distance of the main street. Beautifully styled, neat and tidy. The backyard was a great size for dogs and the decking area was lovely to relax on. So many comfy places to sit and enjoy the surrounds. Wonderful hospitality.

We had such a wonderful time at Crystals place! Such a beautiful home with everything you need to make a great stay. We also really appreciated all the extra little touches. We will definitely come back.

What an awesome place, it really exceeded our expectations! The space is really big and stylish, with nice homely touches around the place! The addition of a bottle of wine and cereal made it even nicer, especially for the price!

A lovely, modern home close to all that Barossa Valley has to offer. Easy drive to wineries, restaurants and the local pub. Ample space to relax and enjoy the fruits of the day's tour! Very peaceful and equipped with everything you would need.
Great place to stay. Great location. Would definitely stay again
great place to stay for exploring the Barossa and surrounds
Crystal’s place is located in a quiet peaceful cul-de-sac. It was bigger than expected. Communication with Crystal was easy and she was very responsive. We would highly recommend her place!

Clean, quiet, comfortable and well equipped property. Secure backyard for the dog also. 15min walk into town for groceries, dinner and the bakery. Short drive to the cellar doors. 

Our host was really quick with communication and even left us some welcome treats.
Such a great place to stay in the Barossa. It was very clean, beautifully presented & had everything we needed.
A beautiful house, cool and charming, if you have time  some time just relaxing and enjoying the space, Trée chic
Crystal's place was very cosy and relaxing. Cleanliness was to a very high standard
Wonderful thoughtful touches, nice modern space - 15 mins walk to the main part of town and restaurants

Enjoyable and restful stay in a quiet cul de sac very close ( about 1.2km) to Lyndoch township and easy drive to Barossa wineries. Spacious and clean 2 bedroom house with one en-suite and a second bathroom & toilet and comfortable indoor and outdoor living spaces. Lots of kitchen equipment to make all our meals. Topped off by a lovely welcome pack of snacks, wine and breakfast cereals as well as coffee, tea and UHT milk. Thanks Crystal & Terry
Such a lovely home. So appropriately presented.

This is hands down, the best AirBnB my partner and I ever stayed at.  It was clean, cosy, with loads of personality.  The fireplace is nice and central, and great to curl up near it with a book or playing games.  The kitchen has everything you'd ever need, and the spa in the bathroom is a treat to relax in.

The host has thought of everything.  I know it's a bit more expensive but it's worth every cent.  We will definitely be coming here again if we are to stay in the Barossa in the future.

What a charming, beautiful cottage full of history and character. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and don’t hesitate to recommend to others. We appreciated all the generous and thoughtful touches. The rooms were spacious and beds comfortable. The kitchen was stocked up with everything you might possibly need. We enjoyed the walk to Angaston to pick up some homemade ice cream and there was a fabulous playground for the kids. For the adults, the cottage is close to wineries such as Yalumba and other attractions such as Maggie Beer. We also enjoyed sitting out in the backyard playing cards and soaking up the Barossa Valley atmosphere.

This was a charming and cute place to stay at. The bedrooms were a good decent size. Everything was clean and tidy. The outdoor area was a lovely space to relax in. The location for us to visit various wineries in the Barossa. And the hosts communicated well. Thank you!
Quaint place in a good location and handy for pets
Christina’s place is fantastic. A beautiful old style home with lots of fantastic extra touches.. would strongly recommend staying here..
An absolutely beautiful place in a fantastic location - definitely recommend!

When you talk about location this little pice of luxury is spot on.  The newly refurbished 3 bedroom house was the perfect break from reality that we were after.  The couch was comfy the heating was perfect the beds were amazing and so was the TVs and Netflix.

The kitchen was a pleasure to cook in and I can only imagine sitting on the deck (in warmer weather) with a glass of local wine and platter of produce  (which Sarah will happily organize for you) would be heaven.

Perfect for a couple, group of friends or a family as the property was totally enclosed and there was area for the children to play.  I would like to return with a group of girls so that we could indulge in a weekend of fine food, wine and fun.

Thanks for having us we had a very relaxing time.
Sarah’s place was absolutely beautiful and conveniently located. Sarah was a very kind host. Highly recommend.

Sarah's place is one of the best Airbnb homes we have experienced. The standard of accommodation and level of comfort was outstanding. The wine and cheese platter on arrival was greatly appreciated as was the great communication throughout. The location is a perfect springboard for exploring the Barossa and experiencing the charming town of Tanunda. Highly recommended.

The house is beyond amazing and the location is great! You can walk into town or you are just a short drive from all of the wineries. The house is super clean and the kitchen is fully stocked with all appliances and Utensils- we collected food from our day and then cooked dinner at night it was great! My daughter also left her favourite puppy at the house and Sarah found it and is sending it back to us! We are going to have one happy child! If we ever come back to the Barossa I wouldn’t stay anywhere else
Absolutely perfect - can’t fault anything about the property. Perfect location, perfectly styled and thoughtful touches throughout. We will definitely be back!
Great location and walking distance to everything.  Perfect for quiet get away with all the convenience of home.  Sarah was incredibly responsive and helpful.
Fantastic stay! Very clean and tidy in the heart of the Barossa!
Perfect place and perfect location for touring Barossa

We had a fabulous time - great location, facilities and service. Our host offered exceptional advice and was helped us with some local food and experience! We would recommend this location to anyone interested in exploring the beautiful Barossa!

Sarah was a wonderful host who went out of her way to make our stay convenient and comfortable. The house is fantastic, spacious and well appointed. Our only regret was not being able to stay for longer !

Beautifully appointed cottage which is sparkling clean and full of charm along with everything you could possibly need. In a fantastic location in the centre of Tanunda close walking distance to fabulous restaurants and coffee shops. Host is very helpful and responsive. Some lovely extras provided. Perfect if you are after somewhere a bit special.
Absolutely loved our stay here! The perfect house for our stay in the Barossa, beautifully styled with everything we needed. Amazing location as well!
Fantastic location - within walking distance of a Foodland and a 15 minute drive from most wineries. The house is clean and beautifully furnished, with most amenities provided.

Highly recommend this amazing accommodation.  So many special touches... well thought out and super comfy.  Close to everything... walked to dinner each night and also enjoyed one night in... kitchen was well equipped and local produce delicious. Easy communication... can’t thank you enough for the comfy beds and sharing this beautiful home.

I cannot speak highly enough about Sarah and This stunning property attention to detail amazing felt like home when we walked in a full kitchen with everything we could need and excellent communication! We were 5 ladies having a girls weekend and this will be our yearly accommodation for sure !! Thanks so much Sarah well done on an amazing property
Great location. Luxury accomodation for a reasonable price. Recommend highly to anyone staying in the area.
The accommodation is stunning, spotless, and a great location - what more do you want?
Beautiful house, perfectly located in Tanunda, in the heart of Barossa Valley. Walking distance to the supermarket but yet very quiet neighborhood. 5 ⭐️

A wonderful, spacious and well appointed home with many lovely thoughtful features. Fabulous host, impeccable facilities and beautifully designed accommodation experience that surpassed expectation. Thank you.

Sarah’s place is in a fabulous location, well within walking distance to excellent restaurants and shops. It’s a very nicely renovated home and much attention has been paid to  all the welcoming details, ensuring an extremely comfortable stay. We enjoyed our time there greatly and would love to return with friends.
the home was very nicely decorated and.cozy

Beautiful spot right in the heart of the Barossa! Perfect for a home base when wine tasting - large living spaces and bedrooms. Loved the personal touches of wine and a welcome platter! Would 100% stay again and recommend to friends :)

Sarah’s place deserves at least 10 stars. The house itself and all the amazing touches Sarah adds to it are above and beyond. Sarah was a great communicator. This place is a must stay, excellent location, super comfy and beautifully decorated. We were blown away - just loved it!
Really lovely, clean house, heaps of space yet really homely. Fantastic location too! Within walking distance to all amenities, restaurants, bakeries etc. Highly recommended!

The house is very stylish and is filled with all the facilities that make a stay carefree. The entertaining areas, especially the outdoor deck and spa, are wonderful and they transition so well from the modern kitchen area. The locality of the property is fantastic - Tanundra is on the doorstep.
Great location. Fantastic hosts. Nice amenities.
房间很温馨很舒服,干净整洁,厨房用具配套齐全｡出行十分便利,给我们带来了新的体验｡
Good spot and well appointed house. Great attention to detail and thoughtful welcome gifts.

Sarah’s Place was an absolute dream. A true sanctuary- we felt so relaxed and energized. The outstanding kitchen amenities, heated hot tub, TVs in the bedrooms and comfy couch were a stand out. We will be back again. The kids loved it.
Sarah’s place was superbly located very close to the town centre. It was beautifully set out and was spacious and comfortable. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks Sarah!

This house has been stylishly renovated and furnished. It really does feel luxurious. Being on Murray Street means that you are within walking distance to cafes and shops. We came as a group of six, and thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
Absolutely beautiful property with stunning decor. It has everything you need and is in an excellent location. Thanks for a great stay! :)
Just a terrific place to stay when visiting the Barossa. Very comfortable accommodation. Loved the open fire too. Heaps of room for our party of 6. Thanks Sarah
Beautiful home, great location and seamless service. Thanks for hosting us on our girls weekend!
Excellent location for touring the surrounding wineries and cellar doors. House was clean and had everything you could want. Would stay aha
What a lovely cottage this was.  Decorated  beautifully and in the heart of the Barossa.

This house is spectacular!!
Location is perfect, across the road from Foodland, short walk to wine bars, delicious food and gorgeous shops. The house has everything you need and more. Looks recently renovated and is super clean and homey. Beautifully decorated. We were two couples and were extremely comfortable in the space.
Even enjoyed wine in front of a working fireplace!

Such a wonderful place to stay. Location just perfect. An easy walk to outstanding restaurants and wine bars. Comfort and style make for a special stay. Welcome platter, wood fire, fabulous collection of books and Netflix make for a happy distraction. Can’t wait to visit again.

What an amazing home! The perfect getaway for 3 couples who want to enjoy a weekend wine by the fireplace surrounded by all that the Barossa has to offer. All the little touches were so well thought out! All of the amenities were amazing. Couldn’t have asked for a better stay.

A sanctuary in so many ways... When looking for a place to celebrate my husband's 50th with a small group of friends it was very hard to find somewhere that catered for 3 couples, but that wasn't so big and expensive it wouldn't feel welcoming, especially in winter. Then I found the Sanctuary and I have to say it was a pleasant surprise. The home is large enough to give 3 couples privacy but set up with enough seating and amenities to make it feel cosy, inviting and engaging. I would recommend it to a small group of friends who want to escape somewhere the same as if not nicer than home that is opulent, super comfortable and has the beautiful Barossa Valley at your doorstep. One of the best restaurants in the world (in my opinion) Ferment Asian is just a short stroll away which means you can treat yourselves to a special night out and not have to worry about driving or taxis. The outdoor deck would be great on a warm evening to sit and debate who bought the best wine whilst the BBQ cooks or a soak in the hot tub after a long day out exploring is equally as inviting and indulgent. There are lots of interesting books to read if you feel like you want to wind down and take yourself somewhere else whilst sitting in the comfy snuggle seat or take a long soak in the beautiful freestanding bathtub. This home is truly at sanctuary which ever way you look at it. Can't wait till we visit again.
Great Place.  Top location.  Nice space, big kitchen and bathrooms ... loved it!
The house is absolutely beautiful and within walking distance of cafes and restaurants. Perfect for 5 girls on a weekend getaway!
What an amazing property!! One of the best places I've stayed using Airbnb.  Great furnishings and design. The location is right in the middle of the town, winery in all directions of this house..
Nice central  location. Easy to park. Clean and stylish place, very comfortable. Great hosts who provided missing wood for fire during rainy evening! Highly recommend the place for anyone!
Great hospitality and stunning house!

This place is amazing. Great location in heart of Tanunda. Check in was very easy. We were greeted to a well presented, warm (heater put on for us), well lit (lights were on as we arrived around 6pm) and clean place, along with a delicious platter and wine. We enjoyed using the fireplace. Just wish we packed bathers, as the outdoor spa looked very welcoming. Definitely want to come back again. Thank you Sarah.

Beautifully decorated, very comfortable and a fabulous location. A perfect base to explore the Barossa or just escape from the city. The welcome platter and wine were  a lovely surprise. Sparkling bathrooms, comfy lounge, open fire. Can’t help but feel relaxed and pampered.
We had a wonderful weekend away in a truly beautiful home.
Great house, lots of good details and convenient location.
Place is amazing, perfect location.

Absolutely stunning! We had a great stay here with 5 girls getaway. It was just perfect, we got the fire going and the beds were ridiculously comfortable! It was a lot better than we imagined! Beautiful little reading nook and lots of books to choose from. Can’t recommend it enough! Perfect for couples getaway.
Great place - perfectly positioned in Tanunda.
We had a great stay here. It’s a great house - clean, stylish, spacious and well located. Sarah was very responsive and helpful. Would recommend.
Sarah’s place was perfectly located and was a big and well appointed space for our stay with friends and a little bub. The cheese board and wine was a lovely touch!
Beautifully decorated, thoughtful touches, amazing amenities

The pictures of this house do absolutely no justice. This house is beyond incredible. From the smallest things of the easy self check in, to the items in the fridge, the house was spotless, the location was absolutely perfect. Every single detail was... simply perfect. We will definitely be back and have been telling all our friends who need a weekend away to have a look at this house. Thankyou so much Sarah, no amount of Thanks will express house much having the most lovely place to stay, made our weekend away one to never forget.

This is a very premium Airbnb. The home is beautifully appointed, light clean and spacious. Amazing special touches with a cheese platter and a bottle of local wine and fresh bread from the local bakery As well as breaky supplies and a stocked coffee pod machine!
A lovely open fireplace for chilly nights and a great deck and very enjoyable hot tub !
Also fantastic location on the Main Street in Tanunda.
Thank you so much we thoroughly enjoyed our ladies gateaway!

A gorgeous house in a great location. Perfect for couples sharing, and very comfortable and stylish. It was great for our weekend away and well situated for walking into Tanunda, and the hot tub was well received after a busy day wine tasing the Barossa.
Absolutely beautiful. Super clean and had extra little touches such as heater left on, cold water and juice in the fridge etc.
We had a wonderful weekend in the Barossa . The house was perfect for three couples. A great central location from which to enjoy all the local attractions.
Impressive modern update to an old home on the main street in Tanunda, spacious and comfortable, excellent location with lots of walksbleeateries etc

One of the best AirBNB experiences we have ever had. Simply, without a lot of detail, if you are visiting the Barossa wine country, this is the place to stay! Great restoration of an old home with modern conveniences and thoughtful touches.

Sarah's place is an amazing oasis in the heart of the Barossa Valley. It's such a treat to return to at the end of a long day wine tasting. The air conditioning is wonderful for beating the heat, the spacious layout is great for groups and the BBQ, hot tub and outdoor deck make it perfect for family gatherings. Sarah has provided all the amenities you'll need from shampoo and conditioner to laundry detergent. I also loved her wall of books and other thoughtful touches. The beds are on the softer side but not uncomfortable and the linens make for a dreamy night's sleep. The back bedroom is off the road so it's super quiet and peaceful. This is the perfect spot to stay in the Barossa.

Beautifully presented home in a central location within easy walking distance of wine bars, restaurants and shopping! The home is very well equipped with everything you need! We had a great time! Thanks Sarah!
房子的位置很方便,完美的住宿
Great lace lovely and clean and loved the location
Everything about this accommodation was perfect! We loved our stay.

Lovely stay in the heart of barossa, we were a group of friends and had enough space for privacy and to hang out as a group. The home is beautiful and has all you need for a getaway. Would definitely recommend and return again!
A very nice, roomy house in a convenient location. Weill furnished and fitted out.
Lovely clean, well appointed house centrally located in Tanunda. It's very easy to walk to shops, cafes & restaurants. Parking & access are also great. Strongly recommend this house!

Absolutely beautiful 
We loved our say at this property 
Would recommend

We had the best stay at Sarah’s. The location was amazing and she went above and beyond helping us with a babysitter and a very generous welcome platter. The place was spotless and had everything we needed for a great stay. A+++
Stylish and comfortable place right in Tanunda. Walking distance to restaurants and wine tasting, short drive to all of the fantastic Barossa vineyards.

Great unique location. The Barn and surrounds is a lovely cosy choice. Close enough to explore all of Barossa, but tucked away enough to enjoy a quiet retreat. 
Wonderful friendly hosts too!

Carolyns place is incredible! We came in the middle of winter and we were so warm and cozy in the studio. The property is stunning and the bed is super comfy! Not to mention, Carolyn, her husband and sons are completely delightful and really helpful with local tips about the area. Would come back in a heartbeat!
lovely little single room beautifully renovated barn, tucked just far away from everything to feel alone, but not so far that you can't get around and enjoy the Barossa. Massive shower head!
Expect great hospitality and 'tips on places to go
Excellent place to stay

The barn is cosy, comfortable,well presented and quirky. We wanted something different to your basic hotel setup and the barn is just that. We felt like real locals waking up with rolling views.  Carolyn and her family have great knowledge of the vineyards and the local area which we appreciated. Thanks again.

Carolyn’s place was a lovely getaway. The barn itself was beautiful, clean, warm and comfortable. The bed is absolutely huge! Nice separate bathroom, a short walk from the barn. The view is beautiful! 
We had a great time staying here. Thank you so much!
Very cute and a perfect location. Thank you Carolyn for being a great host.

Thank you so much for your amazing hospitality Carolyn and William! We loved meeting you all (including Angus and Ruby), and had such a lovely time staying in the Barn. What a gorgeous place to stay! We had everything we needed, the styling was stunning and what a view to wake up to in the morning! We both slept so well on the huge, extremely comfortable king bed and will be recommending all of our friends to make a trip to the Barossa to stay in Angaston ASAP. Thank you for being so friendly and kind!!!! A brilliant mini vacay! Xxxx

We had a wonderful stay at Carolyn & William's farm. The Barn is a cosy and beautifully presented space with a huge comfy bed! It has everything you need for a short stay. The Barn is located near Angaston  and close to many of Barossa's  finest wineries and restaurants. Carolyn & William were excellent and accommodating hosts with great tips and recommendations.  We had a wonderful weekend and would definitely recommend the Barn to our friends and family!

Carolyn was very helpful and lovely. The room is 10/10 as is the location. If you're staying a few days make sure you come prepared with small goods like milk, fruit and snacks. The room was lovely and warm and the bed comfy. Would definately go back.

The Barn is a beautiful stay in the Barossa that offers peace & quiet and a lovely view. The driveway is lined with blossoming trees, the hosts are lovely & will do anything to make your stay special. The Barn itself is fantastic - beautifully styled, huge comfortable bed & has everything you need. The toilet/bathroom is a 15m walk away on a boardwalk, so no big deal. I loved the historical aspect of it. Sunset drinks on the back deck were everything we imagined in the Barossa. You won't be disappointed if you stay here!

'The Barn' is a well appointed room, the host Carolyn anticipating most of your needs before you even know you have them.  Most things you'll find in your room and it's only a short well lit boardwalk across to the amenities. Would definitely stay here again!

The Barn is the most amazing little place to get away for the weekend. The Barn itself and facilities were so modern, new and fresh. The location is perfect and just outside Angaston where anything we needed was a small drive. Absolutely worth every penny for an adults weekend away, drink some wine, eat some cheese, visit some wineries and sights and veg out.

Carolyn is a good helpful host and is creating a charming Barossa country feel. The room is an old stone barn well renovated with beautiful linen, comfortable bed and large fun. There is a nice private outdoor sitting area with country views.
However we were disappointed on arrival to find that the barn had no running water and the new  toilet and shower were 30m away up a boardwalk in a separate building. This is rather inconvenient in the middle of a cold night! To be fair the place description did say amenities were separate but it was not clear to us that this meant no en suite and the photos did not make it clear either.This needs to be emphasised in the advert as for that price one would expect self-contained facilities. We are sure when the renovations are complete this will be a great place to stay.

Absolutely beautiful location. Carolyn is incredibly helpful and quick to respond in communication and provided lovely accommodation.  The Barn is exactly as described and pictured.  Thank you for making my experience so fuss free.
Thanks for the stay! A nice quiet place to go after seeing the Barossa. Loved the bed linen.

The Barn was truly magical and was just what we needed for a long weekend getaway. Carolyn had thought of everything in regards to amentities, from extra towels and blankets to netflix and an array of delicious teas.
