We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and the peace and quiet of the Barn. Would highly recommend if you're looking for a romantic weekend away to enjoy some wine and soak in the peace and quiet.
Our stay was amazing! I would strongly suggest anyone going to the Barossa to stay at The Barn in Penrice. Carolyn is so accomodating and the Barn is in a beautiful setting.

The Barn is a beautifully located villa type home where everything you need is catered for. A great mix of old structures but modern facilities gives this place an edge on everywhere else. Would recommend.
Wonderful stay, great location, great view. Beautiful and comfortable. Biggest bed ever! Just perfect!

Carolyn and family very friendly and room was beautiful with fresh linen, lovely soft towels and beautiful view of countryside as well as great connection to Netflix. However take care when walking to amenities as very poor lighting on path to toilet and laundry at night causing a trip hazard and suggest much improved lighting. Solar lights provide insufficient lighting at night currently.
We had a fantastic stay! Beautiful accommodation, great hosts!! And so close to restaurants, wineries & sites! Can’t wait to come back ... definitely recommend!

Cute space with a rustic exterior and modern interior. Surrounding renovations under way at the time of writing and as mentioned in the description. Carolyn and her family were very welcoming hosts. Highly recommend.

We loved our stay in the Barn. Such a beautiful space with gorgeous views. 
We had a lovely peaceful visit. Would definately visit again. 
Carolyn is s fantastic host.
Great location to explore the region. The pool is a welcome relief if it is hot.
An absolutely beautiful location, room and hosts. It was perfect and I’d stay there again in a heartbeat. Thank you for making our trip to the barossa so enjoyable.
Great hospitality and a beautiful location
Beautiful space and friendly hosts. Highly recommended.

I can’t recommend Carolyn’s Air BnB enough. A welcoming host with great local knowledge that made our trip. The barn is very comfortable with a private decking to enjoy the stunning views. To top it off, Carolyn makes the best brownies! Thanks again, Tom

Highly recommended for anyone wishing to "escape" and find serenity.  A well thought out space, comfortable "large" bed and gorgeous outlook.  The toilet and shower a short stroll away from the barn wasn't a problem.  We decided to stay in each night instead of eating out as we didn't want to miss the opportunity of enjoying the sunset and relaxing in such a lovely setting.  The property is situated within an easy drive to "everywhere" in the Barossa but you still feel like you are in the middle of "nowhere"!!!
Excellent acommodation, very clean and has everything you need.
Enjoyed our stay. Bed was amazing. Best bucolic view to wake up to in the morning
Excellent and helpful host, with lots of local information for tourists. The place was spotless and serene. Sitting on that decking, watching the sun set across the hills is special.
Beautiful peaceful retreat, and there’s a pool!
Great Air B&B. We really enjoyed our stay here. Beautiful set up. Great communication from the hosts. Would recommend.
Beautiful peaceful accommodation in Barossa Hills. Close to town and wineries. Really enjoyed our stay and appreciated suggestions from host re places to go.

The perfect little retreat for a relaxing getaway! We stayed for 3 nights and didn’t want to leave. Carolyn is a very helpful & accommodating host. The king bed is super comfy & Carolyn has the place set up so well with all of the furniture & amenities. It’s hard to beat having a glass of wine on the deck watching the sunset over the fields! The lovely & spacious toilet/bathroom/shower is only 20 steps away and wasn’t an issue at all. Can’t wait to come back & stay again.
It is a lovely little getaway in the Barossa and close to all the wineries.

Was nice place & beautiful balcony & close to other towns. We didn’t have any hot water for a day so had to have a cold shower. The bathroom is away from the room and the lights walking there were very dim so was hard to see where I was walking. Also would of been good to have a sink in the room rather than have to keep walking to the bathroom area.

We had a wonderful stay and look forward to staying again in the future . Carolyn was a terrific host and made us feel very much at home . The property is ideally located a few kilometers from town and sits
beautifully in a rural setting . Highly recommended !

Carolyn is a great host, very easy and lovely to chat to. The gorgeous little barn house was way better then we expected, and had all the amenities so that my mum and I could enjoy a nice hot coffee and brekky in the mornings. Would recommend to anyone who's wanting to get away for the weekend!!
The perfect spot for a week end in the Barossa. The barn is very comfortable, the sky full of star and Carolyn and William were extremely helpful. Would definitely recommend staying there.

Carolyn’s Barn is utterly idyllic! The perfect place for a weekend away to decompress from city life. We spent the weekend wine touring so brought bits with us for breakfast and despite its secluded location were even able to order a pizza at night! The room is very cosy, heating and a great big bed. The separate bathroom didn’t really bother us, just maybe bring your slippers so you don’t need put your shoes on every time you need to go :)

What a wonderful accommodation! My partner and i loved how it was so homely and the short walk to the amenities weren't a problem at all! 
Carolyn gave us a range of great suggestions for what to do in the Barossa which were perfect. We spent hours driving around the Barossa valley.
Would definitely recommend the place to anyone heading to the Barossa!

We had a midweek stay at the gorgeous Barn and it was the perfect spot to explore the beautiful Barossa . Comfortable bed and lovely extras, loved the coffee :) 
Thankyou to Carolyn for the local suggestions which took us to places we would not otherwise have found .
Great location, a lot of history, easy access to the Barossa Valley wineries.

What a beautiful place to have spent a couple of nights at to give us access to the Barossa. Well appointed facility with all we needed. Sitting out on the patio with a bottle of red & some cheeses while the sun was setting was pretty special. Nice location to be able to get out to explore the region as well.

We throughly enjoyed our stay, the barn was beautifully renovated with luxurious and stylish decor. It had everything we needed and was close to excellent wineries and restaurants. I would recommend this accommodation to any couple looking to experience the Barossa Valley.

Fantastic location (close to all the wineries, food places and historical townships) just out of Angaston, the room is very private and open space with a cool layout looking out to the valley view.   The room offers everything you need and more.  If you are looking for a classy escape, this is your place with very friendly hosts.  Thank you again, Samuel & Mel.
Exceeded our expectations. We enjoyed everything about our stay. The premises, the location and the hosts were exactly what we were after. Thankyou so much.

We had a great time at the Barn. It was peaceful and beautiful and exactly what we wanted. Close to Angaston and Tanunda which had lots of good and drink options, not to mention a winery on every corner! Carolyn and William were great hosts and gave us lots of tips for the area. Would definitely recommend the Barn!

Carolyn and William were amazing hosts! The Barn was absolutely lovely and beautifully fitted out. The bed was very comfortable and the amenities were great. It was lovely to sit out on the private deck and look up at the stars. Despite the heatwave while we were staying, the Barn was very cool with AC and a fan. It was also great to have a dip in the pool. The bathroom is very close and no issue to get to. There were lots of brochures and guides in the room for guests and Carolyn kindly gave us some personal recommendations, all of which we loved! The location was great for getting around the Barossa. We were really impressed with the whole experience and will definitely be back the next time we come to the Barossa.
Outstanding hospitality, property and accomodation. Would highly recommend staying here :)
Amazing and beautiful place, very comfy and well located, had a great time! Definitely recommend to anyone staying in the Barossa region

This was hands down the most beautiful Airbnb I have ever stayed at. The barn is incredible, the views amazing and Carolyn’s hospitality and recommendations for exploring the area were amazing. I’m counting the days until I can come back!

Honestly amazing! Couldn’t recommend staying here more.
Carolyn and William have thought of everything. So beautifully styled throughout and the location is just perfect.
Carolyn also provided us with wonderful suggestions for dinner and breakfast that we are so glad to have tried. The perfect weekend in the Barossa made so by having such a wonderful place to come back to. Thanks so much again :-)
Awesome stay

My husband and I had a wonderful weekend at The Barn. The room was beautiful, with lots of thoughtful touches and a very comfy bed. We loved our stay there, especially sitting by the pool in the afternoon with a glass of rose. Highly recommend and we’ll be back!
Amazing place with a lot of character. Very comfortable and stylish room
A perfectly located and luxurious sleep with everything the Barossa has to offer at your door. Enjoy the calm view before you start a day of great food, wine and wandering.
Amazing location near angaston, views of surrounding farmland and rolling hills. Stylish space and great hosts, would stay again.

The Barn is exactly as described and a lovely place to stay. Everything was immaculately clean and stylishly decorated. The facilities were great, very modern and clean. Carolyn and her partner are lovely hosts and it was a pleasure meeting them both. The night sky is outstanding in Penrice, you can see so much detail in the Milky Way. We enjoyed the local visitors too including a kangaroo, kookaburra and watching the neighboring sheep. Thanks for a relaxing stay!
My partner and I loved our stay at Carolyn's place. It was the perfect weekend escape and we loved all of the local tips Carolyn and William provided. We will be back!

This little barn is beautifully finished with thoughtful touches. The French doors lead to a private deck that overlooks the rolling hills and perfect for your morning coffee. This barn has all the amenities that you’ll need. The host provided great local tips
We had a lovely time. The Barn was warm, great views and the bed was so comfortable.
Beautiful property and house that has everything you need included. Bathroom was lovely as well and very close to the house! Great hospitality and stay overall!
Awesome experience and stay. Nice and quiet, welcoming and amazing views at both day and night, highly recommended

Really nice to be just out of town with a proper country feel. The concept of building a small village is excellent and this building is a great part of it and really well done. Lovely little place for the middle of winter and a short cab ride from the nearest town. Perfect  central point for a Barossa stay.

We loved our stay here - very cosy. It was cold and rainy during our stay which made the trek to the separate bathroom a little bit tricky, but the room itself was so lovely that it more than made up for it. We would definitely stay here again!

The photos of the Barn did not do justice to the space (I mean that in the best way possible)! It is absolutely stunning, loved that there was coffee beans and tea, the gigantic bed with heated blanket, the cordless charging ports was a special touch, the deck and outdoor space was perfect for our brunch with food from the Farmers Market. The bathroom and kitchenette was only a short walk along the pavement/deck. We had already planned out the weekend for my partners birthday, however if your stuck for ideas Carolyn was more then happy to offer local ideas and there was plenty of magazines, brochures and a home made guide book to the local area in the barn. I would absolutely recommend this place to any couple looking to get away to the Barossa.
Great Little Spot, good value for money.

Very clean, great facilities and a beautiful room! Some really nice thoughtful touches that really does make a difference. The toilet and shower is seperate to the room however still private and not really an issue! Definitely recommend when staying in the Barossa.
The Barn was all we hoped for, the bed was enormous
A great experience :)

Fantastic place to stay! The place was clean, comfortable, and had plenty of extra little bonuses such as wireless charges for phones, Bluetooth speaker, and lots of tea/coffee options. For anyone staying who is worried about having a bathroom separate to the main building, it is a VERY short distance away and was not an issue at all. Bathroom was clean and tidy, and had a fantastic shower with a rain shower head! 5 minutes drive from the main town Angeston and 10minutes to a heap of great wineries, we had a fantastic time and highly recommend this place as somewhere to stay!
Beautiful spot to relax and forget your worries...will be back!
Lovely place would recommend
Fantastic little place for a weekend getaway!
Fantastic relaxing place to stay. Very peaceful and had everything you need to unwind. Great location and not too far from anything

This place is one of the best we’ve ever stayed at. The photos really don’t do it justice; we were in awe constantly with the beautiful property. Not to mention Carolyn’s amazing hospitality too; it was the perfect stay! Will definitely be back ☺️

Beautiful space in a lovely setting in the Barossa region. The room is so comfy and beautifully styled and has everything you need. There are terraces for sitting outside the room and a covered living room space next to it where we sat with a cup of tea in the morning looking across the garden. The bathroom really is a short little hop from the room and is beautifully done with a great shower.  Carolyn is a great host, quick to communicate and gave us good tips for the area. We only stayed one night but would definitely return next time we’re in the Barossa!
Lovely little place for a quick stop over on our way to the Flinders Rangers

Such an amazing weekend away. The most gorgeous cottage, so private. The separate bathroom is not a problem. The bed is huge and I miss it!!! Carolyn is a great host and very helpful with recommendations. STAY HERE!

A truly beautiful barn - the space was characteristic & cosy :) Not to mention, amazing views, especially from the loo ;) Carolyn was such a welcoming, easy going and helpful host! 
My Mum was in awe of the assortment of tea provided & we both very much enjoyed the recommendation for our lunch outing! Oh & the attention to detail exceeded our expectations; from an umbrella by the door for when it drizzled and beautiful flowers around the place, everything had been thought of ! We definitely hope to visit again someday :)
Great location, great communication, would recommend to others visiting the Barossa region.

This is why AirBnb exists! The Barn was so comfortable and made our trip to the Barossa. The bed was huge and the heater / air con unit meant it was so cozy. It was well kitted out and beautifully designed. It was just so unique and we spent half our time eating cheese and drinking wine on the decking. We didn’t know what to expect from the outside bathroom but it only added to the experience. Getting a good look at the starry sky made it all worthwhile! Thanks to Will and Carolyn for being exceptional hosts.

Loved our two nights at ‘The Barn’, definitely worth more than a night to soak up the country amosphere. Not only is the sleeping accomodation charming and wonderfully inviting, that huge billowy bed requiring the obligatory lay in, but the cosy but spacious sitting and cooking area ‘the pug house’ is delightful to while away a comfy hour or three with a book or bottle of local wine. There are numerous dining in and take away food places open till quite late within a 10minute drive but the pug house was so inviting we shopped at the local iga and cooked a full meal both nights with the adequate facilities and soaked up the twinkling candlelit ambience. If you love to get away from it all yet have everything at your fingertips Carolyn’s is that spot. Highly recommend. Ps, the night visit to the luxury loo is a starlit wonder to behold if you don’t see the heavens often.

The Barn literally has it all!!!!not only that it is very stylish and worth every cent!!! William and Carolyn were great hosts, so helpful and offered some great tips on where to go in the Barossa.
A must stay!!!
Beautiful, comfortable and thoughtfully decorated/designed - thank you we loved it
Carolyn's place is great! Rustic with a sense of luxury and comfort. Carolyn has thought of everything to make the stay as welcoming as possible. Great place to stay when in the Barossa :)
A fantastic stay, extremely comfortable with a beautiful view. We loved it and hope to be back one day soon!

I stayed at Carols Airbnb for 2 nights & the space Carol & her husband have created is perfect for a country escape or if your looking for affordable accommodation near the Barossa.
The king size bed was super comfy, the cottage & the seperate bathroom was super clean & although the toilet & shower are seperate from the cottage it was not an issue & literally just a few steps away.
The private decking area attached to the cottage is a great peaceful space to have your coffee in the morning, a glass of wine in the evening or just to sit, relax & read a book. There was a big electrical storm one of the nights of my stay in which the power was out for a few hours & Carol was quick to make sure I was ok & to see if I needed anything. Comforting considering I was staying there on my own. Thanks so much for your great hospitality Carol

The Barn far exceeded our expectations. Carolyn met us on arrival and gave us a brief tour of the space before leaving us to relax. The bed was incredibly comfortable and we spent some time enjoying the sun and drinking wine on the outdoor patio.

Carolyn and her partner were kind enough to lend us their barbecue to make dinner one evening, and always made sure we had everything we needed. Absolutely one of our favorite AirBnb locations we have ever stayed in. We couldn't recommend this enough! Thank you again Carolyn.
the barn is a lovely place to stay for peace and quiet! very earthy and pretty!

Carolyn has done a beautiful job decorating the small stone barn, the king size bed was very comfortable, the location is so quiet at night, stunning night sky to view the stars. We enjoyed having aircon, a ceiling fan, smart TV and a space to prepare simple meals. Carolyn was a great host with prompt communication.

Very luxurious and relaxing spot within easy reach of everything in the Barossa Valley. Really well appointed and tastefully decorated. You don't want for anything here except a nice bottle of local wine to enjoy on the back deck. William and Carolyn are great helpful hosts.
Quirky, quiet, comfortable and  very close to Angaston yet great 'bush' feel

Wow wow and wow!
I’m not really one to write reviews but this little gem really is something else. 
We absolutely loved our two night stay in the barn. Carolyn has thought of everything. 
Exactly as described and even better than the pics. 
The most beautiful and comfortable big bed, seperate cooking/dining area if you wish although the beautiful little town of Angaston is only a 5 minute drive. We came for a weekend from Sydney and I just want to do it all again
Very relaxing, awesome stay.  Great hosts. Highly recommended.

Incredible accommodation, and the best Airbnb experience I've had. Carolyn and William have done an amazing job restoring the historic buildings, the photos dont do it justice.
You can simply arrive without having done any research or planning as they have included a fantastic guide to the wineries, food, tours and experiences you can do in the region. I had spent a lot of time looking into what to do beforehand and picking up their guide was much easier than searching through multiple websites. 
Can't recommend this place enough, we'll be back for sure!

Great place to stay while experiencing the Barossa! Very comfortable stay with beautiful outdoor areas to relax in. The barn was charming, cosy and the decor had clearly received a lot of attention to detail. Still had all the modern facilities - pretty reliable wifi, smart TV, streaming services, a portable Bluetooth speaker, A/C and a massive, comfortable bed. The back deck and outdoor couch were quite private. 

Toilet and shower were a short (and well lit) walk along the deck and were both modern and clean. Access to the pool was great during our summer stay. Carolyn and William were very hospitable and up for a chat, but certainly not overbearing. Definitely would recommend.

Delightful place in Penrice, barely removed from Angaston and Tanunda. Picturesque, cosy, so many thoughtful touches. Beautiful to look out onto the hills during the day and stars at night. Had we stayed longer we could have had a go at the pool and barbecue. Would highly recommend this to couples looking for a romantic getaway.
Thank you very much for the lovely stay, tips and most importantly the good humour. Could not recommend the barn more highly!

We had an excellent stay at The Barn and would highly recommend it. Every convenience has been thought of and attended to. The decor is beautiful, and there are a number of luxury touches: huge king sized bed, wireless phone chargers, chrome cast, Netflix and Stan, private deck in addition to the pool and bbq areas. It was really outstanding
Beautiful little barn - lots of lovely little touches and really close to the centre of town. It was one of the hottest weekends we've had all summer and we were super comfortable. Thankyou!
A lovely little getaway with everything you need. Beautiful location and a stylish stay. Hosts were lovely and very accommodating. Definitely recommend.
Cute and cosy. Comfortable space. Great location.
lovely barossa rural space. I wanted to show my partner a rural space and this was perfect. beautiful room, lovely pool and space outside to look at the stars!

Charming accommodation.  Definitely recommend staying if you are looking for a unique experience as the bathroom is a very short distance from your room. Great for star gazing. Everything was clean and tidy with attention to the small details. We loved the the super sized king bed which was extremely comfortable. Carolyn and William were great hosts and we enjoyed watching their playful puppy and kitten playing together much like the movie “Milo and Otis”.

Highly recommended, friendly and gracious host. You will love the effort the host have put into the decor, and the little thoughtful touches dotted around the place. The rear deck is perfect for star gazing. This place has charm by the bucket loads. Don’t forget to ask the Carolyn & Mike for dining recommendations.

I was excited to stay here because it seemed interesting and looked beautiful, but it was honestly even better than I expected. Most comfortable bed ever, and I loved sitting on the deck with a wine, watching a kookaburra hop about nearby. Carolyn was very welcoming and friendly, and gave us a great suggestion for a bushwalk when she found out that's what we wanted to do. Would love to stay again.
A perfect place to stay if you're visiting the Barossa. It is a good space in a nice location with great hosts.

We had a great stay, Carolyn and William were great hosts and the barn was perfect. Although you are not that far from their residence, the barn is super private with it’s own outdoor space as well as the pug lounge. Is close enough to the towns to not be inconvenient, but far enough out to escape the noise/light and to feel very secluded.

What a perfect weekend we spent at The Barn!!! It was the most relaxing little getaway. William our host met us on arrival and gave us a tour of our weekend property. Only a short drive to Angaston which has great food options. William told us about the Farmers Market on Saturday mornings which we picked up some amazing local produce for our weekend stay. Highly recommend staying here, we will definitely will be staying here again.
5 stars! The perfect little place to stay and relax.
High value house close to everything tanunda has to offer. Tuoi’s restaurant is seriously good too.
Nice place in a really nice area, host was understanding of our need for early check in. Greate experience.
Wonderful stay in the heart of Tanunda. Lovely house and perfect for a weekend get away in the Barossa.
Great stay. Fantastic location in Tanunda. Thanks Tuoi!
Tuoi's place certainly exceeded my expectations! It was amazing, very accommodating and great location. Highly recommend!

29 Jane was the perfect place to stay during our visit to the Barossa. Our group of two couples had ample space and the house was clean with all the amenities needed during our short stay. The house is a short walk to the town centre of Tanunda which was perfect for our dinner at Tuoi’s restaurant, FermentAsian. Tuoi was an amazing host, both at the accomodation and restaurant. I would highly recommend the accomodation and restaurant if you are travelling to the Barossa.
Great place to stay! House is wonderful and really clean.
Toui's place was fantastic we could not have asked for a better host or amenities and the location was also terrific.

We had a fabulous stay at Tuoi's and it was perfectly suited to our group of 4 adults and 2 kids. The yard is a great play area and the house was so clean. Tuoi was great to communicate with and really helpful with nice touches like bringing us milk and providing high chairs for us.

This 3 bedroom home is a great find! The pool & backyard space was lovely & peaceful, & the kitchen was great for some self-catering. It’s also a great location in relation to the town. Tuoi was a wonderful host & we were lucky enough to dine at her brilliant restaurant, FermentAsia. We all highly recommend both.
Great space the Sonos system and pool were an added bonus

My husband and I enjoyed our stay at 29 Jane for our wedding anniversary getaway in Tanunda. The house is tastefully decorated and the bed and sofa is very comfortable. The pool and backyard area, with its lovely greenery, is serene and relaxing. The backyard and house is suitable for a family getaway with 3 bedrooms, a well equipped big kitchen, and swings and a sandpit area in the backyard. Tuoi is a warm and helpful host, and showed us around and explained things on check-in. Thank you, again, Tuoi! My husband and I have been huge fans of Tuoi's restaurant, FermentAsian, for several years now - the food is amazingly delicious, fresh, and just a wonderful balance of South East Asian flavours. FermentAsian is one of our all-time favourite restaurants. We highly recommend both this accommodation and the restaurant.
Jayne and Glenn, Adelaide, SA.

We had a wonderful stay at 29 Jane Place for a girls weekend. Her place is beautiful and clean, she was easy to communicate with and very warm and welcoming, and dinner at her restaurant FermentAsian was one of the standout meals on the trip. There is a lovely large well maintained backyard with a pool and we especially enjoyed the speaker system she has throughout the house as well as the pool and garden area.

Beautiful renovated house, the outdoor area is amazing for kids. Easy walk to Tanunda town centre. Lovely host. There is a small amount of comings and goings to the outdoor garage down the side of the house, as people collect things for the restaurant.
A fantastic find, handy location - central to everything. Comfy beds and the pool area was a great place to relax. We will be back.
Tuoi's place is a luxury home in a great location with pool and Netflix for the kids. It was perfect for our family from grandparents to the kids.
An amazing place would stay again next time in the Barossa.
Nice place, in the main  bedroom the bed sheets were dirty and the shower  has a very low pressure. But overall the house was really beautiful and comfortable.
Lovely spot to enjoy the beautiful Barossa Valley.  Tuoi's restaurant is a dinning experience not to be missed.
Location is great and place is fitted to a really high quality (Eg. Kitchen, bedrooms, speaker system). The highlight is the pool and outdoor living area which is great for families.

Perfectly positioned in town and enjoyable and comfortable in every way. The quiet street was terrific. Checking in was a breeze and everything was clean and comfortable. The outdoor spaces are wonderful. Will definitely stay again.
A heated swimming pool  is pretty good. The host is friendly and kind. 3 big bedrooms. Bath water is difficult to control  It is either too cold or too hot.

We had a great stay at 29 Jane. It was a great location to explore all the Barossa has I offer and it provides a great space to relax as well. It was lovely meeting Tuoi .. she is a lovely host . We live to come back

Tuoi’s place was fantastic! She met us personally at the door with fresh fruit and milk. A spacious and well appointed house with a great sound system set up and everything you could use need. The best part was the pool and kid friendly backyard - we loved our stay there thanks Tuoi for having us !

Great little place within walking distance of the Main Street. Very quiet street close to all the town amenities. Tuoi greeted us when we arrived and made sure we had everything we needed. Highly recommend dining at their restaurant fermentAsian in town - phenomenal wine list and food to match. Will be back!
Lovely place, nice sized rooms. Backyard would be fantastic in summer with kids and the pool. Tuoi warmly greeted me on arrival. Thanks for having us!
Great place to stay.
Was a great home in a lovely location. The swings and toys in the yard were so lovely for our little girl to play with. Fabulous hosts!
Great house in a great location with everything you need. Tuoi is a wonderful host and made little touches to improve our stay. Make sure you try out her restaurant Fermentasian as it's fantastic!
Highly recommend.  Very clean and great location

A cosy house perfect for couples or a girls weekend away. A short & easy walk to town centre with everything accessible.  Heating was toasty warm for the winter too.
Tuoi also looked after us at her restaurant & the food was absolutely amazing. Each visit to the Barossa is a visit to FermentAsian.

Great modern fitted house, 3 huge bedrooms in the main house each with king sized beds, 1 large annex building with another king bed, kitchenette and bathroom. Fabulous kitchen with all the appliances you'll need, dining and living space would fit 6 comfortably. The house is in a great spot for seeing Tanunda and is a great central location for wineries in the Barossa Valley. Tuoi greeted us at the house with milk and extra info for our stay which was a lovely touch. The house has incredible speaker systems throughout which was great for our group. The house was so lovely and warm even with the terrible weather we experienced during our trip. We will visit again in the warmer weather and take advantage of the lovely pool in the garden!

Great house with modern furniture.
Located in a nice area and it’s convenient to walk to Main Street.

Tuoi's place was just the perfect getaway for our family of 3 in the Barossa! The house was super clean, beautiful appliances to use, the beds were so comfortable and the garden perfect for our son to run around and play in! We walked everyday to breakfast on the main St of Tanunda, and then dinner at FermentAsian. Perfect house in a perfect location!

Tuoi’s place in Tanunda was gorgeous and walking distance to the Main Street. Tuoi was so responsive and friendly. We had such a great time exploring the Barossa Valley from our fabulous base in Tanunda. Highly recommended!

Very clean place with great features, pool was amazing, very accommodating host who let us check in earlier. Communication was fast and clear
2 small things that should be noted are; it’s directly across from a school which wasn’t something we were expecting and the 4th bedroom and 2nd bathroom are actually a granny flat.

We were 6 adults and a toddler and this house suited everyone. It is in a great location - easy walking distance to the main strip of shops and cafes. Particularly loved the large bedrooms and the kitchen / appliances. My grandson thoroughly enjoyed the swings and toys in the large backyard - I only wish it had been warmer to enjoy the lovely pool area. Great stay in a wonderful part of Australia

This Airbnb is in a great location within walking distance of Tanunda’s main (Website hidden by Airbnb) is also across the road from a primary school so there is some noise during the day.The main house is a renovated bungalow that still has a few quirks (like a light switch on the ceiling!). There are three spacious bedrooms with comfortable king beds and one (Website hidden by Airbnb) annex has a further bedroom and (Website hidden by Airbnb) stayed as a family with two babies and were glad that the heating worked well,the kitchen was nicely set up for cooking meals and the laundry facilities were easy to use.The vine covered outdoor pergola and pool area is lovely.Perfect for relaxing with a glass of local wine.
Fantastic house to stay in, needed to stay there longer to get to enjoy everything!

We travelled as two couples with two children. We had a great time and the accommodation was fantastic. The location is very central to Tanunda with all amenities close at hand. The host is wonderful and approachable and very knowledgeable. Loved this place - and we’ll definitely be back.
Tuoi was an amazing host! She made sure we had everything we needed. The house was perfect, would definitely go back.

29 Jane  is in a great location to be able to walk in to town and also has great off street car parking.  The pool is a bonus after a hot days wine tasting and a beautiful  place to sit and relax.  The property was clean and the beds super comfy with great cotton sheets, with all 3 bedrooms being spacious.  Tuoi was a helpful host and on hand to answer any questions when we phoned.
A wonderful get away.
Great house in a fantastic location with a great host

This 4 bedroom home was the perfect place to stay with other couples for a weekend in the Barossa. It was close to many wineries and the other towns. The Main Street was an easy walking distance from the house with plenty of eating options.
We enjoyed sitting around outside listening to the great sound system and Tuoi was just a call away when we couldn’t work out how to operate it.
We had a lovely weekend.

We had a wonderful stay here. The house was amazing and had everything we needed for our short stay. 
Tuoi was very easy to communicate with and always responded promptly when we had questions, and she very kindly let us have an early check in and late check out. She was a wonderful host and I would definitely stay again next time I’m in town! Thank you!
Great place to stay, close to the Main Street. Fabulous for a group and in summer.

The location of Tuoi's house is excellent.  An easy walk to the main drag and its shops and restaurants.  The kitchen was well equipped, the place spotless.  As a host, Tuoi could not be beat.  She arrived to check us in, gave us a quality bottle of wine, and made us a reservation at her restaurant, FermentAsian.  We've been traveling all over Australia and we haven't had a better meal than we had at FermentAsian.  Do NOT miss making a reservation there.
Tuoi is a friendly and helpful host. Her big older house is very clean with a modern kitchen. It was easy to find and we enjoyed our stay in the Barossa.
We all really enjoyed our weekend away. Everything was fantastic, can not fault anything.
Great location, great place!

Lovely renovated house with a gorgeous pool and outdoor area. Ducted heating kept us toasty warm and the sound system is fabulous. The bedrooms are all spacious with comfy king size beds. 3 bedrooms are in the main house with the 4th is in a separate, very large ensuite studio out the back. The kitchen has the basics for cooking, but if you need anything like platters or bowls you'll need to bring your own. The lounge and dining area is quite small and would be a bit of a squeeze if you had 8 people. Fantastic location close to the town centre. A perfect place to chill for our girls weekend!

A sensational location for 4 couples to stay and relax.  Location is a short easy walk to Tanunda main street, with multiple restaurants, cellar doors, pubs and shopping nearby.  The kitchen is well appointed, the beds, soft and comfortable.  The sound system is fantastic.  Host was amazing, met us at the home and showed us around.  Fermentasian is a must!
Fantastic location and great communication with Tuoi!

Awesome location, only a 5 min walk to the Main Street. The Bose music system was a wonder and the smart tv allowed us to watch great movies at night. Kitchen was large and well laid out, great to cook in.
Beds were large and super comfy. 
Look forward to coming back in summer to use the amazing pool. 
Thank you.
Good location
Beautiful house for a relaxing weekend away!
A comfortable rest in a convenient location, quality facilities as described and a multi-room sound system for bonus points!
Beautiful space with great pool. Walking distance to most of Tanunda’s best spots. Very clean
Amazing space for a larger group, located close to the main road. We loved our stay here with easy access and great amenities.

Great prompt communication and flexibility with adding another person to my booking. 

While all of the finishing and amenities provided were great there were a few basics I felt were missing. There was no tea (we bought a big box and left it) there was no basic cooking items like butter and oil (we also bought and left), and no tea towels or hand wash in the kitchen. We also bought a tea towel and left it. 

I also felt that a bbq would have been great, and the host did offer to bring one over. 

Lovely wine glasses and dishes as well as bedding and blockout curtains.

Lovely place to unwind with the family and so central to the main Street. Great facilities and beautiful pool with music system throughout the house. We all had a lovely stay and wished we could have stayed longer.
Great location, extremely clean, good communication with host. Will stay again
Thank you for having us. The pool was a winner with the kids and we loved the location.
Wonderful stay! Wish we could have been there for longer. Loved the pool, outdoor area for children and fresh and clean sheets and towels.
Perfect for families, we loved our stay.
This place is amazing! Can’t recommend the location & accommodation highly enough! Thank you so much for having us

Thanks for a great stay. Awesome location close to main street, well appointed house, pool and outdoor area with Bluetooth speakers make for a relaxing experience. Great kitchen. Handy off-street parking. Host was very responsive and helpful. Would stay again in a heartbeat.

A wonderful place to stay for a girls weekend. A quick and easy walk to the Main Street, right into town! The pool and outdoor area is a lovely addition to the home, and for those of us sharing a room the beds and amenities were spacious. 
The kitchen is very well stocked with a range of high quality cookware and appliances.
Beautiful space to enjoy & relax. We loved the pool!!

Great location, not a big area inside for 8 guests and no protection from rain outside, no platters, salad bowls, barbecue and limited kitchen items 
Pool was a life saver in the heat, but no chairs or umbrella 
House is clean, beds comfortable but broken shower screen and door, back door didn’t slide open well, fly screen torn, house needs some maintenance to bring it back up to perfect 
Air conditioning was fantastic and lots of hot water 
We felt that the cellar door was a safety hazard for kids 
We have had a rental beach house which was fantastic, so a little let down compared to what we supplied to our guests 
We also had 2 strangers walk around the back garden whilst we were there to get stuff out of the shed, no notification or knocking on the door to see if that was ok! We felt that that was quite rude
Lovely quaint house, close to everything. Clean, excellent facilities and delightful hostess. We would be happy to recommend. Hopefully will be able to stay there again one day.
Great entertaining location, will def try and go back.
Greeted up promptly and showed us all the features and helped us with the cool aspects like full house music system! Definitely recommend

Great house, great location. Amenities beyond what we thought. There were 7 adults in our family & never felt on top of each other. Will definitely book again. Thanks Tuoi for all the work that goes into making a difference
Stunning place with lovely personal touches, all the amenities you need and perfect location close to cafes shops and restaurants. Would definitely recommend a stay here!

We really appreciated the heritage significance of the Goat Square Cottages. Our suite was roomy and very comfortable with modern amenities while still maintaining quaintness of another time. Kim’s cottages were in a great location. John St was close to the Tanunda shopping & restaurant area and so it was an easy walk for us. Really enjoyed our stay & hope to come back again next year. Perfect

Fabulous location: close walking distance to centre of town, tourist info, bicycle hub, cafes restaurants.
Historic accommodation with well equipped kitchen and bathroom.
Nice garden to relax in.
We definitely would recommend and stay again.
Greatly enjoyed 1918 restaurant, Red door expressing, and hiring bikes to tour the area. Favourite wineries for ambience and meals/ picnics - Peter Lehman and Seppeltsfield (for artisans and other products.

Great little cottage, quaint and charming , thoughtfully and tastefully restored.
We had everything we needed for my husbands and my short stay.
Handy location with an easy walk into the town of Tanunda.
Would recommend if heading to the Barossa, especially in the cooler months- very cosy!

We enjoyed our stay in this historical house and would stay again. There are two other apartments. We were in the middle and terribly aware of other parties...which led to some tip toeing around late at night. Everything is provided...bread, tomatoes, milk, tea, oljve oil, bacon and eggs...and oh a bottle of gorgeous wine. Great location, very clean and king sized bed.
Perfect spot for a few days in the Barossa
Amazing and quirky!

Kim’s Cottage is a beautiful heritage property in an historic part of Tununda. It was spotlessly clean and had a number of thoughtful touches. It was conveniently located so that you could walk to surrounding restaurants and facilities. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend to others.
Charming heritage cottage in the heart of Tanunda.  A pleasure to visit!

The perfect long weekend in the Barossa. The cottage is beautifully set out, cosy, and spotlessly clean. Bed was extremely comfortable and the fireplace was an absolute treat! Couldn’t fault our stay.
Great location and great accommodation

Perfect spot for a trip to the Barossa. Great location and comes with everything you need.

Host was also very helpful.
A great little cottage. A perfect place for a get away

The cottage was quaint and quite well equipped. Being tall was a small issue with low door ways. It was an extremely hot night but the aircon in the bedroom did a good job.
If you want something a bit different and step back in time these 1840 cottages are the answer.

Location is great and cottage is comfortable with a nice historic feel. We would normally try to stay outside of town and did not realise when booking that this was in the think of it but we made the most of this with nice morning coffee runs to great cafes on main street and a late afternoon wine tasting at 'Artisan's of the Barossa' at the end of the street. Nice to learn a bit about the history of the town and the street as well.
Slight communication breakdown over breakfast provisions was a little disappointing but did not detract from the enjoyment of our stay.
Place is well appointed with nice clear and functional kitchen and bathroom and a comfortable bed. We would definitely go back again!

The cottage is a wonderful comfortable space that connects you to a previous era in a contemporary way, a perfect base for exploring the Barossa. The little touches like breaky provision and wine are a lovely treat from Kim and his team

Goat Square Cottages are a great place to stay in Tanunda , Barossa Valley as they are a wonderful part of history of the area . Centrally located , well equipped , quaint cottages and to top it off , provisions are supplied to cook a delicious breakfast for the number of days that you are staying . We loved having breakfast out in the back garden with the lovely trees and the fragrant herb garden .
Great place to stay.
A well renovated older building in Goat Square. Lots of provisions were supplied.

If you are looking for a comfy place to stay in Tanunda, look no further. Walk to everything in town. Beautifully quiet and comfortable. Loaded with history. You won't go wrong at Goat Square Cottages.

Super cozy cottage, in the absolute best location. You are within 10 minutes drive of pretty much anything in the Barossa, which helps you make the most of your time here. Also only a couple of minutes walk into the main street of Tanunda, with several fantastic restaurants and wine bars for the evening.

Francis and Ann are wonderful, welcoming, caring hosts who have created a warm, comfortable and beautiful space for guests. The cottage is spacious and tastefully furnished, with great heating/cooling and a lovely shower. There are extra touches that add to the sense of welcome - books to read, a lovely tea pot and cups, a bench beneath a spreading oak tree. Remnant bushland is a short walk from the cottage, and a delightful place to walk and soak up the beauty of the South Australian scrub - complete with kangaroos and lots of native birds. While the cottage is close to the owners’ house, they have gone out of their way to preserve my privacy. I have truly had the most relaxing, refreshing weekend. Thank you!

Francis and Anne gave us a warm welcome! We immediately felt relaxed in the lovely bush land surrounding us. The cottage is sparkling clean, beautifully done and full of thoughtful little touches to make our stay comfortable. While the cottage is near the main house our privacy was respected. Anne also offered to collect pizza for our dinner so we could relax  The walking track around the property was lovely, and we awoke to kangaroos, galahs and parrots outside our door.  The forest nearby is great for exploring and the drive up from Adelaide was very scenic. An idyllic weekend escape for us. Thank you both

A beautiful self-contained Cottage in the South Australian countryside. Lovely facilities and very thoughtful hosts. you might want to stay a few nights, as it is such a short distance to the Barossa Wine Region. We only got to one winery and realised there was so much more to explore. Excellent if you are looking for a tranquil retreat.Thank you Anne and Francis for a memorable and very enjoyable stay.

We absolutely loved staying with Anne and Francis. It was so quiet and peaceful, and sparkling clean. We felt so welcome and our hosts were really helpful with local advice. This place isn't far from the heart of the Barossa so it's a perfect location. The wildlife on the property was an amazing bonus! Thanks so much to Anne and Francis for giving us a wonderful and relaxed weekend away

The cottage is cute, cosy and clean. We had a fantastic stay! The place was beautiful. Francis and Anne were very hospitable and took us for a walk around the 20 acre property and showed us their family of dogs. The cottage is out the back of the house so if you want your own privacy you can have that. We chose to interact with the hosts a lot which was really enjoyable. The porch of the cottage was a highlight, sitting there with a tea/coffee watching the birds, dogs, and nature was very peaceful. 

Highly recommended!

Quaint cottage in the woods - spacious timber / kit imported from Czech and with 3 way triple glazed windows, lots of light, french doors, wildlife nearby, Sheridan Linen, brand new, great shower and fittings, amenities and nice touches - flowers, chocs, etc. Awesome stay!! Near to their home but you don't feel that at all.

Francis and Anne’s place was fantastic. Woodland Cottage is in a beautiful and secluded location and the walking track was wonderful. Anne and Francis were very accommodating and helpful. We found this place to be very clean, stylish, comfortable with everything you needed and perfectly sized for two people. The bathroom and shower was excellent. Furthermore, they clearly explained the area, and offered a guided tour of the property. I honestly think this is a bargain. We would definitely stay here again and we highly recommend this beautiful cottage.
A beautiful cabin with everything you need for a comfy escape. The bird life was delightful and the walks in nearby forests were relaxing and enjoyable. Thoroughly recommended

We stayed for just one night, but wish we could stay longer.  Francis and Anne were most welcoming and cordial.  The cottage is sparkling clean and fresh, well equipped for tea/coffee and a light breakfast or snack (microwave, toaster, kettle and a small fridge).  The hosts attend to it with great attention to detail.  The bed is comfortable with high quality linen and towels.  Some chocolates and the fresh flowers were a nice touch.  
In the middle of the bush and near Mt Crawford forest, the air is  clean and fragrant, pleasure in every breath.  Several options for a nice walk right around, and plenty more of really picturesque walks within a short drive.   
A nice added bonus is the joy of watching the amazingly playful puppies (though they are already much bigger than most dogs we ever met).  Thank you Francis and Anne!

Thankyou Francis and Anne for allowing us to stay at your lovely cottage at such short notice.  For such a short holiday it served its purpose well.  So peaceful and calming amongst the native bush and wildlife.   We loved all the extra touches and your hospitality as hosts was exceptional.  Will definitely come back again at another time of year to see the changes in the flora and fauna.   Thankyou,   Donna and Michael.
Awesome place to stay for a weekend away with the Barossa wineries and hills nearby.
A wonderful experience I recommend to anyone.

We were warmly greeted upon arrival and shown around the accommodation and the area. Fantastic facilities and a very lovely cabin. Would highly recommend for anyone looking in this area. A great opportunity to see local wildlife too.
A beautiful getaway. Gorgeous hosts and very adorable wildlife visitors.  Definitely recommend, I'll be back!

We had a lovely stay on this beautiful property, and enjoyed meeting and chatting with the lovely hosts. An amazing walking trail on the property and a very homely and cozy cabin. Would recommend staying here to anyone.

Lovely stay in a relaxing cottage! Easy to find and great communication! Cottage was extremely clean and a wonderful space! Beautiful Wild life at your doorstep! Thank you Francis & Anne! We look forward to returning soon!

Francis's place was perfect- cosy, secluded, modern,clean and everything you need for a ultra comfortable stay. We were lucky to see kangaroos and beautiful native wildlife outside the cottage. Truly a lovely experience. Highly recommend.

A wonderful cabin set on the boundary between Adelaide Hills and Barossa makes for a great go between if you want to visit both in a short period of time. While it’s away from any amenities- it suited us perfectly as we could see the stars, woke up to kanagarooa and birds and could feel totally unplugged. Francis and Anne were very attentive and made sure we were settled and happy- super hosts!
Francis & Anne’s retreat was lovely, clean & nice. Thank you for the accomodation we appreciated your hospitality.
Nice clean and tidy unit on a large property next to the forest
Great place to stay. Amazing wildlife practically at your door step.
A self contained cottage, very clean with new bathroom. Air conditioner if cold in winter or hot in summer. Restful location
Great place

Quaint cottage set amidst a lovely woodland area.  Its warm & cosy, not to mention sparkling clean!  Hosts are very amenable & I would recommend this lovely place to anyone visiting the area & looking for a special place to stay.

Exceptionally clean. Lots of little extras. Don't let a lack of a kitchen put you off. You can still make a decent breakfast with the microwave, toaster and kettle and the supplied weetbix, tea and coffee (and little chocolate ball balls ).
Friendly hosts. Recommended.
Comfortable, self contained cottage set in a pleasant bush setting and located close to the attractions of the Barossa Valley wine district. Hosts Francis and Anne were extremely helpful.
A serene, cute little cottage surrounded by beautiful views!
Great little cottage adjacent the main house for a tranquil weekend getaway.   Hospitable and friendly hosts. Everything you need for a relaxing weekend.
We enjoyed the cottage, the surrounds, the wildlife, nature walk and great hospitality shown by Francis. Highly recommended
Loved loved the cabin on the peaceful property, the hosts were so friendly and the cabin was sweet and thoughtfully set up

What a wonderful hidden retreat. Francis and Anne were fantastic hosts. The scenery, wildlife and location were perfect. The accommodation was spotlessly clean, well presented and provided exactly the right amount of creature comforts and privacy. Both my wife and I would highly recommend staying here.
Great stay in the Adelaide Hills. Very clean and spacious cottage.
Very close to nice places to hike.

Such an amazing place.  Relaxed gateaway deastination. It was so peaceful we wanted to extend our stay. Highly recommended.
Thank you again Francis, such a caring host.
Nice spot in touch with nature.  Lovely hosts.
Great place for the value. Amazing location and an even amazing host.
A good place to stay to unwind and explore the area around.

A very serene, peaceful location - perfect for a complete 'getaway' and ideally located between the Barossa Valley and the Adelaide Hills.  Comfortable, welcoming accommodation with lovely touches such as fresh flowers and chocolates.  Thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
The cottage was clean and comfortable for our stay.
Excellent Cottage with great air-conditioning and amazing hosts!! Loved staying there and would do again!

Francis’ place was wonderful for a short getaway. As a stepping stone for visiting the Barossa or hiking at Mount Crawford it was perfect. Their cabin is peaceful and surrounded by nature. Great local knowledge too and Francis and his wife were extremely friendly and helpful.
Francis’ place is beautiful. Spacious, clean, and nestled in beautiful wilderness. So many gorgeous birds, and close to nice hiking. Mini fridge and microwave were helpful!
Loved sitting on the verandah watching the wildlife. Great location to pop across the road for a hike along the trails in Mt Crawford pine plantations. Gracious host.
A peaceful location to stay

Perfect for a one or two night stay close to Mount Pleasant and the Barossa.  Francis’ place is easy to find, and a breeze to check in. The bedroom and bathroom are light, comfortable and spacious. It’s quiet and Francis is welcoming and friendly.  Plenty of thoughtful touches such as tea, milk, chocolates and weetbix. We will stay here again when we are in the area for a weekend.

Staying at Francis's was an absolute delight and absolutely faultless. He is the most wonderful person we've ever had the pleasure of meeting and the accommodation was very very comfortable and well catered. Cannot speak highly enough - we will DEFINITELY be back.
Great position in South of Barossa to circle the area

I loved that it was clear the hosts were available to me if needed, but that they were respectful of my privacy. This charming, and comfortable cottage in beautiful bushland surroundings provided me with the quietude and peace I was needing.  The visits from birds and kangaroos were a delightful bonus.
Fantastic location and lovely cottage....♥️

Secluded but accessible location.  Warm hosts with excellent helpful local knowledge.  Modern cottage well suited to a couple. Great bush walking available on the property and in nearby Mt Crawford Forrest.  Saw Kangaroos, Echidnas and many birds.

Great, cosy cabin a few minutes away from hiking at Mount Crawford. We enjoyed sitting on the deck watching the birds feed in the garden away from any traffic. We appreciated the greeting on arrival, restaurant recommendation and cleanliness.

The studio is pretty and exactly as described. There's a comfortable bed, large bathroom, armchairs,  tv, books, local information and fridge,  microwave, cutlery and crockery. We took precooked food to heat up and this worked well. The path through the bush block is beautiful. We had a great lunch at Casa Carboni in Angaston,  went for local walks, and went to the excellent Mt Pleasant farmer's market. Francis is a generous host whose love for, and knowledge of the local bush is obvious.
Francis’ place was beautiful. It was lovely and clean and Francis was a great host.

Francis was extremely welcoming and hospitable throughout our stay. Cabin was immaculate and beautifully presented. Well insulated with modern heating and amenities, would come back for the mattress comfort alone! Great place to get away and relax.
A lovely place to stay
Lovely little cottage with a great host. Plenty of lovely little towns to visit not far. A peaceful place to relax after all the exploring.
An absolutely beautiful and peaceful place to stay. Beautiful surrounds, and nice and private. A very restful weekend.

We had a wonderful get away. The cottage was perfectly clean. Francis is a great host who gave us tips for the best places to go/eat. The cottage felt like home. The scenery around the cottage is gorgeous. Will definitely go back there

We loved everything about Woodland Cottage, it was very cosy, clean and comfortable and super relaxing. The native bushland on the property was very special and we loved seeing the Kangaroos and birds. It was a great location for us to go bushwalking and explore the region with lots of excellent suggestions for places to visit. A very beautiful and peaceful part of the world and our hosts very friendly and welcoming.

Really nice place and location, Francis was very welcoming but still gave us privacy. Everything  we needed was provided and had a very warm comfortable bed. Nicely styled place, loved the big window out the back where we were greeted by kangaroos practically at the doorstep!
Anne and Francis were both lovely hosts. It was perfect for a quiet night away. The room was as described, and looking out into the scrub with kangaroos hopping around added to the charm.

Very clean cosy space, great walk around the property. Had everything I needed and Francis even showed me a lot to do in the area. My personal favourite was the scenic drive map he created for his guests.

Francis and Anne were great hosts. Their property is in a great location, next to Mt. Crawford Forest and near plenty of country towns to explore. 

We enjoyed the local birds and fauna literally at the door step to welcome us on arrival.

Highly  recommend
Great place!

Our stay was lovely,  the cabin is fabulous, sparkling clean, beautiful location. Walking trail on property is stunning and adjacent walk in Mt Crawford Forest stunning. We loved our overnight stay and would recommend a stay at Woodland cottage.

We really enjoyed our stay. The cottage is rustic while still having modern amentities and the grounds are really nice. We loved seeing the kangaroos and Francis' hospitality. This is a great experience and amazing value.
Cute little cottage in a serene area

Francis’ place is lovely. It’s perfect if you want to experience the Barossa Valley. It was sparkling clean. I highly recommend this place!! 

Francis is really kind and made us really good recommendations about wineries and places of interest.

Absolutely peaceful cottage tucked away in the Adelaide Hills.  The extra touches of fresh flowers and chocolates were wonderful. The bed was superb and lovely thick towels. 
Wonderful spot to stay for the night.
Awesome cottage. Quite area, sparkling clean and amazing orchids in the nature walk.
Charming cottage set in a wooded area, host is very amenable, cottage is clean, warm & cosy. Would definitely recommend it.
Really nice and lovely place to stay near the nature. Clean and cosy! Great location!
Lovely place and very peaceful. This was our second visit to Woodland cottage and we loved it. Great location for bushwalking and exploring the region.

Very restful rural location. Good walks nearby plus wonderful short natural bush walk on the property. Irish Wolf Hounds (on the other side of a high fence) provided added interest. Variety of birds come to feed just outside the front verandah.

Really enjoyed spending time relaxing at woodland cottage, plenty to enjoy outdoors we just sat and stared at the beautiful garden listened to the birds and when it got dark we stared at the stars and enjoyed the silence.. it was awesome. Francis was very welcoming and respectful to the private space. I will happily return again for another mini retreat!
A perfect retreat in a stunning location, lots of walking trails and wildlife close by. Francis and his wife are excellent and thoughtful hosts!
Francis’ accommodation was warm, comfortable and cosy. We had a relaxing time surrounded by local wildlife and enjoyed exploring the area guided by tips from Francis. Thanks for having us!

Very cute Scandi cottage, stunning flowers all around when we stayed. Francis is very knowledgeable about the various flower species and gave us a private tour of his little sanctuary. Will certainly stay again!
Great space! Amazing host and great value
sparkling clean, comfortable amenities in pleasant bush surroundings
Lovely cottage set amongst a wooded garden. Warm, cosy & peaceful. Great hosts,

Beautiful cottage in the woods! 

Lots of privacy and great little kitchenette for basic microwave meals! 

Great location,  would definitely recommend :)

This cottage was incredibly beautiful to stay in! Francis and Anne’s property is absolutely stunning and situated in the heart of Barossa and surrounded by bushland. Their hospitality was amazing and we ended up staying an extra two days. It has been our favourite airbnb stay and we recommend it for any nature lovers or people wanting to explore the adelaide hill regions!

Our stay at Francis and Ann's was our most favourite AirBnb stay so far. The cabin was so lovely - spacious, clean, quiet and so very stylish. Ann and Francis were the perfect hosts; they were nearby for anything we needed. So say that we enjoyed their nature trail would be an understatement - what an amazing place they have. We're already planning our next visit and are very much looking forward to seeing Ann and Francis again as we enjoyed their company so much! Thank you for having us at your place!
We loved our time at the cabin! It was beautiful among the forest. We really liked all the walks close to the place. Perfect place for a getaway!!

This little place was the perfect place for our one night stop over  We had everything we needed for the nights stay and the space was sparkling clean! Such a lovely secluded place, and the hospitality was very warm and friendly from Francis and his wife Anne. Hope to stay again one day! ♥️

Francis’ place was beautiful; spacious and stylish with thoughtful touches throughout and down to the beautiful fresh roses in vase. The environment is in bushland; peaceful and ambient. We saw wallabies and sat in the sunshine out the back as it set. Wish we’d stayed longer
Perfect stay, highly recommend

The accomodation on Francis’ property was a gorgeous space. Perfect for getting away from city life for a few days. We greatly appreciated the hospitality we received, and information of the local area. The walking track on the property was lovely, and the wildlife was a highlight for sure. Would visit again!
Francis was a wonderful host and the cottage was really comfortable and cosy.
A very pleasant little place. We hope to be back again soon!
The cottage is beautifully clean and comfortable. Francis is very friendly, helpful and generous - a great host!
A very beautiful place to stay with a wonderful host!

Great quiet location in nature
Friendly, welcoming hosts
Thank you

An absolutely sensational place - set in a peaceful, natural bush setting with the delightful sounds of native birds in the background.  
After a frantic year we were looking to completely unwind.  I spent hours reading on the propert and when we felt like it we just jumped in the car and were minutes away from all that Barossa has to offer.   We also loved how we could easily reach the Adelaide Hills via some beautiful scenic driving.  
The cottage is adorable and spotless with a fridge and toaster and microwave.  Francis and Anne are fabulous hosts, it felt like we were staying with dear friends but had the privacy of your own space.  Francis provided some fabulous local insights.
We are delighted to have stayed here and hope to return next year again!

Beautiful cottage. Francis was very kind and helpful in providing information about the surrounding area and also showing us the cottage. Would recommend anyone looking for time away from the city to strongly consider staying here, you won’t regret it! I would return.

Lovely, modern cottage set amongst native Australian bush. We saw a few kangaroos up close and had a beautiful view of the night sky,
Francis was a wonderful host and provided some helpful local suggestions. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would be more than happy to return again.

Francis' place is perfect if you're looking to get out of town to somewhere very quiet, and is a good location for access to the Barossa and Adelaide Hills. The setup is very simple but functional and Francis was a lovely host with an excellent knowledge of local orchids.
Peaceful and relaxing weekend away! Thank you!

Francis’s immaculate cottage is an ideal place for a quiet and secluded stay in a rural setting. It is well maintained, clean and well appointed  for a comfortable, peaceful and enjoyable stay. Francis is readily on hand for any problems, queries or tips on activities, sights etc as he is a long term resident with an intimate knowledge of the area. We highly recommend it!

Normally I will search in the higher price bracket in AirBnb listings to stay in a quality environment and quality accommodation. This place is way too inexpensive for what is on offer. Where do I start? Small but roomy cottage in beautiful bush environment, secluded and rural but with the owners in the house separate but alongside you feel safe and secure. Francis and Anne respect your privacy but will give you a warm welcome and be available if you have any questions. Thank you Francis for sharing your valuable knowledge and expertise and thank you Anne for your cheery and friendly chat. This is an environment where nature is respected. Now to the cottage... Very cute, impeccably clean, TV reception good, great shower, comfy bed. As for the environment it is paradise, bird song and various species sighted and/or heard. Private outdoor sitting area. No kitchen sink/stove etc but microwave/toaster/jug is all you need. After all a true holiday is no cooking lol! Nice shower, good air-conditioning. Memories of sitting outside at dusk listening to nature with a glass of red in hand. This place has got to be the best value listing on Airbnb and we've been to a few!

What a beautiful space Francis has created. We had a lovely stay and felt completely at home. Francis was very welcoming and ensured we had all that we needed. I must say, the bed was particularly comfortable, which was a pleasant surprise, as Airbnb accommodation doesn’t always provide this. Thank you.
Nice cute cottage

As a single female traveller I felt very safe staying in this wonderful cottage. It was a rather exciting stormy night and I loved listening to the sounds of the wind and rain whilst tucked up in the most comfortable bed. I also very much enjoyed a short walk around the woodland and spotted some kangaroos. Thank you so much to this wonderful couple for a lovely night away and for their plentiful tips to explore the Barossa valley.

We enjoyed a 1-night stay at Francis's little cottage which consists of a main room with bed, two armchairs, table, and kitchenette, as well as a spacious bathroom overlooking a large oak tree and gardens. Francis was very welcoming and responsive to our questions. We enjoyed being immersed in the landscape - the sound of rain on the roof, smells of the eucalypts as we walked along their bush track, the rooster crowing at dawn, the friendly howls and barks of the beautiful Wolf Hounds, and the family of wood ducks waddling past for a feed. While it may not be everyones cup of tea, we would definitely stay there again.

Amazing stay!! Anne and Francis' little cottage is gorgeous and they are incredibly friendly hosts. As we were quarantining, they made sure we had everything we needed and even offered to get us dinner. So accommodating and will definitely stay again.

Francis was a warm and welcoming host. The cottage was adorable, in between a beautiful natural setting. It is  perfect for a get away. It was sparkling clean and cozy. Would definitely recommend staying here, the value for money is amazing!

Ann and Francis were very welcoming hosts. The property is really amazing and the cottage as well. If you're looking for a quiet place away from everything, this is the perfect one! Thanks again guys!

All the reviews are true. Lovely hosts, lovely little cottage. 

It is an out of the way location. Some will love this, some won’t.  No kitchen, no wifi, not great mobile reception. If this isn’t your thing then don’t book and then complain.

Francis and Anne made us a feel at home, they are very approachable and gave us great  suggestions and recommendations. The cottage is  spotless and is situated in a quiet bush setting with a beautiful walk on the property itself. it is the perfect location to explore the Barossa Valley and Hanhdorf. There are also plenty of bush walks nearby. We had the perfect balance of peace and quiet and activities to make our 5 days stay very enjoyable and relaxing.  I highly recommend a holiday in this great location.
A great space tucked a way in the Adelaide Hills with many little towns only 20 minutes drive away.
Very cozy and lovely place to stay with a great host!

What a little gem of a place. Close enough to Mt Pleasant yet far away from humans! Great stay, we will be back. 
Brok and Maggie.

Beautiful little cottage to stay in, peaceful and quiet location. Wonderful hosts that were so happy and patient with me, especially grateful to them for letting use the cottage to get ready for my wedding and have numerous people, cars and trucks roll through. Would definitely stay there again and recommend for people to stay there
I can recommend Red Gum Retreat to anyone looking for a country experience close to the best attractions in the Barossa Valley.
Very friendly and helpful host. Home was spotlessly clean.
Cosy cottage in a beautiful setting
Great location, great host. Highly recommended.
Lovely old fashioned country/farm style house perfect for a wine-country getaway. Excellent location and Erika was a friendly, helpful host. Lovely garden and surrounds.

The trip to Ingrid’s was amazing - very charming location and right in the middle of the Barossa Valley.

Ingrid was super helpful and suggested some fabulous places that we would never have discovered on our own.  The house was delightful and there was all the provisions we would need for breakfast.

Highly recommended.

This comfortable and spacious house is located in a quiet town near the Adelaide Hills and Barossa Valley.  It is well equipped and has all the amenities required, including central AC which was very handy during the hot summer days. There are beautiful scenic drives around the area. Ingrid was a very welcoming host and was concerned for us - provided very useful information on travelling  around the area in hot summer conditions and also on local attractions. She was very easy to communicate with. We were also provided with many breakfast provisions and catered for specific dietary requirements.

This is AirBnB at its best: period charm meets modern luxury in this immaculate and thoughtfully presented home. We just loved all the thoughtful touches, the breakfast provisions were ample and decadent, the bathroom and kitchen were generously appointed, and the location was superb. The home is absolutely spotless and everything is to hand. Our daughter adored sleeping in a canopy bed and cried when it was time to leave. An absolutely wonderful stay; we'll be back. Thank you, Ingrid.
A very comfortable old house, close to Adelaide Hills and Barossa Valley wineries.
Lovely stay in a quiet location but was close but to wineries. Great touches with breakfast, coffee machine and toiletries!
The host is really nice and helpful. She did her best to make us feel home also provided us with some yummy goodies for breakfast ☺️
Charming old house which was very cosy with the fire burning. The breakfast provisions were more than enough and we enjoyed a lovely weekend. Erika was a welcoming host and all went smoothly.
A very comfortable and relaxing weekend had in this cozy cottage, the breakfast provisions, thoughtful touches & personal hospitality shown were greatly appreciated.

Welcome excellent. Attention to detail faultless.A very much loved home, spotlessly clean with many warm and welcoming touches. Fireplace brilliant. Location excellent. Interior of home spacious and outlook to private gardens a delight.
Highly recommended. This place has a soul. The owner obviously cares very much about her home and the comfort of her guests.
In a nutshell.....Outstanding!
Had an amazing time exploring the region. Wonderful accommodation, warm and cosy by the fire and plenty of breakfast provisions . Thank you to our wonderful host for your splendid hospitality.
Lovely fully equipped house with big fireplace, huge garden with plenty of fruit trees, very friendly and helpful owner, surely will come back again!
A must stay if you are in the Barossa. Wonderfully warm cottage with amenities, and such a lovely owner. Definitely recommended for a long weekend
Great location and lovely old house.
Fantastic service. Great breakfast ingredients!
Lovely place for a quiet weekend. great fire.
Great retreat in a stunning old house with a beautiful garden. Erika was a wonderful host. Thank you for the experience.
Beautiful location and property set back from the road so felt very private and quiet.
Nice and cosy in a classic old style house. very clean and comfortable
Lovely spacious house, full of character. The host was very thoughtful. Great breakfast offering.
Great place to stay for exploring the Barossa wineries.
A fabulous home, a thoughtful and caring host, spotlessly clean, heritage charm but with every modern convenience.  We love staying here. Thank you.
We really enjoyed our time at Erika's place. An incredible place, peaceful and a short drive from some of Barossa Valley's great spots! The host was very friendly and super fast with communication.
A beautiful heritage cottage with all the mod cons necessary set in a truly tranquil setting. The perfect location for relaxing with a bottle of wine bought from a local vineyard.

location  - perfect. We cooked the breakfast supplied on the BBQ and it was... perfect. Erika's place is in the middle of blissful serenity. Close enough to the big towns for wine tasking. Close enough to the local pub to be away from it all. All the thoughtful details are catered for. Clean, comfy... perfect. Close to coffee, food and wine. My recommendation is a trip to the markets or a local supermarket, local cheese, local wine and enjoy an early night in
This was a great base for a weekend exploring the Barossa. Very cute cottage and a short walk to the local for dinner. Thanks Ingrid for a lovely weekend!
This is a stunning place, we really loved the decor and friendly welcome.

Erika has a beautiful home. Exceptionally clean and the house contains all that you could need including a spa bath! Erika was a really nice host who greeted us upon arrival and was quite quick at responding to messages. I would highly recommend Erika's place to other guests as it is a comfortable home and you get value for money.

Great place to stay when doing some of the many hiking trails in the area. Nice to come back to a home away from home. 
Erika is such a lovely lady, was very accommodating. 
House was clean, and the bed was so comfy. 
Will definitely be back

Red Gum Retreat B&B is a rustic cottage set back from the road in Williamstown. The owner Erika was very welcoming & surprised us with bountiful provisions for a cooked breakfast & a bottle of wine! Nothing has been forgotten. The cottage is very well appointed & has everything you need to compliment a long or short stay. The bed was very comfortable, the kitchen had all utensils & cookware available for making a meal. Tea & coffee are provided as well as shampoo, soap, towels etc. Although we stayed in June,  the cottage was kept warm with reverse cycle heating & a fire with all wood provided! The location is perfect for exploring the Barossa & surrounds. We could not have asked for a better stay, thank-you so much for your hospitality Erika!
Beautiful house and location, fantastic quality and very accommodating host. No complaints, we had a brilliant time. We didn't want to leave!

A beautiful, cosy cottage with all the amenities for a very comfortable stay. Ingrid even checked our dietary requirements and provided us with a delicious breakfast that suited our needs. We would happily come back!
All questions answered quickly and Erika is a wonderful host showing us how everything worked upon check in!  We loved the wood fire and spa and the bed was very comfy!! A cosy get away we loved!!

Great, fast communication and we were met upon arrival and shown how everything worked. The wood fire was wonderful, and the spa was so relaxing. Such a beautiful place, and a great location to explore the local area and the breakfast provisions were delightful!

Beautiful old cottage with a mixture of old/modern amenities. Clean with the most comfortable bed. Host Erika Is lovely and greeted us and supplied breakfast provisions. Communication was quick and she emailed prior to our stay for any dietary requirements.
