A beautiful cottage set in a beautiful location overlooking one of Lyndoch's beautiful vineyards! Nice and close to most wineries and restaurants. We had a great stay in May of 2019 and would definitely consider booking with Nelly again when we decided to visit the Barossa again.

My now Fiancé and I had an absolute amazing time. Perfect place for me to get down on my knee and ask that big question under the rotunda.

Nice and close to everything in the Barossa and definitely somewhere we will be back to enjoy. 

Thank you again Kelly and see you soon

Nelly's place was brilliant for us - the location is incredibly picturesque, the amenities (especially the bathroom!) are really luxurious and Nelly was super easy to deal with.  Thanks for a great stay!

My partner and I stayed here for a weekend away in the Barossa and we honestly could not fault our time at Nelly's cottage. The photos truly do not do it justice and our expectations were exceeded in every way! The view and location of the cottage itself were incredible. The bathroom and Spa were sparkling clean and an absolute luxury to have...Everything that you could possibly need had been thought of and provided. The bed was one of the comfiest we had both ever slept in. We would highly recommend  staying here. Nelly was an incredible host who went and above to accomodate our needs. Thank you Nelly!

Very happy with our stay. The accommodation was exceptionally clean, the linens/towels were amazing (so comfy!) and the space was perfect for a weekend of wanting to stay in, drink wine and sit in the bath! Thank you! ☺️
Beautiful view, great ammenities and exceptionally clean.

Very clean and well presented cottage with stunning views! A couple issues with some things but once we contacted the host they were very quick to sort out and were very apologetic and gave us a bottle of wine. Very romantic spot for couples to escape and relax in style.

Beautiful place to stay and enjoyed playing tennis before doing some wine tastings. Tennis rackets were provided to borrow the day we arrived. 
Great communication and hospitality. 
Stunning views of the vineyard, very clean and had all the amenities for a very comfortable stay. 
Will definitely be booking in another weekend away here soon.
Beautiful location, beautiful place and Nelly made checkin so easy :)
This place does not disappoint 5 star A1 place to stay
Awesome location set amongst the vineyards

Thanks Jodie for a fantastic stay in the Barossa! Such a great location, just a short walk to the main street for cafes and restaurants in Tanunda. The house was immaculate and had everything we needed for a very enjoyable and relaxing weekend. We'll be back!
Loved it. Would definitely stay again. Very clean. Very appealing decor. Appeared to be new. Great breakfast hamper too.
excellent headquarters for a trip to the Barossa

Jodie’s property is truly a gem. 
Located in the heart of Tanunda, you’re close to all of the Barossa’s finest wineries. 
Jodie takes the time to make the house welcoming and as accessible as possible, providing us with treats and necessities for our stay. 
Everything was perfect and I can’t wait to come back!

The house has everything you could want. Very clean and well equipped and Jodie made an excellent host. A short walk to the Main Street where you can find some wonderful eateries. I would recommend to all my friends and family.

The house is perfect for either work or personal trip- walking distance everywhere, comfortable, clean, stylish, and lots of little thoughtful bits that make the stay easy. Jodie was lovely and easy to communicate with - highly recommend and we will be back!

Jodie’s place and Jodie herself were amazing. The location was fabulous, walking distance to cafes and restaurants! 

It was a beautiful little house with great linen, towels and little touches! 

Thank you Jodie, I would definitely recommend this place and would stay again if I was in town again.

What a wonderful Tanunda Gem!  Superb location, so close to the centre of Town, within walking distance to the shopping centre, parks and eateries.

The house was immaculately clean and comfy. We appreciated the special touches like the breakfast hamper, your welcome, directions, recommendations and really enjoyed our stay.

We highly recommend your house to anyone visiting the Barossa and we'll be back next time we're in the area.
Beautifully presented house, personal touches where great, perfect location too! I highly recommend Jodie's house!

The house is well-decorated and BRAND NEW. It's clean and cozy and equipped with kitchen appliances. The whole neighborhood is quiet and peaceful. My wife literally had the best sleep ever since her pregnancy. 

It's located at the heart of Tanunda so pretty convenient. Walking distance to some great restaurants. My parents took a nice walk around and discovered amazing views along the road.

Jodie is so friendly and nice. She had everything prepared before our arrival and offered some great tips. Thanks to her we really enjoyed our Barossa trip.

This place is ideal for families or anyone who is looking for somewhere relaxing. Will come back and definitely worth it.
Highly recommended.  Easy walk to main street shops, supermarket, takeaway .... and I don't like walking  ;-)
Jodie was an excellent host and her house is super nice and there was very clean. Highly recommended!
Spacious, ideally located modern vibe to this gorgeous house
Spacious place on a good location in Barossa Valley. The only concern is the place has no wifi provided.

This very neat, clean and tidy house was such a pleasure to stay at. Very close to all the things that Tanunda has to offer. This place was presented exactly as was stated & Jodie is a lovely host by having the air-con on before we arrived & little frozen treats in the freezer for us to combat the SA heat. Was a pleasure to stay in this lovely house. Thank you Jodie
Beautiful home in a convenient location while visiting Barossa valley.
Fantastic value, great location. I can’t imagine too many places better than this in Tanunda.
Beautiful accommodation, fantastic location and an amazing host!

A beautiful, clean and very comfortable home only s couple of minutes walk to the Main Street of Tanunda.
Jodie is easy to deal with and very accommodating and the home is awesome value for money. We will definitely stay here again!
This property is ideally located, very spacious and well kept and communication and check-in was incredibly easy. Would recommend for groups visiting the region.

Fantastic 3 br house to stay in while you visit beautiful Tanunda.  Jodi the host is so accommodating and helpful especially if you need to know what Tanunda has to offer. The house is very well located only minutes from Murray Street by foot.
beautifully comfortable, spacious, sparkling clean home in a great location. Host Jodie easy and prompt to deal with and was very flexible and kind in catering for all our needs.

Immaculate house in the perfect location. We couldn't fault anything about the house or our experience. The set up of the house is well thought out and you wouldn't want for anything during your stay. Its such a lovely quiet but central location. We loved the park across the road for the kids and that it was a quick walk to some lovely restaurants and for coffee in the morning. We would definitely recommend this house, you could very easily settle in for a longer stay.

Jodie’s house was the perfect location if you are visiting the Barossa Valley and staying in Tununda .Just a very short walk to the Main Street And restaurants.
The house had every amenity that you could possibly need whilst on holiday .
Amazingly clean and tidy and very well furnished and decorated .Along with well stocked cupboards and a generous breakfast basket in the fridge it was the perfect place to stay with my family whilst visiting Tununda .Thankyou Jodie
Great location, great local knowledge, spacious accommodation and nice finishing touches. We’ll certainly coming back to the beautiful Barossa! Thanks Jodie.
Very clean and comfortable.  Great communication from the host.  Close to town, perfect position for heading to town on foot. Perfect stay in Tanunda, would recommend to family and friends.

This charming and modern neat as a pin cottage was a stone's throw from the main street and very handy to  Bars, Restaurants and shops. Full of top notch amenities such as washer, aircon and large back deck to relax of an evening. Central to the Heysen  Trail and Maggie Beer's Pheasant Farm. I would highly recommend it.

Jodie's place in Tanunda is better than described. It was so clean, and as soon as I opened the door it just smelled so fresh and delicious. The house was secure, warm and cosy with good heating, a lock up garage to put your car in, and very quiet. The check in process was a breeze, and communication easy. The location is second to none, being right off the main street and walking distance to restaurants and supermarket. We had a plumbing issue our first morning, but Jodie was on to it immediately and it was fixed quickly. She even offered an extended checkout to compensate, but we were hardly inconvenienced. I would happily recommend this to anyone.
Thanks for allowing our guests the stay. I trust everything was to their liking.

Jodie's house is a perfect home from which to explore Tanunda and the beautiful Barossa Valley. Only a few houses from Tanunda's main street and many excellent restaurants, wine bars and shops, Jodie's house is spacious, beautifully presented and set up with everything you could need. Jodie was a fabulous host, providing a very welcome basket of goodies for breakfast and coffee pods for the Nespresso to get us all going! The kitchen was well stocked with crockery and pans etc so we could easily cook our own meals. We didn't use the laundry but it looked fully stocked also. The bed was really comfortable and Jodie provided plenty of pillows, cushions and extra blankets, as well as coat hangers in the wardrobes. She was also an excellent source of information and recommendations on the local restaurants and tourist attractions. Don't miss Fermentasian if you're in the Barossa, and Tanuda's wine bars are great fun. Can't recommend Jodie's house highly enough. Thank you Jodie!

Exceeded our expectations!! The house was so spacious, exceptionally clean and cozy and Jodie prepared so many thoughtful touches for us. The kitchen was very well equipped and we enjoyed a lovely home cooked meal here. Location was fantastic! It’s close to all the wineries and the main strip of Tanunda. Thank you again and we will definitely recommend this place to anyone wanting to visit the barossa!

Jodie’s place is an incredible base to explore the Barossa from! The house is within easy walk of Tanunda, which is a lovely town.

The house is clean, comfortable and extremely well-equipped. We were able to cook easily and had everything we needed. Jodie also thoughtfully provided breakfast foods for us during our stay, which we really appreciated! 

Thank you for such a wonderful experience, Jodie! We would definitely stay again!
Well located, very clean and comfortable - Jodie is a great host.  Will certainly recommend it to others.

Sensational location and a fantastic place to stay with family or friends. The photos donor do it justice, simply beautiful.
The inclusion of a breakfast food hamper was excellent.
Everything was exceptionally clean and had the comforts of staying in your own home.
Great location to walk the Main Street of Tanunda and take use of the food options available.
Would highly recommend this place as an option to stay. 
Jodie was wick to respond to messages and provided us with an early check-in and late departure.
Fantastic communication beforehand. Great location in Tanunda. Really well equipped and the basket of goodies in the fridge was really appreciated - just perfect experience
This is a very central location in Tanunda walking distance to Main Street and tons of wineries close by
Perfectly located, super clean, all you could ask for really. We loved Jodie's fridge hamper and pantry full of essentials such as coffee pods, chips and muesli! Thankyou for a lovely weekend.
Fantastic place to stay in Tanunda, extremely well presented and clean plus very convenient to so many restaurants and shops. Thank you Jodie.
We really enjoyed our stay at Jodie’s house. It is comfortable and clean with great amenities. It is in a fantastic location very close to town but nice and quiet. Highly recommended.
A fantastic place to stay in the heart of Tanunda! Clean, comfortable and wonderful place to stay with a really great host!! Lots of extras included! We will definitely be back.
Lovely place to stay

Jodie’s place is a wonderful home in the heart of the Barossa. It is extremely comfortable, well equipped with everything you need and with many added extra special touches. The home is very spacious and could easily accommodate a family. Jodie keeps the place beautifully.

Everything is fantastic at Jodie's.  From the welcome pack (full of lots of local goodies which saved our bacon :) on arrival) to the super comfy beds (we slept like babies).  The house is in the perfect location with the best bakery pies just across the road.  Supermarket around the corner, coffee shops (so good!) and restaurants all walking distance.  Note:  we took our elderly father so little things matter.  There was a good strong chair with solid arms for him to sit in and watch TV.  He could get in and out of it easily.  There are NO steps leading into or inside the house. And the showers do not have steps or a step over either.  Everything was perfect! Highly recommended.
Beautiful house & Jodie is an excellent host. So many little touches that make the visit that little bit nicer! Perfect location. Thank you
Great location to the shops, just a short walk to great coffee and many shops. Sparkling clean

Jodie was a wonderful host. Her place is very clean,modern and she thought of extra special things like a bottle of bubbles on our arrival. Felt very comfortable staying there. We will definitely stay again.

A great place in a fantastic location. A new place with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms had everything we needed. The super-sized TV was great for watching the cricket. A very short walk to lots of great dining options like Musque, Fermentasia and Vino Lokal. Would definitely stay here again.
Great place to stay

Jodie was such a great host. She had the place looking great, left a few goodies in the cupboard and was so quick to answer any questions. Would highly recommend staying at her beautiful property, such a great location too!
Stylish great location and amenities. Really enjoyed our time here.
Great property, well appointed, clean and very functional for our group of 3 couples. Excellent location within walking distance to restaurants, pubs, bakeries and shopping.

Perfect house in a great location 
Thanks
Jodie
Could not fault this place. Set up was great, had everything we needed for a weekend away, very close to local shopping/cafe etc. Lots of helpful info about the area :D
Great location, house was much larger than we expected. Very clean and perfect for multiple couples.

Jodie is very prompt and helpful in answering any questions.  We were a group of 3 couples and the house was spacious and ideal as a base for golfing, cycling and visiting wineries the Barossa area.  It is  located near some great cafes, retail shops and a supermarket.
Absolutely can recommend Jodie's house to anyone looking for accommodation in Tanunda/Barossa region. A+
Excellent place to come home to after enjoying the Barossa. Close to everything you need
Thank you Jodie! Amazing location, beautiful clean house and great amenities and thoughtful touches. Would definitely recommend to others and stay again!

This place is a gem in the heart of Tanunda. Its perfect for a peaceful stay. It has comfy beds with lovely bed linen. Jodie left us a basket of goodies and we settled in for a good family get together.
A spotless well laid out place with a great location to Main Street Tanunda and wineries
good
A quiet and well appointed 3 bed 2 bath home close to the Main Street of Tanunda. Spacious dining, seperate lounge and outdoor area. Would stay again.
Clean and fantastic location.  Would highly recommend it.
Jodie’s place was brilliant. Very clean, kitchen had everything we needed. Location and communication from Jodie were excellent. Would highly recommend
Great comfortable house, location could not be better wonderful stay with my family exploring the Barossa
我们度过了愉快的两天,房屋就在主街旁走路几分钟,干净方便,主人还给准备了牛奶果汁等｡全套厨房设备便于自己做饭解决口味问题｡洗了衣服也很方便晾晒｡全家出游首选,性价比高｡

House is excellent 
Jodie was an amazing host 
House is so central
Such a great place! Amazing value for money and in a fantastic location .
Thoroughly recommend Jodie’s beautiful home. Sparkling clean, beautifully furnished and perfectly located close to all that Tanunda has to offer.
Jodies home is sparkling clean, comfy beds and everything you need. A great spot location wise, great restaurants in walking distance and central to  Barossa wineries. Definitely would stay again
Great location, beautifully presented and clean and tidy. Highly recommend!
Jodie's place was in a fantastic location - just a two minute walk to the main street - and extremely clean. A great girls weekend getaway!
Great location for friends &/or family. Would definitely recommend this place

Was a stylish, clean place to stay with everything we needed. My girlfriends and I had a lovely weekend away. Everything we needed was within walking distance on the main street which was so convenient.

We had a great stay at Jodie's house. The house is nicely decorated, sparkling clean and in a great location to walk to cafes, shops and bars in Tanunda as well as exploring the Barossa valley by car.

Jodie’s house is perfect for a get away in the heart of the Barossa Valley. The home is just a short walk from the Tanunda CBD and perfectly located to explore dozens on wineries by bike or car. 

The house is new and sparkling clean and comes with loads of local tips and maps. We really appreciated the stocked kitchen including all the basics; oil, salt, pepper, tea, coffee, milk, butter etc.

I would recommend this stay to anyone looking for a trip to South Australia’s beautiful Barossa valley!

If looking to explore the local wineries by bike I would also highly recommend ‘Barossa Bike’ who drop off and pick up bikes right to your door step!
Clean spacious ideal location ..perfect
Very clean, modern, great location - will definitely be back!

This house is in the perfect location for touring the Barossa food an wine trail. The house is comfortable and well equipped. We loved the fact that it was a 3 min walk to the Main Street of Tanunda accessing plenty of shops.
Would highly recommend adding the Harvest Kitchen for lunch and a trip to the chocolate and wine pairing.

Our stay in Tanunda was excellent! The house is spacious and the location is perfect. The house was very clean, stylish and had all the ammenities you could need. It was perfect for our girls weekend away.
Jodie’s place is great. Everything you need for a weekend away - plenty of room, very clean and within walking distance of some great places to eat and shop.
Fantastic location. Within walking distance of everything in Tanunda. This place is so clean, amenities are very good and bedding is so comfortable. We highly recommend this house!

We loved this accommodation. It was a fantastic location with an easy walk to the shops. Very clean with nice touches. The beds and pillows were so comfortable. We would stay here again. Thank you Jodie.
Jodie is a fabulous host. The house was immaculate and centrally located. It’s within a short walk to local restaurants and shops, and we would highly recommend a stay.

Jodie was a great host, space was better than expected and location perfect! Walking distance to Main Street and restaurants and a short (10-15min) drive to many wineries and breweries. 

Loved our stay and couldn’t recommend it enough.
Fantastic place. Clean, spacious and within walking distance to the main street. Visitor centre and so many amazing cafes and restaurants nearby. Would highly recommended staying here!
10A Elizabeth Street Tanunda is well worth the stay. The hosts hospitality was excellent and the house was spotless. It has everything you need and more.

Very clean and spacious. Little touches made it very comfortable, and a great size tv! Very close to Main Street, an easy walk to get supplies. Great host, communication was great and easy to follow instructions.
Incredible location!!! Felt super tucked away and private in a prime location! It was perfect!! The house was beautiful, loved the outdoor decking and had every amenity you could possibly need!

Jodie’s place was amazing! Perfect location for a weekend getaway. Easy to explore the whole Barossa region by car, and walking distance to the Main Street of Tanunda. 

The beds were really comfy, and the ducted aircon was perfect for a hot weekend. Jodie made so many efforts to make the stay comfortable- the little touches like toiletries and coffee pods were really appreciated. Would definitely stay again!!

Great accommodation, very clean and the perfect location. We could walk to the Main Street and the great bars, cafes etc. The house had everything we needed and Jodie was super helpful with tips, answering questions and dropping off fans when we asked. 
We would definitely stay again and highly recommend this accommodation to others.
Lovely home that is conveniently located. Had all the required amenities and lovely touches upon arrival. Jodie is easy to communicate with. Would recommend!

Great house- very clean and perfect for my family over christmas. This house has everything you need for a great stay in tanunda- I really appreciated the little touches and attention to detail. Jodie even put up a Christmas tree for us!!
Location is everything for our needs. Could be more hanging space in bathroom.

We loved it. Plenty of room for our family. Close to shops and cafes but still a quiet location. Lots of thoughtful touches throughout the house. Very clean and neat and tidy. Would definitely stay again.
Great place
Fantastic house and a great price. Perfect location to visit several local wineries and breweries.

Jodie’s home is perfect as a BnB. 
Position, position , position! So close to the Main Street but in a quiet location. 
A fairly new 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom, modern home.  Nicely decorated with all the mod cons, including ducted heating and cooling. Jodie has great communication and her home was easy to find and get into. Jodie left me a bottle of sparkling wine, crumpets and juice for breakfast. There was a pod coffee machine and a myriad of tea to choose from. She also has a wealth of tourist information in her home. 
Beds were comfy, nice linen and towels. There were even board games . 
Great price and in the perfect position to enjoy all the delights of Tanunda and the Barossa.
Great location, helpful local tips, clean, comfortable beds, fantastic home base for exploring the Barossa
Great facility, lovely and clean, great situation being close to eating places
This compact neat house ideal for our small group with excellent bedrooms, bathrooms, kitchen, lounge and living areas. Excellent as a base for exploring the Barossa.

We had a wonderful stay at the Fig Tree Cottage - it is a beautiful renovated cottage with lots of thoughtful touches including a breakfast of bacon and eggs left in the fridge. We loved the back garden and sitting under the fig tree enjoying some beautiful local wine. It’s an easy walk into Angaston for essentials - and a close drive to lots of wineries!
Great cottage with a well equipped kitchen and lovely garden.

The Fig Tree Cottage is a wonderful historic home on the Main Street in Angaston an easy walk to the city center. It has beautiful grounds in the heart of Barossa valley. For a home built in 1800’s it has updated appliances and is very roomy and the furnishings reflect the history of the home. Jonathan was quick to respond to our questions and we really enjoyed our stay.

What a lovely cottage thourly enjoyed our stay. 
Only a 10 min walk into town. Some great places to eat.
So central to the Barossa Valley.
Jonathan was exceedingly helpful with the best wineries that suited us best. 
Highly recommend this place and they have the most thoughtful touches with breakfast. 
Thanks again will definitely stay again.
Sweet little cottage with maintained style and a lovely outdoor area. The kitchen and bathroom felt very new with essentials provided

We loved our stay the Fig Tree Cottage - it’s a unique experience to stay in a historical home that has been restored so tastefully & with so much character. 
The cottage is ideally located in the village (5 mins walk to the centre of town) & central to most attractions in the Barossa. 
The cottage was well stocked with thoughtful touches such as quality toiletries & generous food supplies. 
We loved sitting in the garden enjoying our Barossa wine listening to the bird life & watching the resident bunnies. So quaint! 
Don’t hesitate to book!
Beautiful home in a lovely part of the Barossa with everything at your door step. Very friendly hosts and extremely accommodating.

Highly recommend this gorgeous property! It exceeded our expectations! Beautifully styled cottage with all the modern touches you need! Lovely garden area to relax in! Very comfortable stay in fantastic location! Great value! Would definitely stay again & recommend to others!
Very cute little cottage deep in the Barossa. Thoroughly enjoyed our time there.

We had a wonderful stay. The house was very clean and there were many small touches. Our kids enjoyed playing in the garden and it was enjoyable having a drink out the back in the afternoon. As the front of the house borders the footpath, there can be a little traffic noise in the front room.

We highly recommend Figtree Cottage if you are looking to stay in the Barossa. The cottage is very clean with lovely touches. The cottage garden is very well kept and has beautiful autumn colours in April.

This is a lovely place, with comfortable beds, a lovely garden, and a great array of cooking implements. However it was not worth the price and had a number of issues; including mice, no working fireplace (the only reason I even got the place) and some practical issues (like bedroom doors that didn’t close, no hanging spaces, and no full length mirror). I couldn’t say I’d recommend the place - at least at this price or until they get rid of the mice.

We spent two days in Angaston and thoroughly enjoyed our time at Fig tree cottage, it was lovely and cosy , the beds were comfortable and the garden was beautiful. It was walking distance from town and a short trip from some of the wineries which was such a convenience! Thanks John and Kate.

We had an excellent few nights in this beautiful cottage. Jonathan and Kate have provided so many wonderful amenities and little touches. The house is spotless and tastefully presented. A great little spot to stay in close proximity to all the great places the Barossa has to offer.

Amazing to stay in such an old cottage which was cosy and had all the modern conveniences. A pretty back garden which would have been lovely to spend time in better weather. Great location close to town and the Farmers markets.
Centrally located, Figtree Cottage was a lovely venue from which to explore the beautiful Barossa Valley.

A good location for touring in the Barossa, it has off street parking.  The beds are very comfortable and the bathroom and kitchen fairly recently updated, the bedrooms are lacking in storage and probably better suited to shorter stays for couples without too much luggage. 

The cottage is old and historic with a pretty garden, it would be ideal for sitting outside on warm days and there are lots of places nearby to eat, although some a little pricey we found.  We enjoyed our cooking course at Casa Carboni and bought fresh local cheeses  next door to enjoy with some Barossa reds.

This quaint and homely little cottage was incredible. The hosts were very friendly and it was special to be supplied with some local produce for the weekend. An amazing little spot with gorgeous aesthetics (both interior and exterior)! I definitely recommend the Fig Tree Cottage for any trips to Barossa Valley!

Fig Tree Cottage is a beautiful place to stay in the Barossa. It has all your creature comforts, lovely garden full of birds, one of the best bathtub views we've seen and very comfy beds. Everything has been thought of, and the kitchen is very well equipped. There is traffic noise in the front room, but definitely the only slight issue. Would highly recommend it, and hope to be back!
Fig Tree Cottage is a lovely quaint cottage in Angaston. It is well equipped and a nice cool sanctuary to come back to after exploring the Barossa. Great location.
Beautiful accomodation in the heart of the Barossa! Will definitely come again.

This was exactly the weekend away we needed!
What a beautiful stay in a beautiful town!
The place was absolutely lovely, so many thoughtful finishes. 

Close location so anything your heart desires during a stay in the Barossa!
Just steps away from local shops and eateries in Angaston and a short drive to surrounding Barossa towns.

Would recommend this stay to anyone!
Lovely space ! Warm, cosy, clean and super stylish .  Always a pleasure to stay at one of Jonathon and Kate’s  places .
cute, great bed , good fire
A lovely, cozy cottage with everything we needed for a relaxing weekend away. Would be very happy to stay again!

This was such a wonderful place to stay. Jonathon and Kate were really easy to contact, and the cottage was beautiful. The wood fire was amazing and kept the lounge room and main bedroom warm over night. We loved the historic charm of the place, and the bath and shower were both really nice (the shower has a great water pressure, which I appreciate). Angaston is also a great spot which is close to heaps of good places to eat. This place has everything you need for a cosy weekend away!

Lovely little cottage on the Main Street of Angaston. Was a little loud in the morning as cars/trucks frequent the area, but was a good wake up call! We loved the breakfast options in the cottage. We really enjoyed using the fireplace. The garden was so cute, unfortunately it was raining so we didn’t get to spend as much time outside as we would have liked! Thanks again for the lovely stay.
Fantastic cottage full of old world charm.

This is a lovely cosy cottage within walking distance of the town . 
It is on a reasonably busy road with the main bedroom at the front but it certainly didn’t spoil our visit but worth a mention if you want a really quiet spot . We had lots of fires in the sitting room and there were oil heaters to keep us warm . 
Cute and quirky this place is furnished with vintage pieces with clean heritage style kitchen and bathroom. There are pretty views out of every window and the gardens are beautiful.

Lovely Cottage in a beautiful Town.
Close to Shops, Parks, Walking/Riding trails.

Jonathan and Kate's house is a beautiful, old cottage with a gorgeous little garden out the back - we spent many happy hours picnicking in the backyard with wine and produce bought in the region. The fireplace was also lovely for the cool nights in early Spring. The mattresses were particularly comfortable. The cottage is located on the main street in Angaston, so was just a short walk to nearby restaurants and shops. Overall we had a lovely time staying here.
Fig Tree Cottage gives the visitor a wonderful experience of the Barossa with a sense of being immersed in its history but with all the modern comforts.

We loved our stay and would definitely return again. The space was great, just like a little home away from home. Gardens were beautiful and enjoyed in the morning and afternoons. Bed was very (Website hidden by Airbnb) been a while since I slept right through, so that says a lot! Little extra touches like tissues...much appreciated. Coffee pod machine a bonus too!

Fig Tree Cottage is a wonderful spot to stay. It’s very conveniently located, very comfortable, and has a lovely rustic charm to it. The hosts were very helpful and responsive and we would certainly stay there again.

Fig Tree cottage is a perfect place to stay - the cottage is warm, cosy and comfortable and picture book pretty! The garden is a dream - flowers galore, an amazing old fig tree, winding path and so many pretty spots to sit and enjoy the view. Highly recommended!

This is a cute cottage with a gorgeous garden. We really enjoyed our stay - the fire was lovely, and so we’re the extras in the house like jams, milk and bread. If you’re cooking at in the cottage like we were, it would probably be useful to take a few oven/baking dishes with you.

Jonathan and Kate were always quick with responses and very accomodating of our requests. It’s a great location, super clean and perfect for a  short weekend away.
Lovely cottage to stay in. Beautiful garden especially now in spring. Great location.
Absolutely fabulous place. Would stay again without hesitation. Jonathan and Kate are excellent hosts.
Beautiful, well located, atmospheric place with gorgeous garden

Beautiful cottage stay in a great location. 
Would recommend this stay and definitely stay again.
Perfect little cottage, my partner and i spent most our time in the beautiful garden so relaxing.

The cottage was incredible. The grounds are perfectly manicured and really add to the whole experience.  We loved our time staying here, dinner and breakfast in the garden, birds chirping and such a homely feel. Highly recommend.

Great little cottage in Angaston. Short walk to great coffee and food! Great breakfast supplies, plenty of tea and a coffee pod machine.  Very comfortable beds. If planning a trip to Angaston or the Barossa this lovely cottage is the place to stay. Jonathon a great host, attentive via messaging.

Beautiful cottage with a wonderful secluded garden.  Great hosts providing thoughtful touches, good supplies and kept in touch throughout to ask if anything needed.  Comfy beds, fluffy towels, good kitchen to cook in and great shower.  We stayed a week and can recommend a longer stay here to see the area.  Fabulous stay!
Jonathan and Kate’s place is the perfect place to enjoy the Barossa. The cottage was tidy and charming with the extra touches that make a stay special. Would definitely come back.
Cosy and simple little house and garden. Very clean and convenient.

FigTree Cottage is a wonderful property and we would highly recommend staying there. Great location with great hosts. Very comfortable beds with high quality linen and a great living space and backyard.
This little cottage is brilliant. Perfectly located, small without feeling cramped, loved it all!

Very nice place in a really convenient location.
Highly recommend for a weekend away.

Thoroughly enjoyed my stay in the cottage. It is stylish and light filled-exactly what I want my holiday home or retirement cottage to look like (insert heart eye emoji here). It has everything you need if you’re staying in the Barossa for while (drying rack, washing machine etc). Kate and Jonathan were always just a message away if you need anything. Highly recommend!

Fig Tree Cottage was a perfect place to base ourselves whilst we were doing some work in the Barossa. It is stylish and practical, very comfortable and spacious. We loved all its period features. And that garden! Sitting under the big tree having lunch one day was my idea of perfection; cool, green, lots of birds visiting. Fabulous! The light-filled bathroom is gorgeous. Having a washing machine is always a bonus when you're travelling for a while. Internet connection was very good. What a wonderful place to stay for work - or a holiday! We hope to return. Thank you so much Kate and Jonathan. Cheers!
Fantastic little cottage full of period features and right in the Main Street. You won’t be disappointed if you stay her!
Lovely period cottage oozing history

Beautiful cottage with old world charm. Location was wonderful a short walk to restaurants and shops. The coffee machine was great in the mornings. Wine, chocolates, and bath bombs were an extra surprise.  Definitely, a lovely place to stay.
Gorgeous and quaint cottage very well located walking distance to everything.

If you want something a little left of centre then this is the place for you. So well appointed with lots of thoughtful little extras. Comfortable, clean and quirky. The second bedroom is a thoroughfare to the lounge and the place is on the Main Street so at peak times there is vehicle noise. Neither of these points would hinder us staying again as the good definitely outweighed any negative.
A great location in a very historic cottage and town. Old world charm with every modern convenience. Lots of room and every comfort for the weary traveller.

Perfect in every way! If you need a good base for the Barossa, then look no further. The perfect place to stay when in the area. Gorgeously fitted out, perfectly clean, lots of extra thoughtful touches, perfect location to walk into town & better than what the pics show you! Can't wait to come back!!! Thank you
Great location, immaculately clean, super comfy beds with luxurious bedding and some lovely thoughtful touches provided by the hosts.
Ideal location on the main street, very cute touches throughout the place. Very comfortable stay.

Cute home. Great location, walked to the brew house down the road.  Lovely breakfasts supplied. I would say if you were staying with 4 people that one bedroom you have to travel between the living room and the kitchen so the other guests would have to walk through. I wouldn’t like that myself. Thanks for the great stay.
Huge cottage, comfy bed, large kitchen & bath. Clean, beautiful linens. Great location to explore Barossa. Best breakfast, snacks AND WINE!!!! Great hosts!

My partner and I had an amazing stay at Johann’s Cottage. The location was perfect, we could walk into the main shopping area of Tanunda within two minutes and were perfectly situated to explore all parts of the Barossa. Mark and Tanya were very thoughtful and left a lovely hamper for us. Would definitely recommend Johann’s Cottage to anyone who is visiting the Barossa Valley.

Tanya & Mark’s place is perfect for checking out the Barossa. It’s a short walk to the Main Street and makes it easy to drive to different wineries. Being on the main road however, you do get the traffic noise.

They are very generous hosts, giving us a gift basket and bottle of wine to enjoy as well as easy to communicate with. After locking ourselves out of the house, they were very kind and dropped off a spare set for us to get back in, thanks again Mark and Tanya.

Great location to get you everywhere you need to go in the Barossa. The breakfast laid out is a life saver after a full day of wine tastings. The shower is a little hard for taller people (like myself) to get around. Tanya & Mark gave great recommendations for the location which were super helpful! Thanks again!
Tanya & Mark have created a very comfortable and stylish accommodation at Johann's Cottage. This place is very well-located, beautifully furnished and sparkling clean. Highly recommended.
Great spot for a country stay!

Tanya and Marks place was beautifully clean, with lovely touches like the amazing breckie basket, bottle of bubbly and chocolates on arrival. The location is perfect, walking distance to everything in Tanunda. The bed and pillows are super comfortable, so important for a restful vacation. Expect traffic noise during the day, as you are right on the main road, but lovely and quiet at night, not disturbed at all!! So many helpful brochures and information included in the house, loads of reading and games to entertain yourself. A very lovely place to stay, highly recommended. Thanks Tanya and Mark

We really enjoyed our stay at Johann’s cottage - it’s a beautiful place, had all the amenities we needed and is located close to shops, cafes and restaurants. Check in and check out was super easy, and Tanya and Mark also made our stay at very comfortable with a lovely basket of goodies. Would definitely recommend staying at Johann’s cottage!
A quaint cottage with good facilities in a great location on the main street.
A gorgeously decorated old cottage with all comfy bed, lots of room and a really generous hamper of treats. So close to everything in the Main Street, walking distance. Just beautiful

The hosts have thought of everything regarding personal touches. There were cereals, snacks, water, milk and a bottle of wine with a personal message as it was my Birthday .The cottage is located on the main road which makes it easy to access all the amenities but it can be a little noisy especially on Sunday mornings with the church bells from the local churches. The cottage was clean and tidy  but some of the facilities were  a bit dated.
Lovely spot.  Very convenient for shops and restaurants in Tanunda.  Lovely extra touches from the hosts.  Cottage was built in 1860 and had a great charm about it.
Really well located cottage with a lot of nice touches throughout. Very spacious. Tanya and Mark were very quick at responding
Was amazing all the small personal touches was incredible would recommend to all !!!! Made our trip so special loved it !!

This quaint little cottage would be perfect for those looking to soak up some history in the Barossa. It’s a lovely little place with antique furniture throughout but lacked a few of the modern creature comforts we’ve come to rely on. For example, there isn’t wifi (it’s our own fault for not checking this beforehand), it was very warm in the house in the middle of summer and unfortunately the single air conditioning unit didn’t quite cut it, there aren’t powerpoints where you might expect, like by both beds (as we’ve come to rely on for phone charging unfortunately) and the shower was quite average (especially for my 6’3” husband). These small things won’t matter to everyone so I’m sure many will still love their stay here.

Lovely cottage within easy walking distance to cafes and restaurants.  Beautifully furnished with period furniture right down to old photographs.  Plenty of good reading material on hand.  It was generously stocked with all you need, even a picnic hamper!  Would recommend the cottage to anyone planning a visit to the Barossa. Mark & Tanya are generous hosts.

Fabulous central location. Interesting and comfortable home and generous hosts who leave a basket of treats to enjoy. In the height of summer the air-conditioner struggled to stretch to the second bedroom but there is a fan available. Be mindful that the shower is over the bath and there are small steps throughout the house, but if you mobility is good, you'll enjoy this beautifully furnished home.
Lovely big cottage, walking distance to a few wineries and gin distillery
Very cosy cottage in the heart of Barossa
Good sized cottage and has a cosy feel. Great central spot to stay if you're looking to visit nearby wineries. Friendly and welcoming hosts. So quiet and peaceful at night
Nice facilities, comfortable, conveniently located with several wineries and distillery in walking distance.
Great stay in the Barossa. The cottage was exactly as stated and perfect for our stay so that we could explore the surrounding wineries! Thanks so much for having us
Great location, huge accomodation which was very clean. Can’t go wrong.
Gorgeous little cottage with everything we needed!
We stayed in Kates Cottage for a weekend escape and loved it. It was stylish, cosy and very clean. We hope to return sometime soon. Thank you.
Beautiful decor and surroundings. Will returning.

As I walked in on a hot day, the air con was already on and music was playing on the retro radio. Loved everything about this place - could not have asked for more, from the yummy breakfast provisions, wine,cookies.... to the super comfortable bed and amazing shower. Even the outhouse toilet was luxurious. Everything was truly perfect - and I’m very fussy! I loved it so much I extended an extra 2 nights and lucky for me it was available - hope to be back one day

Angaston is a beautiful town in the Barossa Valley. We thought the accommodation was amazing and the little touches made
it feel like a home away from home. All credit goes to Sue and Mike for making us feel very welcome...we cant recommend  
The Rusty Olive enough!

Sue and Mike’s place was absolutely beautiful. When I arrived the cottage was exactly like it is in the pictures, very cute and absolutely spotless.
I didn’t have any issues sleeping as the cottage very private and located on a quiet street, so there were no issues with noise. Also, the bed is absolutely huge and so comfortable! The bathroom is also very luxurious, especially the huge bathtub, and I really enjoyed using the rain shower.
The included gourmet breakfast was very extensive and delicious. The kitchen itself was very well equipped; with everything I needed to cook if I needed to.
I only stayed for one night, but I did notice the barbeque out the back which I would have loved to try if I had more time. The private outdoor area was really beautiful and would have been a nice place to sit and spend some time or eat a meal if I had stayed a few extra nights. The cottage also had an outhouse toilet that I thought was kind of quirky but also very cool. 
The cottage itself is just around the corner from the main street of Angaston, so access to restaurants, cafes and shops is super simple – just a few minutes walk from the cottage. The hosts also provided a heap of great information on other activities and dining options around the Barossa which really helped me plan activities for my trip.
Overall, I thought the cottage was incredibly beautiful and clean and definitely worth the price. I wouldn’t hesitate to book again if I was staying in the area.

The Rusty Olive has been lovingly restored and is beautifully presented. It is spotlessly clean and has everything you need for a very comfortable stay. 
We wish we had booked for longer and we would definitely stay again.
We had an excllent stay at The Rusty Olive! Everything was very comfortable and the breakfast (and wine) was great! Would definitely stay here again if visiting the Barossa.

We cannot fault anything about Sue & Mike’s place. Everything was perfect! The little touches were amazing. It was in a fantastic location and was the most amazing cute little romantic airbnb. Seriously recommend!!!
It was very cute and enjoyed the stay. Thoughtful additions and Sue and Mike's communicated well. Girlfriend loved the claw foot bathtub. Would happily stay there again.
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Rusty Olive - such a gorgeous venue! Sue and Mike added so many personal touches that made our stay extra special! Thank you
The house is absolutely gorgeous. Perfect for a romantic getaway.
Best Airbnb we’ve ever stayed in with so many personal touches
Wonderful stay, beautiful town and close to everything in the Barossa Valley as well walking distance to the local shops .
A thoroughly updated old cottage in a quiet little town; great access to the Barossa and Eden Valley without the hustle and bustle that frequently afflicts popular wine regions. Highly recommended!

This cottage is everything you could was from a Barossa BnB. Rustic and charming, yet incredibly clean and with all of the mod cons you would expect. 

Every detail has been considered and this attention to detail and comfort did not go unnoticed. 

Highly recommend.

As soon as you drive into the drive of this unique cottage you will be in awe. Not only will you be stepping into a past era with the style of the home but it has been brought back lovingly into today with the practical ammenities we’ve become used to. A huge comfy king size bed, beautiful linen to match the era of the home, stylish kitchen and the bathroom is amazing.  This property is immaculately presented and the homeliness is immediately felt. Well done Sue and Mike in the lovingly restoration of “the rusty olive”.
A very cosy cottage with all the amenities and more. Would definitely stay again!

The Rusty Olive is a charmingly restored stone cottage, beautifully decorated. The attention to detail and added special touches would put some 5 star hotels to shame. The cottage is exactly like it is in the pictures and absolutely spotlessly clean. Communication with Sue & Mike was prompt and straightforward.  Check in was easy. The Rusty Olive’s location  (on a quiet street – no road noise) is ideal as a base from which to explore the Barossa Valley. It is excellent value for money and I would recommend it to anyone travelling to the Barossa for a weekend away.

The Rusty Olive was absolutely beyond perfection. The attention to detail made it a divine, luxurious stay from the bathbombs and bedside chocolates to the Nespresso coffee machine and local condiments..... everything was of the highest quality and made our week long stay all the more comfortable and enjoyable.
The convenient location made it perfect for exploring the Barossa’s many, MANY Cellar Doors, as well as the Farmers Market, burning vines  and other wonderful offerings this region has.
Sue and Mike are wonderful hosts who made our stay so memorable and the whole airbnb process so easy. Their hints, tips and information guide were heartily used and guided our activities and adventures.
We would definitely stay at The Rusty Olive again and again and again. Book this accomodation, you really will not be disappointed.

The Rusty Olive is the perfect base for a quintessential Barossa experience. It’s such an intimate and cosy space, lovingly restored by Sue and Mike. The thoughtful touches make it feel like a home away from home and we will definitely be back!
Incredibly cosy, warm, stylish and welcoming, this place is great value for money. Really a step above, with lots of little touches throughout the house that made for beautiful surprises.
Wonderful stay. The house is great and beautifully styled. My partner and I didn’t want to leave. Comfy bed and everything you needed for an easy stay. Would love to stay here again
Excellent little cottage, everything was neat and clean. Looking forward to staying again.
Clean, cosy and stylish cottage! It was all we expected and more. Big thanks to Sue and Mike for their hospitality and attention to detail!
Excellent, well renovated cottage. Close to shops, but away from traffic. Amenities were fabulous. Comfortable bed, excellent bathroom! Enjoyed our stay, along with the person touches.
Amazing place to stay and drink some wine!
We really loved this little cottage. So many thoughtful little touches, we couldn’t have asked for more. We hope to be able to get back again
This place is much better than what it looks like in the pictures. We loved it so much, that this  has now occupied a joint No 1 position among our airbnb stays.

The Rusty Olive is a very thoughtfully restored cottage, with many great touches and wonderful workmanship. It is very comfortable, with everything you need and is in a great location - only 5 minutes walk to the shops in Angaston.
A very stylish cottage, great location near the shops. Plenty of information about the Barossa provided for guests.
Thanks so much, what a great stay, lovely place and oh so relaxing!

The Rusty Olive has been beautifully restored and was a great base from which to explore the Barossa, with Angaston winning our vote for nicest village in the district!
The king size bed was luxurious and the waterfall shower brilliant!! Heaps of other thoughtful touches made our stay - we very much hope to return!
Amazing home to discover the Barossa from. Stylish and welcoming.

This bnb is absolutely stunning. You can really see how much thought and care that has been put into this home. It has such a homely feel but with all the modern, and glamorous touches. We will definitely be recommending to others.
 Just beautiful!!

If we could give this Airbnb 6 stars we would! The most comfortable bed we have ever slept on and an amazing shower. So much thought and care had gone into this perfect little cottage from the breakfast spread to the bath tub.. loved it!
Simply the best. Everything you could think of has been thought of. 5 stars and beyond. Book this space.
Everything was outstanding about the Rusty Olive, would definitely recommend it to others!

Sue and Mikes place is a stylish cottage in the middle of wine country.  They provided breakfast supplies, chocolates and wine to make our stay more comfortable.  The place is near restaurants and a grocery store (assuming that you will have a vehicle to tour wineries)
Great location. Lovely accommodation and extra touches.
Had a best time . Perfect spot to experience and have an perfect time in Angaston.

This gem is a perfect base from which to explore the Barossa Valley. The Rusty Olive is well located in Angaston - just a short stroll from the main street - with all the delights of the Barossa just a short drive away.

We could tell the Rusty Olive had been lovingly restored with excellent attention to detail; the whole house felt coherently decorated while at the same time very functional. We found it spacious and immaculately clean with thoughtful extras adding a touch of luxury.

All communication with Sue and Mike was clear and prompt. We would not hesitate to recommend the Rusty Olive as a perfect Barossa home away from home.
Really great heritage house in a brilliant location. Really nice amenities through the house.

We loved our stay at the Rusty Olive. A recently renovated cottage that still retains its old charm also incorporating all the mod cons you’ll need to unsure you have the perfect stay. Very close to the town centre of Angaston and it’s a great base if you decide on exploring the surrounding Barossa Valley!

Very quaint and lovely place.  Town itself was a bit sleepy for us. The Rusty Olive was so nice and comfortable with a lot of thought put into all the details.  Close to other towns and of course wineries. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
This old building  and its garden area have been lovingly refurbished. The location and amenity of this B&B will suit many visitors. It's located close to the Angaston  shops and in a quiet street.
Cheers guys, we really enjoyed our stay ☺️

After a few weeks in Tassie hiking we just wanted to chill for a few days... That’s exactly what we did at the Rusty Olive. This cottage is amazing, with everything you need for a really comfortable stay. Sue and Mike included lots of thoughtful touches like breakfast goodies, leaving the lights on as we arrived late, they even had face wipes and dry shampoo in the bathroom! Was exceptionally equipped. Really close to the Main Street meant we could walk to breakfast or the supermarket and within 15 minutes of all the wineries. Would definitely recommend staying here.
What a great place. So perfect for a couple looking to explore the region and enjoy some luxury. All of the little things were taken care of. One of our favourite ever AirBnB

A beautiful home, full of historical and Barossa charm, but with all the modern convenience of a well appointed luxury hotel. The Rusty Olive is full of treats and trinkets which have been put together with love and make for a warm and inviting space. A short stroll from Angaston and it’s delights, a veranda to enjoy a sundowner glass of Shiraz or morning coffee. Sue and Mike have thought of everything you could need and more, a truly delightful space - very highly recommended and spotless!
Very cozy place, highly recommend
Can’t fault the place, beautiful place in a lovely location
Great location, the place had lots of thoughtful touches. We would highly recommend to anyone visiting the Barossa valley.
Fantastic stay, beautiful property and perfect location for exploring the Barossa
This is an amazing home, with beautiful personal touches that went above and beyond.  I recommend a stay here anytime, and will definitely be going back (soon if I could)!
We really enjoyed our stay..we will be back

Absolutely beautiful place!! 
Thank you so much for the effort you have put into this cottage. So much to look at and explore within the place itself Made our weekend cosy and comfortable but with a luxurious touch! 
Immaculate cleanliness and generous set up of food and amenities. 
Would have loved to have stay longer and make use of the funky kitchen and more of that bath!!! 
Would love to come back in warmer weather to enjoy some local walks.
Delicious local pizza from 40s cafe, please continue to encourage guest!
Again thank you thank you!!
Quaint little cottage close to the main street.  Lovely breakfast and personal touches, chocolates and wine and biscuits provided .Lovely big ,soft bed as well.
Sue and Mikes BNB was one of the loveliest I’ve ever stayed in. So many thoughtful touches and fantastic local tips. Would 100% recommend.

This is the most perfectly formed couples Airbnb we have ever stayed in - anywhere!  The little touches like coffee capsules, bacon, tomatoes, mushrooms and eggs in the fridge, easy to follow instructions, a bottle of wine and chocolates, to the classic music playing on arrival.  This is a delightful, well appointed couples retreat.  Easy walk to middle of Angaston, inexpensive taxi's to BV restaurants.

We have just come from back from a fantastic weekend in the Barossa where we used Sue and Mike’s place as our base. The reviews you will read below are true - this is the perfect spot for a getaway and Sue and Mike truly have thought of everything... from breakfast provisions to a bath bomb for the amazing bath. Thanks for having us - we will recommend to our friends and family without hesitation.

We loved the rustic touches outside, and the stylish touches inside. Perfect getaway for a couple. Big comfortable bed, lovely bathroom, and workable kitchen for egg & bacon breakfast. We couldn't ask for any more!
The Rusty Olive might be one of my favourite Airbnb stays ever - every detail was so thoughtfully considered. Highly recommend!

Breathtaking - Sue and Mike had truly thought of everything. From supplying a Netflix account for when you're relaxing with a glass of wine to the herb garden when cooking up dinner. This little cottage is truly a home away from home, you have transformed a little four room cottage into a mini paradise - 10/10 would recommend.
The best air bnb we’ve stayed at to date! Everything was thought through, the place is amazing and the location is perfect for exploring the Barossa.
If youre looking to find a place to stay in the Barossa the Rusty Olive is it! From a couple who book a lot of stays all around

A gorgeously quaint cottage right in the middle of the vineyards. Sybelle was an excellent host, with quick communication and the home was spotlessly clean. Excellent value for money and a terrific location to use as a base for exploring the Barossa Valley.
Lovely quaint cottage. Very good communications and flexibly with check in times. Total enjoyed the country atmosphere
Great host, everything was super clean and organized! Great time!
Very nice historical house. Quiet location with beautiful scenery. No air conditioner and really hot weather but the fans provided did help.
Little old cottage which is nice and set in between a vineyard
Nice little cottage to stay at, very private location outside of town. Beds were comfy. Host left breakfast supplies in fridge. Everything you need in terms in terms of basics. Good value for money
The host canceled this reservation 10 days before arrival. This is an automated posting.
The cutest cottage in a picture perfect location

Very suitable location that is close to wineries. house gets cold at night however there are small heaters. Good value for money. Lots of brochures and information available for the Barossa valley. Continental breakfast items supplied.

Sibylle's house is amazing. 
Very clean, great amenities and to wake up in the middle of a vineyard is breathtaking. 
Highly recommend this place. 
Luca and Rosanna

The farmhouse was just as gorgeous as the pictures. It was great to stay outside of town in the peaceful Light Pass. Very close to major towns, and lots to do in the area. Sibylle left great instructions for making the best use of the house. Vineyards in the backyard are very picturesque! We stayed for two nights, but could easily see ourselves living in the area.

As my first AirBnB experience, Petra's House was a fantastic surprise. Surrounded by vineyards and staying in an original 1910 house was a great way to immerse ourselves in the Barossa state of mind. The house was spotless and we got some belated easter eggs as a welcome. If you like wine, and peace & quiet, this is a great option.

This little cottage is very quaint and brought back lots of memories for my husband of his grandma’s house in regional Victoria. It was cold but there were plenty of heaters around the house. The bed was good and the feather doona was adequate overnight. The other facilities - kitchen and bathroom were basic but in keeping with the style of the cottage. It was a good location for our needs and a great stay overall.
We had a great overnight stay in Sibylle's quirky cottage. It was the perfect base for our family of four to explore the Barossa.
Lovely historic cottage in a central location away from the main road, old world charm with comfy beds.  Sybille is a thoughtful host, we didn't meet but would choose to stay again.
Petras house is a beautifully maintained old style house. The beds are wonderfully comfortable and it is set in a peaceful location.

️ cosy, eclectic little home
HOWEVER ..

￭ the inadequate Heating ( fan heater FAILED dismally to heat the rooms with 11'6" ceiling height)
￭ the faulty electrical WIRING.. fuses tripping all the time when using fan Heaters & fuses over-Heating. I got a zap when checking one of the fuses on one occasion.
- fuses are 16Amp so is dangerous to use more than one heater per circuit. This meant that for safety one needed to turn off the 12Amp fan heater if using toaster or jug. It was also dangerous to try to use a fan heater in kitchen & Lounge at the same time (24A LOAD against 16A fuse). The expectation to manipulate appliances to avoid tripping the fuses was LESS than satisfactory. 
This house in its current state is unsatisfactory for RENTAL purposes. Additionally there is INADEQUATE / LACK OF heating or cooling ( not even a ceiling fan).
￭ No thermal bedding even though the booking was was in mid-winter. 
￭ Crockery & Cutlery appeared to have been OpShop leftovers & was NOT up to standard .. some items are chipped (hygiene issue). Only 3 plates so had to eat in shifts.
￭ Cooking utensils are old & need replacing .. hygiene issue
￭ HWS was inadequate for 4 adults
￭ Washing machine was NOT working.
￭ No axe provided to cut firewood to length ... had to resort to brute strength to break it up
￭ No broom/ mop provided in case we needed to clean up ?
￭ Only ONE key provided even though it was clear that 2 couples would be using the house.

A lovely house with period correct finishings, bringing back memories of the golden ages of yesteryears. 

Sibylle was easy to communicate with, check in was easy, and some breakfast food and drinks were provided, which is a very nice touch!

If you do visit in winter however, bring extra thick indoor clothing along as the place is cold; there are only two small heaters.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this gorgeous, quaint country house. It was in a fantastic location to explore and enjoy the Barossa Valley, and we especially loved the peace and quiet it offered. We sincerely appreciated the little touches, such as the provided breakfast. Thank you for a cosy, clean, and comfortable retreat!

A quaint house set in the vineyards - a true South Australian representation of yesteryear, with interesting little treasures and nick knacks. 
Nice personal hand written notes about where items are located in the house, how the taps work etc. 
We stayed mid-winter and the place was FREEZING. There are 2 small electric heaters which, together, heat a single room.   We wore coats and wrapped in blankets to keep warm.
Great little spot, very cosy and super quiet. Check in couldn't have been easier. Would recommend

Great location !!!
Loved our stay here - located within a short distance from some of the local wineries. Really appreciated the breakfast options provided.
We came in winter so be sure to rug up! Would recommend to others

What amazing quirky place in a fantastic location. The house was really cool, plenty of room, perfect for 4 people. Lotsog thoughtful touches and in a beautiful setting. Beds were crazy crazy comfortable.
The house was in a beautiful area, very convenient, and I love the history of the house that was around. It was very clean and all communication was quick and clear
Great place to stay, terrific house and host.
Cosy, clean and a stones throw from all the Barossa has to offer
This is a lovely character cottage best visited in the warmer months but it did have the most comfortable and cosy bed I have slept in ever!
Quaint cottage feel in quiet area near vineyards - definitely a "Barossa" feel about it. Thoroughly enjoyed it and thoughtful touches by the hostess. Good air-conditioning system as well.
Clean, spacious and great heating in an old cottage which was perfect for a relaxing night away.
A quaint & clean place to stay.  Comfortable beds.  Airconditioning was great to have (previous reviews said heating was an issue but we had no troubles at all) & breakfast was well catered for.

Petra’s house was cosy and well placed to visit all areas in the Barossa. Very generous with breakfast foods. Having Willows Wines next door was an added bonus . We would highly recommend staying there.
Debi and Darren.

The house has character & love and is comfortable throughout. Loved that it was spotlessly clean. Ample light switches and beautiful, peaceful surrounding grounds that the house stands on. A pure pleasure of serenity to enjoy. Sibylle's extra touches with the food provided for breakfast was much appreciated and enjoyed. We could have easily stayed for a week not just overnight!

You can expect a lovely home with many comfort creatures.  It is an original older property which is one of the many highlights of the property.  It is set in a relaxed rural community right in the Barossa. Access to explore the many vineyards is right at the door step. A most enjoyable place to stay.
This place has a warmth and charm only experienced once arrived. Great cottage and stay with excellent extra special touches.
Had a great time and so peaceful in a lovely location.

Lovely little place. Beautifully maintained and pleasantly furnished with lots of thoughtful touches. We loved our night here - it was the perfect homey environment to return to after a wine-soaked afternoon in the Barossa. Would highly recommend!!
We had a lovely stay at Petra’s. The beds were super comfy, shower nice and hot and the place was very clean. Sibylle made it all very easy.
Great place to stay close to the wineries.
The house is very roomy, old-fashioned, Australian Colonial style and situated  in a very peaceful area next door to some amazing wineries (Willows & Gibsons).

Fantastic authentic home. The days we were fortunate enough to stay were in excess of 45 degrees but due to a modern ducted air conditioning we were very comfortable. Beautiful setting and very close to so many wineries. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay
Lovely historic house surrounded by vines, very pretty.  Air-con works a treat on super hot days (we were there when over 40).
Such an amazing old house! It is beautiful, and the surrounding area is really quiet and relaxing while still being close to all the Barossa has to offer. Sibylle was a great host.

We were satisfied with Petras place. The location great for local wineries & to sit on the front porch. The beds were average & boiling your own rainwater was recommended but otherwise it was a lovely stay and great value.
Beautiful surrounds and amazing hospitality from Sibylle! Complimentary bottle of Riesling from neighbouring winery went down a treat on the cottage verandah.
Very accurate and effective communication, we enjoyed the environment and also the beautiful bottle of wine that was left for us. We will definitely come back and enjoy the space.
Great place.  Clean.  Very central.  Can stay 1 night.  Lovely character home in the vineyards.  Enjoyed sitting on the verandah having a glass of wine.

This place is special.Set amongst the vines with a great view from the front porch. It is like stepping back in time while still being very clean and comfortable. The breakfast provisions were generous and much appreciated.Highly recommended.
Lovely character home and brilliant location if your after a secluded rural spot that’s close to everything in the Barossa.

This is such a great place to stay in the Barossa. There is so much character to the house, and we found it comfortable and warm even in the middle of winter. Excellent location, very peaceful but still close to wineries, a wonderful place to relax.
Cute and cosy cottage in a quiet location. Great spot for exploring wineries
A lovely warm, cosy and charming place to stay surrounded by vineyards
An authentic cottage.  In all honesty though would not choose to stay there again
Sparkling clean, historic cottage in beautiful vineyard surroundings. Has everything you need and more. We had a wonderful stay and would love to come back

(+) Spacious, well furnished, complimentary bottle of wine.
(-) Sound of traffic on the main road outside - front rooms only.
It is a beautiful heritage cottage, which many original features. It is more spacious that we expected and the complimentary breakfast is a wonderful touch.
Great host, thoughtful and welcoming. A lovely bed and place to stay.

Very lovely house with two bedrooms, lounge and kitchen.
Surrounded by vineyards and close to town as well as Wolf Blass Winery.

No wifi but good 4G reception when creating a mobile hotspot.

Highly recommended!

A beautiful, charming old house. Very clean and comfortable with thoughtful touches such as breakfast goods. Not for those who like “modern amenities “ but fabulous for those that love periodic charm.
Beautiful, cosy and rustic house which takes you 100 years back in time - in a pleasant way! We celebrated Christmas evening at this location and it was absolutely perfect.
A great retro house but with all the facilities - a good place to stay for some peace and quiet after a big day at the wineries

Beautiful old house and a great location. So close to most of the cellar doors in Barossa! By far the best cellar door is literally around the corner at Gibson wines- best reds and a must do if you love wine.
Sibylle was easy to communicate with and house was spotless clean and perfect. Thanks again and we will be back
Had a wonderful stay at Petras Place. The location and cottage was lovely

Great house with amazing antiques and old fashioned charm. The beds were extra comfy and the breakfast goods left were great. An extra special touch was the fabulous German bread. What a treat.
The bathroom had scads of really hot water, which was welcome.
A great place for the four of us to stay.
A lovely house and location, with top notch hospitality.
A little cottage about 15-20 min out of Tanunda. Clean and tidy, has old school character. Easy to find and owner was responsive to messages

I highly recommend a stay at Whiterocks. A beautifully presented classic bungalow in the heart of Tanunda, we loved the accommodation and hung around the house more than we anticipated because it felt so homely.

Kim provided us with some great tips for what to see and do in the area and Tammey made us feel very welcome on arrival.

Will be back and telling all my friends and family to stay at this beautiful home, thanks again.

Nathan
Outstanding communication. Comfortable, pleasant accommodation and extremely responsive to guests' queries. Very well maintained - we will stay with this host again!
Very well located, comfortable and sparkling clean
You must stay here. What a perfect Barossa house and hosted really well.
The ambiance of this place is amazing. I slept like a log.
So many thoughtful touches in this place and wonderfully quiet. A place to really get away from things.
Had a lovely stay for our anniversary, very clean and and spacious for two, great breakfast and warm hospitality from Evelyn

We had a brilliant one night getaway at Evelyns place. The unit is exceptionally clean, well furnished and comfortable. We stayed on a mid-30s day and the aircon was nice and cool. Views and surroundings are fantastic.
Nice quiet and relaxing get away with great amenities
Such a lovely spot, with special luxury touches. A perfect spot to stay to explore the Barossa. Would 100% stay again. Thank you, Evelyn.

Evelyn’s guest suite ticks all of th boxes! She has created a beautiful guest quarters in her new home that is stylish and spacious, comfortable,  and convenient to the many wineries and nearby small towns. Located in the countryside, there is peace and birdsong. She provided a wide selection of breakfast items, including eggs and bacon, honey from her hives, and other homemade items to round out a lovely breakfast. After two months traveling, her place ranked in the top three of our many Airbnbs. We highly recommend if you are thinking of visiting the Eden and Barossa Valleys!

Homely, clean and comfortable and Evelyn is very friendly and welcoming.
Thoroughly recommended!

The thought and care put into little touches around the place, like fresh flowers and produce, for example, make this space feel loving and cosy while being super clean, fresh and modern at the same time.

Evelyn asked ahead of time of any dietary requirements so I could happily get stuck in to all the treats provided, knowing my allergy had been considered.

I highly recommend this spot to any couples or singles in need of an escape to take a breath, Meander is perfect.

The place was beautiful! Nice and cosy winter nights with a hot tea was bliss . Beautiful scenery with lots of animals around. Evelyn had out done herself with the homemade products. Nothing better! Loved how she used the space with wooden furniture with touches or green and blue around.

This is the perfect place to relax and enjoy a warm welcome. We used Meander Retreat as a base for walking the Lavender Federation Trail. Perfect retreat after a day's hiking! Evelyn is a fabulous host.

We could not have imagined a better Winter stay - stunning accommodation, great breakfast, and the most lovely host. Evelyn made sure we had what we needed to fully relax and culminated with a bonfire and a bowl of yummy chocolate pudding. We were spoilt and will come back very soon! Thank you - best experience we’ve had in a long time.
This is a beautiful property and a very stylish studio. It’s the perfect location to explore the Barossa/Hills and get some country air. We highly recommend this stay.

Lovely spot on the edge of the Barossa. Evelyn is a great host, unobtrusive but attentive. Super clean, nice Asian decor touches, really warm in the winter, high ceilings and roomy. Chooks, veges, fruit in season and modern kitchen for own cooking. Lost an hour in the big bath after canoeing and walking around Warren Reservoir.
We have really enjoyed our stay. We will definitely recommend this place and will be back one day ourselves.

We had a great time staying at Meander. We love the house and the location. Evelyn is a very thoughtful and generous host. This was our second stay at Meander. We really enjoyed the extra trouble Evelyn went to - bonfire, after dinner drinks, the wood oven pizza. The location is perfect for exploring the Barossa wineries and walking the Lavender Trail. We look forward to another visit in the future.
Thanks Evelyn for a wonderful stay at your sparking cleaning retreat.  We enjoyed our stay in the quite Springton fields with the rolling hills and with the Barossa just down the road.   Peter & Prue

Evelyn's place is just perfect. Lofty ceilings, beautiful views, quality finishes, lovely host. We felt relaxed and pampered there. It was the perfect country getaway. Evelyn has thought of everything to make guests feel welcome and at home. We only wish we could have stayed longer! Thank you Evelyn.
This was our 3rd visit to Meander; we love staying here. Evelyn is a fabulous host!

We have really enjoyed our stay at Evelyn's place.  We love her place;  it's beautiful, well-equipped, comfortable and serene with a country feel.  It is great for a retreat!  She pays attention to details and we felt really well taken care of.  We highly recommend Evelyn's place and plan on returning.

Evelyn was such a lovely and accommodating host! We loved our farm stay and couldn’t recommend highly enough. 

We loved the wine and chat, homemade jam, musli and farm eggs! 
Thanks again Evelyn for a wonderful stay x

What a peaceful and relaxing spot! We loved every part of our stay from adventuring around the property, being greeted by doggo and chickens, relaxing with a wine under the gums and the amazing facilities. Evelyn is a lovely host who will make sure you’re well looked after but have your own space. She puts so many lovely touches into the property and we really enjoyed making our breakfast with local produce! Easy adventuring into the Barossa by car. Thank you again!
A beautiful cosy stylish retreat for 2. Enjoyed spa and outdoor  area. Great hosts.

57 studio was very clean and new, nicely designed and had a great space.
The location was central to Barossa Valley but not walking distance to Tanunda town centre.
We were abit disappointed that we didn’t meet Annemarie during our stay.

Lindsay and Anne Marie were very friendly hosts. A great little
Place to stay for a weekend in the Barossa. Clean, comfortable and the spa was an added bonus. Look forward to a beer with Lindsay when we are next in the region.
Beautiful little studio.
Great stay, hosts were very welcoming, would recommend to other guests.

We loved staying at Lindsay's apartment. It was beautifully decorated with lots of thoughtful touches. The shower, outdoor spa and kitchen were highlights, as well as the lovely bottle of wine on arrival. The location is perfect for exploring the Barossa too.

Highly recommended!
You'll enjoy a nice stay in the Barossa Valley. Nice and comfortable place, good location, friendly owners.
Nice little studio apartment in good location. Lots of pretty decorations and furnishings. Plenty of room for two people with a nice outdoor sitting area too.
lovely, stylish and cosy with nice extra touches, would stay again!
Most enjoyable place to stay, very clean & comfortable. Very friendly & accomodating hosts.  Would gladly stay again.
This place is as it is listed. Loved the place. Loved the Barossa

Studio 57 is a beautiful spot to stay and explore the Barossa. The location was perfect and the hosts were very helpful. The studio contains absolutely everything you need and is very comfortable. We didn’t want to leave!
clean, everything a couple would need, great hosts, very friendly.
