Lovely comfortable stylist apartment. Quality amenities like furi knifes and a couch throw rug made were great touches. Location was great, right behind the main street but still quiet and private.
A lovely, clean and well positioned apartment, well laid out and comfortable.

Tracy’s place was an excellent base for our Barossa exploration. A very easy walk to the Main Street that has everything you need after a day of wine tasting. Tracy was also great at organising some extra bedding for our stay. I’d stay here again!
Tracy’s place is beautiful, definitely stay here if you’re planning a trip to the Barossa!

Tracy’s place was fantastic. Great location central to everything the Barossa has to offer, and easy walk to Tanunda’s Main Street, shops, cafes and attractions. Clean, airy, spacious apartment, with lots of thoughtful touches and amenities. Perfect base for a Barossa getaway. Really enjoyed our stay.
We really enjoyed our stay. Great location, lovely home and Tracy was very helpful and quick to respond.
A lovely home,  very close to town and we thoroughly enjoyed our one night here. Next time we will have to stay longer.

Tracy's place is fantastic! Located just one block off the main street, walking distance to all the restaurants and shops. Quiet and a beautiful space. Lovely touches with fresh bread, milk, eggs and butter, thank you. Comfortable and warm bed! Plenty of space to relax in the lounge / dining or out back at the outdoor setting! Perfect gateway to the Barossa and all it has to offer. Thanks for having us!
Lovely and convienient place to stay.

Lovely place to stay that has everything you need! Great location, very spacious, clean and bright, with all the amenities you need.  Tracey was very punctual with correspondence and gave useful local info. I would definitely recommend this as a great place to stay in the Barossa.
Thanks!
Was a great place to stay. Very clean and a great location

Tracey's place is a stunning gem in the barossa. She is so helpful and gives you many tips and advice for the area. The accommodation is stunning and comfortable with all the amenities you need. We loved our stay here and only wished it was longer.

Tracy’s stylish and nicely decorated town house in the heart of Tanunda was a wonderful place to stay to explore all that the Barossa has to offer.  The open plan living room and modern kitchen downstairs and two upstairs bedrooms were all very comfortable and clean. Tracy’s added touch of hospitality included providing freshly baked bread, free range eggs and milk for breakfast as well as giving us her suggestions for the best places to eat and visit. Highly recommend Tracy’s place for an enjoyable stay.
Great location and nice place with everything you need. Would definitely stay again if I came back.
I can’t fault Tracy’s place. Everything was fabulous. We didn’t want to leave.

A beautifully, tastefully decorated place in a superb village location. We stayed here with another couple for a wedding and it was perfect. Tracy added lots of little extras which were very much appreciated ie fresh bread, butter, jam, selection of tea and milk. 
I wish there had been a mirror in the bedrooms - it was a rush getting our faces on sharing the one bathroom mirror.  Other than that the property has everything you would need.

Tracy's place was beautiful, well-equipped and conveniently located. The thoughful extra touches were much appreciated and made the house feel like home. I would recommend her place to anyone looking to stay in Tanunda.
Great place to stay, close to the main Street of Tanunda. Communication was fantastic and house was well presented.
Very comfortable and clean and full of thoughtful touches. Tracey went the extra mile and gave a list of recommendations which was so helpful. We will be back!
Close easy walk to town, comfortable beds and simple breakfast provided.

Couldn’t have asked for a better air bnb - so beautiful and comfortable with everything we could need and so close to the lovely town centre. Tracy was so helpful with local tips and recommendations and made it the perfect stay in the barossa for us. We can’t wait to come back!

Lovely light and airy property which was a great base for exploring the Barossa valley. Great communication and lots of helpful ideas and tips from our lovely host too.

Walking distance to lots of restaurants and shops too...

Would love to come back!

Tracy, thanks for making our stay at the Barossa Valley so special.  The apartment was so well located only 1 minutes walk from the main street, very clean,  beautifully lit by natural light, tastefully appointed and lacked for nothing.  We particularly appreciated the little touches upon our arrival such as the bread, milk, butter, and coffee provisions.  First impressions are everything and we were really impressed.  I would recommend your place to anyone who wants to be in the heart of it.

Our stay at Tracy’s was seamless and easy. The communication was great which made the checkin process very easy. The unit was clean and well equipped for our stay. The location in the centre of Tanunda suits us and was easily accessible by foot. Perfect place to stay to visit Tanunda and the Barossa valley

We had a great short stay at Boseka. It was in a quiet location yet only a few minutes walk to cafes and shops. We were very comfortable and the apartment was spotless. It was in a central position to drive to a variety of wineries. 
We would highly recommend this accommodation. Thank you Tracy for being a great host.

Very spacious clean and comfortable!
There were only 3 of us but 2 couples would be fine too.
Clean, modern, excellently appointed apartment in Tanunda. Tracy provided so much useful information and was available if we needed her. We loved our stay and would definitely stay again.

What a great find ! In a surprisingly quiet location, but literally just a short stroll to the shops and restaurants. Super comfy beds and super clean. I would recommend Boseka to future travellers and would happily stay there again.

A lovely place in the middle of town with a short driving distance to wineries in the area. It comes with all the creature comforts you come to expect on a high-quality Airbnb. I have not hesitation in recommending it to others who look to explore the area.
Cute, stylish and cozy place with great amenities. Perfect for a weekend getaway.

Tracy's place definitely exceeded our expectations and we really enjoyed our stay. It appears to be a fresh, recently renovated unit with new appliances and furnishings. Every room, including the all-important bedrooms and bathroom, was sparkling clean throughout. Bedding and towels were hotel-quality clean. A lot of the bathroom and kitchen products stood out as eco-friendly. AppleTV was appreciated for the extra entertainment options. Location is perfect, being one street back from Murray St which is the heart of Tanunda with great food and drink options a short walk away. Could not fault the unit at all. Tracy the host has done an amazingly thorough job to make a very comfortable, homely experience. I highly recommend this place and we'd definitely stay here again!
Lovely stay. Great small gestures like fresh bread, eggs, milk and coffee pods. Thank you!
Wonderful place to stay. Beautifully styled, spacious, clean and great hospitality. The best accomodation we have stayed in from air bnb!

Our stay in the Barossa Valley at Tracy's Airbnb was just fabulous. We loved everything about it. The location was perfect; it was clean, tidy and stylish; and the little extra touches were so thoughtful and appreciated! From the milk, bread, cereal, eggs and coffee machine that were provided, to the little shampoo and conditioners in the shower, to the house being wonderfully cool on arrival on a hot 40+ degree day, we couldn't fault our stay! We would recommend highly, and would love to come back and stay. The only negative was that we only had 2 nights here! Would've loved to have longer. Thanks so much Tracy!!

A big thank you to Tracey for providing such a clean and well appointed apartment for our stay in the Barossa. It was great to walk into the apartment to find the air conditioning on as it was a day of 43 degrees, much appreciated. We will definitely recommend Boseka to our friends. Have a fabulous 2020.

What is advertised is what you get .
A fresh clean and inviting place. As soon as you enter the apartment your eyes are drawn to open space with lots of natural light and a homely feel .
Tracy’s special touches of lovely decor and organic teas etc are only just a few of the treats you will be very delighted to see . 
Included is high quality linen with great comfort upstairs in the bedrooms and even though the bathroom is very small everything is exceptionally clean and modern . 
With only a short walk to the Main Street ,this little gem “Boseka” in Tanunda in the Barossa is in a great spot.
Lovely home, loved the environmental touches like loose leaf tea instead of teabags. Thoughtful touches like eggs, milk & bread provided. Great location. Thanks for having us!
Immaculate home, perfect for a weekend away. Beautiful touches like milk, eggs and bread. Will definitely be re booking again as it felt so cozy!

The place was lovely and clean and rather spacious. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the high quality linen made it a hotel style experience. The extra inclusions of high quality local produce and stylish kitchen made it easy to stay in at times to cook and eat. The extra considerations toward organic and green products through out the place added to the well thought out hospitality this host provided. Easy walking distance to local places but the off street parking is reassuring towards the want to hire a car to really experience the wonderful places to visit in nearby areas. Perfect place to stay for a food and wine lover.

Beautiful sparkling clean, modern apartment right behind the Main Street in Tanunda and close to all amenities. There is a great information centre nearby so we booked a winery tour from our front door. Brilliant place.

Great clean,modern apartment, great value for money and in a convenient location. Tracy was easy to communicate with and we really enjoyed the little touches of bread and eggs on arrival. Would definitely recommend this place for anyone exploring the Barossa.

We had a beautiful stay in Tanunda. Tracy’s home is a short walk to the main part of town. The home was beautiful and such a nice space to be in. The fresh bread, milk and eggs was such a thoughtful touch and we really appreciated it. We would love to come back soon.

Fantastic place in very central
location. Super comfy bed and spacious living area. Would highly recommend!

Most amazing apartment. Ideal location. Hosts were fantastic. Great communication. Apartment stylish,modern, clean and great amenities. Will definitely be back. Would have loved to have stayed longer. Thankyou!
A great little gem in Tanunda, easy to access and some awesome little touches like the local amazing Apex bread loaf there. We will be back!
Nice place very clean and nice and close to the Main Street great host. Lovely to have some breakfast supplies.

We were so well looked after even before arriving. In light of the COVID19 stress, Tracy went out of her way to not only keep the place clean and safe for us but also ensured we had food available and a clear list of where we could buy food to take home. Since we love the outdoors she also provided us with detailed descriptions of her favourite walks so we were well set up. On arrival the house was sparklingly clean and tastefully decorated. It was just as nice not going out in the evening when the place is so nice. We will be back!

A lovely place to stay, very clean and spacious and close to the main street. Beautiful touches with the fridge and pantry stocked up with basics. Excellent response, time wise, to our questions and very thoughtful to our needs. Highly recommend this place in such a lovely quiet setting.

The Loft was a little slice of heaven in Tanunda for us! As soon as we entered this beautifully decorated property we felt at home. It was spotlessly clean and very cozy. We appreciated the high quality decor, linens and towels and the extra little touches that made it so welcoming. We were delighted with some lovely provisions of fresh bread, milk, eggs and organic tea and coffee that were left for us. 
The location is perfect for walking around the town to enjoy the scenery, visit the shops or enjoy a meal or drink. 
We look forward to visiting and enjoying The Loft again in the future and thoroughly recommend it to anyone thinking of visiting the Barossa!

We were so impressed with our stay at the loft. It is beautifully decorated, a great location (easy walk to the Main Street) and a super cosy. Not to mention so nice and clean! It honestly felt like home. We especially loved the bread, eggs and milk etc left for us. 
Tracy also left a book of places to visit which was so helpful as we didn’t really have a plan before our stay.
I highly recommend this stay to anyone wanting a little getaway in the Barossa. Thank you!!
Lovely apartment in the Barossa.  Everything was above our expectations.

The Loft is the perfect spot to stay while exploring the Barossa. You are one street back from the main street of Tanunda with lots of great cafes, dinner spots and boutique shops all within walking distance. The apartment exceeded expectations - it is tastefully decorated, cosy and has everything you need to feel at home from a capsule coffee machine, to smart tv, washing machine, air con etc. Tracy also has a very helpful list of recommendations which we frequently consulted. Will definitely stay again next time we're in the Barossa
Beautiful, clean and close to everything. Great base to explore the Barossa.
Extremely clean, very comfortable, had everything we need. Excellent location just behind the Main Street. Highly recommended and Tracey was extremely helpful and accommodating.
A lovely space that was a pleasure to spend time in

Really great location! Very stylish. Great little additions like eggs and bread and tea and milk. Comfy. Beds. The only thing was cleanliness, very dusty place. Both my partner and I were sneezing the whole time. The 2nd bedroom floor was also so squeaky
Absolutely amazing place! Would highly recommend!!

Our stay at the Loft was absolutely perfect. It was the perfect space for my Bridesmaids and I to get ready for the Wedding, and the perfect space for photo's - with such beautiful styling, fantastic natural light - and stunning features such as the windows, stairs and big circular mirror. 

Everything we could need was exactly where we would need it, and there was so many thoughtful touches such as the 'Thank you' soap products, local suggestions for food/experiences, coffee pods, eggs, olive oil, bread, milk and above bed lighting to name a few. 

We will definitely back, as it was such a special, relaxing space - we could not recommend it more.
A great location, such a cute but spacious place.
The Loft was very tasteful, homely and comfortable. Well located and some perfect recommendations on cafes, wineries and attractions from our host.

Wonderful place. Highly recommended.
Clean,stylish and cozy interior!
Beautiful place to stay! Tracy is very helpful and informative! Had zero issues and loved the home!
Loved every minute!
Great place and ammenities. Lovely little touches like cut rosemary in the bathroom and bread and eggs. Close to the Main Street. Highly recommended!
Fantastic loft apartment, great location and very spacious. perfect place to relax after a day at the wineries.
Loved the location! Great design too with all the touches you need for a getaway to Barossa. Would def stay there again.

Beautiful place that was perfect to relax in after a day tasting the food and wine that Barossa has to offer, with a great location right in Tanunda. Comfortable, clean, had all the amenities we required. Getting to know the neighbour’s cats was a treat too!
Beautiful place to stay. Very comfortable and a lovely atmosphere. Some nice touches provided. Would be happy to stay here again.
Beautiful space and comfortable stay. Will definitely be recommending!!

Such a stylish and well put together interior in a convenient location to explore the Barossa. The king bed was very comfortable, the kitchen was well-equipped, and the rain showerhead with skylight above the shower was luxurious. Would stay again!

Location location location and gorgeous too!   Right in the heart of it all, perfect for our family of 2 adults and 2 kids.  Beautiful, light filled and clean place to stay.  Easy walk to the Main Street and short drive to so many favourite wineries.  Thank you for having us.

I would fully recommend staying at Tracy’s place. I had such a relaxing stay there- it’s beautifully decorated with all the amenities you need. It’s also in a fantastic location, in the heart of the Barossa Valley!
The Loft was a pleasant surprise - beautiful modern and minimalist style, thoughtful touches, and the location was fantastic. It was a great base for our Barossa roaming.

Stunningly renovated apartment with great facilities and amenities. It was a superb location, only a few mins walk from the town centre, shops and restaurants. Communication with Tracy was very easy! Can’t wait to stay here again!

A gorgeous apartment, very well appointed in a very quiet street. Fabulous location within walking distance to the vibrant Tanunda Main Street and easy access to the Barossa wineries. We would definitely book again.

An absolute gem! The perfect spot to base yourself in Tanunda - close to town/shops/restaurants. The space is so comfortable, thoughtfully laid out and beautifully styled with everything you need, and the massive comfy bed was a bonus! Tracy was a fantastic host and I would highly recommend this accomodation to anyone visiting Tanunda. We only wish we could have stayed longer!

Tracy’s place was beautifully presented and in a great spot just off the main street of Tanunda with everything within walking distance. Beds were very comfortable and air conditioning in both bedrooms was lifesaving on a weekend of 40+ degree days! Would definitely stay again and recommend Tracy’s place as a great base for exploring the Barossa.

The Loft was a great base for our two nights in the Barossa. Both of us really appreciated that all the air con units were on when we checked in on a 40+ degree day! It was easy to get to the beer/gin/wine tastings we had planned and pleasant to hang out at the property between trips. Breakfast provisions and coffee machine meant we were well fuelled for each day’s adventures! Big comfy bed was lovely to come back to. Thanks for a fab getaway!

fantastic location to Main Street,  and the communication from tracy was amazing! the pictures are a great representation of the loft! floors are very squeaky upstairs though which was a little annoying at night when someone got up to go to the toilet, but other then that, the stay was amazing.

We loft our stay at the loft at tanunda. It is an absolutely beautiful neat and clean space and we loved the sparse but thoughtful styling. The king bed was the comfiest of our trip since being in SA we slept great!! It was very well set up as an air bnb providing everything you need including basic but delicious local breakfast provisions. It is a very easy walk into tanunda township centre. Tracy was a great host and answered any questions we had promptly. We also enjoyed a cheeky visit from the gorgeous neighbourhood cat. Would definitely recommend
Absolutely stunning Airbnb in a very convenient location. Would definitely stay again
The loft is a beautiful place and located just off the Main Street making it perfect for our trip to tanunda. My girlfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would definitely return to the loft
Tracy's place is great! We highly recommend anyone tostay at this stylish Barossa accomadation.
Great service. I loved that there were lots of local touches around the Airbnb, such as bread, jam, tea and milk. The beds were comfy
this loft has everything you need. sparkling clean, great facilities and alot of character. Super close to town. Would love to stay again
Amazingly stylish loft in the centre of Tanunda, this place had everything we needed! We absolutely loved our stay!

Everything you could ask for in a getaway, a stylish and beautiful home, extremely helpful and welcoming hosts, and the Barossa at your finger tips. Highly recommend you pick The Clyde for your next Barossa visit!!

Words cannot express what an incredible stay our family just had at The Clyde for a week over Christmas! The house was absolutely beautiful, including a lovely pool that we enjoyed with our kids every day, and we also fell in love with town of Greenock. Janine thought of every little touch to make our stay special, including holiday decorations, incredible amenities, and delicious treats to enjoy during our stay. We explored local wineries, restaurants and breweries by foot and spent a few days exploring the Barossa Valley, Adelaide Hills and Adelaide by car. Our stay at The Clyde was the highlight of our trip and we will be back!!

A stylish and comfortable house ideally situated for exploring the Barossa and Clare Valleys. The hosts have taken a great deal of trouble in providing quality furnishings and equipment and have also been unusually generous in stocking it with provisions. The air-conditioning coped well with widely varying temperatures during our month long stay whilst the large TV screen with Netflix was a pleasant bonus. The only slight negative might be that light sleepers could find intrusive the noise from the surprisingly busy road in front of the house particularly in the master bedroom. However we would certainly hope to return to this house when making future trips to the region.

The Clyde made our stay in Barossa Valley absolutely perfect. The attention to detail was amazing, and we loved the wine and cheese platter provisions on arrival. Breakfast supplies also meant we could relax as soon as we arrived. This place was unlike any other we've stayed in, Janine and Matt go above and beyond to ensure that guests are well looked after. Highly recommend The Clyde!
Amazing place to stay!

The Clyde offers a luxurious getaway in a stylish home with everything you need. The house was very clean and a generous amount of local goods are provided for your stay. Janine and Matt were very responsive and helpful. Location was great too, with a winery across the road! We will absolutely be back to stay again!

We were all so happy with our stay at the Clyde. Such a warm welcome, so fresh and clean, and the hosts were so kind to provide us with such special goodies. 

Everything we could of asked for and more.

I recommend the Clyde to all that!! 

Thank you again :)
We absolutely love our stay at Achala’s place. Our experience of the SA farm is amazing. Definitely will return to this place in the future.

Achala and her family made us feel very welcome in their home. We were free to treat their home as our own. I found the kitchen easy to cook in. My kids loved the big smart TV and absolutely adored Achala’s gorgeous little girl. I think the highlight of their stay there was playing with her.

Josie and Andrews place was a very comfortable stay. Everything we needed was provided, and it was super cozy and warm. They supplied cheese and crackers and food for breakfast, which was such a nice little touch. I would highly recommend staying at their place!

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here whilst visiting the Barossa! Josie and Andrew were wonderful hosts and went out of their way to help with food/winery suggestions and anything we needed. The cottage is newly revamped, super clean and has everything you will need, oh and some little extras to make it feel more like home. Beautiful outlook to vineyard at both front and back and even a cellar door to visit on the neighbouring property. Would highly recommend!

We loved the location just out of town but near everything at the same time. Very comfortable Airbnb, we chose to stay in at night after winery lunches out. 
Beautiful Barossa sunsets from the front porch with a few wines, and lovely starry nights, hard to beat. Nice breakfasts, comfortable bed and all you need for a relaxing leisurely stay. 
Thanks Josie and Andrew.

Josie and Andrew’s place was beautiful and set amongst the vines as described. Perfect for a weekend away, and in close proximity to everywhere you’d want to visit whilst in the Barossa. Would definitely recommend.

This is an amazing guest house. It is private and has a wonderfully stocked fridge. Josie and Andrew have done a great job renovating the property and everything is sparkling clean. The location (within the vines) is perfect for a weekend or mid week getaway to explore the Barossa Valley. We highly recommend this property.

Josie & Andrew’s place is simply perfect. My girlfriend and I stayed here for a couple nights and we absolutely loved it. The cottage itself was extremely clean and felt brand new, kitchen and bathroom were full of all the amenities you could possibly need, bedroom was really comfortable and even had an electric blanket. The biggest stand out for us was the location, the cottage is located right in the middle of a vineyard so you literally look out the window onto the vines themselves. The hosts recommended we check out Tomfoolery winery which is the vineyard next door, and we were very glad we did because the wine tasting was amazing and it is only a minute walk from your front door! Everything else is within a short drive so we were never in the car for too long. Josie and Andrew could not have been more welcoming hosts. They were accommodating with our check in/out time and were very knowledgeable of all things Barossa and gave us some great tips. Truly lovely people and I hope we will cross paths in the future. Highly recommend staying here!

Sam & Emily
Great people and a beautiful place to stay. Amazing view over the vine yards and very central to all the attractions of the Barossa. Highly recommend

Josie & Andrew were super nice and inviting. The cottage was way more equipped than we expected, we could have rocked up with nothing and still had everything we needed! All the products they have stocked are either local or organic. Great local knowledge of events and places to visit, would highly recommend!

We'd happily encourage anyone to stay here if you're in the area. Josie & Andrew are great friendly hosts and the property is outstanding. The amount of little extra touches (and some amazing local produce) included make this feel more home than home stay. Great location close to the best the Barossa has to offer. A little out of town, so it's beautifully quiet among the vines, but only a couple of minutes to Nuriootpa.
Wonderful romantic getaway cottage for anyone looking to relax or indulge in the heart of the Barossa. Close to everything you need and the most welcoming and helpful hosts. Would recommend to anyone
A delightful little hideaway right next to an excellent boutique winery. Wonderful hosts

Don’t bother looking at anywhere else - STAY HERE!

Josie and Andrew thought of everything at their listing, and it’s those little touches that made their place great. As a nurse, I loved the addition of a first aid kit in the bathroom.

Be sure to ask them about winery options as they are great for local tips, and the winery next door gives you 10 per cent off purchases of you mention them. Fantastic!

Stayed for two nights, it was a great space with lots of homely touches. 
Josie & Andrew are great hosts and helped us out with suggested routes for bike rides.

Great location only minutes drive to wineries, and a few different villages (or an easy bike ride).

Lovely accommodation.  Better in real life than the pictures.  Very clean and Andrew and Josie have thought of everything.  Definitely choose to stay here when visiting The Barossa.  Fantastic winery just next door as well.

This little place is perfect for a weekend in the Barossa. It was beautiful to look out onto the vines every morning, and the amenities provided were very special. Make sure you're here on the weekend to visit the farmers market.

Josie and Andrew were fabulous hosts. Their knowledge of the Barossa helped us make the most of our two days there. Josie went above and beyond to make sure we had a refrigerator stocked with vegan goodies, and the cottage was spotless (probably the cleaner Airbnb I’ve ever stayed in). Location was perfect for exploring the region - you can hit tons of wineries within 15 minutes. The kitchen is fully equipped for cooking. Great shower and spacious bathroom.

This is a really beautiful little place with lots of extra little touches that speak to the thoughtfulness of Josie and Andrew as hosts. As friendly as ever, they go out of their way to make sure you get the best out of your stay. Highly recommended and we’re looking forward to staying again.

Beautiful location, lovely cottage. Josie and Andrew are very helpful if you need suggestions of where to go and what to see, also very accomodating of dietary requirements - all you have to do is ask.

Where do I start... Josie & Andrew are fantastic hosts, from the time of booking, quick responses and helpful tips to their outstanding cottage.

The guest cottage is located between vineyards, in a quiet and peaceful location in the heart of Barrosa Valley. Newly renovated with everything you need for a relaxing weekend. Josie and Andrew supplied local produce for breakfast (eggs, bread, milk & bacon -yummm!) That was such a lovely touch! 

Bed was comfy & views were amazing! Josie &Andrew gave us tips about local restaurants and family run vineyards.  Overall we had amazing long weekend  & We will definitelybe back! 

Thanks again! X

Lovely, sparkling clean, modern home. Josie and Andrew have thought of everything you might need to make your visit comfortable. They are gracious hosts, ready to help in any way. The location is perfect for touring the area. Look no further!!!

We enjoyed the beautiful cottage in the middle of the vines very much. You both have a good taste for beautiful and good products. You offer a perfect B+B with everything you want. It was nice to have met you and we like to think back to the beautiful Barossa Valley.

Rita  and Marcel

We had a lovely stay here, nice quiet location but still close (as you can be out here) to a lot of things in the area, e.g. the markets.

The additional personal touches, breakfast provisions, and details about the area were super helpful, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.

Would definitely stay again if we are in the area.

The cottage in the Vines is peacefully located and beautifully appointed. The breakfasts were sumptuous and Josie and are the perfect hosts. We enjoyed our stay in the Barossa even if the weather was unseasonably cold.

What a wonderful place to stay. The cottage is gorgeously located amongst the vineyards. Josie and Andrew have gone above and beyond and thought of lots of little extras and they provide great local tips. We would definitely recommend this place to others.
Amazing cottage! Quiet place to stay and relax in Barossa. The details, location and recommendations are excellent. Highly recommend.

The place was perfectly clean - no dust anywhere ! Hosts Josie and Andrew are the perfect hosts. The manual they put together and the breakfast amenities were amazing. There are little touches through the place that you wouldn’t expect from an airbnb that really made our stay 5 stars. Would absolutely stay here again!

Thank you Josie and Andrew for our stay. 
It was most relaxing in beautiful surroundings. 
Light Pass is a lovely part of the Barossa, still close to all the towns and wineries. Lovely to look out over the vines and see the wildlife. 
Amenities were great and we were overwhelmed how well stocked the fridge was when we arrived. Local tourist tips were spot on.
We hope to return again

I cannot recommend Josie and Andrews place enough, one of my new favourite places in the world. Their hospitality is exceptional but not intrusive, they have great local knowledge and make the effort to understand what your interests are before making recommendations, all of which were spot on. 
The cottage is a home away from home, great cooking facilities and has a few lovely spots to enjoy a glass of wine. 
Little touches such as complementary breakfast options and delicious coffee were the cherry on the cake.
We had an amazing stay. The cottage is beatiful, very comfortable and we will 100pct book here again next time we are in Barossa.

A gem of an Airbnb. Josie and Andrew provided us with delicious breakfast ingredients, recommendations for local restaurants and wineries, and thoughtful touches to ensure our comfort -- Andrew even brought us a pillow to better enjoy lounging in the hammock! It felt like we were staying at a friend's place, instead of just an Airbnb, with the right balance of help from the hosts while also maintaining our privacy. Thank you again for a great stay!

Perfection - it's the only word to describe this experience. If you are visiting the Barossa and this place is free, don't hesitate - just book it! Outstanding hospitality from very thoughtful hosts, extremely comfortable and well-appointed accommodation where everything has been thought of, sparkling clean, and as for the location - you can walk to a winery *next door* to get a bottle or two. Spectacular sunsets, waking with birdsong every morning, a hammock for two....Josie and Andrew have thought of everything, and it shows. If we ever return to the Barossa, we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Thank you again for a wonderful relaxing time and for all the generous extras and helpful tips throughout our stay.

In the Vines has to be our best Airbnb experience to date. Jocelyn and Andrew have worked hard to ensure that the cottage provides an exceptional guest accommodation. The fit out and furnishings are of the highest quality and all done with thought and taste. The shower room is just amazing, perfect to wake you up or soothe you after a day in the hot Barossa sun. The hosts provide helpful local insights and tips to enable you to get the best out of your visit. Andrew has good taste in wineries, eateries and coffee shops! Watching the sunset in the evening form the verandah or double hammock is a highlight. I recommenda visit to the Tom Foolery tasting room just a few mins walk away. Enjoy!

We stayed at ‘in the vines’ for 2 nights and had a wonderful time - Josie and Andrew went above and beyond to ensure we had a great stay, from the goodies in the fridge to lots of local recommendations. We enjoyed a glass of wine in the hammock looking over the vines at sunset and would definitely recommend as a place to stay!
Josie and Andrew are wonderful hosts.  Their place is very clean and relaxing.  Highly recommend!

Josie and Andrews home was everything and more. Spotlessly clean, comfortable bed, a relaxing and fresh decor. The provisions for the breakfasts was exceptional and gave us a chance to experience the local produce. We would highly recommend this home.
Amazing place. Andrew and Josie went out of their way to make us comfortable. Best Air BnB hosts we’ve had so far! Thank you guys :)

Top spot nestled in the vines. Jodie and Andrew have a gorgeous little cottage perfect for two. Lovely touches such as cheese and crackers, local wines and games to play make this an exceptional place to visit.

My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our long weekend in the Barossa, and staying ‘In The Vines’ made the trip that much more special. Drinking a Barossa Shiraz and looking at the sunset over the vines on the property was the highlight if our trip. The house is so cosy, the breakfast provisions were delicious and the shower was amazing. Do yourself a favour and make sure you stay here on your next Barossa visit.

Lovely little one bedroom cottage. Mini kitchen and bathroom look pretty freshly renovated. Everything immaculately clean on arrival. Reverse cycle split system kept us nice and warm throughout our stay.

Josie & Andrew are lovely and met us on arrival to let us in and give some tips on things to do and see. Also had plenty of maps, and details about good restaurants and cellar doors. Tomfoolery cellar door is walking distance away, directly next door and well worth a visit.

Josie and Andrew were very friendly and welcoming on our arrival. We were offered a tour of the accommodation and offered one of their very own bottles of red wine which was of high quality. 
The accommodation was exemplary in terms of cleanliness. The fridge stocked with sufficient breakfast provisions including fresh bread, pod coffee and tea. The kitchen and bathroom modern and fresh. Little finishes such as maps of bush walks,  wineries  and local food options were highly helpful. 
The surroundings are magnificent. Nestled within acres of vines with great views from the lounge and kitchen. You have the feeling of being secluded yet close to many top quality wineries. Tomfoolery next door within a 2 minute walk is worth a visit. 
Our privacy and space was maintained throughout our 3 night stay. 
We recommend for couples looking to escape the city. Thanks again Josie and Andrew for your hospitality
We had a wonderful time visiting the Barossa and staying here again. Just as beautiful as the first time! Super warm and cozy visiting in the winter time too

A beautiful cottage location, set in between vineyards with amazing views from all windows. Cute decor, exceptionally clean with high quality ammenities. The bed was very comfortable  and the bedroom was warm and cosy. Highly recommend!

A lovely vista, centrally located to the entire Barossa region. The cottage was fitted out to a very high standard with many added touches to make our stay that much more comfortable and was sparkling clean. Plus we got to play Snatch! a new game for us. 
Cheers
Frank & Elizabeth
Recommend this beautiful place highly. Perfect location, beautiful views of the sunset, really clean and tidy with everything you could need for a great stay! Will most certainly be back!!

Perfect if you are looking for a top class private house in the heart of the Barossa and right in the middle of a vineyard! Super clean and comfortable with many thoughtful touches, a fridge stocked full of breakfast for one. Josie and Andrew were very welcoming, suggesting some of the things to see and do in the local area then  leaving us to have the place to ourselves, perfect.
Beautiful place. Lovely people. Had an amazing stay
A great place for 2 people -- sparkling clean and has everything for a holiday in the Barossa

Beautiful space. 
Very comfortable and stylish. Food provisions were excellent. 
Would stay again and recommend it to our friends

Very tidy and kosy cottage in a great location in the Barossa! We loved every single bit of our weekend at the cottage and we really can't wait to return in the future thanks to their beautiful hospitality. Highly recommended!

Tranquil & beautiful location in the Barossa hosted by Josie & Andrew. They thought of everything and more. Delicious breakfast provisions & great advice for local adventures. Highly recommend hiring bikes for a self guided winery tour!

Perfect place to stay if your looking for a relaxed get away in a beautiful vineyard. Josie and Andrew were lovely hosts who gave myself and my partner great tips.  We will be back one day for another 5 star stay :)
Wonderful and welcoming, Josie & Andrew made sure I had everything I need to have an amazing time in their beautiful guest cottage.

Beautiful cottage hosted next the owners main house. Cottage was right on the vines and watching the sunset on the chairs was a bucket list moment. 

Beautiful amenities and the breakfast provisions was a great touch. 

Tomfoolery tasting next door is a must.

Great place for a trip to the Barossa. The cottage is great size for 2 with great amenities! Andrew and Josie are super easy to talk to and add lots of small touches that make the cottage really homey!
A cosy home in a lovely area. The gas fireplace was very handy in the cooler months
Cute little place right in the heart of Angaston! Walking distance to the main street with cafes and pubs. The place was super clean and cozy! Thanks!
Nice clean house in a great location, close to town amenities and close to wineries.

This is a fantastic place located right in the heart of Angaston.  Walking distance to restaurants and cafes, it is the perfect place to base yourself for your time in the Barossa.  Lydia's communication was first rate and the house was sparkling when we arrived.  We would highly recommend this location!

A comfortable house that easily accommodates 5 people with everything to make your stay pleasant. For us the location was excellent as we dined at Casa Carboni and didn’t want the hassle of organising a taxi to get back to the accommodation. We’ve stayed in Angaston before - it is a delightfully pretty town.
Our workers enjoyed their stay at Lydia's place.
We loved staying at at Lydia’s it is perfectly located within walking distance to town and a short drive to many tourist attractions.
Great location, close to everything you need and extremely clean throughout. Perfect for what we needed.

A perfect place to stay within walking distance of all Angaston has to offer. This home was very comfortable, very clean and tidy. The bed was very comfortable and the rooms are a good size with lots of storage. The kitchen is well equipped and roomy and easy to accommodate a small to mid size family.
Stop looking elsewhere because Ten on French has it all: a very comfortable and newly renovated charmer so close to the Main Street; Angaston is by far the prettiest Barossa town.

Located in a very quiet tree-lined street this property has everything! Very welcoming, lots of little treats on arrival, scrupulously clean, very comfortable, awesome views from kitchen/dining areas, fantastic bbq and undercover area, gorgeous garden. So close to great food places and other Barossa attractions. Highly recommend!

Everything we could want and need and special little touches and treats which made it a wonderful stay. Would strongly recommend to anyone in the area to stay here. We had a wonderful time and would be back.

I would give Jerry’s place 10 stars if I could. The space is immaculately tidy. It is truly a welcoming space with luxury fittings and decor throughout. 

The bed and linens were superb quality. 

Only 5 min walk to the main road in town. Location was quiet. 

With all of the uncertainty right now around travel restrictions, Jerry was prompt with his responses to my questions and provided us with a platter and Prosecco on arrival which was well received and thoughtful.

I’ve now stayed in quite a few Air BnBs, This has to be up there for my favourite. I would without any hesitation recommend Jerry and his place to anyone.

Such a charming stay in the heart of Tanunda! Walking distance to town and close to several vineyards. Jerry is a great host! He provided a portacot and high chair for bubs, detailed PDFs of restaurants, wineries, and shops in the area, and lovely welcome treats. The fireplaces were all set up and ready to go, which was very much appreciated on a cold winter night! Jerry also had hand sanitizer set up at the entrance of the house. Wish we could have stayed longer!
Absolutely amazing home! We will be back again soon
Lovely little cottage a walk away from everything in Tanunda. Nice warm wood fire was a treat!
Beautiful cottage in the heart of Tanunda. Perfect location for all of Barossa wineries. Lots of heating and a beautiful fireplace. Comfortable beds We had a really lovely stay. Thanks Jerry.
Thank you for a lovely stay. Sparkling clean. Well appointed. Comfortable bed and couches. Plenty of wood to keep the fireplaces going. Warm and homely. Recommended.

My husband and I stayed at Mataro Cottage during a weekend trip to The Barossa. Jerry is a kind and thoughtful host and there were lots of thoughtful touches that enhanced our stay. His communication was prompt, accurate and responsive. The cottage is beautiful and in an excellent location just off the main street of Tanunda making it a perfect base for exploring all the region has to offer. The cottage is clean and cosy and the beds are super comfy. I  would definitely stay again and would highly recommend this to anyone looking for the prefect accommodation in the Barossa. Thanks again Jerry!
A lovely, clean and stylishly furnished house. There’s a fire to curl up beside when the weather’s cold and a great garden to relax in when it’s warm. The location is fantastic.
Great spot, walking distance to restaurants. Good wifi and fireplace in the lounge room.

Lovely sparkling clean place with a thoughtful mix of classic cottage and newly renovated facilities, as well as all the modern comforts, and Tanunda’s main street just a few minutes walk away; staying here was a pleasure.
Fantastic base to take in all the Barossa has to offer. Jerry is a wonderful host, great communication.

We had a great stay at this apartment, it was clean, roomy and comfortable with everything we needed. It’s in a great location, on a main road, not really noisy though, and close to shops, cafes/restaurants and bars. Great outdoor area with bbq too and another outdoor area off the apartment itself.
The apartment was clean and in a great location and jerry was very flexible to our requirements

I booked Jerry’s apartment for my parents who were very happy with everything. They said great location, clean, nice & modern & would stay again.
Jerry was great to communicate with also!
Fantastic accommodation, everything you could possibly need is provided and the location is delightful!

The accommodation at Angaston Mews was outstanding. Clean, stylish and functional. So close to everything Angaston has to offer and a homely-feel - which is always appreciated. Thanks for the great memories - would definitely recommend.
Very neat apartments with everything we need. Great location on the main Street of Angaston, and a very helpful host with easy communication. Highly recommend.

What an incredible place to stay! A working farm still home to the 7th Generation of the family. 

The JHA stone cellar was an ultimate escape for us with all the luxuries and mod cons you could think of, full off hidden surprises to make us feel welcome.

A truly stunning renovation and extension that must be experienced to understand. 
Don’t change a thing at this property, it is perfect! From the old stone wall cellar room to the modern extension, underfloor heating and hot outdoor showers!

We are already planning our trip back at the end of the year!!!

Staying at the JHÃ Stone Cellar is a truly special experience. What an amazing building formed from the restoration of an old stone barn melded with a modern addition to create something architecturally unique and spectacular. It sits on a rise and offers 270degree views over the peaceful rolling landscape. The house is so well appointed with thoughtful and luxurious fittings and stylishly decorated. The cooking facilities are a cooks delight and the opportunity to cook with an AGA oven and cooktop was something quite special. Our host, Jan, greeted us and gave us a quick but comprehensive orientation to the house and the region. Her recommendations were spot on. Don’t leave without taking the opportunity to have a tasting of The Hutton Vale Farm wines with John. There is a 10 minute drive into Angaston where you can get some Hutton Vale Farm lamb from the local butcher to cook at the house in the AGA or on the Weber Q. While you may just choose to stay in and enjoy the property and facilities, relaxing listening to vinyls on the record player, sipping local wines or g and t’s and taking in the views, it’s also an easy drive to see many of the highlights of the Barossa. I personally can’t wait to return for another stay at this property. Thank you Jan, John and Caitlin for providing such a beautiful space.
Beautiful space, gorgeous views, great location, clean, comfortable amazing. Highly recommend ..... great for all seasons......... will definitely come back :)
Beautiful accommodation. The pictures don't do it justice. Lots of personalised touches and service. We have a fantastic time.
beautiful relaxing spot, great for a getaway. highly recommended

We had an absolutely amazing weekend away and a great overall experience, thank you Sarah! The cottage was absolutely beautiful and we could not fault a thing. Sarah went above and beyond helping with dinner reservations and bike hire which we were incredibly grateful for. We hope to visit again in the future :)

Perfect accommodation in the Barossa amongst the vineyards. Sarah and Ben could not have been more lovely as hosts and showing us around the winery. Loved all the personal touches and the fridge stocked with beautiful local produce was very much enjoyed and appreciated- we definitely hope to return!
Don’t look any further! If you are looking to stay in the Barossa, and would like a beautiful place to stay, then check out Tomfoolery. This was an exquisite air bnb. All amazing!

Incredible! Highly recommend to anyone travelling to the area! Absolutely stunning and luxurious! We loved it and hope we can be back soon! The perfect stay! So many thoughtful touches made it such a comfortable experience!
Awesome accommodation with thoughtful inclusions and fantastic food !

We had an amazing stay at this beautiful cottage and were blown away by all of the small things. The pool came in handy on a very warm January day. Having the cellar door on site was great! We ended up tasting all of the wines over a three day period which was amazing! Thanks you, Ben and Sarah, for being such wonderful hosts!

This place is paradise. Period. Ben and Sarah obviously have an extreme passion for what they do and Ben's enthusiasm for his craft is contagious. The staff at the cellar door were friendly and extremely knowledgeable. The cottage was beautiful, comfortable, and well-stocked. To top it off, the pool, fruit trees, and garden space made us feel like royalty. If you're considering staying here, don't hesitate, just do it.
Amazing little cottage with everything you could possibly want for a quick little get away. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a place to stay in the Barossa !

Sarah was amazing to communicate with, nothing was to hard to help us with from arranging bikes to helping us get a taxi for a nice dinner.
The B&B was amazing we didn’t want to leave, the bath was so big both my Husband and O could fit and relax. The food which was supplied was amazing! It help my husband cooked it for me so I could have a sleep in. The amenities which she also supplies were very thoughtful including the fresh flower from the garden which smelt beautiful. 
Would go back in a heart beat!
Thank you so much Sarah!

We spent a weekend at Sarah's place and we thoroughly enjoyed it! Sarah was quick to reply to all our  messages and she provided all the necessary information for all our requests. The cottage is amazing and there were lots of food (and wine) waiting for us upon our arrival. The spa bathtub is perfect and was great for us after a whole day of biking across the valley. The cellar door is right next door for those fancying wine tasting. We loved our stay and would love to come back again at some point!
Fantastic place to stay with everything you could need and Delicious wine!

The cottage has everything you thought you needed, and everything you never thought you really wanted for a deluxe Barossa experience. It was so tempting to never leave to  explore the area. Sarah has looked out for every detail! Six out of five stars.

Wow what a fantastic getaway my partner and I had at the Tomfoolery cottage! 
The facilities are absolutely first class and The hosts thought of everything and are so selfless with the breakfast staples provided as well as the unbelievable wine we were fortunate enough to be given. 
Will definitely be coming back again!

This place was just brilliant! Sarah has thought of everything and the personal touches make for a truly memorable stay.  The inclusions are extremely generous and the cottage is very comfy.

For the organized people - the 2 things I normally take away that I didn’t need to were my hairdryer and a wireless speaker!
Incredibly cozy and welcoming!! The local products and produce was an extra special touch! Perfect for staying in and/or as a base for barossa adventures. And such delicious wines

Had a fantastic stay at the Tomfoolery Winemaker's Cottage. Sarah has obviously spent so much time making sure that everything you could ever need at the house was there and the house is so lovely surrounded by such a beautiful landscape. Overall thoroughly enjoyed our time spent here and couldn't be any happier!! Loved it!!

We were so impressed with this beautiful cottage. It was a gorgeous space, beautifully decorated and carefully prepared. Everything you could possibly need was provided! Breakfast included ample supplies of local produce (cheese, fruit, small goods, bread etc) and we were treated to beautiful wine and beer. The spa was incredible and the amenities were of a high quality. Sarah assisted with amazing communication, including booking a restaurant and taxi service for us. We can't wait to return. Highly recommend for a special getaway!!
Absolutely amazing place to stay! Sarah and the team are incredible and went above and beyond for us

Is this place available? Book it. That’s all you need to know. Sarah has made the place magical with all her through tail touches. It’s so close to everything, yet still private. It’s a cosy sanctuary and we are so thankful that we had the opportunity to stay here. Thank you for your incredible hospitality, Sarah! And thank you for the incredible wine, Ben!

We stayed as a part of our honeymoon. Sarah was incredibly welcoming and flexible. When our honeymoon plans had to change because of COVID restrictions we were able to find new dates that work. She offered numerous suggestions for things to try and made reservations for us.

The house is stylish and comfortable with everything we needed to feel relaxed.
Great position in the Barossa and a very stylish setup with pool and breakfast supplies. Stunning garden and spotless. Spa bath added plus.

A thoroughly enjoyable stay. A modern & private little lodge in beautiful garden setting amidst the vines of Tomfoolery with the bonus being a kitchen stocked with some of the most incredible local produce (those tomatoes!) Thanks Ben & Sarah. We will be back.   PS The Youngblood Grenache is a belter!

Located in the beautiful Barossa Valley, this cottage is really special, with so many extra touches, superb wines, local produce, quality toiletries, linens and furnishings. The delightful garden, sunsets from the veranda of the Cellar Door, not to mention the spa and private pool. Sarah is a fabulous host, offering suggestions and making bookings for us. Highly recommended for a special occasion.

My husband and I did a two night honeymoon getaway and this place was perfect! We had the entire place to ourselves. It was super clean with breakfast and some snacks included which I thought was really nice from Sarah. Would definitely make a trip back here in the future:)
Amazing little cottage perfect for a romantic getaway and for a time you will never forget... the cottage is perfect and you just want to stay in and enjoy every aspect of it...

We couldn’t have thought of a better way to celebrate our recent engagement. The orchid was an amazing spot for our morning coffee and nightly wine.A stroll to the top of the hill made for some amazing sunset photos.We absolutely loved the attention to detail throughout the house.

The house was packed with everything we needed for stay

Make sure you go to the cellar door while you are there as the wine is amazing.
Top quality getaway with every amenity catered for.  Beautiful surroundings and garden.  Sparkling pool and quality wines. A must for a peaceful enjoyable escape.

This accommodation is faultless. It is luxurious beyond words. Attention to the tiniest details has been made. The gardens are huge and serene, the bed is heavenly and the spa is out of this world! Everything you could possible wish for is right here. Sarah responded immediately re questions, recommendations and requests. It’s so gorgeous I stayed an extra night. I highly recommend this magical place.
Diana

The beautiful cottage is the setting for an idealistic couples retreat – particularly given the thought put into all the intricate details of the cottage. The breakfast produce and ammenities are exquisite, we were flabbergasted by the extent to which Sarah had thought of everything you could possibly need for a retreat. We can’t wait to come back!
The perfect retreat to get away and relax! So much thought went into every detail. We can’t wait to come back!!
Such a great place! The place was spotless and so welcoming
Amazing place we would love to stay again
Fantastic hospitality, super clean place, comfy beds and just a wonderful hospitable host!!
Lovely place to stay, friendly & helpful host. Very clean & in an excellent position
Great place, very clean and comfortable, would highly recommend

Excellent stay and (check my Airbnb), the best ever. Good location but the touches Dianne has made to the historical house are fabulous. she is a perfectionist (in a nice way). Very well equipped and a nice breakfast was left. Great aircon on a hot day and likewise for the cool night
Very well equipped for any disability needs.
Book this place while it lasts!

This place is a beautiful and spacious 3 bedroom house in the middle of Williamstown. Great location for travel and exploration of the surrounding Barossa valley and to come home to at night to rest the weary legs. The house was sparkling clean. The beds were very comfortable. The doors were wide and wheelchair accessibility well accounted for. Little touches like bread, milk, bacon and eggs, general pantry foods, board games, netflix are some simple additions which made the stay homely and comfortable. Excellent communication with host Dianne. We loved this place and it comes highly recommended.

Didn't realise it was an actual B&B when I originally booked. It was a wonderful newly renovated building and absolutely lovely to stay at. Fantastic location, not far from the Barossa and Hills areas.

Dianne was super accommodating and lovely to chat to. Her touches to the house made it even more welcoming and the place was neat, clean and spacious. I’d highly recommend staying here. Will definitely come back!

House is beautifully decorated with amazing views.  Very short walk to main street area.  I have rated 5 starts for cleanliness as the house was spotless.  Only negative was that the BBQ was dirty so didn't get used.  Jasmine was extremely apologetic when I messaged her and has said she will keep a closer eye on the cleaning.   Main living area is large open plan.  Bedrooms are generous sizes.  Was a perfect place for our big family gathering.  Would stay there again as a large group.
Enormous and very clean house with beautiful views... great family house to enjoy!
Great location....excellent place for the whole family to gather....very good communication with the host - all my questions answered.  Happy to come back to Lindsay House!
Beautiful views, plenty of space.
The house was beautiful and huge with lovely scenery. Easy check in and good communication, had everything needed to stay overnight in the Barossa. Would definitely return.

We were 5 couples having a weekend away. The accommodation  was perfect for us all, plenty of space, all bedrooms had queen size beds in them, lovely views and walking distance to town.
We would all quiet happily stay here again.
Nice location, very neat and tidy
Such a fantastic accommodation for bigger group with kids. Very good and instant communication. The view over the deck is something to die for! Amazing!
Well positioned and well setup accomodation. Would recomend for a group wanting a week away in the barossa

Beautiful house in a perfect Location. For ten of us very comfortably. Plenty of spaces for people to gather and also lots of little retreats for privacy. Gorgeous Barossa views and adorable farm animals to feed. 

If I had one small gripe, it would be the mattresses. They’re like concrete. But to be fair, after a long day of wine touring, you barely even notice.

Thanks for a great stay!!

From the start, our stay couldn't have been more relaxing and enjoyable. The property was beautifully landscaped and on arrival, we were met by Chris who showed us around the farm and introduced the alpacas! The grounds were stunning, from the nearby rolling fields where we spotted a few late night kangaroos from the kitchen window to the paddocks further down the track, there was lots of space to explore should we wish too and an abundance of wildlife. The stars at night were some of the brightest I have seen and the Airbnb had its own, private entrance and truly felt like our very own tranquil escape. 

The log fire and cosy living room were dreamy, immaculately clean and with a homely feel. The bed was comfy, lovely linen sheets and despite the winter, the house never felt cold. I would recommend this to anyone looking for an escape that is still a stone's throw from the Barossa. Plenty of nearby places to eat (a short drive) and caring, respectful hosts, who have put a great effort into the finishing touches. A gem in SA!

This has to be the best air bnb I think I have ever stayed in! The setting was absolutely perfect, peaceful, homely and the hosts were amazing! They went above and beyond to ensure our stay was perfect but also left us to just enjoy the surroundings! A complementary bottle of wine whilst putting your feet up infront of the fire was the exact break anyone needs! Getting to meet and feed the alpacas was such a great experience and the hosts are so informative! 
We absolutely loved our stay and will be back!

OMG Tracey and Chris have been amazing and we highly recommend it for anyone looking for a country stay. 

Property - Gorgeous & picturesque 
Animals - Hilarious 
Hosts - Tracy was away during our visit but Chris was great, funny and super accomodating to us city folk. 
Personalised Touches - OMG who has pillow-top beds in Air BnB's ? Tracy and Chris do !!! The flowers, the candles .. we just all loved the welcoming style of this house.
Atmosphere - Homey, ohhh that fire was amazing 

We just loved our little girls vaycay for the night, thank you for having such an amazing property and give our love to the cheeky alpaca's. 

Diana xo

Wonderful stay! the space is gorgeous and has everything you could need for several or one night stay, the fire was going when we arrived so the living room was toasty, the living room windows look out over the alpaca area which is entertaining. We mostly engaged with Chris who was passionate about the farm and was very welcoming, giving us the freedom to walk around the farm, enjoying the scenery, as well as take part in feeding and interacting with the alpacas as much as we liked. highly recommend!

Thank you for such a wonderful few days. We loved the house, especially the woodfire! It was exactly how it was presented in the pictures. Hosts were available to answer any questions, and continually stock up the wood pile. We loved our stay!

Walked out of a cold wet winters day into a cozy living area with a fantastic wood fire, amazing views and lovely hosts. 

An amazing place to stay!

Tracy and Chris were very welcoming and generous with their time, always happy to accommodate you. The property has many lovely design touches and is being thoughtfully restored/renovated. It is a lovely spot to both relax and truly unwind, or there are many nearby towns and attractions. Likewise there is plenty to amuse the family on the property, you can go for a walk and see kangaroos and many other animals, or interact  with and feed the alpacas. We learnt a lot about the breeding and behaviour of alpacas and our son loved hanging out with them.

This place was above and beyond expectations cottage was lovely, fire place was fantastic and the extra touch of bacon and eggs for breakfast was great. Then there are the Alpacas and other wildlife around the place was just great. We will be back again when we need a getaway from it all.

Tracey’s place is a beautiful, serene piece of farmland out in the Adelaide hills. On top of an amazing herd of alpacas, expect an enthusiastic welcome and roaring fire when you arrive along with a bottle of local wine, paddocks, woodlots and dams to explore if you feel like it, and a comfortable, modern set out of the house. 

In the morning, wake up to the sunrise over the hills from a spectacular view out the bedroom window, and complimentary breakfast supplies. 

We were lucky to join in the morning feeding of the alpacas too, which was a pretty special experience.

Would recommend!
Excellent location- peaceful, tranquil and beautiful.  Excellent value for money. Great hosts. Amazing alpaca experience. The bed is super comfy, quality bedding, cosy space with a magical fireplace.

Very tidy and well decorated house in the tranquil suburbs of Barossa. It is also convenient, only five minutes to the town for grocery shopping. 
Tracy and Chris the host couple are very considerate and nice.  They lit the fireplace for us in advance before our arrival and prepared so many wood for us. They also invited us to feed their alpacas which are so cute and furry. 
We also saw several kangaroos in the barn.  
Very pleasant experience.  Highly recommended!
距离巴罗萨主产区40公里,你可以在结束品酒之旅后带上心仪的酒驱车下塌这个宁静农庄,有2个大房间一个有着舒适长沙发的客厅,装备齐整的厨房,整体装饰干净精美,驱车6公里可到附近镇上的Food land超市买好牛排羊排,回来简单又原味配上红酒,宁静致远｡主人夫妇热情好客,很早便为我们生好了壁炉,还准备了很多木头｡他们还邀请我们去喂他们养的可爱羊驼,又看见了成群的袋鼠｡
如果时间允许,真想多住两天,呷口红酒惬意无比｡
Great hospitality and the alpacas are super cute!

Chris and Tracy were wonderful hosts for our one night stay. Loved the styling of the cottage and had everything we needed and more! Lovely couple willing to show us around the property and tell us all about it and their alpacas! Will be sure to come back one day and see the progress of the farm :)

You will love every minute of your stay. Tracy & Chris’s farm was so beautiful and peaceful. Could not recommend their place enough. Walking in to a roaring fire was amazing, can’t wait to stay again.
Amazing! Little touchs to the house made it even better. Breakfast provided and the fire on arrival was a great touch
I was a great place that have a short trip. The owners are really friendly and very easy communication. Definitely will come back again.

We had an enjoyable stay at this property. It’s nice being out in the countryside and it’s so quiet.

Tracy our the fire on before we arrived and it as nice an cosy.

The place looks great and the bedrooms are particularly fresh, clean and comfortable.

We enjoyed the breakfast provisions and the short drive to wineries.

Would not hesitate to recommend this place. Would stay again.

What a treat! The alpacas were ridiculously cute, the place was beautifully decorated and the hosts were so kind and informative. We loved our stay here and can't wait to return - next time we'll have to time it to make sure we can help take an alpaca for a walk!

Amazing stay, thoroughly enjoyed.
beautiful house with great little details. It’s everything you want and more when staying in the Barossa region.
Tracy and Chris were so lovely and helpful, and even assisted in organising our wine tour with pick up and drop off. I would definitely recommend to anyone travelling to the Barossa valley.
10/10

Tracy & Chris were wonderful hosts and the house was amazing. Definitely exceeded expectations. So many beautiful finishing touches added and all the little extras looked after. We wanted for nothing during our stay. The tour of the property was lovely and the Alcapa's were gorgeous and fluffy. We had the most perfect and relaxing birthday weekend away.

环境优美,风景很好,晚上看到了广阔明亮的星空｡羊驼非常可爱,喂食羊驼是一次难忘的经历,主人Tracy和Chris非常周到也非常热情,提前一天询问到达时间提前为我们生好了壁炉,冰箱里也有丰富的食物,以及红酒｡厨具也很齐全｡房间装饰的很有品味｡床品是我这半个月的旅行中最柔软干净以及舒适的｡羊毛被真的很暖和｡有独立的入口有自己的空间和私密性｡可惜行程太匆忙,如果有机会一定住上一段时间好好感受｡
Everything is perfect, the scene is very beautiful ,the hosts are kind and thoughtful , the alpacas are so cute, the decorations shows a good taste of the host｡A home away from home . We really enjoyed our stay here. Thank you Tracy and Chris.
Tracy and Chris are very warm and attentive hosts. The place is beautiful.

Lovely place with a cozy fire and super comfortable couch and bed! The alpacas are super cute as well. A really nice, relaxing spot that is a short drive to the Adelaide hills or the Barossa. Would definitely recommend!

We had SUCH a wonderful time at the farm with our almost 2 year old who couldn't get enough of the 'acapacas'. Tracy and Chris were very thoughtful and attentive, taking us for a walk, letting us borrow their grandson's trike, keeping the firewood stocked, and it was so lovely to have some food to cook on arrival and a warm fireplace- so important when you have a hungry little person in tow! We'll definitely be back. Thanks so much Tracy and Chris! x
This place is awesome!

This location is a hidden gem 
Tracy and Chris have local knowledge of this region and know how to make guests feel at home  
Loved our stay we were warm as toast and enjoyed a huge breakfast prior to book out 
Would recommend and would stay again

Thank you both to Tracy and Chris for a wonderful relaxing farm stay. The house was beautifully styled and we felt right at home with arriving with the fire place lit. It was the perfect country downtime we were seeking from a city-escape. Quiet, peaceful, private, beautiful. The house was spacious and cosy and we loved interacting with the alpacas on the farm. Thank you for the great stay - we look forward to coming back in the near future.
Thanks for an amazing stay, we loved every minute. Alpacas are so gorgeous, what a beautiful stay, we will definitely be returning. Thanks Tracy and Chris

Tracy and Chris place was amazing to stay .
I love the stay very quiet and beautiful place, especially the lounge setting and the animals at the farm beautiful.
Tracy and Chris are super host, there anytime to welcome you in , happy to show you around good people.
I will definitely recommend anyone to stay.
Warm welcome and fabulous location!
We had such an amazing time at Chris and Tracy's place. We highly recommend it and we will definitely return.

A truly luxurious and superbly cozy experience. Excellent getaway for a relaxing worry free stay. Superhosts to greet you on arrival and show you around they amazing place. Fully equipped with all amenities: two large bedrooms, built-in cupboards, individual access to bathroom, plenty of blankets and towels, kitchen with all desired features, large cozy living area with a built-in wood fire place, TV, radio, and a large deck for morning coffee with great views. Breakfast included with all the extras you could think of. Complimentary wine of choice makes an evening by the fire momerable. The cherry on top - take the stunning Alpacas for a walk and learn all about them.

What a wonderful house and property! We loved the space and Tracey and Chris were friendly and made us feel comfortable. Would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a quiet trip away. A memorable experience!
房间非常大,干净,房东非常热情,在冰箱里准备了牛奶面包冰淇淋｡亲手喂了羊驼宝宝,全家都很开心｡非常值得入住｡

One of the experiences should have in a lifetime!!! Highly recommended, the host Tracy and Chris are very friendly, will walk with you along the third farm and pet the animals. The star night sky and the wood oven just make the stay unforgettable! Should try!
原汁原味的农场生活,完全独立的house,热情洋溢的主人,已经农场里的羊驼,袋鼠和其他的动物｡烤着火炉看夜晚的银河星空,喝着房东免费提供的红酒,很是惬意!
A unique stay at Tracey and Chris’ Alpaca farm BnB, loved having a hands on experience with the Alpacas!  Beautiful location!

We were checked in by Chris. He really loves what he does and Is very passionate about all his projects on the farm.  He showed us around the land and he let us feed the alpacas which was a lovely experience. The Airbnb is perfectly kitted out for everything you would need. (Pots, pans, kettle, coffee, tea and milk  etc)They even provided breakfast. It was also lovely to have a nice fire to relax in front after a long day of travel. The beds were extremely comfortable and gave for a great night sleep.  
The location is wonderful.  It really gives you the opportunity to have a snap shot into Chris and Tracy’s life on their alpaca farm.  With the alpacas, wild birds and neighbouring kangaroos all outside your window, you really couldn’t ask for more.  We would highly recommend this airbnb. 
Keep up the great work and we hope you get your tractor sorted out soon!

Amazing stay at Tracy's place. Beautiful location and so quiet. Tracy and Chris were so welcoming and showed us around the farm and we met the alpacas who were adorable. Chris has done a great job with all the renovations. Breakfast provisions were provided in the large fridge as well as a lovely bottle of wine. Loved this place and would highly recommend it as an escape from the city. Will definitely be back when next in S.A.

First time farm stay expensive,  loving it.
Tracy and Chris both are super nice persons sharing how they renovate the farm, how B&B work and a lot of knowledge of the alpaca...
All alpacas are lovely and adorable.
Highly recommended ! Sure will come back next time

Tracy's place was exactly as pictured. The setting felt very tranquil and the fireplace was so lovely, even in October. We were warmly welcomed by the hosts and given an informative  tour  of the Alpaca farm. Our toddler loved the outdoor space!
Great place to stay, very clean and tidy. Got to feed the Alpacas
Outstanding location, living space with everything you need, amazing hosts and we loved the alpaca interaction. Will be coming back!

Tracy and her husband, Chris were fantastic and friendly hosts. They met us in arrival and were prompt in communicating with us and accommodating our late check in. We loved the opportunity to meet the alpacas and the walk of the property, there are so many wild kangaroos around. The fact that you can see the stars in the sky at night also really brings home the fact that you’re away in the country! 

The bnb is comfortable and fitted out well with beautiful furnishings (some made with alpaca fur, which can be purchased), also there is a full-functioning kitchen with utensils and ingredients for preparing meals. Tracy very generously left bacon and eggs for us in the fridge so we had breakfast in the bnb both mornings while we stayed there. Location-wise we were well placed to cover both Hahndorf and Barossa, both about half an hour away give or take.

We had a great time and would recommend this bnb to anyone who wants a farm stay away from the city, in the quiet of the country.

We had an amazing stay with our host Tracy. We loved every minute of it. The hospitality and thoughtful touches made everything the stay that much more homely - not to mention getting to feed her adorable alpacas! Would 100% recommend this place to anyone wanting a quiet getaway ❤️❤️

Tracy's place is just divine, an amazing country retreat - we didn't want to leave! Tracy is so welcoming and warm, the house is gorgeous, so comfortable, spacious and very stylish (we adored the super soft fluffy towels and the super comfy bed!). We went on an amazing walk with Tracy around the property, accompanied by her three gorgeous dogs and saw kangaroos and fed the lovely alpacas - it was the best Sunday morning we've had and really slept so late in the mornings as the property is so peaceful and quiet. We will definitely come back - would highly recommend. Thanks Tracy x

We had an amazing night away! Tracy and Chris were wonderful hosts! We loved being able to have a tour around the property, interact with their animals and feed the alpacas. We would love to visit again! 
We would highly recommend this place! Thanks again! :)
Great hosts and quaint place. Definitely worth visiting.
Very sweet stay with everything you could possibly need, meeting the alpacas was the cherry on top! Very warm & welcoming stay, highly recommend!

We loved our stay here! Very peaceful and serene. 

Tracy and Chris were excellent hosts and the place was beautifully decorated and nice and clean.

Tracy was an amazing host, and provided a very warm welcome. She provided very quick responses and made the process very seamless. She even pre-organised a time with us to take a morning walk and feed her beautiful alpacas!

We absolutely loved our stay with Tracy and Chris, the farm is so peaceful. We felt quite at home and got to have a walk around the farm and feed the baby alpacas. Hope to be back sometime to visit and see where the renovations go
Thank you Tracy and Chris for such a perfect experience ☺️

Staying at the fantastic place of Tracy and Chris was a wholesome and wonderful experience. They are so kind and nice hosts and we felt at home immediately. The separate house for guests is spacious, well equipped and super cosy. Interacting with the Alpacas was really fun and we got to learn a lot about them in the process. There‘d be so many more great things to write about our stay but best thing you just go and visit them yourself. Highly recommend staying there to anyone!
Couldn't be happier, everything was just lovely
It’s an amazing place and a great experience. Highly recommended

It is one of the most family friendly places we ever stayed. All of us including my 1 year had a great time walking around and feeding Alpacca's.

One of the highlights is seeing millions of stars under night sky. It is so beautiful as there is absolutely no light pollution and it is something we all enjoyed which we can not do in the city.
 
I would highly recommend to stay at Gundaroo in the Barossa Valley.

We loved our stay at Gundaroo Cottage. Tracy and Christ are delightful as are the herd of alpacas across the field. Highly recommended for a friendly, local and relaxed AirBnB experience. Thanks again!

Had such a great time staying at Tracy’s. We had a farm tour and watched stars at night. Met their three adorable dogs , cat and fed their friendly Alpacas. A definitely must go in Adelaide! Plus point - wineries are not too far away!
Tracy and Chris were so welcoming and accommodating. They showed us around their beautiful property and even let us walk the absolutely gorgeous alpacas.
It was a peaceful and relaxed stay but also centre to many of the area’s attractions. This gave us the chance to either rest and recuperate or tour and sight see. The alpacas were a bonus!

Chris & Tracy are amazing hosts & have done fabulous  restoration to the farm and home. Unfortunately our stay was cut short by the terrible fires that came very close. Chris & Tracy we’re both caring and helpful despite the difficult situation. We hope to visit again & wish them a bright future with their farm stay. Highly recommend.
Tracy has great communication with us from point of enquiry. She was very considerate of our situation. Would book again if we were ever in Adelaide again.
