A fantastic place to stay, quiet and secluded with beautiful views. Close to all the wineries and towns. Beautiful living spaces and lovely little touches make it a warm and comfortable place to stay. Highly recommend.

Our stay at Vineyard Views was definitely one to remember!! 
The location and views were absolutely stunning, and the house was clean and tidy. 
We were greeted by the family cat who joined us for a cuddle or two. 
We also later met Nat who was so lovely. 
The little extras like breakfast supplies definitely added to the visit. 
We will definitely be visiting the Barossa in the future and this would be the only place we would stay!
Super clean and modern! Lovely hospitality! Would 100% stay again!
Fantastic place and a wonderful setting! Couldn’t have asked for more, the finishing touches and the delicious local food to cook for breakfast was added beautiful touches!

Such a nice place to stay. The deck and the views over the vineyard was a great place to both start and end the day.
Karl and Natalie were so accommodating and were such nice hosts, going out of their way to look after us. The selection of local produce was also a lovely touch.
Unfortunately our stay was cut short and both Kyle and Nat were very helpful and understanding. We’ll definitely be back to spend some more time there.

Beautiful space with beautiful views. 
Easy and quick to get everywhere through the taxi company up there. 
Perfect for the few nights we were there to get to explore different areas of the Barossa. 
Would definitely recommend

Wonderful setting and stylish layout. A beautiful view to make your home in the Barossa for a few days. Karl was very welcoming and the touches like homemade honey and local bacon were extra special. Have no hesitation in recommending.

Perfect location for a peaceful stay in nature, set right amongst the vineyard with beautiful views and amazing night skies.

Karl was super helpful with great recommendations and really quick communication

We had an absolutely excellent stay at Karl’s place. The local breakfast produce was very thoughtful and much appreciated. The location of the place was perfect to explore what the Barossa has to offer. We would definitely stay again.
A little hidden gem! Peaceful and very comfortable, with an amazing sunset to boot.
This place is an absolute gem. 5-10 minutes from Tanunda, you can soak in the best views of the Barossa valley. Comfortable, quiet accommodation while enjoying a glass of wine on the deck. Bliss!

Vineyard Views was a great place to stay! Amazing property overlooking the valley, the host was very easy to communicate with, and the breakfast board was with local and farm fresh goods was a really nice touch. Perfect for a little getaway for two to the Barossa.

Karl and Nat are incredible hosts  - they want to ensure that you have the most enjoyable stay possible. I would describe them as the epitome of true South Australian warmth and hospitality. 

“Vineyard Views” is the most spectacular Barossa Valley AirBNB. It felt like a dream come true to stay in a place where I could enjoy an al fresco dinning space and overlook the vineyards. Get your camera ready for those exquisite sunsets. 

I adored the layout inside as well. It is incredibly spacious and comfortable. I loved the stylish colour schemes that added to a wonderful experience. 

The location is perfect as you are only a short drive to several wineries, the Mengler’s Hill Sculpture and Barossa Adventure Parks. 

Thank you so much for ensuring that I had a brilliant first time in the Barossa.

Karl and Nat’s place is amazing, great view with everything you need. Beautiful breakfast with local produce and coffee machine. Communication was super easy and quick. 

Location is perfect, close many great wineries and restaurants. 

Their hospitality was above and beyond, highly recommend and would definitely stay again :)

A great little spot to stay while we toured the Barossa. Just a short drive from the town and from many great wineries! The space was beautiful, and the little breakfast bits and pieces we discovered on our arrival that Karl had left for us was a really nice touch. We would happily stay again.

We absolutely loved our stay at vineyard views. The self contained accommodation was very clean and had everything we needed for our stay... Including delicious local goods for our breakfasts! The view from the deck was beautiful and we were really able to relax and feel like we were on holidays. Karl and Natalie were excellent hosts and we would recommend their place to anyone visiting the barossa.

Highly recommend this beautiful vineyard stay with amazing views sunrise to sunset and amazing hospitality as well not to mention being so closes to majority of vineyards only a 5-10 minutes drive , we would definitely stay again and recommend everyone to try the experience.
Accommodating hosts and an incredible space and view. I would highly recommend to anyone!

Newly renovated barn, stylish decor, immaculately clean with absolutely everything you’d need. Stunning views from the deck of the vineyard and rolling hills. Lovely hospitality with fresh eggs, bacon etc for breaky! Could not recommend more!
Thanks Karl, my parents loved their weekend away!
The perfect location for vine-side ambience, 10mins from the centre of Tanunda. Our evening spent on the deck overlooking the valley was a highlight of our trip. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Great views of vineyard, lovely quiet getaway. 10 minute drive to many wonderful restaurants and cafes.

Where do I even start on how amazing this spot is. 

We came to the Barossa for our Honeymoon, as we arrived we were greeted by Karl for a quick gday. It was great to know who he was and where we were staying. Karl was great on the text and communication with us and happy for a call or text anytime. 

The actual room itself was 10/10 with all the little comforts you want. 
To start with the photos are spot on, walking out from your lounge area you are directly on the deck very close to Karl’s vineyard. Awesome to have a bottle of wine at the end of the day right on a real working vineyard. 

The whole room is brand new, high ceilings. We however loved the little things like;
- free wifi
- Apple TV with the ability to sign into Netflix 
- real, big towels and bath mat for the shower 
- really good strong shower with hot water 
- powerpoints right beside the bed for Charing phones etc. 

Karls hospitality was sensational. He answered any questions we had and really went above in beyond with us which we can’t thank him enough for. 

We were left in peace the whole time did not see any of Karl or his family unless we wanted to. 

All the taxi’s we got to and from town knew the address from previous guests and we didn’t have to explain where to go or how to get there. 

This is like a classic Air BnB experience but revamped to the 21st century. 

You will not find another place like this for the price.
Terrific place to stay for a relaxing Barossa weekend.

Ankica was quick in getting back to me when a last minute trip came to fruition.  Her house is centrally located, so an easy walk to the pub for dinner.  It is an ideal base for walkers doing the Lavender trail or cyclists doing gravel or road riding in the area.
Loved staying at Ankica's place - perfect for one person.
Very clean. Cute little house in the barossa.
Ankica is a perfect host and her accomodation is very clean and homelike. A great location to stay if you are cycling or hiking on the Lavender Trail.
Ankica was a fabulous host who happily arranged around my hectic schedule, giving me the best experience I have ever had with air bnb.
Fantastic place to stay for the night. Our family has used Ankica's place for the second time and we can highly recommend it.

Ankica’s place was clean and comfortable, was very easy as I was working each day of my stay. Ankica is a friendly and welcoming host. A huge range of teas was a thoughtful touch and her cat is very sweet.
Ankica's place is very clean, the surroundings are very tranquil. Really enjoyed the stay.

Ankica's place is by far the nicest place I have stayed at for the value on AirBnB. It was perfect for a little quick trip up to the Barossa for wine tasting and sight-seeing. I would highly recommend it and would definitely stay again.

Ankica is the loveliest of hosts. She is passionate about healthy living & treats her guests with such kindness & homely hospitality. Enjoy simple delicious breakfast & copious cups of varieties of tea. If you are coming to Springton & need a place to stay look no further. If you have no reason to come, invent one & come & enjoy Ankica's lovely home, relax, meet her & her dear gentle pet cat & take in some peaceful rest and relaxation
Great place to spend a night if your walking solo along the Lavender Trail.
Basic room and ammenties in peaceful surrounds. Clean and tidy.
Ankica and kitty, Ella, were great hosts and very welcoming.
Beautiful new home with amazing facilities- very good location! Jay was lovely and so helpful with recommendations and where to eat and tour

Fantastic spot for larger groups.
House was very clean and had all the things we needed.
Water pressure was AmAzInG

Our stay in Jay's house was excellent. House was spotlessly clean, very stylish and spacious, and had great amenities. 
Jay was very responsive and helpful, and was an excellent host.
I couldn't recommend a place more highly for groups wanting a place to stay in the heart of the Barossa Valley.

My family and I had a wonderful stay. The place was very clean and offered everything you would want with a home away from home.
Great place for children with walking tracks and playground close by.
A lovely and spacious home, perfect  for a small family or group of friends.
Fantastic house in a convenient location. Would definitely stay again!
Stayed overnight with a group and we all loved this house. Clean, affordable, modern, and the host was incredibly helpful! Will definitely be back.

Ben's place (Triple Creek) is literally in the middle of a vineyard - beautiful home, stylish with plenty of space!!! very private, but only a short drive to the local town.  We loved our time here and it was a perfect place for us to hold our Camino Reunion and relax after a day of exploring and wine tasting throughout the region.   We loved it!  Thank you!
Beautiful location & plenty of room for many guests. Lovely spacious rooms & comfortable beds. Very bright rooms so makes for an early rise.

We had a fantastic stay at Triple Creek house - the house was huge, very well equipped and with excellent views of the vineyards. Ben was also an excellent host and quick to reply to all our questions. Thank you Ben!

It was an absolutely stunning location with vineyards surrounding the property. The home fit us perfectly with ample space. I would highly recommend staying at Triple Creek! Thanks to Ben for your great communication.
Good location, nice view, very warm hospitality.
Beautiful stylish house in a quiet locale, in the heart of a premier wine growing region. Lots of space to relax & enjoy.
Wish we stayed longer. Amazing views. Perfect for a group or a large family. Will be back soon
Lovely hpuse, great location
I would highly recommend staying at Triple Creek Wines! The views were stunning and the house was spacious and comfortable! Perfect for a group trip of four couples! Ben is fantastic!
Great place. Beautiful home.
Very spacious, great views, modern amenities and well equipped

We were blown away by this place. It was even better than we had hoped. The house is very spacious. Wonderful for a family getaway. And the view of the surrounding hills is quite a sight to wake up to. I loved that it was peaceful as there are no close neighbours. However, you are only a short drive from the main strip in Tanunda. Very handy for dashing in and out of town. Would highly recommend and we hope to visit again.

The house is nice but a bit tired. The house was full of millipedes mostly outside but a significant amount inside as well. Both toilets were blocked by the time we left. The house location is nice but on a long dirt track so a bit bumpy. The blinds in the rooms are not block out and we could see the blue sky through them so expect to wake up whenever the sun comes up. Overall it's a nice place and very big but for the price we paid I don't think it was great value for money.
Beautiful location
Lovely location in amongst the vineyard.
Great location and prompt responses to any messages/questions.
Fantastic location, beautiful views. Highly recommend.
Lovely accommodation for couples. Spacious,clean and in great setting.

Triple Creek is well located for a time in the Barossa if you want to spend more time out of the house than in. It's spacious and the beds are comfortable and the linen fresh. There was however a very unpleasant smell of plastic / vinyl which needed to be expelled from the house every time we went in. This unfortunately brought many of the bugs in - and there were a lot! Provision  of little things, like insect repellent, coffee, sugar, normal tea bags (only green or earl grey was provided), more than one tea towel, cling wrap, a vegetable peeler, or sieve would have made it a little more comfortable. The outside area was not really pleasant or user friendly with the verandas being quite narrow. A little too expensive for what we thought it was / provided.
Great place, super spacious, lovely grounds!

Loved this place, such a unique experience staying on your own vineyard in the heart of the Barossa. The house is large, modern and well fitted out but the real star is the location among the vineyards
The place was in an ideal location. Within close proximity to all the other wine cellar locations. The house was supper comfy with all things included. Great place

Amazing getaway! 
If you want to escape the city life, this is definitely the place to do it
Loved staying amongst the vineyards.  Great central location to explore the Barossa Valley.

We loved our time at Ben’s place! He was a great communicator from booking to check in. 

The house was great, so much room for our group of 6 adults & 4 kids. 

We would definitely book again & recommend to others
This place was so wonderful. Being in the middle of the vineyard and away from other buildings was sp refreshing. Wish we could have stayed longer.
Huge space - great for groups!
Sooo big! Amazing for my bridal party to get ready in the morning!!
Beautiful place and such a lovely location.

If Under the Vines is available for your dates, stop looking and BOOK IT NOW. As a Superhost, I appreciate when a host has gone the extra mile. Karen has gone the extra 10 miles. The finest stay with Airbnb I have ever had, in my 5+ years on the platform. She is very thoughtful, the space is carefully thought out. The location is PERFECT for exploring Barossa Valley right between Nuri and Tanunda, just perfect. Incredible views. It is hosts like Karen and places like Under the Vines that make Travel so exciting. 11/10 experience.

Such a beautiful place and really is such a relaxing getaway, so many great local tips and the little restaurants and bakeries nearby are great, we also went fishing nearby and had a great time. The house is beautiful and was just the holiday we needed, Highly recommend 10/10.

We couldn’t recommend this cottage highly enough. Sparkling clean, beautifully appointed with lots of little touches to make our stay special. We will definitely be back! Thank you, Karen. The effort you have gone to with the cottage was simply amazing!
Absolutely amazing place 100% recommend this house for anyone! Thanks so much Karen for the hospitality!

Lovely place, and such a generous breakfast. All the ameneties and extra touches that you could possibly want so we felt so welcome and at home. We had the best time, comfy bed, peaceful surroundings and a movie curled up on the sofa. Thankyou so much Karen we couldnt have asked for anything else. x
A brilliant stay. Great getaway, great location,  excellent value

I really appreciated Liz and her husband, Rudi for welcoming me warmly. I was gonna leave very early morning a day after I stayed but my plan had to change, so I asked them to stay there a bit longer until late morning. They didn’t mind at all and suggested me some alternative plans to do during the day. 
As we talked through it’d be quite helpful for guests if they prepared some brochures  for sightseeing, especially the area is  known as wineries. 
Overall I did have a nice time with the hosts and their puppies  Hope more guests stay with you and get more inspiration from them! 
If I visit the area in the near future, I’ll definitely come and stay longer there. Highly recommend ✅
It was great staying with Rudi and Liz! Very clean house and they have 3 lovely pugs who are very friendly. Very nice neighborhood and overall a great experience!
This house was beautiful

Amazing high spec accommodation. Beautifully decorated and extremely comfortable. Location is second to none, walking distance from cafes, wineries, shops and parks.

We will definitely return and choose this accommodation due to the luxury, location and convenience.

10 out of 10
Stylish, renovated property in perfect location for visiting Barossas best wineries. We had a wonderful, cozy weekend in this beautiful house.
What a stunning place to stay; everything of the highest quality. Great location, walking distance to lots of places to eat and drink. Hosts could not have been more helpful. Highly recommend!!

An amazing property combining the old with the new.  Stunning extension and very luxurious.  Every detail is there - zone heating, bathrooms for every bedroom, underfloor heating. Louise is an excellent host and has all of the tips for where to go.  An excellent trip!

Excellently appointed beautiful northerly 
Aspect. Very comfortable for 6 individuals or 3 couples.
Love those heated floors
House was sparkling clean, beautiful interiors  and top end appliances. Made our stay so comfortable and we did not want to leave - will be recommending to anyone heading to the Barossa!

What a fantastic property. It is clear that a lot of hard work, an eye for detail and stylish decor has gone into the house. 

It was a pleasure to stay in and so centrally located!
A stunning property with everything you could ever need. We had a terrific time at 10 Murray Street, can’t wait to come back.

Unfortunately, due to an mixed up in booking our preferred dates we weren't able to stay at the property we had originally booked and needed to find somewhere else to stay for my family of 7 at very short noticed. Thankfully, we came across Louise's Place and sent an inquiry if we could book for that day and the following..with relief we received a messaged back within minutes and were all sorted for our two night stay in the Barossa (Website hidden by Airbnb) family can't thank Louise enough for her clear communication, friendly manner and customer service in ensuring we got to enjoy a well deserved family breakaway...The journey became on our arrival to this beautiful property. Loved everything about it...the 3 king beds with quality linen, gorgeous ensuites in each bedroom, master chef kitchen, heated flooring for the chilly mornings, great outdoor space for the 9 and 2 year old to play, minute walk to the Tanunda shops which was perfect for all and so so much more. Thank you again Louise. Warm regards, Jacqui Freeman

If you are fortunate enough to find this fabulous house available when you are visiting the Barossa,  grab it quickly,  you won’t regret it!

This home is incredible.  Stunningly designed, beautifully appointed and walking distance to all the best cafes, restaurants and bars.

Louise responds quickly to all your questions and makes checkin / out easy.

We felt quite sad driving away from this place.

I thoroughly recommend this lovely home and will definitely make it our home when visiting the Barossa.
Great location, close to ammenities, fabulous home - will be back
Wonderful little get away, better than what we expected. A very spacious house, very clean and welcoming. Within walking distance to local stores and cafes.
10 Murray St is very comfortable, spacious and beautifully decorated. It is well located and an easy walk to restaurants and stores.

Stylish comfortable and excellently located in a great little town for exploring this beautiful region of SA 
Fine touches and beautiful fittings made this our rural home for a few days .
It was lovely both to return to and wake up in both indications of a great property.
Bathrooms and beds were beautiful as were the linens and the house has a great layout outdoor area was welcome and we enjoyed several games of Boules on the lawn .
Definitely return .
Fantastic place for luxury and comfort. Unbeatable
This is an awesome property in a great location. Ideal base for a group of friends to explore the Barossa.
Absolutely perfect if you are visiting the Barossa. Extremely luxurious and so well equipped for daily visits to wineries and the town. You will not regret choosing this place to stay!

The exceptional standard each AirBNB place should aim for. Beautiful house, excellent amenities (the best beds I’ve ever slept in!!!), perfect location - the cottage is totally on point, as is Louise’s customer service. Worth every cent!!

This is a perfect location to visit the region, coffee places, bars & restaurants are just a few minutes away. The house is stunning! On top of that communication with Louise was super easy. I highly recommend a stay here. Will definitely be back.!
Beautiful house, great location and perfect for a girls trip away!
Louise’s home was fantastic a short stroll to the shops restaurants in tanunda the house was very clean and modern would highly recommend
Beautiful & stylish house as well as being in a great location in Tanunda. Well thought out accomodation and Louise was so accomodating of us. We will be back for sure.
Great amenities, stylish, good position, great value
Amazing location, amazing house! Fantastic place for three couples.

One of the best airbnbs we have stayed in. Worth every single dollar! In fact (and I probably shouldn't say this) I think it's worth more! We can't wait to stay again.
..although I should write a horrible review just so that many don't book our new fav barossa accommodation. X

We adored our time at this beautiful property. The location is perfect for exploring Tanunda (walking distance to cafes, restaurants and more) and a great base for exploring the rest of the Barossa. The house itself is beautiful styled, impeccably clean and has everything you need (including heated floors!) and more for a comfortable weekend away. We will be back for sure.
Lovely historic building, good location, spacious, quiet, warm and cosy, welcoming host

A quiet spot in the heart of the Barossa.  The spacious suite of rooms is just around the corner from the pub. A 15 minute cab ride/drive from Tanunda with cafes and shops aplenty.  We were delighted to find this gem!

We thoroughly enjoyed every step of our connection with this very hospitable couple and loved staying in this quaint home constructed in traditional Barossa Stone style of the 1800 and early 1900s. We found Lyndoch a perfect location in easy distance to all Barossa Vineyards.

Our host’s hospitality and responsiveness were first rate; always time for a chat and interested to find out how our adventures had gone. The gardens are coming up a treat and will be spectacular in Spring. 

We loved the historic setting and enjoyed our stay immensely. Thank you

Frank & Elizabeth
Excellent accomodation in a great location
Huge comfortable bed, very clean and spacious, lovely high ceilings, friendly and helpful hosts who gave me my privacy too. Had a lovely break away.
Great spacious space. Like the classic decor. Truly appreciate the thoughtfulness of the host and ease of communication.

The old library building is amazing - it's much better than the Airbnb listing lets on. You have your own entrance, own private suite, gorgeous soft bed, sitting area, microwave, fridge etc - the list goes on. And you're very easy strolling distance to the local bakery, pub, wineries, shop and more. Will definitely stay here again if we're back in Lyndoch in the future. :)

Thank you for an amazing stay. 
The place was bigger then what we expected. Brett was an amazing host felt very welcome. If we are ever down that way again would definitely stay again!
We had a great stay after a long day of wine tasting in the Barossa Valley. Great location, everything was awesome, warm welcome from Brett! Would stay again for sure.

Historic Valley House is amazing.  We loved the old charm with class. 
The huge bed was very comfortable and the whole place was sparkling clean. 
It is walking distance to some wineries, the pub and bakery.  
Brett is a great host full of historic info and of Barossa Valley.
Timeless accommodation with all the comfort needed.
Spotlessly clean heritage  cottage. Good communication from host and everything included to make our stay comfortable including Tim Tams! Thanks for having us.
Brett is an amazing host. He helped me out with an earlier check in and his place felt so homely and welcoming. Will definitely recommend this place as a must stay, when in Lyndoch
The Heritage Valley house is in a good location, close to cafe, general store, pub. It’s a beautiful house, quiet, clean. Brett is a good host and we had a comfortable stay.

Our stay with Brett and Lee was perfection, it was great to have the pleasure to stay in accommodation with such history and charm. We found the accommodation extremely comfortable with everything you could ever need and the location was brilliant! We recommend hiring bikes from Lyndoch Hill and exploring the local wineries - it’s a day well spent! We cannot wait to come back to SA and particularly the Barossa.

Outstanding accomodation right in the heart of the Barossa! Brett has done a magnificent job with this property - old world charm and pristine throughout. His hospitality was perfect and the little touches throughout only added to the comfort of our stay. The location is far enough off the beaten track that you think you feel you’ve escaped to a quieter, slower part of the world while being close enough to Tanunda and all the major wineries and restaurants. However nearby are a heap of great wineries within stumbling distance and a sensational  little bakery. You won’t go wrong staying here
Cleanliness and presentation was excellent. The host willingness to help us and surprise us with some unexpected treats was beyond our expectations.
5-star stay at Brett's place, very clean and cosy in a very beautiful house. We recommend !

Comfortable and spacious with history and old world charm. Brett friendly and helpful with local knowledge of places to eat, do wine tasting or go for a walk. Close to wineries and a short drive to the other Barossa towns.
Brett's home in Lyndoch is absolutely charming, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable.  It is in an ideal location to begin a tour of the Barossa Valley.
Charming old house in the Barossa! Brett is a very nice and helpful host !
Brett was so helpful and accommodating. The house is lovely and full of history. It is walking distance to many dining options. We had a lovely stay.
A lovely, spacious area to explore the Barossa. We enjoyed the thoughtful touches of guidebooks and local tips. Walking distance to a few wineries and local eateries. Thanks Brett, we’ll be back!
A bed but no breakfast.
Very gracious surroundings, roomy, great bed, quiet, great location to explore Barossa. Very congenial hosts. Recommend.

Loved loved this place! Brett was an incredible genuine host, very welcoming and knew a lot about the area which he passed on to us. The guest suite was beautiful, a stunning old style space and furniture to match . A great location to get to different areas in the Barossa - highly recommend!

This historical place is fabulous. It had everything that we needed and the bed was so comfy. This place was spotlessly clean. Brett was a perfect host and even carried our luggage inside for us. Thanks Brett.

Brett greeted us on arrival and showed us around our accommodation. It is centrally located in Lyndoch and easy walk to the hotel and restaurants. He also gave us many tips for local attractions. 
A fantastic place to stay, highly recommend.
Worth every cent. Great location, beautiful house.

Lovely place to stay. Brett was very welcoming and provided us with useful local knowledge. The house was well air conditioned for 40 degree days! Comfortable bed and ceiling fan and well equipped lounge area. Well located next to pub, restaurant and cafes as well as wineries. We would definitely stay again.
Wonderful accommodation, fantastic host, ideal location. Lots of nice, homely touches - excellent value. Highly recommended. Mark
Lovely historic home.  Central to all Barossa Valley tourist sites.

Friendly host. Beautiful accommodation. Comfortable lounge. Great tea and coffee facilities.
Great king sized bed and  ensuite.
I loved the views. It's close to the local pub and restaurant. Only minutes away from Lou's Place.
We had the perfect weekend.

Beautiful home in a great location to explore the Barossa Valley. Restaurants and convenience store within walking distance and only a short drive away from other towns and wineries. The suite is spacious and great for a couples getaway.
Beautiful, peaceful space. Comfortable and spacious. Hosts went out of their way to ensure we were comfortable.

Valley House was a fantastic place to stay if you want to explore the Barossa Valley area. The accommodation we once the historic town library and Brett and Lee have tastefully decorated the rooms accordingly. The bed was really comfortable, and the lounge area was huge. There is a massive parking area (off-street) in front of the house. Everything was super clean and the owners could not have been more friendly and hospitable. We would definitely stay there again and recommend this place highly.
A very stylish and modern B&B. Fantastic value for money. The hosts provided little extras that made the stay even more special. Highly recommended. Would definitely return!!

A beautiful central location in Mt Pleasant! Such a lovely place to stay, with all the amenities and personal touches you could possibly think of, we definitely didn’t want for anything. The super comfortable bed made for an amazing couple of nights sleep. We can’t recommend this place or Shari and Gareth highly enough, truly was a lovely weekend. ❤️
A cosy space a little drive from the main Barossa Wineries. The rooms are very clean and have lots of little homely and thoughtful touches.
A great place to stay with all amenities and with thoughtful touches.
Awesome hospitality and great hosts. Highly recommend staying here. ✌

We spent the weekend at Shari & Gareth's place and liked it so much we added another night . The place is really comfortable and  and was pleasantly surprised to have a bottle of wine & a box of chocolates waiting for us . Even a chocolate each on our pillows .
They contacted us before we checked in to ask what sort of bread & milk do we like .They put a lot of thought into making sure we had everything we needed .
The bed is super comfy and the outdoor porch area is nice . We had total privacy and enjoyed having there little dog Pero coming around to visit . Shari was concerned  Pero may  bother us and would keep him away but we were happy to have him around .
Definitely recommend

Beautiful little place to stay. The owners attention to detail is remarkable. They have thought of everything you may need for your one night stay. Very clean and stylish quiet place. Hosts give you your privacy but if you need anything they are there to help.
I had a lovely nights stay in Mount Pleasant with great hospitality.
A very quiet place to stay close to the Barossa and Adelaide Hills.
Amazing place to stay, enjoyed a relaxing weekend away
They were Very lovely and inviting
Lovely place to stay

We appreciated the breakfast items, and extra treats, the quality kettle, toaster, TV, bed was very comfortable, lovely fluffy towels, heating worked well, nice bathroom. good size fridge. Lovely clean crisp decor. Lovely get away space.

Wow! This accomodation was exactly what we needed. Spacious studio with so much to offer. Fantastic value for money, great amenities. So many thoughtful touches that made is easy to relax. Thank you for a great stay- if we ever come back to mount pleasant we will definitely rebook with you! ❤️

Amazing quiet country escape, so relaxing yet rustic and luxurious.
Great location with so many great wineries with in the surrounding district.
Pristine accommodation with super clean and high quality amenities :)

The Auction Shed was such a dreamy place.
The Shed was beautiful and very homily and the place was immaculate.
We were worried about being cold in such space but the heater was incredible, the place heated up within minutes and we were toasty warm the whole trip.
I would recommend Auction Shed to anyone - the place was just stunning, the views, the cleanliness and atmosphere was beautiful.  
Jasmine was very polite and accommodating to our needs, she made our weekend so special and was efficient with communication whenever I had questions  and contacted her.
Sensational !
Beautiful spot for a special few days.

This is a beautiful place for a solo or couple trip. It’s set in a peaceful paddock and is a very short walk to the Angaston Main Street. The place is modern and stylish and is a cosy retreat in winter.
Perfect place and location. Will be back for sure.
Amazing place to stay while in the Barossa valley
Jasmine’s place was great! Nice little spot in the Barossa. Unfortunately the gas ran out on the morning of our check out but Jasmine was quick to respond and rectify the situation. Cheers
Everything is high end at the Elders Office. It just works :) lovely fire, great heating (including heated bathroom floor), great shower and very comfy. Great home-base for a Barossa weekend away.

This was such a lovely little getaway! My partner and I enjoyed the nice escape from work life. The location was beautiful, the house was stunning - such a beauty to look at both inside and out. The subtle old touches mixed with the modern, balanced beautifully! Jasmine was a lovely host and extremely helpful when needed. Definitely recommended you check this out!
Great place to spend a couple of nights. Very close to town and many amazing wineries
Great place to stay and only five minutes walk into Angaston.

Very cute Airbnb in a great location and close to everything you need in the Barossa. 
Incredibly easy check in and check out process and fantastic amenities. 
We would definitely recommend and stay again!

We absolutely loved the charm of the old mixed with new, and didn't want to leave! The place is only a short walk from Angaston too, which is such a quaint town. We went to Hive Cafe in the main street 3 times - the coffee and food was amazing!

Elder's Office is such a stylish place, and was sparkling clean! We loved the gas fireplace and the spa bath too - they were both really nice touches for a romantic getaway. 
Jasmine was a lovely and attentive host too, and we look forward to coming back one day!
Loved the tub and the peaceful surroundings! Perfect place to unwind.
We absolutely loved our stay. You will not be disappointed if you stay here. Extremely clean. Amazing styling. Could not recommend it enough. Loved looking for the alpacas. Thanks again!
Great place to stay just minutes out of the heart of Angaston. Stylish cabin on a small property and would highly recommend!
The accommodation is very stylish and  beautifully done . I don’t think I can find the words.  Yes I can we are definitely coming back.
Jasmine’s place is comfortable and cosy with everything you could need. It’s in a great location and enough space on the property to do your own thing! Loved our time away, will be back!
The converted shed is lovely to stay in and the town of Angaston is just beautiful!
Beautiful view, close to plenty of restaurants and food places

We had an excellent stay at Elders Office. The accommodation was spotlessly clean, the amenities were great and the location perfect. Would highly recommend Elders Office  to anyone wanting a relaxing stay and good access to the delights of the Barossa.
Such a clean and lovely place to stay! Amenities were amazing!

We loved our 2 night stay at Elders Cottage. It was super close to town and a quick drive to cafes, restaurants and wineries. 
Jasmine and Andrew were extremely fast on the reply (we couldn’t work the gas fireplace) but this was no issue and we were shown the way by Andrew within minutes :)
The place was spotless and the attention to detail was obvious with the provision of everything we needed for our stay. We loved the heated bathroom floor and the spa bath! It felt like we were staying in a 5 star hotel. We will definitely stay again in the future !

Beautiful space! Relaxing, cosy & next to perfect! Would advise other travellers to bring eye masks for sleeping, the blinds in bedroom don't block out much light so keep this in mind that early mornings will happen! Otherwise everything was beautiful, loved the bath and heated tiles. Thanks again!
Wonderful place to stay

We had a wonderful stay at Elders office. Check In instructions were easy to follow, and the place was easy to find. Everything was as expected the place was lovely and clean with everything we needed and more, for a night away.  We loved the spa bath, the view from the bedroom doors was wonderful and we enjoyed eating breakfast on the outside deck.  The smart tv was an added bonus and everything was thought of. Jasmine was prompt to reply to a special request we had and she was happy to oblige, which made our time there even better.

My stay here was absolutely lovely. Its a beautiful location exactly like the photos. Very quiet but an easy 5 min walk to central Angaston where there's restaurants and bars.
I would stay again and recommend to friends.
Beautiful area and such a cute place to stay. We loved it.
A great hidden gem, within walking distance to Angaston. Elders Office has great facilities and was exceptionally clean. A great find!!

Absolutely perfect for a getaway that isn’t too far from Adelaide but makes you feel like you’re in your own world. Perfect location, the fireplace is amazing and despite my already high expectations we were still blown away. Have already started recommending this place to friends and family!
Amazing little getaway. Very private and cosy. Close to the town centre

Lovely place in very quiet area. Close to amenities and vineyards. Very nice and clean accommodation. Had a restful stay. We really enjoyed the little personal of the Airbnb. We shall come back. 
Thank you.

elder’s office is a beautiful, private and wonderful place to stay! jasmine was a lovely host, with very prompt response time and was very willing to help out with any issues we had! elders office is within walking distance of the main strip in angaston. we will definitely be staying here again!

Amazing! The views from the windows are just amazing! 
We loved our short stay and would definitely recommend to anyone wanting a relaxing, romantic night away!

A comfortable, clean and beautiful spot to stay in Angaston! Only a short walk from the Main Street but with that beautiful feeling of quiet isolation. We can’t wait to come back and have our morning coffee on the deck. Thanks Jasmine :)
We loved our stay at Elders Office, super coasy and stylish. Walking distance from the main street. We will be staying again.

well worth the money!! this beautiful place is tucked away and private for that romantic get away or a weekend away from Adelaide. We thoroughly enjoyed the spa bath and heated bathroom tiles- exactly what we needed on a cold night. The house was styled so nicely, from the bathroom to living area. A nice big wrap around deck made it a perfect place to have breakfast. The gas fire and a glass of wine went perfectly together to end a lovely night. We can’t wait to come back!
Fantastic place, great location, very clean and comfortable.

Jasmine is great on the communication, check in instructions were easy and non contact. The accommodation is just lovely, the pictures dont do it justice we spent every afternoon/evening on the private deck looking at the view, surrounded by nature and wildlife, it was lovely! It was quiet and private just as we had hoped and were really impressed but the thoughtful touches added my Jasmine. Highly recommend a stay at Elders Office!
A great place to stay while you’re in the Barossa, the cottage is very well done and very stylish. It made for a comfortable stay, would definitely come back here again!
Cosy vibe in a beautiful location.
We enjoyed our stay at Elders Office, perfect place to stay. Great location!!Jasmine was really helpful. Thank you!
We absolutely loved this place! Beautifully styled, well appointed, and comfortable. A perfect place to stay for a tour of the Barossa. Our only regret was not booking another night!

A great location to stay & explore the Barossa yet felt secluded and private at the same time. It was a beautiful little place to call home for a night, and was well-equipped for a relaxing night-in! Highly recommend staying at Jasmine’s place :)

Really well appointed standalone accommodation that was a great jumping off point for our weekend in the Barossa. We really enjoyed our stay, and since it was a bit chilly we got to take full advantage of the heated floors in the bathroom. The space heater also worked great to warm the bedroom. We only regret that we didn't see the alpacas on the property while we were there. The town of Angaston is just down the road and has some cute cafes and other conveniences. Would return and recommend to other travelers.

The Elder's office is a beautiful little slice of anguston. Wonderfully situated near a great cafe and away enough from the road to enjoy the quiet country side. Very clean and beautifully renovated. Highly recommend staying here for a Barossa getaway.

Amazing space. Really stylish revamp that was authentic to the original building but so luxurious and had everything you needed! Like  underfloor heating, king bed, gas fire, spa, recliner lounge for movies, breakfast box, milk, all kitchen amenities and a washing machine. Close enough to angaston to walk in to get coffee, groceries or dinner. Loved it and would not hesitate to come again!! Best Airbnb we’ve stayed at yet :-)

Elder's Shed is an amazing little getaway in Angaston. The exterior looks like a rustic shed but inside is a beautifully transformed space and looks stunning. Bed & bedding were super comfy. Would definitely stay again in future!
A beautiful place for a couples getaway! Excellent amenities and easy to get around to the local wineries.
Great place to stay for a get away!
Lovely stay! Thanks for accommodating our late check out to suit our plans!
Awesome place to stay in the barossa, modern yet rustic and in a quiet and convenient spot. Would recommend!
A truly memorable experience in a unique cottage, beautifully appointed and designed.

AWESOME!!! We loved are stay and will return as we just found it so peaceful and loved the wildlife as well. Elders Office is an amazing shed turn into a stunning getaway... Thank You !!! Miss the place already.....

Highly recommend staying here when in Barossa Valley. Nice quiet spot around nature. Comfy cottage for couple trip away. Very close to all of the vineyards and Angeston town supermarket only a 5 minute drive away.
My partner and I stayed at Elder’s office for 2 nights for our anniversary. It was a beautifully furnished industrial themed place. We had so much fun.
Great space in fantastic location.
Had a beautiful time. Highly recommend
Such a tranquil location with a beautiful bathtub!
I have only good things to say about our stay here. Everything was very comfortable, a quiet country setting but close enough to the little town of Angaston to be handy
We absolutely adored this place! It was great for summer and would be divine in winter with the cozy fireplace! Thank you for having us! It was a lovely way to celebrate our wedding anniversary! ☺️
Great place! Five minute walk to town - coffee shops, pubs, restaurants. Incredibly clean and well maintained. Really private, quiet location. No block out blinds in bedroom.

Jasmine’s stay is a a beautiful romantic escape! a stunning location, mixed with a range of amenities and helpful local tips create a wonderful stay. although on the pricier side - well worth the experience of the best the barossa region has to offer!
Awesome little place which is only a few minutes walk from the main street. Could not recommend a better place to stay for a few nights in Angastan.
Awesome accommodation and great location.

Great accommodation, extremely well fitted out with modern facilities and all so easy to use. Bed was really comfortable, slept so well, tick ✅. Bathroom with heated floor and shower were fantastic. Gas fire so nice and convenient to quickly warm the space. Lounge chair really comfortable. Loved our stay and great location. Well done on providing a great space and thank you
A fantastic place! Super clean, stylish, quiet, cosy and convenient.
Beautiful renovation, tastefully styled. Quiet location with all amenities we really enjoyed our stay, very close to the heart of Angaston.

The Elders Office is divine. Beautifully renovated and all the amenities that you could possibly need. All set in a gorgeous location. Will definitely be staying again next time we are in the Barossa.
If it’s peace and quiet this is the perfect spot. For a couple that enjoy natural surrounds Jasmins place is great. 10 minute stroll into Angaston which offers everything you need.
Jasmine was so helpful and the place is superb, really couldn't recommend highly enough! Thanks for the stay!
Clean, stylish, excellent location and great local tips. Jasmine was very responsive.

Beautiful accommodation located quite close to central Angaston. A really nice bathroom, comfortable bed, with all the basics you could need to cook (Inc. Oil and milk!). The fireplace was also a nice touch on a cold night. Would definitely recommend.
A lovely, peaceful place to stay.  Lots of history associated with the cottage and renovated well.  Would highly recommend Jasmine's place.

Beautiful spot close to Angaston town with spectacular views from the balcony. A real retreat. 
Wish we had time to stay longer. 
And the hosts were very accommodating!
We really enjoyed the staying in the shed, clean and interesting to live in a Auction room before.
Clean, cozy and very spacious! Quality amenities and beautiful views over the Barossa.
Our stay at this venue was AMAZING! It is so different and is a wonderful property. Lovely little touches, beautiful linen, towels and amenities in general. Can HIGHLY recommend it.

We loved every bit of our weekend getaway and the accomodation just made our trip! 
We were blown away when we arrived, pictures just can’t do it justice. Inside was not only beautiful but spotless, with great amenities. 
We look forward to returning when we have the chance! I would 100% recommend staying here, it’s everything you need and more.
Highly recommended.  We loved our stay here in every way.

The auction yard was really nice. If staying with another couple need to realise that there is no wall from floor to ceiling for the bedrooms so you can talk to eachother and hear everything, ie talking snoring ect . It was a very unique place to stay.  Be careful with the highly polished bathroom tiles, our friends commented on how slippery they are and about 1hr later my partner fell over on the wet tiles.  We stayed for 3 nights and ate lunch and dinner at the location however had to buy dishwasher tablets as there were only one for each night which wasnt enough given the time we spent there. We booked thru Airnbnb however should have booked thru Jasmines own web page as for the same time Airbnb was $250 dollars more expensive. jasmine tried to help us out with resolving that problem and went out of her way but we couldn.t cancel and rebook thru her. Big difference in price.

A spacious delightful open spaced 2 bedroom house. Very clean with comfortable beds and large en-suite. It is in walking distance to Angaston and very close to the start of the Angaston to Nuriootpa cycle path. Highly recommend this Airbnb
A beautiful renovation of an interesting building in an excellent location. We had a great time!
Fantastic place with very unique features. The place was very clean and luxurious. Will definitely book again!
Loved our stay here, a unique and stylish space but very comfortable with everything you need. Location was great, peaceful and private and a plethora of birdlife to enjoy.
Loved this place!
Fantastic place, perfect for two couples. ensuites were incredible!
Stunning house in a great location! Sparkling clean and smelt amazing. Really thoughtful host with lots of good recommendations. Would definitely recommend

Was an easy check in and an amazingly beautiful place to stay every little detail had been thought of and was located in such a beautiful area just out of Nuriootpa would definitely stay here again soon

We had a wonderful stay at Mel's house. She was easy to communicate with and she went out of her way to accommodate us. We appreciated all the special touches especially the banana cake she left us in the fridge. Thanks so much Mel I'm sure we will be back to stay with family or friends

Melissa's place was absolutely spotless, stylish and cosy. We stayed 2 nights with our two year old and felt right at home straight away but still got to experience those little touches of holiday luxury. The cottage is a ten-minute walk to the really pretty main street with heaps of cafes and amenities, including two beautiful playgrounds. Melissa was a dream to communicate with. I would highly recommend a stay at this perfect spot.

Melissa's cottage was the perfect backdrop for our girl's weekend away in the Barossa Valley. The cottage itself is gorgeously styled, fully stocked with everything we needed (and more!), and the extra touches were so thoughtful. Melissa's local recommendations were excellent and even though weren't able to experience them all, we can't wait to come back again to finish the list! We can't rave enough about how smooth and easy communicating with Melissa was, the location of the cottage and and how the host had thought of absolutely everything - we were so impressed and can't wait to come back!!

Mel is prompt in answering questions and has truly gone above and beyond to create a calm, relaxing and beautiful space. The backyard is picturesque and the amenities are second to none.
It’s perfect for a girls weekend away or if you’re a couple looking for a romantic get away in the Barossa.
Angaston and the Main Street has lots to offer and delicious food and coffee.
It was all the personal touches that Melissa had that truly made us feel special and made our stay extra amazing.
Couldn’t recommend highly enough and we will most definitely be back.
Fantastic stay! Wonderful hospitality, clean, welcoming home. Far exceeded my expectations.

An excellent modern house in a great location. The house had everything that we needed and Mel was a fantastic host who made our stay very special. We would definitely recommend staying here and we look forward to staying again. Thank you Mel!

Melissa is a super host. Beautiful accom. Walking distance to everything in Angaston. Mel's attention to detail is superb - so clean, folder of local tips, so many kitchen (fully equipped) and food items provided. Great washing machine (!) Well styled. Warm. Kids toys, games and books are a handy touch. Netflix was appreciated! Lovely new bathroom. Spacious outdoor area. Hubby, kids and I LOVED it.
Highly recommend. Great house with everything you need. Very clean. Great location.
Extremely thoughtful, spotless and comfortable. A lovely space! We will definitely stay again

Melissa thank you so much for your kind hospitality. Your place is in a perfect spot close to everything in Angaston. Your thoughtful touches were much appreciated. The property was spotless. We would definitely stay again and also highly recommend this property to others wanting somewhere lovely to stay. Cheers Leanne
Clean and gorgeous space! We had an amazing weekend away!

Book this charming home! We had a wonderful stay here and are already planning a return visit. It is beautifully furnished, with lots of thoughtful touches (including my favourite candle!), it is amazingly clean, has comfortable bedding and the most gorgeous outlook - we enjoyed a few cold glasses of wine admiring the view whilst our girls happily played the provided lawn games.  Everything is on your doorstep. Holiday bliss!  Mel is simply a wonderful host. 10/10 from us, thanks again!
We had a lovely stay at Melissa's place. Clean, lovely outlook in one of the nicest towns in the Barossa. Would thoroughly recommend staying there!

Melissa was an absolutely AMAZING host for my friends and I. She was super accommodating and was more than happy to go above and beyond for any request I had. The place was sparkling clean & she added some sweet touches upon arrival. For anyone looking for a beautiful little cottage to relax and enjoy a nice weekend, this is the location! I can’t recommend this place enough. Absolutely loved my time here & look forward to booking it again in the future :) thank you so much Melissa ! :)
Mel is a great host, place was clean and cozy. Some nice little touches that make you feel at home. We would recommend Mels place to anyone

Melissa’s place was fabulous. It is in a great location...you can walk into town and is only a short drive to many local wineries and other towns. Everything you need for an enjoyable comfortable stay is there. Melissa has local knowledge of the area and provides many little extras that made our stay wonderful.

Mel’s place is amazing!! Such a lovely house in a great location. Mel was very quick with communication, and left a great selection of information about Angaston and the Barossa. I highly recommend you stay here!

Thinking about staying here? DO IT! 
We were so impressed with the communication - especially given I am a bit crappy with communication, missing emails and texts (I'm the person who never knows where my phone is!). 
Mel even made sure the heating was on for our arrival and there were so many lovely touches like local bread, treats and wine which just made my day on arrival. 
The facilities are top notch and Mel has though of all the little things. 
We would so happily come back next time we are in the Barossa - great value and great location!

The Perfect location from
Which to enjoy a Barossa escape. Mel’s communication and quick communication was fantastic. Clean and stylish home with beautiful views and plenty of space to relax.

We had a wonderful stay Melissa's place. The home was beautiful, clean, and had many generous little touches. 

Melissa was also very responsive and thoughtful about the public health environment. She was a fabulous host and we strongly recommend her place.

This cottage was immaculately presented and really comfortable. It was well-located with an easy walk up the main street  to the local cafes, shops, playgrounds and walking trails. Angaston is such a pretty town and close to other Barossa townships.

If you're looking for a 'home away from home' while in the Barossa, Mel's place is IT! From the quality of fittings and stylish layout to the wonderful welcome pack and information on local Angaston and Barossa attractions and activities, Mel's place had it all. It is a gorgeously renovated cottage with sparkling new bathroom and laundry, quality kitchen fittings and very comfortable beds. Mel ensured it was spotlessly clean - including extra foil in the Smeg oven to catch any drips. The house was as depicted in the photos but with much more outdoor space to which photos just don't do justice.  Sitting in either of the covered outdoor areas with views across to the sheep and alpacas grazing on the hill while listening to the cockatoos and parrots in the creek-side gum trees made us feel as if we were a million miles away - but in fact, it was only a short walk up into the main part of Angaston where there is something for everyone. Being central to many wineries, taking a taxi was easy too. There were no 'downsides' to staying at Mel's place! Easy to find, great location, excellent communication - highly recommended.
A lovely stay for a relaxing trip in the Barossa. The house is exceedingly comfortable and pretty, and Melissa was kind all the way through.

Absolutely awesome place to stay. The house is stunning and instantly put me in holiday mode. Felt like a home away from home and I really enjoyed being able to cook up a storm in the great kitchen. Would definitely recommend staying for a decent period of time to explore the area. Thanks Mel ☺️

A wonderful stay to disconnect from city daily grind. Loved the kitchen facilities, kitchenware and extra touches in pantry; we cooked a lots of meals (due to allergies) during our stay and almost used everything at least once. Lovely new appliances with Miele dishwasher and Smeg stovetop/oven and mattresses were comfortable with some feather pillows. Mel was able to accommodate a late check out request which made us and the kids so happy. A short walk to playgrounds and shops which was amazing. Loved the space of the backyard and views of the hill with animals. Recommendations and tips by Mel in the book was very helpful and yes Kiel’s have SPECTACULAR coffee! Many thanks for your great communication and being a great host Mel. Hope to stay again in the near future.
We really enjoyed our stay. The photos represented the place very well and the kitchen was particularly well outfitted. The property was very clean and well kept. Loved the outdoor area and view.

If you are looking for a property in Angaston - or the Barossa Valley in general - look no further. We have stayed in a number of Airbnb's around the Barossa and Mel's is the best we have found. Welcoming, clean, stylish, well stocked; it is pretty much everything you want in an Airbnb. Mel's communication was outstanding and she even left local wine and sourdough bread for our arrival. It is a 5 min walk to all the restaurants in Angaston and an easy drive everywhere else. Perfect for families or couples.
Mel is the definition of a superhost!

Mel's place was a wonderful place to stay at. The house was sparkling clean and extremely well appointed. We loved the outside area, which provided a fabulous playground for our 2 young children. The property is fully fenced so we didn't need to worry about our kids running out onto the street. Mel provided some little extras, that made us feel very special, including fresh bread, fruit, coffee, etc. The beds were super comfortable and we ended up sleeping better and for longer than we do at home ;). We would be back in  heartbeat!

Beautiful place to stay in the Barossa. Melissa has thought of everything, and it’s an incredibly homely place to stay. Loved the bottle of wine and treats to help us settle in on arrival. Would definitely stay there again and highly recommend.
Beautiful spot to get away and enjoy some fresh air. Drinks on the deck, watching the sunset was lovely

Sharon’s cabin was exactly what we were after. 
Cosy and clean with great amenities.
Would highly recommend
Would highly recommend staying here for a weekend break in the Barossa. Fantastic location, delicious goodies in the fridge for breakfast
Excellent proximity to local wineries. Cabin was nice and modern with a shared community feel. Check in and out was a breeze.
Beautiful space perfect size for a couple and the spa bath was a highlight!
A perfect getaway from the city life. My partner and I enjoyed our little holiday. Loads of experiences around the area. We will definitely be visiting again and recommending friends.

Great location. Just a short taxi to The Louise for a great dinner and close to some excellent wineries for tasting. Walking distance to Fino for lunch. Wonderful goodie basket on our arrival with terrific breakfast provisions. Dolce Gusto coffee machines with some pods provided. It was super hot outside and the aircon coped really well. A great little weekend away.
Wonderful cozy space. Would love to come back.
Sharon’s place was clean and tidy. Perfect location for the Barossa wine region!

A great studio cabin which is very well placed for the local wineries and very stylishly furnished. Very clean with a good range of amenities and kitchen accessories. We had a little trouble with wifi dropping out
Perfect spot right next to the wineries. Everything you need has been thoughtfully provided, great space! Will be returning when in the area
awesome location!
Very nice place in a very great location, would definitely recommend!
Amazing little cabins had an awesome weekend! Thanks guys!
Amazing place would highly recommend
Clean room, was unfortunate that we couldn't reschedule our booking due to a canceled balloon flight.
Nice location, close to wineries, comfortable accommodation.
Perfect location!
Lovely space for a getaway. Sharon was very good at communicating and very accommodating.
We had a lovely stay! Very clean and close to everything. Thanks Sharon
Amazing stay thank you

A beautiful and special cabin. Loved the whirlpool spa! Very convenient that firewood is provided and that there's a community bbq. It's in a great location, only a short walk Seppeltsfield winery. Would definitely stay here again!!
Comfortable and affordable stay. With an amazing spa bath
Not bad, good location in the heart of the barossa valley.. But for the price, we were expecting a little more
Great location and cute little cabin! Was perfect for our stay
Just as described. Good location, clean and spa was a nice touch. Breakfast provided for one day too was a nice touch.
Lovely stay! Loved the animals nearby and the breakfast too! Sharon was easy to communicate with and we will definitely go back!

It was a lovely stay, a pretty location looking over the field of animals and vineyards. We felt it was a little overpriced compared with other homestays/cabins we’ve stayed at. It costs $30 each way for a cab into town if you both aren’t driving.  The lovely breakfast supplied was a sweet touch - very thoughtful.
Great place
We had a great time at Sharon’s place, the place was amazing with everything we needed and the cutest animals outside too. Would definitely recommend :)
Such a beautiful place with the most incredible view from the front porch. AND a delicious breakfast!
Clean, tidy, comfortable and communication was reliable

Great location for a cozy couple getaway! 
The animals were a delight to interact with also.

We enjoyed our stay at Sharon’s place. Hosts were very responsive to an issue we had with power and rectified this quickly for us! A nice walk to seppeltsfield winery :). Nice and peaceful with great views of vineyard and paddocks. Amenities were better than expected - eg. Toaster, electric frypan, breakfast food provided.

Perfect cosy winter getaway, what with the wood fire in the bedroom and the spa bath! The bed is comfortable too and the location is fantastic for visiting nearby wine cellars. We will definitely be back and stay more than one night next time!
Fantastic little place to stay with a gorgeous view!
Perfect for a couples get away, even for a family as there was a bunk bed as well as the double bed! couldn’t recommend this beautiful little stay enough!
Great location. Sharon was quick to respond to any messages and very accomodating. Perfect spot for a quick getaway.

Thank you Annika, 
We appreciated all of your efforts to make our family holiday so enjoyable. The house was lovely and suited what we needed. I am was really grateful for all of your thoughtful touches including all the work you did to accomodate my baby daughter.

Annika’s home is beautiful and was stocked full of food, snacks, and board games! Annika was very hospitable, lovely, accommodating and responsive. The home was clean, quiet and bedding and towels were great quality. The location is also very close to the main strip. We would definitely stay there again and cannot recommend it enough!

We had a lovely weekend at Cirillo Guest House. Annika went above and beyond to ensure our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. Our stay included a large selection of delicious breakfast foods, sweet treats, nibbles and a bottle of wine on arrival. Annika was extremely generous! All linen and toiletries were included as well as many suggestions for our stay in The Barossa Valley. The house was exceptionally clean and was in a great location. We definitely recommend to others. Thank you for a wonderful stay!
Annika and Marco were incredibly generous and thoughtful hosts. Had a great stay in the Barossa!
Great location and a great house. Thoughtful ammenities and great hosts

Absolutely exceeded our expectations! Annika was so thoughtful and communicative in both the lead up to and duration of our stay. The house is incredible, amazing kitchen and dining, extremely comfy beds, and no shortage of additional touches around the house. Highly recommend.
Incredible property with lots of extra little touches. Fantastic hosts, beautiful space. Ideal setting for exploring the barossa. Thank you

We had an amazing stay. The b&b was sensational. Annika had so much food available and her general thought of our comfort requirements covered every aspect!  The B&B was spacious and  
clean. Annika was such an amazing host, best ever and the private session we had with her husband Marco regarding their fabulous wines was memorable. Their Grenache came from the oldest Grenache vines in the world, well what more can I say but..it was special! We will definitely be back.

We had a fantastic stay at Cirillo House - A beautiful house with everything you need, including amazing comfy beds! Enjoyed having a few Cirillo reds by the fire and having a wine tasting with Marco! Annika was a friendly and lovely host and was really accommodating - the delicious fresh food for breakfast was great! Thanks Annika and Marco, we hope to come back for another girls weekend sometime!

We had a family getaway with babies in tow, and this house had everything PLUS some! Annika was very easy to communicate with and Marco treated us to a wine tasting, which we definitely recommend. The house was sparkling clean, beds very comfortable and location was perfect for our needs (far away from noise, but close enough to all the Barossa attractions). Very happy we found Cirillo House!
This place is amazing! Very clean, comfortable and has everything you need! Be sure to pop over to Cirillo Wines just across the road

Annika has a well presented accomodation situated on the beautiful Cirillo estate. The place is well positioned being five minutes out of Nuriootpa and a stones throw from the sights and tastes of the wider Barossa region.

The house is spacious, clean and well stocked with all the amenities you could need.

We made the most of the warm afternoons and spent time relaxing on the outdoor deck, withdrawing into the house with the onset of cooler night and retiring by the fire.

This place effectively had everything we needed and more.

Honestly the best place we have stayed . Annika and Marco catered for literally every need you could think of!
The guest house was amazing, set within a great location of the vineyards on their property. They supplied breakfast and snacks which was fantastic and even a cake for my girlfriends birthday which was a nice touch. Marco hosted a wine tasting which was brilliant and made the day! (His wine is )

Thanks again and hopefully one day we can come back!

Craig, Donna, Ryan and Jessie

Truly the perfect Barossa Airbnb; absolutely exemplary in every aspect. The house is modern and stylish, light-filled and airy by day, snug and cosy by night, and positively teeming with supplies, amenities, and a bespoke selection of goodies that raised the bar for thoughtful hospitality and attention to detail. Its location strikes an ideal balance, with easy proximity to many iconic Barossa treasures and yet just removed enough from the town centres and arterial roads to ensure a serene and secluded escape. We’re also so grateful for the superb private Cirillo tasting with Marco — an absolute must for lovers of wine without the wank(!), it perfectly encapsulated the Cirillo experience: welcoming, generous, understated, deliberate, and the quality speaks for itself. Wholeheartedly recommend, and will certainly return! Huge thanks to Annika and Marco.
All good
Great place! Nice amenities and in a great location.
everything was as advertised.
Great stay, clean and great location
Amazing apartment! Clean, well set out and the location made our stay great! The huge spa was definitely a highlight!
This is a lovely, modern, and super clean room. The spa is awesome. We loved that it is in the centre of town and walking distance to cafes and shops.
My partner and I enjoyed staying here, it was very clean, had nice amenities and in a great location.
Amazing locations thanks so much for a lovely experience
Very good location
Great place to stay. Tidy comfortable and well set out unit.

Perfect central location in the heart of Tanunda for exploring the Barossa. Comfy bed, sparkling clean apartment and loved the spa bath. We enjoyed sitting out and having a platter on the balcony and Jasmine was great at communicating with us.
The Apartment was sparkling clean and well located as a base to explore the Barossa region , tanunda is a great little town. Can’t wait to return soon x
Standard
Very clean and good location!
Thanks for a great stay! Super clean and comfortable, spa is an awesome addition!!
This apartment was perfect for our quick one night stay! The jacuzzi was perfect to soak in after a long day of wine tasting. Great location, close to shops.
Great location and clean apartment!
An excellent apartment within an easy walk of all the restaurants and cafés. Spacious area, big bathroom and extremely clean. Everything needed for a weekend getaway.

We stayed here for a base spot to explore the barossa. Penfolds is 5 minutes drive and so is Jacobs Creek. The main street is essentially 2 minutes walk and there' s a great gin/wine bar musque. Id recommend this place and the barossa  it is definitely a great town.

The apartment was smaller than the photos would suggest but still nice. The location is perfect, walking distance from restaurants and a short drive to wineries. The air conditioning was really good during our hot stay. There were bugs in the bathroom and main area which wasn't ideal. Overall, a nice stay
Pretty good place clean tidy close to everything
Lovely clean space, close to everything
beautiful place. clean and modern.
Nice little apartment in a great spot in Tanunda.
Great location, literally just behind the main street making everything walkable. Very comfortable accommodation with everything you need.
Had a great time. Fantastic location. Clean and modern room. No complaints!
Great location, walking distance to the main street and everything you need

The apartment building looks very nice and is very well maintained, inside and out. Plenty of parking and crawling distance from the main street with plenty of shops, cafes and restaurants to choose from. Perfect location for a lovely getaway!
Clean, spacious comfortable bed and great bathroom and spa. Also a great, well equipped kitchenet.

This apartment is in the perfect location and more than reasonable for the price. So clean and spacious. Small touches such as having copies of the local pubs menu’s in the room really added extra convenience and ease for our weekend away
The best location for the main street of Tanunda! Absolutely easy walking distance to all the shops, cafe's etc on the main street. Clean room with beautiful bathroom.
Very clean and easy
Was very clean and spacious. Great value.
Great location, lovely and clean studio perfect for exploring the Barossa valley
Great apartment in a great location, walking distance to everything on the main street
The spa bath was amazing ! Very close and central making it a great location  - walking distance to everything you need !  Free parking in sight made it easy to go out on day trips
Lovely modern little cottage, comfy bed and couch, and stylish bathroom, good value :)

Greg and Mary were great hosts. We enjoyed our stay in the cottage. Amazing amenities and very close to lots of beautiful wineries. We also enjoyed walking around the area to see the horses and wildlife.

Thanks Greg and Mary for sharing your little cottage. It was modern, clean with really great amenities. Thanks also for providing breakfast foods! If we'd had more time, we would have enjoyed sitting on the verandah and chatting to the chooks :-) Easy access to Gawler and the Barossa Valley.
Clean, fresh, peaceful, comfortable. Just what we needed for a brief retreat and unwind from stress.

Greg and Mary's place is a true gem! It is even better than the photos, they have done an amazing job renovating.
The space is so large and open too!
The location is beautiful and serene, and only 20 minutes drive from Tanunda, and only 5 or 10 minutes from the start of the wineries. It is so conveniently close to Gawler too, so we were able to pop in and grab some bits and pieces and make the most of the kitchen. 
It was so kind to have the bacon and eggs available too, clearly fresh from the chooks on the property.
Greg and Mary's hospitality was amazing, and Greg truly went out of his way to help us with some left behind items.
We would happily return again!

Perfect space in an amazing location. Greg and Mary’s hospitality was lovely with many thoughtful touches in their space. 110% recommend to anyone looking to stay for some time in the Barossa! You won’t be disappointed!
Very clean, neat and comfortable space with everything you need for a peaceful getaway!
Photos don’t do it justice - gorgeous place to stay!
Beautiful, secluded and clean cottage. Updated and stylish. Exceeded our expectation for size and comfort.
Great place, private from the main house and close gateway to Barossa and beyond!
Greg & Mary’s was delightful & charming, a perfect little getaway from the business of Adelaide

We enjoyed the peace and quiet of the property located a short drive from town. Everything you need at the property including the ever important coffee machine. Nice to be in the country away from the chaos before Christmas time!
Nice clean and upgraded interior. Quiet country setting. Would go there again if I had a  comfortable recliner for a person in their retirement age.
Beautiful place
Wonderful spot with all the touches

Very stylish space with all new furnishings and appliances. Fantastic location near all of the Barossa Valley wineries. Also near the town of Gawler for all necessities. Great surprise to also find a tennis court there, which we made great use of. Loved our stay and definitely recommend it to everyone!
Wonderful place to stay
Greg and Mary’s place was an excellent introduction to the Barossa! The space was clean and had everything needed for both a coffee and making a full meal. Thanks Greg and Mary for a great stay!
A well styled, modern and clean accomodation that is perfectly located!
Great place to stay. Well appointed, lovely breakfast supplied.

A real gem of a find. The cottage is located close to Angaston town as well as a variety of vineyards. The cottage itself was perfect for myself and my wife and had everything we could've asked for and more. It was clean and it has clearly been well kept. Debra was quick to respond to queries and provided us with local information that would cater to all age groups. We were also provided with breakfast which was a lovely touch. If anyone ever wants to stay within the Angaston area or surrounds, I would highly recommend staying at Debra's cottage.
Was a great little place with everything we needed.
Lovely little cottage. Brilliant location.
Almond Cottage was sparkling clean and a comfortable stay. Excellent location opposite to vineyards and close by to Barossa Farmers market. Highly recommend

Debra’s cottage is so perfect for a relaxing stay in the Barossa. The bedroom is modern and stylish with a very comfortable bed overlooking the TV. There is a sparkling clean bathroom with a spacious shower. The kitchen is so well equipped with everything you need to prepare your own food, plus an awesome selection of teas. The air conditioner is very powerful and the cottage also includes a heated blanket and heated towel rack too. 

The location is ideal as it situated centrally to Angaston, Nuriootpa and Tanunda and we discovered that quite a few of the takeaway places in these towns will deliver to the cottage. It’s also very close to one of the major walking/bike trails too. The cottage is surrounded by beautiful gardens with vineyards all around. 

We absolutely loved staying here and will be back again in the future!

We stayed at Debra’s cottage for two nights while we explored a tiny bit of the region. It’s a cosy, private, peaceful and clean cottage situated amongst the vineyards on Angaston Road. We thought it was going to be a bit out if the way, but not at all!! We walked to Atze’s Corner for tastings, to Vintner’s Bar and Grill for a superb dinner and could very easily catch taxis further a field. Debra had gone to a lit of trouble to make sure her cottage was well stocked and very comfortable. We highly recommend a stay here for a cosy, charming and good value getaway in the Barossa.

This little cottage is perfect for a couple looking to explore the Barossa Valley. It has every thing you need, very well presented in a clean and fresh environment. Would have no hesitation in staying here again.
This is a lovely place to stay. Spotlessly clean, well provisioned, and a very comfortable bed.
Great location and lovely cottage with kitchen. Very welcoming and provided everything we needed. Would recommend!

Good location close to Vinters and the market. For those that are concerned it is next to the cemetery. Debra was quick to respond and friendly, their property is the one in the front so you can always find them if there's any issues.

I highly recommend this beautiful place.
It was a real treat. Close to everything but centred so that you feel like you are in the peace and quiet. Absolutely delightful
An absolutely beautifully renovated home that is perfectly located to take in all the Barossa valley has to offer.
Lovey place at a great price.

The property has been tastefully renovated and is super comfortable. Well located to the Barossa wineries and restaurants ( by car). It was a charming property and our host was charming and quick to address our questions.
Beautiful spacious house in a quiet street that is the perfect base for exploring the Barossa. The host has thought of everything and we really enjoyed our stay!
